Pros:
fun gameplay
good to play with friends
not too repetitive 
Cons:
lags my bad internet a bit
takes a bit of space, not much compared to alot of other games
This gamÄ™ teached me how to rÃ³b na actual bank so i can finally afford all dlc's
Very good game and mechanics, love it.

I got this game on the Xbox One and it is really fun. I think that it is very unique because whenever you start a heist there is a chance that there is some moron who makes the mission way harder, for example, I was doing a heist on the Brooklyn bank and at the start, this idiot drives the van into the Bank so we had to survive an assault from cops while trying to open the vault door then we had to carry HEAVY stacks of gold bars to the sewers. The game is also very good because it has a cool customization system where you can customize your masks and weapons. I also like the game because you can choose if you want to play with A.I or by yourself or online with people such as your friends. I like the graphics, for a 2013 game it has some smooth graphics, I thought it was made in 2018 because of how good the graphics were. The Money system, I think the money system is very good because of the amount of money you get a mission. It is usually around 150K if you are a starter. I have to do other things so ill just finish this off with I LOVE THIS GAME PLEASE MAKE ANOTHER ONE
Me and my buddy play this game all the time. Dont play with randoms they are stupid 10/10
want to rob a bank one day and topple the US Government the next? play this game.
The onlything that will make this better is a SCP site heist.
Game is actually free to play. Fun with dlcs but friendly to those who can't buy the packs. Actual W game would recommend.
fucking awesome and i havent even bought a dlc (NOTE this review was by a kid so it is certified true now play this game)

Good game, decent number of heists, but the inventory options are extremely limited, especially if you don't have the paid DLCs. Practically maxed out after ~20 hours, and the rest was just piling up money I'll never use.
it can be fun with multiple people but also is great with one other.

I recommend this game

Its so perfect u can customise your loadout.
Lot of guns, best missions and its fun to play with your friends ðŸ˜ðŸ‘
if you're looking for  game to share some quality meat, this is the game.
hi, i'm Yi Long Ma. Come come, money, give it to you

i hit people with big spoon

Hello! I'm Robin... Robin Dabank heheheh
got it?
no...
not funny?
ok...
sorry

I personally love the game as it has a good blend of stealth and chaos(loud). the only criticism i have heard from this game is that the cops have an infinite amount of reserves but I'm cool. hey at the end of the day its my fault for going loud. lol

This game is really good, its concept is unique and well made as well as it is loads of fun. It has a bit of an issue with minor bugs and glitches but nothing game-breaking. This is also coming from someone who has also never played with friends which is always better than alone. I 100% recommend

I got this from a friend, it sounded pretty fun. 20 hours later, I was playing overkill as a low level and sharting my pants constantly. Good game, lots of content for a low price, super fast paced on higher difficulties (hence the pants sharting), and so much more. Plus the game is actually updated, and itâ€™s usually on sale. Also really good with friends, so you can shart your pants simultaneously when a multiple cloakers walk in mid-drill repair. 10/10
One of the worst games I have ever played

Great game to play with friends it offers a different style of game then your typical shooter games. I will say it does get frustrating and repeating after you've completed all the heists but considering when this game came out it has aged well.

Like $90 Bourbon Its never as good as the $250 Bourbon

Very fun single player that gets infinitely better with friends. Definitely recommend the dlc as the base game feels very minimal but this game goes on sale like every other week so just pick it up then. Very fun and highly recommend, especially if you have some pals to tag along.
"Guys The Thermal Drill Go Get It." -Bain
Great game I suggest trying it out with some friends
"guys the thermal drill. go get it" ðŸ¤“
For me its fun until you hit infamy. Cloakers are a bitch tho and so are dozers.

payday 2 in a nutshell:

preplan phase: mess around and scream at friends for not using 3 detection on shadow raid

lobby: crossbow.

skiils: inspire.

one down: *ptsd intensifies*

10/10, dallas doesn't need medic bag

im very happy (:
I think I can rob a bank now

I have been playing this game for a few years and i can say it is a very fun game overall and there are lots of things to do in the game. The game gets updated regularly and overall PAYDAY 2 has a great community of players.
I had hundreds of hours on this on ps4 and I loved it. PC is way better.

Ive played this game from launch and it is a very fun co-op game. the main issue that i have with it is the player base. There are two types of players that will prevent you from enjoying this game. 

1. the AFK lobby Host. Host sits in inventory or crimenet for a million years preventing a game to start. try to join other lobbies and you'll find the same. 

2. players who are infamy and wont play with anyone whose not. stopping a lot of progression because they assume you cant hold your own or help out. all i see is metagamers trying to get an easy heist and not have a challenge. but the challenge is kinda why you play the game in the first place. 

both player types will take up hours of your play time just trying to get a game going. so unless you want to host a game your kinda toyed around with.
[You have been kicked by the host]
Still a good game after all this time and even without the DLCs
Full of cheaters but fun with friends
Meh itâ€™s aight. Fun for a bit but then it just gets ridiculous. Decent heist game.

The game comes with FLAC versions of it's awesome soundtrack in the files. Even if you have literally no interest in the game  but like collecting music, this is worth it on sale. As for the game itself, it's really fun, although it can get repetitive.
Makes really fun to rob banks. Noting things for my future
NOTHING I DISLIKE ABOUT THIS GAMES ITS JUST BALANCES..

This review is spoiler-free.

---{ Graphics }---
COMMENT: For a game launched in 2013, the graphics still really good.

---{ Modding }---
COMMENT: Mods on PD2 are mostly HUD's & Addons to be usefull on heists (Like Meth Helper, Bag Stacker, etc) you can find some heists aswell, but nothing really advanced.
â˜ Incredible Modding Community; Has Total-Conversion Mods
â˜ Strong Modding Community; Has Several Major Mods
â˜‘ Decent Modding Community; Has Some Major Mods, Many Minor Mods
â˜ Weak Modding Community; No Game-Extending Mods
â˜ Practically/Literally Nonexistent Modding Community
â˜ Developers Are Anti-Modding

---{ Gameplay }---
COMMENT: PD2 gameplay can change depending on the build you are using. You can be a Dodge dual wielding Shotgun player running fast almost flying over the map, or just a full armor Juggernautt with an M249 that walks like a turtle, be the aim god or the rip-fire maniac. It's up to you decide what & how you want to play.

---{ Audience }---
COMMENT: You can enjoy PD2 being a casual player or tryhard CrimeSpree player, both can have fun.
â˜ Kids
â˜‘ Teens

â˜ Elder

---{ PC Requirements }---
COMMENT: Hardware it's not a major requirement, some decent spec you can already have some fun.
â˜ Potato
â˜‘ Decent
â˜ Fast
â˜ Enthusiast
â˜ Supercomputer

---{ Difficulty }---
COMMENT: PD2 difficulty can be changed before you buy the contract, (Normal, Hard, Very Hard, Overkill, Mayhem, Death Wish and Death Sentence) higher the difficult, higher the money you got. One Down is now optional, it's just an extra challenge. The game can have Major changes depending the difficult you're playing. On normal Loud/Stealth, the soldiers are really dumb, and can be easily killed, even with a pencil. On Death Sentence, they got more health, damage, for the enemies, cameras now got a ballistic protection, etc. Also the game use the major thing on heists, special units (Taser, Dozer, Cloaker, Shield, Medic and others) some can endure more damage, other can do more damage, heal, use special moves, etc.
â˜ Freebie
â˜ Easy
â˜ Easy to learn / Hard to master
â˜ Needs Serious Critical Thinking
â˜ Difficult
â˜‘ Relative
â˜ I GIVE UP

---{ Grind }---
COMMENT: PD2 "grind" is Infamous, you need to get to Level 100, have 200mil on offshore cash, and 1mil on spending cash, after this, you reset your cash and level to 0, and start over again, now with Infamous level I(1), more level you got, more prizes you win(all them are cosmetic). It's completly optional, you dont need this to play the game.

One of the games that rightfully earns it's place in the shelf of "10 year old games that are still relevant".

PAYDAY 2 is one of the best multiplayer games, ever. The cooperation required is on its own level of difficulty, every mission requires a different mindset, a different team. And PAYDAY fills this gameplay loop absolutely perfectly.

Stealth in PAYDAY 2 is one of my favorite stealth loops of any game ever. Singleplayer stealth is incredibly difficult and long, almost enough to warrant it being called its own gamemode. While multiplayer stealth is this masterfully weaved art, where every pager used increases the intensity of the mission ten fold. Every player in a stealth mission has to be on their A game at all times, because you only get so much room to breathe.

PAYDAY's gunplay is also one of the most enjoyable parts of this game. Crafting absolute monsters of guns with modifications that make it look like something akin to Frankenstein's monster. The guns play off of every mechanic in an almost harmonic fashion. I never once felt like I was dying because of a fault in my weapon, I felt like I was dying because it was [i] my [/i] fault. Doing loud missions with a team of completely different playstyles is one of the most fun times you can have.

Although PAYDAY can be a buggy mess at times, maybe even downright unfair. It is still one of the best multiplayer cooperative games I've played. After 9 years this game still holds up immensely well, and it shows in its gameplay how much refining it took to get to this point. PAYDAY 2 will always hold a place in my heart and mind as a great game with extreme quality, backed by an incredible developer team. I hope to emulate it's refined gameplay in my future projects, as well as take notes and lessons from it's developer team about the proper way to develop a game about guns.
huh you know how its done

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

I've been playing PAYDAY 2 since the good old Xbox 360, where buying skills costed money, the hardest difficulty was overkill, suppressors were only obtainable through RNG and it was pretty much impossible to reach level 100 through legitimate means before infamy 1.0. Payday is a game about heisting, but way more than just robbing banks: infiltrating into a museum to steal a rare diamond, robbing a casino, commiting election fraud, stealing from the FBI, breaking people out of prison and even cooking meth!
 
The game has changed a lot since its initial release, becoming more of an arcade game than the previous franchise game. However, both PAYDAY 2 versions shine in different ways. It is definitly worth playing. And if you would like to go back to the old days, there are certainly mods for that.

Pros:
- Plenty of missions
- Replayability: this game has RNG elements that make playing the same mission different everytime.
- Huge variety of characters, weapons, masks, gun attachments and skins
- Two different general strategies to play: stealth and loud
- Skills and perk decks allow playing in many different ways, suiting one's playstyle
- Lots of achievements and in-game trophies
- Contains secrets, easter eggs and even memes
- Great soundtrack
- Even better with friends, but you can play the game by yourself and bots
- Allows playing heists that you don't own
- Allows modding and ways to avoid playing with those who use mods

Cons:
- Outdated graphics
- No straightforward campaign (but honestly, it doesn't really matter)
- Unlocking some items require earning achievements
- Many heists are paid DLCs (you have to buy the respective DLC to be able to host the heist, buy the Legendary Collection for most of the content)
- Sometimes you are kicked right after joining a heist for seemingly no reason, but most of the time it happens due to the host restricting use of cheats and/or mods.
- Even though the bots are OP, their A.I. is incredibly dumb. You can clearly notice the difference on higher difficulties. It's manageable, however.

PAYDAY 2 is a great game, one of my all time favorites, so give it a try.

I remember buying payday 2 when it came out when I was in high school, and I was utterly intrigued by the way the game captured a heist or a smash and grab and the suspense and atmosphere that comes with it. SInce then i've spent countless hours in the game and I can confidently say please do not buy this game or support these greedy (dlcs). It is buggy as fuck and leads to irritating and unneccasary interruptions in an otherwise pleasant and exciting heist/stealth game. The gun play, the objectives sometimes, it just makes me laugh as if they truly don't care about their consumers or their quality of game play. I am tired of these games that clearly recycle game play loops and repackage it as dlc or game play by paying a celebrity or a license for a movie or franchise; it's initially exciting but wears off quick once you realize how dull and lifeless this game is time after time level after level, day after day, bag after bag, crouch sprint jump crouch after crouch sprint jump crouch.

This is the best game to have ever been created. I remember bothering my best friend to buy the first payday when we were kids because he had a shitty dell laptop and it could barely run anything but I bothered him for months straight. That story has nothing to do with this game but he never bought it but playing this game reminds me of those times. The wifi is trash where I'm at and it took 3 days to download but it was worth is because I now neglect all my other games like an alcoholic father to his kids. I recommend this game to anyone and everyone. I spend every second of free time I have on this game. Do I need help? Maybe, but if I were to die with this game being the last thing I did I would fall into hell happy. The point is that this is a great game and I love it.
If you like sinking dozens of hours into trying to reach level 100, only to realize you need to pay $200 million to go Infamous, then you would love this game.

7/10

Its a fun game, but the game is extremely poor when it comes to singleplayer - They give you two NPC characters who are next-to useless and have no proper AI and the missions require multiple people to do properly. So you'll spend half an hour doing a mission and if you get downed, your teammates are no where to be seen and you have to do the mission from the very beginning and you get nothing at all from it.

There are missions where you have to protect multiple points at the same time otherwise the enemies stop progress, but you can't be in two places at once and the AI people always blindly flow you and get in the way so missions that should take 20-30minutes instead take up to an hour to do.

The Teammate AI is so bad that that it makes me want to stop playing the game but I enjoy using the guns in it so am forced to play levels that aren't so heavily team focus.

There are also parts where you have to drive vehicles through a very convenient pathway, but the AI teammates don't board the vehicle to help shoot, so you have to drive without them, but, there are enemies dotted all over the course shooting you and then you get downed and your teammates are all the way over the other side of the map and ignore you when you call them for help, resulting in a failed mission attempt. Its happened at least 3 times now and when you get really far on a tougher difficulty its just BS that you can never get past that point because of the same stupid reason.

The added kick in the teeth is that you start getting an penalty on the EXP you earn if you keep replaying  missions, so it basically penalises you for playing solo and having to put up with their Bulls**t AI system. 

NPC's aside, the game is cool for leveling up and upgrading your characters, the skills can be really beneficial but also remain subtle and the "Freeform" class style is good - It lets you build your character to your playstyle.

An annoying part to the game is the random loot drop thing. you basically pick a card at the end of the mission and it gives you a random item (Weapon mod, mask, colour for the mask, pattern for the mask, etc) but it's all random chance and if you want to upgrade your guns you have to pray that you get the piece you need. they let you pay in game money to help hedge your bets towards a particular item (Weapon mod, mask, ect) but as what item specifically you get is all chance. and It frustrates me that you play the game for hours and not get the thing you want, which forces you to either use something else, or again, suffer for it because there is no work around.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories

I love this game. 

I loved this game when it first came out, and I have continued to love this game all the way into 2022. Payday 2 when you break it down is an FPS heist game where you fend off waves of cops (Loosely Horde shooter?) until you complete your objective and then ride away in an escape vehicle knowing you just pulled off a heist. The game does play a little clunky at times but I believe that is due to its age since it came out in 2013. I thoroughly enjoy the game while playing Single Player with the bots, but Co-op with friends is where the game REALLY thrives. I think for what you are getting with this game even $9.99 is a steal because there is loads of content and even though the developers have released an unworldly amount of DLC you don't have to buy it to have a good time. Supposedly they did that to continue development on Payday 3 and if that is the case I am all for it (I CAN't WAIT :) However if $9.99 still sounds a little steep then steal this game when they have a sale because then it is only $0.99 - $2.99 and genuinely that is too good of a deal to pass up for what you are getting (I mean I have played for 91 hours on here and have NO IDEA how much I played on 360 for). 

I write this review because I have seen a lot of negative reviews about this game recently and I honestly just can't wrap my head around them. If I can give you one piece of advice that a random Game-stop employee gave me it is, "Buy and play the game yourself to see if YOU like it, because reviews can be helpful in determining how well the game is received among others but you won't know if YOU will like it until YOU try it, you might end up missing out on a game that you would have loved because of that."

" I was once a beautiful women, maybe not by todays standards, but in my day I was a hit. I was showered with praise and subtle glances from the average man, but one day I met eyes with a man like no other, it was as if our souls pressed together, and our pheromones congealed. His hair was tastefully wound up in a pony tail, his musk was penetrating, overwhelming....sexual. I kept asking myself what this was I was feeling and not until years later did I realize, it was love. All lady like aspects I had forged for myself were swept away by his presence, I desired him, and he desired me. Connections like this aren't easy to escape, neither of us could just walk away, this was happening, it mattered not that we were in a Macy's, this primal thirst between two people had to be quenched. So inside that fated Macy's handicapped bathroom, we made sweet, sweet love to each other. Later on I'd learn his name was Robert, and not much longer after that I'd learn that I was Pregnant. Nine months  later I popped my first little peanut out of my gross vagina, we named him Alex. Immediately we knew Alex was different, he had a dark aura to him,  he exuded evil and the doctor that ripped him out from inside my gross smelly gross vagina died not long after he was delivered. However, life with Alex was fine and two year after his birth we were ready for another. Our Second child ate so much in the womb I Gained about 437 pounds during the pregnancy. This was not only record breaking but extremely painful, I was tearing at the seam, this fat ass baby was tearing me apart. As a result I was forced to receive a c section five months early, leaving our child extremely premature, and extremely mentally/physically handicapped. We named this special needs baby Benjamin, and I have tried to kill him in his sleep many times but the boy will not die. I'd use my gross, crusty, blue and puss filled vagina one last time to birth a third child. Am I happy with  my life of love and family? No."

An absurdly massive game full of things to do and things to play with. A true heisting simulator filled with memes and genuinely cool stuff. A bloated mess. A game in desperate need of a third entry.

Payday 2 is a lot of things, but at its price, all you can really say is "it's worth it".

Doing heists, both in "loud" and stealth, is always fun, and playing with random people can still definitely be fun. You don't need friends for this co-op experience.
There's a massive amount of customization both in terms of loadouts and the look of your heister. There are skill trees as well that give you abilities to do various things, whether its supporting your team, doing dumb stuff, or putting out massive amounts of damage for free.
You can easily stack 500 hours into this game (as I have) and still find more things to do. I can't guarantee all of it will be as rewarding or intriguing as the early experience is, but I can say this game is definitely worth picking up (I don't have any of the Silk Road Collection DLC either; this is all "basegame" content; (a lot of it used to be DLC, it's a long story)).
These days, late game suffers from massive content bloat and general lack of viability of a lot of builds on the higher difficulties. In addition, there's so much that it can easily overwhelm a new player; a third entry from the ground up would be a much better pick than this game.
I give this game a thumbs up, both because you should buy it AND because it deserves it's third entry so badly. It's in development right now, so be on the lookout for that in the coming years.

The UI is not the best, i found out in the wiki that there's skills section but never found it myself, the server browser (if you can call it that) is really, really dumb; there's a map and you click on... stuff... and join a game but you can't even see your or anyone's ping. Also, whenever a player joins an in-progress game everyone else's game just stops until they are in, literally.
The gameplay loop is pretty much a waiting simulator with shooty weapons, you go to thing, press E, wait, repeat; the game got really boring really fast. There's stealth missions too with slightly better gameplay but you don't do those in public unless you get a teammates more coordinated than a professional F1 repair team.
Another thing i didn't like is that you rely on teammates too much to progress, sure you can do objectives by yourself but then you reach a point in which all alive players must go to a point, good luck with the lvl 100 guy spamming his lmg and shooting explosives at your feet for funsies.
I really liked the class and weapon customization, lots of potential, however, the rest of the game just falls flat on its face for me to enjoy it.

Reading all of these poor excuses of 1 star ratings have really irritated me, and caused me to make this review.

The game is not "buggy as hell" as people has stated it is, where as there may be a couple of bugs, the game is still extremely playable, and those bugs do not show their head much at all, In over 3000 hours of play time, I've experienced a bug, probably once or twice.

I've seen people say that the guns are terrible, feel awful, and that Call of Duty has a "natural feel" where this can not be further from the truth, Payday 2 incorporates recoil control, and attachment selection in order to fit the gun to the playstyle you are going for, Aiming down sights feels as natural as it can, considering the games age, Bare in mind, the game was released in 2013....

The AI, can be stupid at times, but again, this is due to the games age, which you can not deduct points for, as they work a lot of the time. People complain that they are sluggish or don't follow commands, However, if you are calling them to you, and they are shooting, they are not going to just run through everyone, because that is not realistic at all, they will seek cover, and shoot their way back safely, this is how the game is designed.

As for the person who stated "The game is rubbish solo" This is completely incorrect, I have personally completed every heist on solo, loud and stealth, you need to learn to understand the game and its mechanics and character build system before making a judgement that is factually incorrect.

As for being cheaply made, the game was made in 2013, Overkill was still a small studio, and what they did, with the budget they had, was phenomenal, you can not compare this game to games like Call of Duty, or GTA, because its just wrong, the studio was small, and are still supporting the game to this day, they are a fantastic studio, that has created an amazing game, and for that, I will be leaving a 5 star review for this game

This game is visually and physically stunning, it's one of those hoard shooters that isn't based on Zombies or an Infection and instead is based on Heists, and by that fact it's one of the best Heist Shooters in the world, no doubt. Payday 2 is a timeless masterpiece as now 9 years later is still going strong with Payday 3 coming out next year, and the only fact that this game goes on sale A LOT and is always $9.99 without a sale is just a low price and amazing for a video game with so much content.

If you haven't bought Payday 2 already, get it, It's timeless and with Payday 3 coming out you can get warmed up before you buy another absolute banger of the Payday franchise.

This game is a one of culture. Despite it being almost 10 years old the game still holds up well.  The game is still updated with new content up to today and the developers are very generous when it comes to pricing.

(im a console player with like 400 hours infamy 9) i just wrote a 5000 word essay on how console is better as they made the game worse with updates and haven't fixed simple crap like medics not having a stagger animation and them healing through walls and ceilings. but steams dumb and deleted all of it on me for making it a negative review instead of the inital positive review. lets speed it up shall we? console doesn't have leech, is missing a few missions, doesn't have 200 dollars of dlc, it has some dlc prepackaged in it already, damage range falloff isn't on console, All the 500 levels of worthless pointless infamy levels with a mod they ripped and put officially into the game to circumvent the constant inventory and skill wipe of an infamy isn't in the game you have to reset your equipment and builds entirely every reset but on console is just capped at 25 infamy. in summary they've fixed nothing, made every shotgun but the 2 boring meta shotguns bad, ammo pickup is still pretty terrible even when your berserker 1 shotting heavy swats, they've made new missions that change very little about the game, overkill is terrible with money and invested terribly resulting on console payday dying with it and financially crippled payday 3, they added loot boxes for a while against other devs wishes and ended up walking it back. all we got for customization is armor colors and masks, you cant mod yourself into an anime girl or a cringe youtuber and you cant make your gun blue. your not told how much health you and enemies currently have or what stage of the assault is or how many downs you and your friends have left on console too. Mods (mostly) good, updates (generally) bad

hopefully once I get at least 1000 hours you might consider this review at least a little helpful. Anyways thanks for reading and 5/5 game.

PAYDAY 2 is an action-packed, four-player co-op shooter that once again lets gamers don the masks of the original PAYDAY crew - Dallas, Hoxton, Wolf and Chains - as they descend on Washington DC for an epic crime spree.

The CRIMENET network offers a huge range of dynamic contracts, and players are free to choose anything from small-time convenience store hits or kidnappings, to big league cyber-crime or emptying out major bank vaults for that epic PAYDAY. While in DC, why not participate in the local community, and run a few political errands?

Up to four friends co-operate on the hits, and as the crew progresses the jobs become bigger, better and more rewarding. Along with earning more money and becoming a legendary criminal comes a character customization and crafting system that lets crews build and customize their own guns and gear.

Elder "Dragan" Approved!

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories

If you ever wanted to go guns blazing running your way through endlessly spawning enemies without a care, scout and sneak around a set amount of enemies and security cameras, or play on such a high difficulty you will need to hit almost every headshot, have almost perfect positioning and timing while completing objectives or stealing valuables and drugs this is the game for you. There's enough enemy variety, classes, perks, and weapons to allow for almost any play style you can think of, and enough missions to provide lots of content giving you incredible value for your money. The multiplayer with friends, especially in stealth missions makes the game even better. For me personally, the base concept of shooting NPCs, sneaking by NPCs, bagging up loot and taking it to the escape did get boring for me after 120 hours though. My friends and I will 99.9% be buying Payday 3.
10/10 Value 10/10 Content 9/10 Gameplay

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably deadâ€“ murdered by my brother-in-law, Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now, and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, he asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded. I... I always thought Hank was a very moral man, and I was particularly vulnerable at the time â€“ something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me in on a ride-along and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin, so I agreed. Hank had a partner, a businessman named Gustavo Fring. Hank sold me into servitude to this man. And when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling-out. Things escalated. Fring was able to arrange â€“ uh, I guess... I guess you call it a "hit" â€“ on Hank, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured. And I wound up paying his medical bills, which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge. Working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring. The bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA. To keep me in line, he took my children. For three months, he kept them. My wife had no idea of my criminal activities, and was horrified to learn what I had done. I was in hell. I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, and in response, he gave me this. [Walt points to the bruise on his face left by Hank in "Blood Money."] I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. All I could think to do was to make this video and hope that the world will finally see this man for what he really is.

Look man. Ive played payday on many different platforms and have played a good amount of hours. What I've learned over time is that what makes payday 2 so addicting to some people is the gameplay loop. Most heists require you to complete some sort of objective or multiple objectives. Then you must secure and move the loot to the loot location. The payday gang will then have to escape. Now they're many heists that are an exception to this gameplay loop but that's how most of them go. This gameplay loop brings me back to the game again and again. Now the weird loop of carrying illegal shit is not the only thing that keeps coming back. The second thing that makes me come back is the different builds you can make. You can create some really wacky but really fun builds. The most recent one i can think off is any build with the venom gas grenade launcher. You can turn the whole map into Shrek's swamp. It's really ridiculous but can be super effective and fun with the right build. Haha bad things about payday 2 where could I start. The game is really buggy. Most of the bugs are because of payday 2's engine called diesel. Its not good, never was good, and will never be good. It's just too out of date and buggy. Payday 3 is being made in the unreal engine which was amazing to hear. I just hope overkill gives us a great experience. The diesel engine is not just buggy it also just does not look good visually. It also has trouble delivering on cinematic sequences. When they try to do something cinematicaly the diesel engine just fails to deliver. The game doesn't crash too often for me but it does happen enough to be mentioned. Its probably due to mods mostly. Overall if you can get past the quirkyness of the diesel engine. You have a fun horde shooter with a heister coat of paint. The bugs can suck sometimes but when they aren't present you find yourself having fun with friends and even randoms online. I hope Payday 3 is good next year.

I finally played PayDay 2 and... yeah it's pretty fun. To call it a good game would be a stretch in my mind, however it does make you feel like you're in a heist movie; and boy is it fun.

[h1] The Loop [/h1]

The game has a very repetitive game play loop, that follows a pattern of:
 1. Find the objective
 2. Access the objective, usually by defending something.
 3. Loot the objective
 4. Run for the extraction.

There are optional objectives you can complete, like picking up misc items like packages; however this doesn't actually effect the game apart from straying off path a bit. You could also stealth, but stealth in this game is very boring. Take the bank heist for example, you: sneak in, plant the drill, wait 3 minutes, haul out the loot. There are only 3 guards you need to worry about, and the cameras never face the vault in my experience. The stealth missions that require stealth are a lot better and are extremely tense even on normal difficulty.

Let's get back to the main game play loop. As I said above it is very repetitive; however when actually playing the game I never really thought about it since the game disguises the loop. As an example, let's take a mission I enjoyed; you go to Russia in search of a hidden lab where they're doing experiments. You have to:

 1. Find the lab.
 2. Once inside, you access a scanner; which you have to defend whilst it scans a test subject.
 3. Once the scan is complete, you grab the server; which has the scan data on.
 4. You run to the extraction point.

As you can see the loop is still the bulk of the mission, however instead of defending a drill; you're defending a scan. It may seem like a small thing on paper, but actually in game; it feels fresh. I'd wager the little story has something to do with this. Pair that with the: beautiful new map, different looking enemies, and unique side objectives; it all comes together as a brilliant way to trick your brain into feeling like you're not doing the same stuff. It keeps the game not only fresh, but fun. I'm sure it could get to the point where you complete all missions and the illusion is lost, but at that point you've already spent days in game.

[h1] Difficulty [/h1]

Next we need to talk about difficulty, it sucks. Playing PayDay on the normal difficulty you're practically invulnerable; you would have to try your hardest to die. I'll admit it does add to the feeling of being in a heist movie; however it becomes stale very quickly. The police and swat become more of an inconvenience then a fun challenge, there's just nothing to keep you occupied whilst waiting for the drill. Ultimately this led me to trying the harder difficulties, I found that Very Hard is where I struck a nice balance between difficulty, and fun. It's not too hard to the point where it takes all the fun from the game but it is also challenging enough to really distract you from the defense timer. The higher difficulties become a lot less fun, Overkill is probably doable; anything higher just seems silly to me. You do get amazing rewards, but honestly if you're in the situation where you are able to do those levels with relative ease, you probably don't care about the money or EXP.

[h1] The Soundtrack [/h1]

The soundtrack in PayDay 2 is fucking brilliant. It compliments the game in such a big way that I didn't realise until I turned off the music. It is mostly high BMP electronic music, however mowing down a whole countries worth of police with [url=https://youtu.be/RhyJWStIpFc?t=136] This playing [/url] you feel a rush of not only adrenaline but also confidence. All the tracks are amazing, but aren't all equal. For example, you don't want the song I linked to earlier playing when you're sneaking, it would just make no sense and would be annoying. The game chooses the right soundtrack depending whats happening, which is really great. I can't do it justice honestly. Oh also you can create a completely custom soundtrack with literally any songs you enjoy, but why would you do this when PayDay has masterfully created music to pump you up? 

[h1] The AI [/h1]

The AI in PayDay is terrible. I play mostly offline with the bot team-mates and let me tell you; they don't care about you at all. They will let a whole village worth of enemies just walk past them and shoot the shit out of you, even when you're trying to complete an objective. The enemy AI could be compared to lemmings, following their team into a swarm of bullets. They're truly all artificial without any intelligence. I suspect this was on purpose to allow you to mow down a lot of them so you get that rush, that we keep chasing; however  I think you could still have that feeling even after a few adjustments to the AI. Take GTA V for example, you still feel unstoppable moving down hundreds of cops however they will try to save team mates, flank you, send bigger units ect, I think it would be a really nice addition to the game.


[h1] Wrapping up [/h1]

There are a lot more things in the game to talk about, however there's nothing I can really add my take to so it would look something like "There are builds in the game, they allow you to take on a new role". There's not a lot to add really. I could talk about the units however I didn't really have a huge take on them. Most of the ones the average player will encounter aren't that special. There are snipers, that lock down an area of the map, that's cool but annoying. If I talked about all enemies that is about as much detail as I could give. In higher levels they play a bigger role however the average player won't be playing on Overkill or higher making the whole subject a moot point.

So to wrap up, PayDay is an okay game with a repetitive game play loop; however the game strives in being addicting and fun. Slaughtering thousands of cops makes you feel like an unstoppable force that could rob anything; and you do. This game isn't about following a story, it isn't about being strategic, it isn't about even being realistic. It is a game that wants you to feel like you're in a movie; and it does that amazingly. The AI may be stupid, the harder difficulty levels may not have never been play tested, the randoms you get paired with may be as dumb as the AI; but honestly even with all the issues the game has been and continues to be a entertaining power trip that always leaves you craving more.

Do you enjoy grinding and being a criminal? Outlandish stand offs with police? Tons of customization and ability to make your crew drip with cool gear and weapons? This might just be the game for you! PAYDAY2!

It's an amazing game. At first it can be frustrating with understanding markers for objectives. The indicators may take a little longer than necessary to show up or seem a little vague at times for players to quickly adapt to the situational awareness. Over all, it may be a little lagged at times or slow with dialog or objective updates from one point to another, but still a greatly FUN.

It's the type of game that isn't meant to be taken seriously to an extreme. It's a great heist game that has a sand-box feel to it with some interesting dynamics and story plots, missions and more. Customization is awesome! With tons to choose from (Some stuck behind DLC or require certain levels to unlock) in game for weapons, masks, outfits and more. It would score an 8/10. This game is great to play with friends (If you have any) or by yourself and that's perfectly fine. Multiplayer, online, offline selections allow freedom to progress on your own or side by side with other players. Making a matching outfit for ALL 4 crew members makes the drip and trip worth while progressing forward in game as one group of wolves or a bunch of comical misfits.

It's a great game for something that is inexpensive in what you receive. Don't take my word for it. Try it yourself and be sure to give it a chance. That's what I did, which it turned into a great idea and investment of entertainment. Hopefully, this review helps in making a better decision to buying the game (or not).

I got all 1,287 achievements in this game. Don't believe me? Check my profile. I got to Infamy 100 and unlocked pretty much everything in the game. Did I have fun? I don't know? My life has spiraled out of control over the months that I have been grinding Payday. My girlfriend left me for a man who paid attention to her. My house was taken back by the bank. I've been fired from my job at my IT company after not showing up to work for 8 months. I have only a couple hundred dollars left in the bank. I'm struggling to find a new job and have been living in a cheap motel for 2 weeks. Am I happy with this outcome? Am I happy that I have ruined my life to be the best at this online video game? Am I happy that the only thing I have in my life is infamy 100? I don't know. I haven't felt much since infamy 60. I don't know what I am going to continue doing but I doubt it will be much, if anything at all. Once I run out of money and can't find a job I might just call it quits. My only option would be to leave my mortal vessel and return once more to the heavens in which God himself chose me to be birthed from an egg and sperm. That is if I'm lucky. Knowing my life I'd probably spend the rest of my afterlife living in eternal damnation. What is life? Is God real? Is Heaven real? Am I REAL? Why has my life come to nothingness after this game. What have I done to deserve this? I'll edit this post eventually on my situation, that edit will either be my last ever action on this world before the end or it will be filled with the good news of cotton candy and sunshines. Thanks for tuning in.

Payday 2 is a first person coop PvE shooter, where the player takes place as a member of the PAYDAY-Crew which are known for robbing banks. jewelry boutiques etc. with their brutality.

the game has a lot of weapons to choose from. from small SMGs to heavy assault all the way to mini and mashine guns.

What i like about the game is the variants you can execute each job: stealth or loud.
with each difficulty making it harder for the players.
from unbreakble cameras to heavy SWAT assaults all the way to a heavly armored "Bulldozer" with shotguns/Miniguns (depents on difficulty)
 

i recommend playing it with friends for the maximum fun.

Overall a fun experience, but not necessarily a must play; especially since Payday 3 is due in a few years from the time of this review.

7/10 i can surely say that payday 2 is an ejoyable game and my 210 hours on this prove it. Lots of weapons,heists, characters, lots of customization and a good story behind it all. But yes the game has a lots of dlc's and if ya say pd2 is pay to win then i agree with ya. But what is the best thing about it is this : i spent 100 hours in the game before i bough any of them (NO JOKE!) so its not that bad of a system. Bugs and glitches are still in the game - such as when you shoot someone in head his neck will just get 25cm longer or civis dont react on your command or get stuck or sometimes the detection meter fills up and nothing happens - this last one is rare like hell. Many heists can be stealthed or you can go loud. Community is ok, not rly toxic, but some players just go : ''AH YOU DONT HAVE THIS PERK DECK SO I KICK YOU!'' ...I dare to say this out loud : Its retarted. Overall its a good game indeed, not perfect but rly good.

My favourite moment in Payday The Secondth is when the Payday Gang steal a prototype of the Sentry Gun that was locked on a train. This sentry gun was made by Engineer (From the hit game Team Defence Fort The Secondth). This means the Payday universe and Team Fortress 2 Universes are linked. Mean while, the Portal universe and Half-life universe are shown to be connected. As well as this, Half-life can be linked back to Team Gamer 2, proving that in theory i should be allowed to use portal guns in Payday 2.

My name is Yoshikage Kira. Iâ€™m 33 years old. My house is in the northeast section of Morioh, where all the villas are, and I am not married. I work as an employee for the Kame Yu department stores, and I get home every day by 8 PM at the latest. I donâ€™t smoke, but I occasionally drink. Iâ€™m in bed by 11 PM, and make sure I get eight hours of sleep, no matter what. After having a glass of warm milk and doing about twenty minutes of stretches before going to bed, I usually have no problems sleeping until morning. Just like a baby, I wake up without any fatigue or stress in the morning.

I was told there were no issues at my last check-up. Iâ€™m trying to explain that Iâ€™m a person who wishes to live a very quiet life. I take care not to trouble myself with any enemies, like winning and losing, that would cause me to lose sleep at night. That is how I deal with society, and I know that is what brings me happiness. Although, if I were to fight I wouldnâ€™t lose to anyone.

Very good fps game with a heist theme. Both Loud missions (action-packed), and also Stealth missions (sneak and be as stealthy as possible). Very good graphics, music score plus sound FX's and voices are perfect. Highly recommendable. Only minor things to put on this game, is eg. one needs to switch to Steam in order to accept Friend invites. But usually the case (I think) with a bit older games. If you are a beginner to fps games, or you have become a bit rusty after a hiatus period, then the game can be difficult even on normal. Setting up a custom game, could maybe also be a bit more straightforward. One needs to go to Online game - Then to Contact Broker - Then set up settings for the custom game - Plus invite to friend (And friend needs to go to switch to Steam window, and accept friend invite in the Steam Chat.). But guess that's minor things, that doesn't spoil the overall awesomeness of this Heist fps game. Krusty BTW: Looking forward to Payday 3 I had heard rumors should be there in 2023.

On reasonable difficulties this game is pretty great, as is the stealth. But loud heists are more about mowing down endless enemies while timers tick down instead of working as a team, completing objectives, and most importantly filling duffle bags with gold bars and cash. Players aren't able to really contend with the cops until level 70 since all the good weapons are locked off and your skillsets are unfinished. The DLC is necessary to buy, about half the content like levels and weapons are locked behind paywalls which is a shame. I think they did alot of things right though it just devolves too quickly into a fustercluck, its not "over the top action" its a mess.

This is a video game.

I don't even know how to describe it. This game defies categorization because at one point you're robbing banks, and in another one cooking meth, and in another one you're basically playing Metal Gear Solid. You're playing an RPG, a puzzle game, a strategy game, a stealth game, and a "host kicked you from the session" game. It's a broken mess because of its outdated engine and it has more DLCs than the total amount of filler episodes in Naruto.

And it's one of my favorite games of all time.

Y'know, I've played quite a bit of this. It's really fun with friends, and a little less without. Sometimes the game bugs out and you fail a mission or it's not passable entirely, but it is still a pretty great game.

The only problem I personally actually have with this game is that it locks 90% of the content in DLC's that cost way more than they should. And while I could see maybe one or two clothing or skin packs that occasionally get an extra skin, they have tons of packs of just gloves!
I could also see maps being extra DLC, maybe even some weapons, since the different missions can be played different ways, but it would be nice if they stopped trying to nickel and dime us.

Sleeping in his car was never the plan but sometimes things don't work out as planned. This had been his life for the last three months and he was just beginning to get used to it. He didn't actually enjoy it, but he had accepted it and come to terms with it. Or at least he thought he had. All that changed when he put the key into the ignition, turned it and the engine didn't make a sound.
The spot was perfect for camouflage. At least that's what she thought when she picked the spot. She couldn't imagine that anyone would ever be able to see her in these surroundings. So there she sat, confident that she was hidden from the world and safe from danger. Unfortunately, she had not anticipated that others may be looking upon her from other angles, and now they were stealthily descending toward her hiding spot.
"Do Not Enter." The sign made it clear that they didn't want anyone around. That wasn't going to stop Jack. Jack always lived with the notion that signs were mere suggestions, not actually absolute rules. That's why the moment Jack looked at the "Do Not Enter" sign, he walked past it and onto their property.
He sat staring at the person in the train stopped at the station going in the opposite direction. She sat staring ahead, never noticing that she was being watched. Both trains began to move and he knew that in another timeline or in another universe, they had been happy together.
She never liked cleaning the sink. It was beyond her comprehension how it got so dirty so quickly. It seemed that she was forced to clean it every other day. Even when she was extra careful to keep things clean and orderly, it still ended up looking like a mess in a couple of days. What she didn't know was there was a tiny creature living in it that didn't like things neat.
One foot in front of the other, One more step, and then one more. Jack's only thoughts were to keep moving no matter how much his body screamed to stop and rest. He's lost almost all his energy and his entire body ached beyond belief, but he forced himself to take another step. Then another. And then one more.
All he wanted was a candy bar. It didn't seem like a difficult request to comprehend, but the clerk remained frozen and didn't seem to want to honor the request. It might have had something to do with the gun pointed at his face.
It had been a rough day. Things hadn't gone as planned and that meant Hannah got yelled at by her boss. It didn't even matter that it wasn't her fault. When things went wrong at work, Hannah got the blame no matter the actual circumstances. It wasn't fair, but there was little she could do without risking her job, and she wasn't in a position to do that with the plans she had.
There was a leak in the boat. Nobody had yet noticed it, and nobody would for the next couple of hours. This was a problem since the boat was heading out to sea and while the leak was quite small at the moment, it would be much larger when it was ultimately discovered. John had planned it exactly this way.
Another option you have is choosing the number of syllables in the words you speak. You probably have never considered this option before, but you have it every time you open your mouth and speak. You make so many choices like this that you never even think about, but you have the choice with each one. What are you going to do with this knowledge?

This game has a great concept but got so many things wrong. To start it is bombarded with DLC (which is a shame considering it costs 10$ Pay to Play and is on a PC) including extra, there are not many weapons available and if you are looking for an LMG, sniper, or any other special weapon then you are stuck with one choice and some of the choices particularly the free sniper rifle are very bad and if you want a good weapon you are forced to pay. there are also many good and pricey special weapons like rocket launchers which gives the players who pay for them an advantage over the other killing massive groups with one shot confirming that the game is also a P2W considering the initial cost, in addition, some perk decks like burglar and kingpin are also paid and give the player a significant advantage. generally, the microtransaction has bad value (except for packs with big discounts) and if you want some investment like extra heist and weapons you have to pay something like 4 times the cost of the game itself.
another problem is the toxic community. If you are playing on a higher difficulty you may be instant-banned after joining without explanation and some of the reasons being that you have to make your steam profile public and expose your name and your location (if you like the privacy of course)  the problem propellers itself thanks to the default host kicking rather the other more popular method of vote kicking and most of the heists being paid to be hosted.
Last, the game experiences a lot of crashing even with no any mods installed compared to other titles.
the concept of a co-op criminal bank robber simulator is excellent but unfortunately, the over-monetization of this specific game has ruined it
I keep shooting the civilians, butterfingers i guess

Pretty good game. Rather gruesome for my taste and takes some guts to play if you are not into... you know... mass murder and things, yet even then it's pretty fun if you have friends to play with.
Great diversity in terms of customization, and a game whose plotline allows for memes and inside jokes not to ruin or oppose the canon, which is a very smart move.
I must of course exclaim that said plotline is quite gory, as the characters themselves are bandits and hitmen, or employers of such people. Although not exactly my cup of tea, I must admit that it is a rather interesting game if you've got some friends to back you up.

Its honestly a really fun game. When you start to get into it, you start to get really addicted to the progress you make. You rob banks, mansions, hell even rob a airplane full of cash lol. PAYDAY 2 is an addicting "cops-and-robbers"-style horde shooter. The sandbox nature of the heists and the limitless variation of your loadout gives this game almost endless replayability. Plus, the soundtrack is great and (most of) the characters are full of personality. Though the game has shown its age a bit in terms of graphics, it offers a ton of paid DLC, and the heists can take awhile to complete, the fun gameplay alone makes up for it and I highly recommend it!

9 years, 70 DLCs and one bankruptcy later, Payday is still [i] somehow [/i] one of the most fun co-op games you can play. It's longevity and replayability comes in no small part from its dedicated modding community, creating entirely new weapons, heists, cosmetics, and even accessibility options, and the offline functions of the game ensure a fine single-player experience too. You'll have to splash a bit of cash to access all the content, fittingly enough, but it's a surprisingly casual game to hop right into with a variety of difficulties and playstyles. You might find yourself playing Payday for more hours than one person ever should, if you don't quit due to FUCKING DIESEL ENGINE CRASHING FOR THE 5,000th TIME.

Ive played this game for many years across both pc and console. The game contains a wide and fun range of "heist" anything from sprinting through a mafia filled building, run and gunning coke heads to sneaking into a museum and slipping a diamond between your cheeks. It has a fun set of skill trees in the early game that quickly become fun to play around with different builds depending on your approach to a heist. I feel like in order to improve upon the game, to be honest the game play and progression is fun and the art style suits how the game plays. 8/10 :)

There are two options: Commit to stealth mode, and spend 30 hours per level perfecting your route, optimizing your objectives, and memorizing the randomized aspects of the map; or go in guns blazing and kill the equivalent of the population of Uruguay in police officers. Also stealthing becomes exponentially harder with more players.

This is a very fun concept, with a long, long history of developer support (as evidenced by the 999 dlcs). The gunplay is kind of bad, and the whole thing feels, in 2022, slightly unpleasant to play mechanically. But the gameplay loop, rewards, and challenges are very engaging. I spent several nights committing HARD to the stealth strat and man, it feels so good once you finally pull it off.

Honestly the game is really fun, making the perk lines feels great, the missions can be really cool and overall I think it's a fantastic game to play with a group of friends. Stealth and Loud missions means there is some good diversity and a lot of options for how to approach your objectives.

PAYDAY 2 is a great game with sometimes broken mechanics and with some friends you can have a real fun time. When you choose what you approach you want to take, the stealth approach system allowing for skilled completion of a heist with a preplanning menu and a lot of waiting. Or you could throw all that out the window and storm places like banks to the White House. I'm not even mentioning one of the best soundtracks in a game ever. If you are ever thinking about buying this game, wait until a sale comes to get the legacy collection, you will enjoy the game that much more. Also get ready to wait for a lot of drills.

Screw this game and its god awful stealth. no matter how careful you are or how close you are to finishing the heist, one tiny slip up costs you the whole mission and all the time you spent on it. you can only kill 4 guards per mission because of the pager system but there is always at least an extra 5 ready to call back up on you. Its horrible. The detection ranges and angles are so inconsistent, It makes it impossible to guess where you should and shouldn't be. Not only that, but this game needs at least $120 for all the content, locked behind ridiculous DLC's. I got a bundle on sale, so I didn't spend to much at all, but another whole half of the game is locked behind payment for me, Its sad.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

I am a 41 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 16 now. My son got this game for Christmas, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, got my car and map and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories

Way worse than how I remember it from years ago.. This game has no realism too it whatsoever. The amount of police killed during the average heist is at least 3x the amount that any normal police force would even have on call. The police are suicidal AF and you can take bullets on top of bullets and never die because of your shield that can take 100 bullets and restores in 5 seconds.. There's no challenge.

So, I want to start by saying that the game feels kind of incomplete. Not a lot of tutorials that REALLY explain the Skill and Perk Decks, convoluted methods for starting a party, certain missions are cumbersome, LOADS of stuff is locked behind a DLC paywall, and the VR feels a little rushed. (the weapons belt mechanics are kinda clunky) BUT, I really enjoy this game's co-op. Getting into heists with friends is super fun, even if at points you're all left wandering around, wondering where the objective is. The singleplayer is okay, but the AI doesn't do much more than follow you, pick off a few enemies, and absorb bullets.

In summary; I like the game, co-op is super fun, singleplayer is passable

This game is some of the most fun I have ever had playing with friends, or by myself. My friend kept recommending the game to me, and eventually gifted it to me. I installed and hopped on the game, to be blasted with an insane amount of weapons, heists (Missions), cosmetics, and all around content. A lot of it is locked behind a pay wall however, but there are a few mods out there that unlock the DLC. (It kind of is pirating, but you get a "Cheater" tag in online lobbies.) Which brings me to the mods, which ads a whole other level of content. There are people who use mods to cheat like god mode, infinite money, etc. But there are quality of life mods that change the HUD, fix some bugs, or just fix the game aesthetically. Then there are mods that add things to the game such as weapons, cosmetics, heists, and a lot more. This game also comes with a free VR DLC. By itself, its not very fun, but as soon as you add mods, it's an amazing VR experience. All in all, I would rate it a 9/10, subtracting one point for greedy DLC, and a not very good base VR mode.

If you were talking to middle/highschool me, who would religiously play this game with friends instead of doing my homework, then he would 100% recommend this game. The Soundtrack is to kill for and never gets old, the actual gunplay itself in terms of handling is pretty good, and I can't pretend that I wasn't invested in the lore and the characters, and I can't pretend that I didn't have a fun fucking time shooting cops and stealing cash.

But that was years ago. 

Every time I think "Yknow what? ONE more time!" I'll redownload the game and give it ONE more shot; It's just not the same, especially as I've grown and learned what I want out of my games.

- The ai to this day is just fucking abysmal, especially civilian ai when taken hostage. Everyone you encounter just feels very robotic and completely takes away from the immersion the music and ambiance is trying to sell.
- It took them YEARS to make a proper safehouse and even then it's just... okay?
- There might be like 5 maps that give genuinely good cash while the others are purely just for fun - which is fine - but once the fun is gone, or you NEED to grind exp or cash, then those 5 maps feel like a chore (I'm looking at you, meth lab)
- I stg i don't know how I never noticed this when I was younger, maybe I was just too in love with the game, but almost EVERY update felt like one step forward, one step back, SOMETIMES making genuine progress but at a snail's pace.
- When playing public yo- [PLAYER IS JOINING: Please Wait 0%...] and brings everything at a grinding halt sometimes for legitimate MINUTES regardless of hardware or internet, and for WHAT?
- Everything is just "Hold F to do blank" and when I tried playing again it drove me fucking crazy, as it's the most lazy way to do things. Not that it can't BE a mechanic, but it's literally EVERYTHING. There is not ONE mini-game or ANYTHING to immerse you in the game at all, it is LITERALLY just "Hold F". Not ONE lockpick mechanic, hacking, ANYTHING.
- Any time they had weapons or systems that were overpowered, they'd basically fuck with everything BUT the weapon, or in general tweak very convoluted things to make it work, screwing with everything.
- DLC, Where 10% might be okay or even GREAT in the meta, but 90% is just fucking rubbish in terms of stats, as if they just randomly typed stats in the chart and sent it, not knowing they'd be underpowered. And when it comes to the GOOD gear, it leaves a bad "pay-to-win" taste in my mouth.

And overall just to summarize: This IS a game that holds a near and dear place in my heart, but I was younger and didn't play that many games, so I didn't have a reference for what I wanted. It's the shittiest haphazard game with the most addictive gameplay loop. 

If you want a genuinely fun 4-player co-op shooter, I couldn't recommend Deep Rock Galactic more, it was everything I wanted out of PAYDAY 2 but better. If you want to give PAYDAY 2 a shot, I can't exactly stop you and hey maybe you WILL have fun like I did!
 But for ME as someone who was a diehard fan for this series, it really does just feels like a corpse that was only kept alive due to its fanbase (okay AND killer OST like goddamn) and without us, payday 2 would have never stood a chance.

Payday 2 is everything you'd expect from a sequel and more. Though there's still some jankiness, and it's still basically just a horde shooter with a cops and robbers coat of paint, it's pretty fun and there's a lot of customization. 

The main reason I didn't recommend Payday: The Heist was due to its low player count and poor solo experience. Payday 2 still has a thriving community, and offers a much better solo experience. 

I also noted that Payday: The Heist was more expensive at $14.99 compared to Payday 2 at $9.99. But it's worth pointing out that Payday: The Heist only has 2 pieces of DLC (one of which is just a soundtrack) totaling $13.98. Payday 2, on the other hand, has 75 pieces of DLC totaling over $200. Yikes! 

The good news is that buying DLC is not required to join missions from DLC. Only the host has to have it. And if you bought the Wolfpack DLC for Payday: The Heist, you automatically receive it for Payday 2. Additionally, all DLC maps up to "The White House" can be played without owning them, once, in Career mode.

The base game offers hundreds of hours of gameplay. The full version further extends gameplay by adding new heists in addition to exclusive weapons and equipment. So far I've enjoyed the base game well enough.

PS: If you're wondering why Payday 2 has the most Steam followers (over 8 million, while the second most, CS:GO, has over 3 million), it's because following their official Steam group unlocks a bunch of stuff in-game.

[h1]Technical Notes:[/h1]
Fullscreen mode only runs at 60Hz by default. To change it: 
[olist]
[*]Go to the configuration files location. 

Native Linux: 
~/.local/share/Starbreeze/Payday2 

Proton:
~/.local/share/Steam/steamapps/compatdata/218620/pfx/drive_c/users/steamuser/AppData/Local/PAYDAY 2/

Windows:
%LOCALAPPDATA%\PAYDAY 2\renderer_settings.xml

[*]Edit renderer_settings.xml

[*]Find "refresh_rate=" and set it to your monitor's refresh rate.
[/olist]
The native Linux port uses OpenGL. Depending on your hardware, you may get better performance with Proton & Vulkan.

Voice chat is bugged on Linux (players can hear you, but you can't hear other players). Another reason to use Proton.

There are several [url=https://www.pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Payday_2#Mods]mods[/url] available.

Fun game to play, loud is solid, stealth is fun. Definitely good with friends and would recommend it to others when on sale. Few problems with gameplay/design however which I like some critics of the game have.

1. Stealth rng: Ever want to do Go bank, Diamond store, Breaking Feds, or Bank Heist without sweating? Just pray then. 
In Payday 3, I hope they tone down rng that affects stealth and actually make the rng fun rather than a restart like the door on Diamond Store.
Ironically, a lot of loud only missions have little to no rng what so ever like Brooklyn 10-10 which would actually be interesting to have and add replayablity.

2. Buggy ai/pathfinding: Ever have tied civilians run straight into everyone's line of sight and raise the alarm just from trying to move them into a room? Yeah, annoying like the guard movement animation sometimes being clunky and confusing to understand where they are going. Another example is with crew ai, ever have them walk to you slowly to revive you when you are about to be in custody? I hope in Pd3 they invest more into better ai and pathfinding.

3. Pay for meta: Kinda wish more base kit weapons were viable on Death sentence without using a bunch of perks and perk decks (which most perk decks cost money).

4. Tedious heists: Some missions like Golden Grin and Alesso are very annoying to complete ranging from too many bags, or waiting forever for an objective to complete. It would be nice if more of the missions used design philosophy of some of the older missions like Shadow Raid where you can do multiple objectives at the same time or have multiple ways of doing an objective.

5. Bugs: Self explanatory, Starbreeze should've fixed many of them already.

Though there are many problems with this game, I still enjoy it as a flawed masterpiece. 
Also, make sure to not shoot Garrett on accident while doing Breaking the Feds.

This game is amazing. Just absolutely amazing. The fun yet challenging difficulties are amazing. There's just something so rage-inducing yet also dopamine inducing about getting curb-stomped by a Cloaker or getting your body ripped apart by a Bulldozer, or even getting shocked by a Taser while a Cloaker runs up to you and a Bulldozer starts firing with their LMG. The guns are extremely fun aswell, you're able to customise them to no end. And the characters have fascinating backstories, even if it's just Jacket from Hotline Miami or even John Wick. Not only that, but the MASKS. THE GOD DAMN MASKS. Where do I even start? There are so many of them even if you don't download DLC (Downloadable Content.) They're extremely fun to unlock, not to mention the extremely cool designs. Even after that, if you don't like the regular look of a mask you can customise it to your own style with different materials, patterns and colours. Overall, bloody amazing. The DLC (Downloadable Content) Isn't a problem either, because it's basically one of the only ways to fund the development of Payday 3. So, sorry for writing an essay about this game, but I love it and seriously recommend it.

upps are: cool gameplay, alot of combos of weapons, alot of weapons in general, dumb (in a good way), multiplayer, customization is cool, and kinda funny.
