HOWEVER. remember that this game is PVE so it doesnt give you advantage over other players. i guess you can flex the dlc weapons? idk, i cant also say that hackers in this game are a problem but i also cant say that they arent. its 50/50 cuz on the good side this game is indeed PVE so its basically good for the team. but on the bad side. it ruins the fun. so think of what you will. i still think that this game is fucking awesome, you atleast need to try it out for the badass music. its absolutelly awesome.

Great co-op heist game and definitely fun with friends, especially as the base game can be very cheap to get  - but with a terrible DLC model that forces you to essentially rebuy the game every few months if you want the latest gear. If you never intend to play on public lobbies, consider having you and your friends install a DLC unlock tool and the mod that hides the "Cheater" flag from the UI. (If you play with DLC content you don't own, the game marks you as a cheater - the same as if you played with a full-on cheat tool, which in most cases will block you from playing on public lobbies)

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

[h1] Game Details [/h1]
[list]
	[*]   [b] Game Name: [/b] PAYDAY 2
	[*]   [b] Game Release: [/b] 2013
	[*]   [b] Genre Tags: [/b] Action, Heist, FPS, First Person, Co-op
	[*]   [b] Estimated Playtime: [/b] 100+ Hours
	[*]   [b] Personal Rating: [/b] 7/10
[/list]

[h1] Review [/h1]
[b] Summary - [/b] Payday 2 is a cooperative first-person shooter video game developed by Overkill Software and published by 505 Games. The game is a sequel to 2011's Payday: The Heist. Two years after the events of the previous game, the Payday gang comes to the Washington metropolitan area to perform another heisting spree. The player can participate in a variety of heists, including but not limited to robberies of banks, shops and armored cars, and producing and distributing narcotics. The game differs from the previous by allowing much more customization of the player (aesthetically and gameplay-wise), somewhat improved graphical interface and experience, more variety and playability in levels, and has reworked stealth mechanics.

[b] Gameplay - [/b] Payday 2 has really addictive gameplay (you are warned). You have a ton of content in this game and the progression is really well put together from what I have seen so far. You can make different builds and do so many different kinds of heist in this game. You have a loud and stealth option for most of the heist, although I will say the stealth ones are pretty hard to do if you are not good at stealth (like me). The gunplay is really good and snappy so no complaints there. I will say that if you want the full experience and everything in the game, it will cost you a good bit of money to get all the DLCâ€™s. I donâ€™t have a ton of hours yet, but I can see myself putting over 100+ hours easily in this game so you will get your moneyâ€™s worth, especially with friends. I feel like even with 40+ hours on this game, I havenâ€™t even touched the surface in this game. After every heist, you get a card that grants you either a weapon attachment, mask, weapon skin, ect. I really do like the progression system in this game, and it gets me coming back to do another heist. So in terms of replayability, you will have no issues with that.

[b] Difficulty - [/b] The game is really challenging, for good or bad thatâ€™s up for you to decide. Personally I like the challenge. The harder the difficulty, you meet different enemies that can make your heist more like a torture session than anything. Stealth is really hard in this game, but then again that could just be me being really terrible in stealth. The harder the difficulty, the more money and xp you get so itâ€™s a fair trade.

[b] Multiplayer - [/b] The way this game shines is multiplayer without a doubt. I met some really cool people here and had a blast. I never met a rude player (well for now) yet, but Iâ€™m sure there are a good bit of toxic players out there in Payday 2, just like in any game. I will say that I only play with friends so I never joined a random match yet, which will probably be the moment I get kicked. Besides that, the multiplayer is amazing and the game is super popular and shows no signs of slowing down. 

[h1] Pros: [/h1]
[list]
	[*] Amazing heist
	[*] Great replayability 
	[*] Lotâ€™s of weapons and customization
	[*] Tons of content
	[*] Huge player base/community
	[*] Character builds and playstyles
[/list]

[h1] Cons: [/h1]
[list]
	[*] Bloated with DLC (wait for sale)
	[*] Difficulty can be a hit or miss for some
	[*] AI companions can be a liability at times
[/list]

I write this review having last played this many moons ago and many DLC ago it seems, so take what I have to say with a healthy pinch of scepticism. 

The game is a fun shooter experience, adding the dynamic of robbing various places and racing towards the exit area/van/gettothechoppa! You get to customise your character, weapons and loadout for each match which is cool and then selecting your missions based on difficulty and payout as they appear on the map. I played this game with my bros and we had a laugh trying to hold back the waves of never-ending police units, watching each other fumble to get the money to our van and trying to save each other when the gunfire was heaviest and casualties were had.....which roughly translated to in most cases running away whilst your squaddie gets tasered to the ground! We had fun playing this game but it soon became apparent that missions were being recycled quite frequently, the challenge aspect was getting too manageable and soon the appeal to select the same mission with the same goals and the same payout was too stale and we dipped out of this game. Now, as I said before this game has had plenty of DLC added so you will probably take a much longer time to reach this point, and one day I may even dust off the old mask and re-enter the chaos, but I still recommend this game as it can be a chaotic ton of fun at times and definitely worth looking into.
For 9 Years I'm play this game it is pretty good and good but for now I think it too boring now and I'm waiting for Payday 3.

It's a good game. Very replayable and generally dumb fun. Each difficulty has its own fun and frustrating side, each heist has a unique approach that you are required to discorver, usually by trial and error. Gameplay is very easy to learn and adapt to, and you don't need a lot of time before being able to fully commit to harder difficulty.
It's great for unwinding with some friends and honestly, as toxic as some of the community is - the majority isn't. People complain about it a lot, but I'd disagree. A few bad apples don't spoil the bunch in PD2's case. 
The DLC's are good. The heists are fun and the cosmetics slap. I do find H3H3's inclusion incredibly unnecessary and just plain stupid though, absolutely pointless.
But other than that - great game. 
Go play it. It's worth your money.

This game saved my life.

I am 200.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 40 years old!

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read NONE of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.
After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 40 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Payday 2 is a good game, dont get me wrong, but so many qualities that just ruin it for me.
I had fun with public lobbies, and the friends you make along the way trying to figure out how to do a stealth run.
I had fun getting fucked by cloakers every 5 seconds, reviving my allies while being showered by bullets.
The game is fun, especially if you have friends to play with.
BUT THE DLC just kills the game.
Half of the contenct is locked behind a paywall, you can get into heists dlc heists if you join someones game sure, but i said content, that means not just heists...
90% of the guns are locked, All you're left with is just garbage weapons you're never going to use except the only 10 useful guns that dont kill your build.
Speaking of builds, you cant really have any of the fun builds either, the card decks that give the best bonuses are locked away.
And i think the infamy system is both my least favorite feature of the game, it promotes replay value, for some masks...
I stopped playing when most of the playerbase left is either a russian hacker, or infamy 50 players sweats who insta ban you for daring to join their game.
Also, the grind for levels can sometimes be so exhausting, the closer you get to level 100 the more every failure kills your motivation, and then you throw it away for a goddamn mask and repeat the diamons store farm once again!
It's a good game, prob would've had a better experience if i didnt try to cheat the game and skip a few levels and reset because of my guilt, but it doesnt take away the clear issues of the game

The best guide for bag throwing simulator
1. Press F on door
2. Wait for drill to break
3. Hold F on drill
4. Wait for drill to finish/break again
5. Repeat 1-4 for a bit
6. Bag up loot
7. Throw bags
8. Get all the bags secured 20 min later

8/10 and I have at least 150 more hours on different accounts

A genuinely great game with even better soundtrack bundled with it. I've only been playing it off and on for about a year, and I can say that its an amazing game for when I'm too bored to really decide what to do and need something to kick-start my night (though I usually just then end up playing it all night). The game also has a pretty nice modding scene, just don't expect it to go all-out like Skyrim's modding scene. You can replace a bunch of random neat stuff ranging from your HUD to some paintings to a shark that appears exclusively in one heist. With all of this good stuff being said, there is the drawback that this game is a massive DLC-fest. For that reason, as much as I'd love to encourage people to buy this game, I can only recommend waiting for a sale. The base game's price drops to 0.99 USD, and you can snag the Legacy Collection for 10 USD (USUALLY), and that'll give you PLENTY of content to gun your way through.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Story: Good in the beginning but went into a "What even is this? I drill a safe to get a treasure box with kirby in it and then I put the kirby in a microwave and when kirby explodes ghost thing invade whitehouse and stuff happens lmao."

Graphics: Could be better but pretty good. 

Music: Literally put the soundtrack to random and the song will always be good.

Replayability: Endless because the RNG gods just go "Whatever you're doing transport train heist why don't we make the turret shoot the player? (won't actually happen but yeah, replayability is endless)"

Difficulty (I'm a DSOD player): It is a good challenge but once you get used to how to beat DSOD easy it isn't a challenge anymore.

Customization Options: A lot for masks, guns, even heists with preplanning and assets so pretty good job so far :D

DLC: Most DLCs are worth it (especially the heists) but for the DLC weapons? No just wait for a sale on those boomer and there is free to play options. Plus you don't even have to own the Heist DLC to play it, you can just wait for someone who owns it to pop up on Crime Net and you can play it.

Bugs: A lot but most of them are harmless to gameplay and can be pretty funny like a dead cop clipping through a wall XD

Community: Literally just the Dead by Daylight community (very toxic) but a bit better?

Should you buy the game full price?: Pretty worth the ten dollars but on stuff like the Steam Summer Sale it can go to 99 cents.

Gameplay: Pretty fun in both stealth and loud unless you are playing a pub stealth, then that is when you rage and want to throw your monitor out of your window.

Content Creators: Pretty funny sometimes and actually deliver news about the game instead of going "HeY gUyS, tOdAy We ArE gOinG tO dO a PAYCHECK 2 lEt'S pLaY sErIeS" when all they do is play one game on very hard difficulty and go "ThAnK yOu FoR wAtChInG" with their cringe outro music.

Developers: Pretty good and come out with content every 3 months except for when they went all "We are not adding micro transactions" and then they added safes that you need to buy a drill to open a safe just to get a weapon skin.

Overall Review: 8.5/10 because of the story being kinda cringe and the micro transactions that one year :/

Payday 2 is probably one of my top ten favorite games of all time, but that does not mean it does not have its flaws. Payday 2 has a very very repetitive, yet consistently satisfying gameplay loop. You always have something to work for, whether that be infamy, challenges, achievements, etc. There is an extensive set of weapons to choose from. All the way from your bare fists to a rocket launcher to a crossbow to a gun that fucking shoots money(unfortunately only as an event weapon). There are a near endless amount of builds you can create and nearly all of them are fun to play and experiment with. All of this wouldn't mean anything if the gameplay itself was bad. Luckily, the gameplay is amazing too. The gunplay is surprisingly smooth and responsive. However, it was built on the Diesel Engine, which limits quite a bit but they still somehow made it work this well. The driving is pretty terrible which is ironic considering the game was literally built on a racing game engine. There are unfortunately a fuck-load of DLC's. None of them are required to have hours and hours of fun, but they can get pretty pricey if you buy multiple. However, by themselves, they are quite cheap and almost always worth getting. I recommend checking the reviews of the DLC before getting them as they can be hit or miss. The modding can also be hit or miss depending on your view of it. Most of the mods you'll see are just texture or HUD mods. However there are plenty of cheats for Payday and it can ruin the experience for you if you want to do things legit. Luckily there is a way you can tell if someone is using mods in-game, so you can kick them or choose not to join their lobby.

Overall, I highly recommend this game and do not see myself quitting any time soon. It is well worth the price.

If you're just looking for casual fun robbing banks and stealing nuclear warheads, this is the game for you. But I will bring up a topic that a lot of new players may not completely realize on their first time booting up the game: the things you think are good, probably suck. The miniguns for the most part fall off in higher difficulties and the heaviest armor in the game will be 1-shot by most trash mobs. What seems fun at lower difficulties will only be a hindrance once you want to bump the challenge up, and the difficulty curve in both stealth and loud is quite a jolt. Most things that seem fun or powerful, like dodge builds, are regarded as noob traps and you'll find yourself relegated to approximately the same 5 builds by the time you reach maximum difficulty. If you aren't concerned with higher difficulties and can manage to ignore the bleating from the DSOD community, then I welcome you to Payday 2, heister.

I never expected this game to fall under the genre of "horde shooter" but it does. Getting into the higher difficulties you'll fight small town's worth of police officers. The amount of content that is locked behind DLC is kinda lame, but the game and DLCs go on sale a lot - I would highly recommend the Legacy Collection which gives you all DLC from 2018 and before. The game can be intimidating, and veterans are not exactly helpful to new players, but give it a chance and it'll be some of the most fun (and legal) cop killing you'll ever experience.

I haven't played the first game so I can't say the game has improved, but from some gameplay I saw, the game did get kinda better. The first thing I want to start with is the community, it is really small but is actually helpful and cool. Second, you have a lot of builds in the game you can play with like dodge, tank, etc... and they all revolve around a healing perk so you can say that you really don't have much freedom in picking which build you are gonna play but that is for you to decide. You can put mods in the game too so i guess you can put hentai robots or something idc. Now the bad part about the game for me at least is the content that is locked behind a paywall, I mean it would be ok if the missions weren't connected to the main story and a secret ending, and that is pretty much the only problem I have with the game so yea I recommend you to have more than 10 euros to spend on the game

maybe I didn't play this game for too long and maybe i'll get some hates from this game's tryhards but for the FIRST TIME in my life I feel like a PC game feels more like a mobile game.. here is why

Microtransactions:
I understand that most modern games have this feature and they're kind of overusing it but payday 2 went with it to a whole new level, they LITERALLY went beyond the limit with these stupid microtransactions I mean 80% percent of the content is just DLCS that you have to buy 
Gameplay:
1-Stealth: stealth is just broken in this game sometimes when you kill a guard ( silently of course ) you hear sirens and stuff
even though there are no cameras nor other guards.. nothing it's just you and him, I couldn't even get past the tutorial because of this or even any stealth mission
2-The Animations: I was surprised when I was saw how bad were the animations this is what made me actually doubt if it was a mobile game ported to pc ( apart from the microtransactions ) I can't really describe how the anims look like but I'd recommend playing any 2-star mobile game on playstore if you really wanna see it
3-Graphics: for a game that is being frequently updated and worked on by its dev team the graphics aren't that good it's just below average. I guess the devs are just working on more dlcs to cash grab their players

Speaking of players why the heck do people play this piece of sh-- and how in the hell can you bear these microtransactions and the limitation of content, best thing I would do right now is delete this game but i'll keep playing it for a while more just to make sure i wasn't wrong about something

Payday 2 is the sequel to Payday, the four player (or 1 player / 3 bot) heist series. 

Worth getting when it and its dlc content is on sale. 

Gets somewhat repetitive but over all a fun game with lots of customization possibilities from your character(s) to their equipment and perks. 

Plenty of ways to modify your characters appearance and an ever expanding catalog of missions added with the new content that comes out quite frequently. 

Like i said, Absolutely worth picking up all of it, when it is on sale.

Skill trees and perk decks allow you to shape a unique playstyle, while being reconfigurable infinite times means you don't have to pick one style at the start and create a new character from the ground up should you wish to try a new playstyle. Gunplay isn't exactly a substitute for joining the army, but it's a strong integral part of an overall thouroughly enjoyable 9 year old game that still holds up against modern titles in terms of enjoyment. As a game about a gang of criminals trying to make bank while evading the clutches of the law, [i] PAYDAY 2 [/i] succeeds with delivering such a premise with a diverse selection of heists, and a variety of gameplay ranging from fast-paced, high intensity run-and-gun missions, to strategy-involving, puzzle solving stealth missions.

I personally had a great experience with [i] PAYDAY 2 [/i], whether it was by myself or with friends, there is always something to keep any heister on their toes, looking for their next, new and exciting objective.

[i] PAYDAY 2 [/i] doesn't come without some performance issues due to some of the incompatibilities of its engine. However, if your computer doesn't run like a potato, or you're willing to sacrifice a large margin of your in-game graphics quality, these issues will be few and far between.

The game itself is simply great, especially if you want to play with friends and fight alongside each other against an endless wave of law enforcement officers in high-stakes PvE missions. I would definitely recommend buying the $10 base game, as there is still something for every heister even without buying any DLC content.

I see that the developers are trying to add more content and to attract more players but this game is very repetitive. The point of this game is that you rob banks or houses and you have to choose how to do it either stealth or not. You get money after every completed heist and you can buy some cheap skins, abilities and weapons. It was fun playing with my mates but if you play this game alone you will fall asleep as i did many times. I see that the game is cheaper now but i would still not recommend buying this game at full price. I hope Payday 3 will be filled with more content and diverse missions.

If you like horde mode games, this is a very satisfying one. Variety in enemies, plenty to fight, and adjustable difficulty so you can just have fun mowing enemies down or give yourself a serious challenge as you play the meta. It also has stealth in it, and it's actually done well. Nothing game changing, but also fun and with it's own set of challenges. 
And the DLC aren't ridiculously priced. Even if you don't get them, while you won't have access to the weapons and can't host the different heists, you can still join on players who are. So don't feel like you have to buy it to play the heists, but I'd still say it's worth if for the variety of weapons and such you can get, as well as being able to host and play those maps whenever you want.
Final thing, you are not required to always be online or play with others. There's AI companions and a single player you can play. And while the AI companions aren't the smartest, they are at least great meat sponges that can revive you if anything happens. And with strong weapons, they can kill and hold a room by themselves. So they are useful.
Probably the most replayable game ever made.

Then you grab bags of money and walk to the getaway vehicle and it's over.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

When considering the price and that Payday 2 often goes on sale for a dollar, it's not a bad deal. It is fun to shoot and conduct heists for a little while but it quickly becomes stale. As you play more, the sameyness becomes very apparent. Playing with friends and the rather in-depth build crafting helps remedy this problem a little but that stuff only goes so far. Also, there is way too much DLC. However, I would still recommend it because you can get a good bit of fun for the price that you pay.

Probably one of the greatest cooperative shooters ever made. Hundreds of fully customizable weapons ranging from pretty standard assault rifles and pistols to quad rocket launchers and massively over-sized solid gold spoons that ignite enemies on hit. An absolute insane amount of build diversity and a frankly amazing set of almost 80 missions that allow you to approach the objectives in either stealth, or loud and frantic combat, adapting the objectives to suit your chosen approach, and randomizing elements of each mission to ensure you don't know exactly what you're doing even if you've done it dozens of times before. This game has something to offer pretty much anyone, and the fact that it balances it all as well as it does is insane.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character, and started playing, but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I've spent so much time messing around with randos online in a way that really brings me back to the early days of multiplayer games. This game just has such a fun, careless aura that it makes it so refreshing.

That being said... you almost can't play the game with just the base game. I was lucky enough to get this as a bundle sale with 80$ of DLC for only $20, and I think that's almost the only way anyone can get into the game.

Wait until it's on sale and buy the Legacy Collection, that will ensure you have a majority of the content for decently cheap.

man i love payday 2 so much, you may look at this review and think, "how could he love payday 2 so much with only 4.9 hours in the game". my simple answer is that it takes even less than that to appreciate the true splendor this game brings. payday 2 is the culmination of such elaborate and purposeful design, providing a product and experience unlike any other. the tags of the game, "co-op, action, fps, heist, looter shooter" do not do justice to the boundary breaking this game does in each of these categories. starting with co-op, you are allied with your friends, those you trust the most, in such high octane circumstances you learn to rely on and provide for your team. this brings me to action, the true and suddenly realized adrenaline you hear when you come face to face with the enemy "cloaker" or have to juggle the tedious tasks of thrusting the "f" key to keep the civilian hostages down and fending off the ferociously fortified firearm flaunting officers. the gun-play in this game is second to none, playing games like csgo, i now see their attempts at such a system of gameplay is a meager attempt at replicating that of payday 2. payday 2 reinvigorates the heist genre for our generation, interposing items, trials, and elements unseen in any game before and likely after. after playing this game, you come to terms with the fact you will never play such an amazing a beautifully constructed piece of work which we are forced to inadequately and modestly call a "game". payday 2 is so much more than a game, it is revolutionary, it is the greatest game of our generation and likely of all time.

I used to love Payday 2, but now I find it unenjoyable.

It used to be, you fought off cops while securing objectives, playing out the heist while also battling it out. Which was very hard, but at the same time there was some oversight to it all, with tactics and gunskills involved at the center of it all.

But then they started introducing builds / a meta that was so insanely overpowered compared to the AI's mechanics / it's potential that you stood there practically immortal and able to slaughter hordes of them without any concern whatsoever, and apparently rather than addressing that meta, the horrible imbalance it created, they figured "Let's continue down this path lol and just throw some more cops in there so it balances out..."

And now you have this nightmare.

It's just so silly you're basically just four people cheesing through all the missions with cops absolutely everywhere, no chance even to control anything nor do you need to, as you just rely on magic immortality skills coupled with ridiculous and spammable firepower to get you through.

They went and made a mess of what used to be an awesome shooter, basically, these days it's just a parody of what it used to be.

It started so innocently with speedy dodge-builds which combined with converted bullet-spunges made it possible for you to just run past fifty cops before they even reacted to you, and they've only ventured further down that road since with abilities (decks to be specific) some of which, on top of that, makes you practically immortal. And now that battlefield which used to be enjoyable, it's just a mess, as the game has become 100% geared towards timing your cooldowns, cheesing past cops at lightning speed with them just looking at you dumbfounded, and resource-management (as long as you don't run out of medic bags, you can get through any mission).

I enjoyed it better when it was about actually fighting your way through a mission, battling it out against a well-balanced army of AIs, the way you'd expect from a shooter, but now seen from that perspective it's mostly unrewarding.

(Disclaimer note: All this only applies for loud mission, stealthing is still quite fun but it was never my favorite part as after a while it gets repetitive).

[Massive Download Time]
This game takes almost an hour to download - i can download any other game in my library in 1/8 that time or less.

 also why do i have to download DLC that i dont own? ive read that its to prevent players who do/dont have certain DLC from crashing or running into issues but ive seen games fix this issue in a multitude of ways that arnt as bloated as this.

[Needlessly Complex]
There really doesnt need to be this many bits and pieces - things to choose - equipment to change - perks to swap - this and that.

when i first saw the depth of this i let out an audible sigh as i realized i needed to disect every single one of these pieces to understand why it needs to be fiddled with and the more i dug into the more impatient i got with it as i started to realize how pointlessly extrapolated it was. Payday 2 could really do with looking at every other game that allows players to set up a kit but its way to involved to the point of being a chore especially to people just jumping in wondering "why is this important - whats the deal with that - etc etc etc"

[Minor Keybinding Gripe]
there are is a fat chunk of keys bound to a multitude of things that its becoming seriously overblown - most keys could probably be cleverly coded to like 1 or 2 keys at most but it seems like almost every facet of your clothing and equipment needs its own dedicated key instead of a more intuitive equipment selection method

you cant change keybindings without first unbinding the key that you are looking to place on another function which only leads you down a rabbit hole once you discover that you have to bind a fuckton of different keys just to get one to be ideal.  seriously just let me press backspace and unbind a key or something.


[TL;DR]
* Downloads take to long
* Downloads include things that dont need to be there - content you cant use
* Equipment/Perks/Etc vastly over complicated - could be better simplified
* Keybinding is dated and doest afford the ability to simply unbind a key
* Far too many keybinds - could assign most functions to fewer keys

Where to begin with Payday 2? Well if you've always wanted a heist style game, that's fantastic with friends? You should look no further. The difficulties feel fair and balanced, and always keep you thinking of new ways to completely higher difficulty runs. The weapons feel fairly well, and the different ways to build them will have you thinking of what ways you can run heists more efficiently, all while maintaining great team play behind it. You want to stealth? Go right ahead! Prefer the loud runs? On most heists that's another efficient way of doing things if that's your choice! I give Payday 2 a 9/10 and have many hours from console and PC combined to give it that rating. Buy this game if you want a great game to play with friends.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Day Schedule:
Wake up
Buy and download PAYDAY 2
Buy minigun and rob bank after bank
Get a whole squad and quietly rob a car dealer
Blow up road and drive to the port delivering the cars in shipping containers
Play PAYDAY 2

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Nothing to say payday 2 is best robber game in the world 1000/10

After buying Payday 2, I was overjoyed daily at the multitude of heists I could pull off, banks I could rob, and mafias I could dissolve. I spent hours of my time, purchasing and modifying weapons to my heart's content, then, mask up with a personalized dripped out mask that I could really build to my style. I earned thousands, massacre thousands, if not millions of cops and special ops along the way. Sometimes, a newbie would join and ruin a heist. That's okay, after the lawyer does their work and you get released from custody, you teach them, or guide them in the right direction to become that big, bad mafia boss they always wanted to be. 

The game is pretty fun too.
Stop looking at the negative reviews to find an excuse not to buy this game.

This game is a blast.

Throughout my near 250 hours of playing, I can say I enjoyed at least 245 of those hours. The price is insanely low, especially during winter/summer sales. DLC may be slightly excessive, but gosh golly the game is good enough without them. It's even better if you're playing with friends. If you need co-op game that doesn't bombard you with unnecessary mechanics, yet still allows you to customize the way you play, then be sure that the 6.5$ you spend are more than worth it.

10/10. Ideal with mods.

This is my review on payday with my experience, (kinda just got bored and did this, didnt expect to really make a review.)

please remember, i'm not the best at explaining, this is a review/explanation, probably gonna be my longest review for a long time. If you are actually interested, this is gonna be a hell long review but please, i ask you, read it all.

The gameplay - Your a heister, or as our legendary sit-in-the-chair-guy calls it, clowns, and your job is basically to just heist banks, with two options, stealth or loud. You rob jewerly stores, malls, anything really. Including the 'career' (campaign) you have things that arent even heists, you transport stuff safely (if you call throwing a bag of weapons a few miles up safe), or create the white clouds in one of my beautiful paintings. It's all different, each heist. On that topic there are 79 heists, each with 7 difficultys, Normal, Hard, Very Hard, Overkill, Mayhem, Death wish, Death Sentence, and the extra one down mode. One down mode will be explained after I tell you this story...
Downs, you've heard it, seen it, had it in other games, you run out of hp you get downed, you have a standard of 3 downs, but with a skill you can get 4. On 0 you get downed and go into custody. There are 2 ways to go into custody to my knowledge, 1 is run out of downs, 2 is when downed, you have a 30s timer and if you don't get revive in those 30s (yes timer stops when being revived) you go into custody no matter the downs. How to get out of custody? To get out of custody (Only in multiplayer or it'll just end) you must have a hostage, can be a police or civilian, and wait for the police assault to end and then, our amazing bain, will negotiate for us so that if we set our poor civilian free or police, we will get our psychotic-maniac with a flamethrower free. For the gameplay changing part, that's skills and perks, (and weapons but you already understand that the second you get in.) Skills, to get them you must have skill points, which you gain 1 (only level 50 you get more than 1, which is 3) each level, up to level 100, you use these skill points to get certain skills depending on what your going for, a dodge build, tank build, crit, all what you want. How the skill points are categorized is with 5 sections, Mastermind, Tank, Technician, Ghost, and Refugee or something, each one has 3 different column's each with 2 sides (except for top and bottom skill which will be explained later). Each column is labeled on what it basically does, per say mastermind's first column is medic, to go up the skill ladder, and on the left side its mostly about giving more uses to medkit (equipment will be explained soon) and reviving, whilst on the right side its about medbags and that, but what the main ability of that column, is the top piece, there are 4 skills in each column(on each side) and the first and top have just 1 skill, not 2, each skill you get (except for top) will unlock the next tier skills, (does not include other columns in that section) but the top normally includes all + a few aced skills to unlock and only THEN you can get it with skill points, aced skills are skills where you need skill points as well to ace a skill, acing doesnt mean improving, its basically a whole nother skill. Going back to my main topic, the top ability only costs 4, at its the 4th tier, but its ace costs 8, and the ace is what makes it good. Inspire is the skill, and what it lets you do in comparison to aced inspire is, when pressing f at a teammate, it shouts and improves some stats for a bit, but aced lets you have a 100% chance, to revive a downed teammate by shouting at them from 9 or less meters away, this can only occur once every 20s. 
Now that, I think i explained the skills, (please if you got this far if you see me missing something or i left you confused at a part, tell me in comments.) 
It's time for me to ramble on about perks, or called perk decks.
Perk Decks are basically, skills, but you cant really choose which you want to get, each perk deck (most are locked to dlc) has a different objective on what it's goal to do, an example is rogue, best perk deck for a dodge build, (a dodge build is basically a build where you get your dodge to max, which is 60, so that you have a 60% chance to dodge each bullet) with 3 of 9 perks giving +15% chance to dodge, and other abilitys, 
you get to see what all the perks are in each deck and what they do.
Now to utilize them, it goes in an order likes, but its just a straight ladder, to gain them you use perk points.
I have no clue how to really gain them, all I know is after each mission/heist you gain perk points which you use to put progress into the perk your on in that line. 
I think I explained perk decks, so now i'll explain the working of equipment and thus some light to my information.
Equipment, includes quite a few things like sentries, ecm jammers, ammo bags, medkits and medbags, body bags, or the unlockable from every perk deck ( i think every) armour bag.
Equipment is meant to be used in a certain way, like jammers for stealth, or medkits/medbags for tanks that are going loud, body bags for stealth, and sentries, kinda just op with ammo bag, with inclusion of the supressed sentry which is meant for killing unlike its counterpart thats used for distractions. All of them (except armor bag) are able to be upgraded/improved by skills,
for example to what I said before, sentry skill allowing you to place 4 sentries instead of 1.
These are incredibly useful as medbag is able to heal you up to full and reset your down count if you lost some, or medkits which skills can allow you to carry a ton, is just a fast place-then-use to regain full hp.
That's mainly your gameplay, what you can change for your character.
Onto about the fbi, there are a few special enemies, they basically do different/special stuff but I don't think i've seen em all, so I don't think I can explain that part, but imo it's way more fun to have the "what the F**K!?!??" or "wHaT tHe hELL is that thing!"
But also the best part of the fbi, is the voicelines, I'm gonna explain one of special enemies;
Cloaker.
Every. Payday 2. Players. Nightmare. 
He will jump out of thin air, do a summersault and drop kick you to the ground in a second, and his insults hurt more than his drop kicks.
The voicelines he has, are one of a kind, going from "Listen here, I got this drum solo I've been working on." and proceeds to hit you with a baton to "You call this resisting arrest? We call this a difficulty tweak!" 
But thats just fbi, all the heisters (there are multiple heisters you can pick to play as, most from different places) have their own. 

Overall, it's honestly great, I haven't learned to much or gotten to far, not much knowledge. but it's nice to see an option to "Auto-kick cheaters" and whatnot in a game for once, or "allow modded players". They encourage you to play how you want, Instead of just not allowing cheaters to play with others, its a choice if you want to play with a cheater. Per say, in public if you turn off the option, someone with cheats can join and that was YOUR choice to heist with a cheater.

Now maybe, probably 99% of the gameplay, is the masks, customization, was NAILED, to the masks to outfits, they really did it perfect, it's so fun to play around with the masks and with a friend it's just funny.

Honestly I definitely feel like im missing a lot that i should be explaining, but i'm gonna stop right here
I don't really think anyones gonna even see this message and, the rest you'll figure out easily on your own, 
or just go watch a video! go on wiki!, again this is the gameplay part, not the review.

And as always, remember, this is my opinion, if you don't like it, read a different review.

Payday 2 is one of the games in existence. The moment I laid my eyes on it, I could definitely say I was in for a game. This game has many unique mechanics, like walking, sprinting, and jumping. I could tell that people made this game, the voice actors did a job, the graphics are visible, the soundtrack is audible, and there is certainly a story. There is a selection of weapons to use, and they are all instruments used to purposefully inflict damage. Payday 2 has characters, and they play roles. Every heist I play through has me on my seat and playing the game. I had such an experience playing the game that the main character, John Payday visited me in my dreams and delivered the famous line: "It's Payday 2". I would certainly rate this game as 4 paydillion stars.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

- Best criminal simulator game

One of the more classic and better games to put you in the shoes of a criminal. Stunning graphics, very well developed story line, many well thought out heists, much better stealth possibilities compared to the first game, a very neat customization system that allows you to express your criminal side and also a lot of classic characters to be rememberd. You can't possibly forget how Hoxton insults his younger counterpart, Houston when calling out to follow him for example. The only real issue that might seem annoying to players of the game is the fact that you need to own a very specific version of a whole another game on Steam, to unlock one of the playable characters, Jacket. This just seems like another gash grab opportunity that Overkill Software decided to take, just like they did with the Wolfpack DLC in Payday: The Heist. Other than that, a big improvement from it's predecessor. Very hyped up for the upcoming sequel!

Directions/Instructions Checklist
Step 1
In a Dutch oven, cook sausage, ground beef, onion, and garlic over medium heat until well browned. Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, tomato sauce, and water. Season with sugar, basil, fennel seeds, Italian seasoning, 1 teaspoon salt, pepper, and 2 tablespoons parsley. Simmer, covered, for about 1 1/2 hours, stirring occasionally.

Step 2
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook lasagna noodles in boiling water for 8 to 10 minutes. Drain noodles, and rinse with cold water. In a mixing bowl, combine ricotta cheese with egg, remaining parsley, and 1/2 teaspoon salt.

Step 3
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Step 4
To assemble, spread 1 1/2 cups of meat sauce in the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish. Arrange 6 noodles lengthwise over meat sauce. Spread with one half of the ricotta cheese mixture. Top with a third of mozzarella cheese slices. Spoon 1 1/2 cups meat sauce over mozzarella, and sprinkle with 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese. Repeat layers, and top with remaining mozzarella and Parmesan cheese. Cover with foil: to prevent sticking, either spray foil with cooking spray, or make sure the foil does not touch the cheese.

Step 5
Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes. Remove foil, and bake an additional 25 minutes. Cool for 15 minutes before serving.

This one is good. Get it, Or don't. Wish the monetization scheme wasn't so... ridiculous. But it seems the devs are (and have been for a while now) in a tight spot. So the macro-transactions don't feel as bad as they probably should. Even so the game is great fun especially with friends. The community ranges anywhere from good too trash (about a 50/50 shot) so think about trying to get some friends to get the game as well. If nothing else just too have a more consistent time of it. Weapon customization is fantastic, I look very much forward to this system being expanded upon in Payday 3! The game play itself can be kinda... jank as hell and finicky at times (particularly with stealth) but with friends this is some the most fun I'v had in a while. It's unfortunate that I can only really recommend this game if you get at lest the "Legacy Collection". I'm not really one to recommend the "Definitive Legacy Ultimate Complete Edition BUY NOW! 800% VALUE!" version of any game, But for the aforementioned reason it doesn't really feel as bad as maybe it should. So get it, or don't.

Isn't it fun to go rob a bank with a thermal drill that breaks down every 30 seconds? And meanwhile, the police free your hostages but after being untied they just stand there in the middle of the crossfire, being human shields for the cops. You can hear Bain being angry at you for killing some suicidal civilian. And then Dallas is screaming at the top of his lungs, "I NEED A MEDIC BAG!" Bro, go to the doctor bag I left by the vault. Oh, and speaking of the vault, After 5 minutes of repairing a shitty drill multiple times, the vault opens up by itself (oooh, magic!) and inside, there is gold worth millions. This is some tiny bank in the poor part of the city. WHY IS THERE GOLD? I guess someone around here robbed Fort Knox and just deposited it all to the bank. Oh well, now it's ours.

Terrible game by even worse developers.

There are ads everywhere in the menus to buy their DLC.

They even charge to customise the color and shape of the cross hair.
Ai Is the worst i've ever seen. They don't help with objectives, deliver loot or even follow you most the time.
The mouse sensitivity is way faster than humanly usable and there is no setting to change it and never will be. The Devs only care about adding more paid content not fixing bugs.
They force you to follow their page for in game items and if you leave they take them away.

The only reason i'll still play this is with friends, but i wont be buying anything from these Devs in the future.

Pros:
+ Only game in my opinion that has this type of co-op heist feel that is fun to play solo/multiplayer
+ Lots of customization with weapons, mask, and outfits
+ DLC is fun and recommend to have
+ Story is actually pretty good 
+ Perk deck and skill tree allows more variation to how you play
+ There are mods but be warned that some could cause you or other players to crash but makes the game way better
+ Recent Infamy patch allows you to level up infamy without losing your levels, so you don't have to start off with no skills or basic weapons until a certain level. Also you can double level up infamy with this new patch but you are sacrificing you levels.
+ Easter eggs 
+ Repair the Drill simulator and Bag carrying simulator!
+ Lovely webseries and trailers

Cons:
- Waiting for the drill during stealth, but it's not a huge deal because you could use that time to do other things 
- The game engine is poorly optimized 
- On the highest difficulty some of the maps are cancer, but doable 
- Some perks, items, and skills could be reworked/buffed to make them less redundant on higher difficulty. You can do them, but it's not going to be fun.
- Not a lot of things you could buy because you get a lot of money later on
- They reuse maps or parts of it
- Community is a bit iffy with elites and cheaters for online but I think it's better than most 
- Buggy shit but playable 
- Fall damage :( 
- Ethan and Hila like bruh
- Killing civilians bad :( but killing a whole police department good =)

Remarks:
Although it might not seem like a lot of content for a 2013 game to now, they are trying and still adding content. Plus mods will solve a lot of issues with the game and some of the cons I mentioned. The game is PVE so you don't have to worry about cheaters too much apart from the fact that they might be able to crash or make the game too easy for you. It's up to you to decide where to draw the line. It's your game, so play however you want but don't hurt others enjoyment due to your actions. They are also making Payday 3, so support them if you like the game.

Pros:
Decent game that can waste your time, DLC heist content can be accessed if the host has access to it, Great variety of weapons from the devs. The modding community has made a lot of mods to fix bugs and make the game look better even adding more weapons for you to add/play with. The custom heists can be immersive and great fun to play on with some friends. Game is easy to mod too. 

Cons: 
Can get boring when solo, modding can be initially difficult. Some of the heists (Hell's Island being one) is highly unoptimised requiring a rather powerful machine to run it with somewhat steady fps. 

Works on my low end rig: i5-3470 @ 3.6ghz, Intel HD 620, 8gb DDR3 RAM @ 1333mhz (only rated "Decent" because half of the maps are unoptimised for the lower end machines like this one)

The game overall has a lot of fantastic FPS game-play like in COD, CSGO, and Battlefield, mixed in with a lot of ideas and more arcade-like and fast pased like DOOM. Sure its a game made back in 2013 and has some problems with it like:

- AI either clipping through walls, stand there doing nothing, or just ignoring you and shooting other teammates (Even if you are behind them BTW).
- Missions that are a tad bit aggravating like finding a certain item in an area that has items that look identically to each other, or carrying heavy items to a drop-off zone 150m away.
- Forces you to wait either for a helicopter to arrive, a drill to finish drilling, a thing to heat up, or literally waiting to move forward with the mission.
- AI teammates not having the best awareness and can either do somethings good or bad;
Good - They help you by taking care of enemies, carrying things for you, and helping you off the ground when you get downed.
Bad - Sometimes they'll take a different path to follow you instead of directly following you, or follow me if I go too far whenever I told them to stay in one spot.

Despite the problems that I have endured the game overall has a ton of content and is still getting updated to this day, and I've been overall happy with this game since its all that I want in a more arcade like shooter, it has great mechanics, a very high level of customisation, likeable characters, tons of references that'll make someone laugh, and has the best skill tree that I have ever seen in any game.

Game overall is a 8.5/10
It has its flaws, but is still a fantastic game.

Great 4 player co-op shooter game, much recommended, very poggers and much fun. DLC may be overloaded though but worth the price. Game can also be modded which is great. If you're looking for a great crime spree game, this game definitely for you.
this game is fun..., despite shooting thousands of SWAT forces obv

Overkill is terrible for their handling of console. So it's a "No". And they deserve it. But without bias, I'd call this a good game. But don't screw a bunch of your players like that. What's that tell us to expect from Payday 3? I buy the game on PS4/5 and it'll get abandoned again?

Don't worry there's a real review here too.

PC has all kinds of new stuff to do, but some things are different; masks and attachments tied to challenges/achievements. it's ok, just a bit annoying. More continental coins. But can't buy masks with coins now? I can't find a way to do so. Overall not a bad game. 

My problems personally are Overkill's abandonment of the console titles. That hurts my experience with the game vastly. Wasn't happy with Tony Montana's (Scarface's) removal, but that's not on Overkill, that's on Universal Pictures. But it still annoyed me. So i bought the pack that had him included.

Got it (with the Legacy DLCs) for 1535 CAD (11.6 USD), don't remember the discount or original price. Was a while ago. Refused to buy off Steam to support Overkill as much as possible. Got it as a code off a games-for-sale site, i forget which one. cdkeys, g2a, one of those i think.

Hours are low on PC. Played for hundreds of hours on PS4. PC is better. 
On PS4:
beat the game
Unlocked everything
experienced pretty much all the content the game has to offer.

Give it a 4.5/5 as a game. (Removing my bias on Overkill)
Give it a 2/5 for terrible business practices regarding Console. 
Have it noted, I have many things I'd say about Overkill that would get purged from this review by the review process that I have omitted. You can use your imagination tho.

I got this game on sale since it was probably one of the best deals, I had wanted to play it for a while but honestly wasn't expecting much. I had heard many good things and equally bad things about it. Looking at it was like the beginning of The Dark Knight with Left 4 Dead like gameplay but instead of going through through a cooperative campaign of levels slashing zombies it was robbing banks and I guess fighting off cops and swat. This game is very, very fun, mowing down dozens of enemies and going overkill (haha funny) while having specific objectives will never not be fun at all. And the environments of the places you can rob are amazing. However the game does have some minor animation bugs which can get annoying at times, also why is this game 80GB? It should be about 50GB at max, 80 is just way to much disc space for this. Although I have only played an hour and a half it has been awesome fun and I can't wait to play more of this, especially can't wait to try the VR mode

Dumb fun with friends, worth buying (even at full price, this game is far from dead), just make sure you have some people around you that are experienced, as there is some nuance in this game.

My favorite is the stealth heist "shadow raid", I had a ton of fun with my friends in middle school running that all night, and it continues to be fun after all these years.

There's no game that gives me the feeling of urgency like this game does, nor is there one that makes me feel as badass. 

The best part, in my opinion, is the ability to play as you'd like. Wanna be a ninja? Go ahead. Wanna wear an iron man suit and try to out-tank dozers? Nothing's stopping you! Wanna kill all the guards, take hostages and leave without a fuss? Perfect! 

The only gripe I have about this game is the grind. But even then, you can min-max to shit and still get away with it, given you have a well coordinated team. Right now, it's only a dollar, so don't hesitate because it's a crime (pun) to not try this game.
Game offers a lot of different weapons and interesting missions

My Personal Review:

1 - It's a great game, alone and with friends. There is a lot of possibility in this game, there are different ways of doing heists, different masks, weapons, and characters. There are a lot of strong female characters in this game, which is always a plus.

2 - Payday 2 may be seven years old, but it still provides gamers with an extremely fun and unique experience. The game allows players to live out their wildest dreams as a professional thief, as they complete a variety of different heists ranging from simple jewelry store robberies to elaborate military raids, Which I find really impressive.

3 - (Extremely Important) Parents need to know that Payday 2: Crimewave Edition is essentially a bank heist simulator and is full of inappropriate content. Players can rob banks with others, shoot and kill rival gangs and police officers, kill hostages if need be, and deal drugs in some other missions, Plus it's a fictional game, Not based in a real life situation.

4 - Whether you are joining for the first time or jumping back in, PayDay 2 is the perfect game to play with friends. I personally have a lot of fun playing this game with my friends.

That's pretty much it, My honest review on this spetacular game! :)

With the about 40 hours I have put in, I feel I am finally able to rate this game. Payday 2 is an amazing co-op game to play with friends. The majority of time I have in Payday is time staying up with friends seeing how much meth we can cook or how much money we can take from a bank. Combined with the fact that this game is often on offer with its DLCs going for literal pennies, Payday 2 can manage to create a wide variety of enjoyable scenarios. The achievements can probably keep you playing for 100s of hours and the repeatability of this game is practically through the roof. Hell, even if friends aren't online I will still play a game in offline mode. Payday 2 is almost impossible to sum up in this last sentence, but even if it is not on offer, you should buy a copy to play with friends.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

It was fun like 6 years ago but the feel of the game hasn't been updated to feel modern or smooth and playing it now feels like a chore. Kinda wish they'd just make a new Pay Day instead of making all these map updates. The game is starting to have feature creep too. The skill trees are massive and overwhelming if you haven't studied the meta and maps, which also feels like a chore to get through if you haven't been grinding the game since day 1. 
The mechanics are cool and fun, but my main thing is that they need to just make a new game already. If they made a modern Pay Day or Pay Day 3 I think it would sell extremely well and that's exactly what I've been looking forward to.
The game overall is fun if you can get past the old clunky FPS feel. The heists are cool and strategizing new maps is very fun. Of course some maps have less replay-ability since you learn how to easily get it done. The developers helped with this by making some aspects of the map randomly generated, so a specific room you might be looking for could change from one side of the map to another from each heist.
Love the game when I played it years ago, can't say I recommend it now though because I just want them to actually make a new game instead of updating an outdated model. Too clunky and saturated with features.

PD2 is an incredibly fun and most often fast paced arcade shooter. It isn't realistic, it isn't strive to be realistic, it isn't supposed to be realistic. Most importantly: The game doesn't really try to be something it isn't in most cases - it's simply fun.

Almost all levels can be done "loud" (read: shooter) and most can also be done "silent" (read: sneaky), wether it's robbing a bank, a warehouse, the white house, or tampering with election machines. The game can be picked up years after having it played last and is still exactly that: fun. Pretty much everything can be done solo, however it's also optimal with a few friends, if all have a decent internet connection. Modern heisters and characters from pop-cultural sources are also available, whether it be John Wick, h3h3, Clay von Sons of Anarchy, etc.

A major gripe for me is the amount of DLCs now - shortly before the h3h3 expansion came out in 2017, I remember patchnotes reading there would be no more, as the game is finishd... 5 years and over 100â‚¬ later, there is still content coming out - which is good. But a lot of money for people only getting a chance to play on rare occasions.

Beat every heist on One Down back when that was the hardest difficulty and I gotta say there's a ton of stuff here.

Music- Slaps

Gameplay- Splits into 2 different types that require different builds, thought and honestly some luck to pull off well.

Sound design- For 2013 really well done and immersive.

Hours to complete- Depending on skill level I'd say around 300-700 hours to see and do everything

Final Verdict- 9/10

Almost 9 years on, it is one of the best cases of a GaaS done right. Despite the memes, this game refuses to die, and keeps adding great content to this day. This means that Payday 2 is one of the most massive games you can get today, with dozens of heists, weapons, playstyles and some different modes. All of this with (currently) no abusive loot boxes (since they were removed) or microtransactions.

There is a lot to complain about with Payday 2, but it's impossible not to recommend it for anyone who likes horde-style action games, careful stealth planning, and comically large spoons.

Payday 2 is an all-time classic. Many poor technical decisions were made from the outset of its inception. It is no secret that the diesel engine (literally the foundation/core/engine) around which the rest of the game is built.
Regardless of the flaws in logic of the original creators, the game is a cult classic. 
The lore, characters and the sheer brilliant audacity of the concept around a game in which one can rob banks. Live the life of the outlaw and become infamous and extremely rich. 
there are many characters to choose from thanks to DLC adding to the original four heisters of the Payday Gang. And the team didn't skimp on choosing great quality actors, including many well known in hollywood.
there are many great features connected to lore in the game. Most of the heists have a stealth option, so one can sneak in and sneak out with either sim[pe of complex plans, feeling worthy of notoriety for not being detected. Personally I get my rush from stealth heists, however those of your for whom "the action is the juice", most heists do have a loud option. Some achievements and trophies will rely on either stealth or loud to be achieved. I love the idea of being a professional, not a mass murderer, so I generally try to stick stealth for the immersion factor.
an added bonus is the level of character customisation (in terms of clothing and masks/disguises) only for aesthetic purposes and not really functional, however, it is all part of building your own take on the style and type of professional heister(s) you prefer. While they all come with back stories, it is fun to insinuate oneself into the role of the character, build on lore/legend in the imagination. 
There's not better rush than working with a team (communicating and assisting via mic) and pulling off the ultimate heist together or getting one of those badass difficult achievements with a good team. CO-OP is the name of the game, but it's no less fun playing solo with AI either on standby or joining you when it goes loud.
Despite a little too much whining from some players, the devs have done a great job at patching and updating  and really taking on board player feedback for bug fixes. The devs were often put under the pump. working unfair hours just to try to slap together updates and DLCs that were given unrealistic release dates by the head of the company. All things considered, the devs did an amazing job whith what they had.

When all is said and done it will forever be one of the greatest. most infamous games of all time. I love PAYDAY 2 and i am looking forward to the release of PD3. I pray they learned their lessons with PD2, but maintain lore and characters (keeping original voice actors) while still introducing new characters. I'd be happy if they really surprised us, even if the original characters have "retired" or maybe it'll be an origin story. EIther way, conceptually they have set the bar pretty high. And I hope they listen to the creatives over the bean counters or their own egos and pay due respect to what is such a classic. 
PD2 is affordable and despite its age it is still and always eill be one of my all time favourites.

DEFINITELY GIVE PAYDAY 2 A TRY. YOU WON'T REGRET IT!

*ps apologies for typos. I am currently very sick wih COVID, so I don't have the energy or patience to be as precise or eloquent as I usually write.

god cried when this game was installed on my pc. the devil laughed when i opened it. we call this a difficulty tweak. fully automatic flame enhanced high explosive rotary akimbo shotguns. all who feel my presence live in fear. my 7.1 tonne body armour that was fastened from tearing a tank in half with my bear hands cause the earth to shake when i walk - all particulates in the air travel around the globe at mach 6.3 and induce tsunamis that cover 65% of japans population. my sheer playstyle in this game makes me wanted by 6 separate private militaries across the democratic republic of congo. dallas is more cracked than my great great twice removed nans urn when i punted it across the floor wearing steel toe boots at 4:15am. the only objective in the entire game (despite the announcers orders) is to take every guard off the census with 6000 pounds of c4 plastic explosive in a stealth mission. its ok though. the c4 had a silencer on it. stealth? no wenches? filthy casuals. loud is the way god intended this game to be played. i need my 200mm shoulder fired autocannon in case i get in a heated battle with a deer. what if the real cloakers were the friends we made along the way?

Payday 2 at first seemed like something I could find on Roblox for free, but with a little convincing from my friend and some contemplating life decisions, i concluded I would try it out for its relatively cheap price, good reviews, and variety of maps. My first day on Payday 2 wasn't very fun as my friend carried me through the heist with very long drill timers which at first I was unhappy about, but after playing a lot more other heists the drill timers are not that bad as you can do other things while waiting for them like searching for gage packages (a collectable found on every map that gives more xp), other tools needed for the heist, or just fucking around with body bags or nailing people in the back with a giant metal spoon. The drill timer is also needed for loud as defending a drill can be very challenging, especially in higher difficulties. money isn't really a thing you have to grind as you get a lot of money already from career heists (multiplayer story mode basically). If I had a spare $30 or so I would 100% invest in getting Payday 2 if I were you because of the countless hours of entertainment it provides, and even if you finish every single heist in the game 3 times, you can always go for achievements, different variants of heists,  and smack more people with a giant metal spoon to unlock a giant golden spoon that you can smack even more people with.

This game saved my life.

I am 37.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you
