The game is really fun, especially when played with friends. Specifically it offers a great variety of stealth and loud heists with various difficulty settings giving you the freedom to choose how you want to play, even plan a few details in a heist yourself via the preplanning or assets tab when you are ready to launch a heist. It also offers a great variety of weapons of all kinds, clothing options for your character ,deployables and also it offers a variety of skills and perckdecks that you can equip as well depending on how you and your team want to play. In my opinion the game is still worth buying in 2022 as it gets constantly updated with new content and even if you dont have a crew to play with you can always go solo with team ai or you can join public games hosted by other people. With all these things considered i am sure that the game is worth the money and time put into it, guaranteeing a plesant expirience.

Affordable as hell when it's for sale, even with the dozens of DLC it has. Also realising that the game has the Comically Large Spoon as melee weapon and a person behind their Twitter page that's just a legend, I really can't recommend this game enough. Engine is obviously a bit dated, but hey, they resort to Unreal Engine for Payday 3.

Also, this game has loads of mods. At the same time, this game also doesn't have anticheat, meaning you'll run into cheater/modder lobbies quite a lot, but you can simply leave them if you're annoyed by them. 

On the bright side, mods can really overhaul the game. Weapon rebalancing? Sure. Full visual overhaul with textures? No problem. Give your characters Titanfall 2-tier movement? Go ahead!

This is game is simply Awesome.

If your into first person shooters and maybe if you have friends who are too. This is a must have.
The Gunplay is great, the builds you can create are unique and help you and your crew fill multiple rolls.
Whether your the Crew Chief buffing your team and controlling hostages.
The Muscle - being a general badass, mowing down guards and Cops
The Breacher - your vault cracker who can get you in the vault ASAP
ETC ETC, there's TONS of different builds and roles you can do to help your crew pull off a big score

And this game is JAMPACKED with years of DLC (Free and Paid).
The sheer amount of content is insane in this game. Especially when you compare this to games that big AAA studios have put out in recent years.

And considering this game is generally on sale very often. its a steal. Your gonna get more than your moneys worth from this. I can promise you that.

Its a great game to play with friends. The comedy is great, the characters are great, and there are so many weapons and classes to choose from. Very fun. My only issue is that there really are only a handful of viable classes to play in higher difficulties, and the really fun/good weapons all have awful ammo pick up so you cant really use them because you don't have any ammo after a few minutes. This causes the really open ended variety you feel when the game starts out to become very restricted feeling at higher levels. Other than that though, the game is great.

 Easy Southern Banana Pudding

Ingredients
3 cups cold milk
2 pkg. (3.4 oz. each) vanilla instant pudding
30 NILLA Wafers
3 medium bananas, sliced
1 tub (8 oz.) frozen whipped topping, thawed

Preparation
Pour milk into large bowl. Add dry pudding mixes. Beat with wire whisk 2 min. or until well blended. Let stand 5 min.
Arrange half of the wafers on bottom and up side of 2-qt. serving bowl; top with layers of half each of the banana slices and pudding. Repeat all layers. Cover with whipped topping.
Refrigerate 3 hours. Store leftover dessert in refrigerator.

Recipe Tips
Better For You
Save 60 calories and 3.5 grams of fat per serving by preparing with fat-free milk, vanilla fat-free sugar-free instant pudding, Reduced Fat NILLA Wafers and frozen reduced-fat whipped topping.

Special Extra
Garnish with additional banana slices, dipped in lemon juice to prevent darkening, just before serving.

The game was good, but the companies views on dlc and their abandonment of their player base has caused the game to become stale for most players.

Before they swapped to this model they had an ultimate heist bundle which had every heist but none of the clothes and cosmetic included with it. With the new business model they changed it so that ultimate heist bundle no longer includes anything from the past 2 years, nor does it live up to the companies promise of not having to have another dlc.

If you want a fun game this is for you, but if you want to have a game where you don't have to worry about companies changing their busniness model just so they can make more money this isn't the game for you.

I've played Payday 2 off and on over the years, and I think it's the game that just keeps on giving. It may seem like a one-trick pony, but that trick is incredibly satisfying and keeps people engaged for literal years on end. It seems so simple at first glance, but it is proof that great games don't need incredible graphics and a million different abilities and animations in order to have great gameplay. The game does what its players want it to do, and while there is a ton of DLC, it's all quite cheap and actually adds to the gameplay loop. I've never once had to ask myself, "Do I need this DLC?", because each DLC adds to that gameplay loop in its own way according to each individual's proclivities. 

Payday 2 is in a way a bit like the Hitman series, albeit much simpler with more action-oriented gameplay and is a bit more random due to placement of different items in each heist, meaning that not every heist is going to have X at Y location. Online gameplay is fluid, easy to jump in and out of, fun, and challenging. 

The game scratches the itch for the specific type of gamer who likes these games, and that's why it's still on top.

While the stealth leaves something to be desired and is very uninteractive, I can't possibly recommend the rest of the game more. Combat is enjoyable, challenging when it comes to higher difficulties, and very fun. It is possible to build into becoming an unstoppable tank or a incredibly damaging one shot build, and all sorts of other fun, interesting, and engaging builds. Buildcrafting is wildly variable and in the perfect zone of being limited enough to make you care what you're investing in, but generous enough to give you everything you need, and makes making and using a build incredibly engaging. All and all, 8/10

Abigail says he's dying dutch, we'll have to
stop some place.
"Okay, Arthur's out looking, I sent him up
ahead." Dutch Said.
"If we don't stop soon, we'll all be dying."
Hosea Matthews Said.
"This weather, it's May..." Hosea Said.
"I'm just hoping the law got as lost as we
did." Hosea Said.
"There." Dutch Said.
"Arthur! Any Luck?" Dutch continued.
"I found a place where we can get some
shelter." Arthur Said.
"Let Davey rest while he... you know."
Arthur continues.
"An old Mining town, abandoned - it ain't
1
far." Arthur continues.
"Come on." Arthur Said.
"Come on - Yaah!" Dutch Said.
"Miss Gaskill... get that fire lit quick. Miss
Jones, bring in whatever blankets we have,
Mr. Pearson, see what we've got in terms of
food." Ms. Grimshaw Said.
"Davey's dead." Abigail Said.
"There was nothing more you could've
done."
"What are we going to do? We need
supplies." Hosea Said.
"Well first of all you're gonna stay here...
and you're gonna get yourself warm, Now I
sent John and Micah scouting out ahead,
Arthur and I, we're gonna ride out see if we
2
can find one of them." Dutch Said.
"In this?" Arthur Said.
"Just for a short bit." Dutch Said.
"I don't see what other choice we have."
Dutch continued.
"Listen... Listen to me all of you for a
moment, now we've had... well, a bad
couple of days, I loved Davey... Jenny...
Sean, Mac... they may be okay, we don't
know, but we lost some folks, Now, If I
could throw myself in the ground in their
stead I'd do it, gladly, but, we're gonna ride
out... and we are gonna find some food,
Everybody we're safe now, there ain't
nobody following us through a storm like
this one, by the time they get here, well,
we're gonna be, we're gonna be long gone."
3
Dutch Said.
"We've been through worse than this
before, Mr. Pearson, Miss Grimshaw, I need
you to turn this place into a camp. We may
be here for a few days, now all of you, all of
you, get yourselves warm, stay strong, stay
with me, we ain't done yet!" Dutch Said.
"Com'on Arthur." Dutch Said.
"Alright, we got some work to do." Susan
Grimshaw Said.
"Well, we ain't run into them yet." Dutch
Said.
"So, they both must have headed down the
hill." Dutch Said.
"Sure." Arthur Said.
"Hey, I ain't had time to ask, what really
4
went down back there on that boat?"
Arthur Asked.
"We missed you, that's what happened."
Dutch Said.
"Come on." Dutch Continued.
"Hey, you need horses?" Charles Smith Said.
"Oh yeah, and Mr. Smith, get yourself
indoors, you need to rest that hand." Dutch
Said.
"I'll live." Charles Smith Said.
"Get indoors, son!" Dutch Said.
"I... we need you strong." Dutch continued.
"Ain't sure what we're gonna find out here,
Dutch." Arthur Said.
"We have to try, stay close, we'll do our
5
best to stick to the trail." Dutch Said.
"This goddamn weather." Arthur Said.

After a decade of consistent updates and dlc packs, there is more than ever to sink your teeth into; stealth will always be an imperfect system based on how it was implemented (running into enemies around corners or on stairs etc.) but it is still fun and satisfying. Engaging enemies feels satisfying and the selection of weapons means there is almost a guarantee that something will peak your interest. Play this game casually and you will have a great time, don't go hardcore after a specific goal or weapon as you may be gated by dlc cost, level / experience or in-game stolen money amount preventing you from reaching that goal for an indeterminent amount of time. This is the kind of game you keep coming back to and there's more to offer each time you jump in.

The VR mode is a great addition but assigning reload to the grip sensor was a terrible idea as during a gunfight you will subconsciously grip your controller with more force when firing which will repeatedly empty your clip to initiate a reload leaving you defensless until you can reattach ammo to gun.

Summary
You play as various Hesters ranging from maniacs to ex military to youtubers as they rob, cook, frame, and get revenge across the world in a stealthy or Loud manner. They are given these jobs by contractors which are the best part of the game because of Giancarlo Esposito and Mira Furlan (God rest her soul). 

PROS
Great Gunplay
Cool and Free cosmetics
No lootboxes
Great replayability  
Over 75 heist to play
Great Customization
A playable shitpost
You can join randoms or friends with DLCs you don't have
Stoic

CONS
Hard to understand aspects
Overabundance of DLC
Diesel Engine (It's a very unstable engine that is meant for racing games)
Not very good driving (It's made on a racing engine and the driving is bad)

MIDDLE (Things that are good and bad)
Mod Support but due to the engine might completely break the game
Over 1,200+ Achievements but about half of the achievements are doing a heist on a difficulty 
VR Support but has a weird set up 

Overall
This is a fun game solo and with friends. There are some issues but they are overshadowed by the enjoyment this game can bring.
 
Score
9/10

I consistently talk an absurd amount of trash and negativity regarding this game when it is brought up in conversation, but that is due to my own burnout and experiences with this game through its 9 year development cycle. Despite the insane road it took to get to the point it is now, Payday 2 remains one of, if not the greatest multiplayer co-op shooter of the modern day. A game with absurd replayability, content, and challenges to keep you entertained and spicing things up. I hate this game, but I also love it, and I hope people continue to keep its legacy going.

After playing this game for ~1000 hours on and off since late 2014, I figured I could at least make a review of how I feel about the lovable nightmare that is Payday 2.
And taking a trip down memory lane, the game changed alot in the 6 years I've played it, starting fresh at least FOUR times due to computer/system changes, on top of modding it to hell and back didn't help either.

But ooh boy this game has some really bad first impressions : lack of any menu or stats tutorials (I see soo many players with no perk deck upgrades) and lackluster heist tutorial that is so scripted it barely teaches anything about how the game works, along with so many difficulty settings that either don't feel any different to huge gaps in difficulty all the way to a new story order for missions that not only makes little sense in the timeline, but it also jumps around in difficulty and design quality so much you're honestly better off ignoring it for some time. 
Speaking of story, the "lore" of the game is so convoluted you're better off watching youtube videos about it (still don't get it by the way).
Now to talk about possibly the worst aspect of the game : the JANK, starting with the engine, I'm honestly surprised the game not only runs but also is being modded so well given the obscure engine it's running on ! But that's the only positives I can give it, the performance are awful (it's still just a 32-bit game that runs on a single core !!!) and the game is prone to crashing, even on vanilla (loading some heists on high settings straight up closes my game in some extreme cases), with the absolute DUMBEST AI pathing and enemy behavior I've seen in a long time.
There's also the stealth behaviour of the game, with the biggest issues being the host-based detection and getting instantly spotted in some obscure cases you otherwise wouldn't. There's also the infamous "detection loop" where someone or something gets detected by a guard, said guard is detected by another guard which in turn is detected by a camera which sounds the alarm instantly.
I also cannot talk about this heist without talking about repetitive it can get, the entire game is basically one giant grind to max level and once you're there uhhh ... achievements I guess ?
You can add on top of it all some fairly absurd monetization of weapons and their mods, missions and weapon skins (because of course, thankfully most of them are ugly as sin) but thankfully all of the "main story" DLCs as well as the first secondary story arc are now bundled each in their own discounted package.
And abit of a personnal thing, but I wish the game had some better sound design to help identify better when you're getting shot at.

But I'm very happy to say that everything else sound-wise in this game is absolute gold ! Be it the soundtrack (minus a couple but that's just personal taste), the gun noises, the special units callouts or the voice acting (no the H3H3 heisters don't count as "acting"), all of this is great !
There's also the sheer comedic aspect of some of these voice lines - especially some pager answering ones, but the cops have some great ones too, especially the special units.
Speaking of cops, the gameplay in this game is amazing : It's responsive and feels great. The guns and their animations are really responsive and gives great feedback with your actions (like helmets popping and such).
Did I say guns ? Right, they're the main reason you'd buy this game : the weapon customization is through the roof ! From sleek and classy frames to the most absurd Mall Ninja meme shit, there are so many options and accessories you may as well spend more time in the inventory recreating movie/game weapons than actually shooting them with how good the customization is here.
And while I only mentioned them a little bit earlier, mods are really what makes this game playable for me nowadays : customizable HUD, view model and menus ; better performance, heisters and enemies reskins as well as reskinned or entirely new weapons, characters, heists, ... From must-have quality of life changes to the most obscure fandom memes, the modding community never ceases to amaze me !

Despite all its flaws, this is one of my favorite games ever. There's a reason it's my most played game according to Steam !

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

PAYDAY 2 is one of those games I have a love-hate relationship with.

On the surface, the game promises a fun, wacky wave-based horde shooter system. But once you actually get into it, you find out that most of the content is locked behind way too much DLC and the game runs on a racing game engine from 2006 (and even then the driving is horrible).

Don't even bother playing online with randoms, either. The public servers are either full of cheaters or you get kicked out instantly because f*ck you.

The only "anti-cheat" the game has will only slap you with a "cheater" tag on your nameplate. That's it. Not even a VAC ban. Sometimes the game will even falsely flag you if it thinks one of your mods are allowing you to cheat

This game is on life support, and OVERKILL needs to just pull the plug already and focus on only developing PAYDAY 3 instead of making more DLC for 2

I would say that the DLCs are actually worth buying, there are so many achievements which give you a good incentive to play this game even more and the game itself is kind of repetitive and tiring when you have to wait but otherwise, it's the best experience you could have with your friends.
I only recommend this game if you have 3 other friends to play with.

I have played this game since 2016 and on 3 different platforms in total, each platform had brought something new. The Xbox 360 version had introduced me to the heisting. The PlayStation 4 version had more heists and weapons, but no ending to the story line.  The PC version however, has way more jobs and heists than the other two versions, plenty more weaponry, and a story line with both endings. Payday 2 has always been there on my days of blue, so if you like shooting cops and stealing cold hard cash, then this game is for you.
I like the game but if you do any job solo, it becomes a giant struggle because the AI can be very bad. I hope payday 3 gets a big AI overhaul that makes it less of a struggle.

I've known about this game for a long time and only recently picked it up. And boy am I glad I did. The game has a little bit of everything. There's tons of content after 9 years of updates and DLCs. This game has hiests for people who like to be slow and methodical and heists for those who just want to just blow stuff up.

Pros:

100s of weapons with something for everyone.
A lot of different missions ranging for stealthily stealing shipments to raiding the motherfucking FBI.
Tons of customisation from the guns, characters and even skills and perks.
Interesting story if not a bit over the top.
Different difficulties from incredibly easy to down right impossible.

Cons:

Some bugs, but that's a given for how old the engine is.
Random crashes, again given the reason above.
Some enemies are down right OP.
All the cool stuff is locked behind DLC.
After a while, you start playing the same heists over and over.
AI team mates are kinda dumb.

Would I recommend this game? Abso-fucking-lutely. I also recommend you annoy your friends into getting the game as its so much better when you can shout at your friends to drop a medic bag instead of the AI.

Anyone who smokes or uses other forms of tobacco is at risk of becoming dependent. Factors that influence who will use tobacco include:
Age. Most people begin smoking during childhood or the teen years. The younger you are when you begin smoking, the greater the chance that you'll become addicted.
Genetics. The likelihood that you will start smoking and keep smoking may be partly inherited. Genetic factors may influence how receptors on the surface of your brain's nerve cells respond to high doses of nicotine delivered by cigarettes.
Parents and peers. Children who grow up with parents who smoke are more likely to become smokers. Children with friends who smoke are also more likely to try it.
Depression or other mental illness. Many studies show an association between depression and smoking. People who have depression, schizophrenia, post-traumatic stress disorder or other forms of mental illness are more likely to be smokers.
Substance use. People who abuse alcohol and illegal drugs are more likely to be smokers.

Tobacco smoke contains more than 60 known cancer-causing chemicals and thousands of other harmful substances. Even "all natural" or herbal cigarettes have harmful chemicals.

You already know that people who smoke cigarettes are much more likely to develop and die of certain diseases than people who don't smoke. But you may not realize just how many different health problems smoking causes:

Lung cancer and lung disease. Smoking is the leading cause of lung cancer deaths. In addition, smoking causes lung diseases, such as emphysema and chronic bronchitis. Smoking also makes asthma worse.
Other cancers. Smoking increases the risk of many types of cancer, including cancer of the mouth, throat (pharynx), esophagus, larynx, bladder, pancreas, kidney, cervix and some types of leukemia. Overall, smoking causes 30% of all cancer deaths.
Heart and circulatory system problems. Smoking increases your risk of dying of heart and blood vessel (cardiovascular) disease, including heart attacks and strokes. If you have heart or blood vessel disease, such as heart failure, smoking worsens your condition.
Diabetes. Smoking increases insulin resistance, which can set the stage for type 2 diabetes. If you have diabetes, smoking can speed the progress of complications, such as kidney disease and eye problems.
Eye problems. Smoking can increase your risk of serious eye problems such as cataracts and loss of eyesight from macular degeneration.
Infertility and impotence. Smoking increases the risk of reduced fertility in women and the risk of impotence in men.
Complications during pregnancy. Mothers who smoke while pregnant face a higher risk of preterm delivery and giving birth to lower birth weight babies.
Cold, flu and other illnesses. Smokers are more prone to respiratory infections, such as colds, the flu and bronchitis.
Tooth and gum disease. Smoking is associated with an increased risk of developing inflammation of the gum and a serious gum infection that can destroy the support system for teeth (periodontitis).
Smoking also poses health risks to those around you. Nonsmoking spouses and partners of smokers have a higher risk of lung cancer and heart disease compared with people who don't live with a smoker. Children whose parents smoke are more prone to worsening asthma, ear infections and colds.

This is much more than "Robbing Banks with friends."

The game has been given countless DLCs and is brimming with endless content including Heists, playable characters, crossovers and OG content that can keep you busy for ages. With the new Texas Heat Campaign right around the corner it is the perfect time to pick up this gem.

You steal nukes, cook meth, raid the FBI, Break out Criminals. And kidnap Goats.

Kill cops with flamethowers, Russians with Commically Large Spoons, Mexican Federales with Chainsaws and Specs Ops Mercs with your own bare hands.

Combine the already absurd base game items and situations with custom heists, guns, characters and full blown Fan Made DLCs for free on Beardlib Modding you got yourself a endless stream of content to enjoy.

TL;DR

"A pantomime discovers that his lover has hung herself. He tries to explain, silently, the experience of this new horrific shock. almost 10 years later and payday 3 on the horizon this game still surprises me with a long list of different heists and ways you can do most of them, i can only give this game a thumbs and would give it something better if i could. I will continue to put time into this game because its a memory to my childhood with the first game. I can do almost anything in anyway, tank bullets, dodge bullets and shoot even more bullets. If your too critical or lack the part of your brain that releases fun juices then you will see this as a mindless cop horde shooter game which happens to involve robbing a bank or something of that nature. But you if enjoy having a good time and have friends to play it with then its a worthy investment of not only your money but your time. You can raid the white house, rob different sized banks and much much more; there is even a ending if you follow the lists of heists Bane gives to you. With 158.9 hours so far what more could i ask for? Honestly Couldn't tell ya, because there is already so much to this game that most player barely get to scratch. Not to mention yeah there are micro transactions but it is mostly for weapon skins and the like, nothing that could hinder your gameplay in any way. Sometimes you will get a safe that you can open for free and out pops a skin you can sell for money on your steam account. No money spent to do this besides buying the game and dlcs if your interested but if you have a friend with hella dlc then dont worry cuz you can still play whatever map you want with them as long as they are the host. Only downside to not having dlcs is the weapons that become available when you purchase them BUT you can still make it work without them but its always nice to have them. For reference when there is a huge sale (summer/winter steam sale) the most of the dlcs if not all are $1 a piece. So as of now with the game being only $10 on steam and about $5 on G2A it is a very good game and even better with friends who are not smooth brained.

Throw me five years ago with this game in my hands and I would have recommended it but now, just no. This game is outdated in every possible aspect. 
> The AI is utterly stupid, running into your bullets, the only difficulty residing into their sheer number and HP amount. Stealth is a massive cheesegame with an AI either seeing through walls or blind to a guy hidding behind a pot of flower three feet away from them. It's just a game of "which couch will hide me from the omniscient blind guy on rails".
> The graphics are horrendous and the game's engine is a massive failure. Google Chrome has nothing on how it eats up your ressources and is willing to crash for maps that are barrely more developped than some CS:GO ones.
> The balance is lame. Each class of weapon is divided into four subclasses: lots of ammo - low damage; medium ammo capacity - medium damage; low ammo capacity - high damage. And the fourth: Utterly broken because it's part of the last paid DLC and people need an incentive to buy it because Payday 3 needs funding. Same for the perks. The meta is pretty much "use the last added broken thing Overkill hasn't fixed yet" if you wanna be effective on the high difficulties.
> Multiplayer is fun if you and your friend(s) are willing to put your brain aside, or suffer a meltdown because of frustrating game mechanics and desyncs. Oh and don't play with randos unless you wanna stumble upon cheaters over cheaters over cheaters because anticheats are hard.
Not worth whatever money it's sold for currently.

One of the best PC games there is

Given the short period of only a 3-hour worth of playtime experience, the game was tight enough to keep me engaged and wanting back for more. I imagine for a co-op + fps game to be based entirely around the criminal lifestyle landscape, it would turn out to be an easy-to-digest type of game and then morph into an easy-to-forget type of a game. Goddamn was I wrong, it had a tidy selection of variables meshed unto the gameplay mechanics such as the different scenario for each maps, the proprietary approach, equipment roster (which equipment would suit best for a map), safety net planning just in case things go south, role fulfillment and more. The visual aspect is not bad, I believe the graphical details are poppy and accurate enough to satisfy your craving for realism specially for a game in this genre, which is respectfully understandable. Audio aspect is also worthy to be mentioned, soundtracks can be set to your liking. Add character and weapon customization in the mix and you already have a solid view of what Payday 2 offers. There are many types of playas out there. I am the smash-and-grab, clap that foo' type of one, I like it loud, extremely risky but slow and also fast. I will give this a honest 8/10. Also cocaine, try not to get addicted to it at least virtually.

The best zombie shooter.
But really, one of the best horde shooters even after the years. HUGE amount of weapons, each customizable, sometimes to crazy degree. Lot of different and interesting missions. Hordes of enemies with the choice of how to dispatch them being entirely up to you - going in full Rambo, Melee, walking tank, matrix dodging bullets, or going stealth and avoid them entirely. Thanks to good companion AI you can play solo, but its infinitely more fun with friends.
This is an impressive game with strong gameplay and mechanics.

Payday 2 is a heist game so you might be wondering if it's worth getting when GTAV exists however there are many good reasons. If you liked the heist aspect from GTAV at all you will love Payday 2. It just does heisting infinitely better than GTAV. The car physics in this game are very aged but other than that the game does not feel old by any means. The game is still being updated (Update came out a few days ago) and there are 70 or so DLC's that you can buy if you ever want more content. It is still a worthy purchase almost 9 years after release and I highly recommend you check it out.

Normally, grindy games with no real stopping point don't capture my interest much. I often rely on a driving force toward a final boss or narrative climax of some sort (and while Payday 2 has the latter, it isn't in the way that would normally catch my fancy). But Payday 2 is an exception to this, with a very addicting gameplay loop, pure freedom in gameplay options, and an interesting plot to boot.

Let's start with the pros, shall we? The main draw of the game is the pure build freedom available to you, because holy FUCK are there a lot of weapons, skills and equipment to choose from. Any play style that you're interested in (in terms of FPS games, anyway), Payday 2 almost certainly has it, both in terms of guns and perks that allow you to play the game however you want to, and while you're very limited in terms of options in the very beginning, the weapons and skills at your disposal quickly ramp up over time.

Of course, Payday 2 isn't a perfect game. While most of it's glitches don't affect gameplay experience, there will be the occasional glitch or bug that forces a restart, and while it isn't common, it isn't an extreme rarity, and will likely happen every now and then. And while there's plenty of content available without any DLC purchases, there is a massive amount of content that's included with DLC, which can make things seem very limited if you're unwilling to spend a bit of cash to get DLC weapons and heists.

Despite it's flaws, though, Payday 2 is, in my opinion, a very fun game once you get into it.

9/10.

This game is pretty good, but not quite as good as Cinnamon Pull Apart Bread!

What you'll need:

- A 9x13 Pan (preferably glass)
- Non Stick Spray
- 2 Tubes of Biscuits (Pillsbury or Otherwise)
- 1 and 1/2 sticks of Salted Butter (Unsalted also works, just be sure to add a 1/2 teaspoon of salt in step 3)
- 4 Teaspoons of Brown Sugar
- 1 Teaspoon of Cinnamon
- 1 Tablespoon of Honey
- 2 Tablespoons of Milk, Heavy Cream, or Buttermilk (Non-Dairy Milks work as well. See Step for more info) (More as Needed)
- 2 Cups of Powdered Sugar (more as needed)

Step 1. Preheat your oven to 350 and give your pan a light coat of non-stick spray

Step 2. POP THEM BISCUITS OPEN BABY!!

Once you get the biscuits out, grab a butterknife (or use your hands you filthy animal) and quarter them. Start laying em out in the pan. Spaces in-between the biscuits is A-okay cause we want that buttersugar to get down in there once we start pouring. Likely, you'll run into the issue of "too many biscuit pieces, not enough space" so just kinda squish em down and try to fill in the edges and corners with an extra biscuit piece. Once you've got all the biscuits packed in there, we're on to step 3!

Step 3. BUTTERSUGAR TIME

Grab your 1 and 1/2 Sticks of butter and we're gon' melt that son of a gun. Personally, I like to melt butter in the microwave, but if you wanna get all fancy and pull out the saucepan then go for it. Ain't nobody stopping you.

So for the rest of us common folk, put your butter in a microwave safe bowl or Pyrex measuring cup. I throw it in there for like 1min and just check on it closer to the minute mark, but we all got different microwaves. Basically, you just want the butter to be melted with no chunks left in it. So however long it takes to do that. DON'T leave it in too long or it'll burn and then you gotta go get more butter.

NOW. You've got your melted butter. Add the Cinnamon and the brown sugar to it and stir the everliving life outta that thing til' it's all nice and pretty. Once you've successfully crafted the buttersugar, pour it over the biscuits in the pan. My two main goals here are "1. Make sure every biscuit gets some love" and "2. Fill in all the cracks" So pour slow and steady.

Step 4. MAKE IT HOT

Okay. Let me level with you here. I am not a classically trained baking professional. I'm just a regular schmegular person who likes the sweety sweets. I have â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ these up before and this is the step that made my spouse leave.

Double check the oven is on 350. Put the little biscuits in the oven so that they can grow up to be big and strong. Leave them in there for about 10-13min. Be sure to check on your biscuits throughout the process. What you're looking for is the tops to be golden brown. Like that real fresh baked brown, that you see in the movies and tv and recipe sites. Once you see golden brown, open the oven and don't be afraid to get a little greedy. Grab a biscuit off the top so you can see how the middle section and bottom of the pan look.

If it looks doughy Turn the oven off and let the biscuits sit inside for maybe 5 minutes. Again, note the color of the tops and go back to your reference piece that you took out. You want them to look like done biscuits. I can't put pictures but I'll make a guide if people are interested and go back through all the steps with pictures.

If it doesn't look doughy Well then what the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ are you doing? Move on to the next step champ! We got biscuits to eat!

Step 5. Make the Glaze

In a good sized bowl, whisk together your Powdered sugar, honey, and milk. If you don't have a whisk, that's fine. Just go grab a utensil or something. Personal preference: Fork. They look meaner than the other utensils.

NON-DAIRY MILK USERS UNITE!
I really like an almond milk substitute here, but whatever works, works. Just know, with the amount of ingredients we're using here, your glaze may come out thin and runny. If it does, don't panic and cry. Just add a little more powdered sugar in tablespoon increments. Add, whisk and repeat if it still comes out runny. Once it's thick enough, go ahead on.

Take your whisked mixture and and drizzle it over the finished biscuits. And boom done. You just baked something delicious.

If you read this far, thank you. If you liked the recipe, thank you. I'll try to make a guide and go back through with pictures and gifs to make this a lot easier to follow if enough people want that.

Call the ones you love, tell em you love them.

Let me know what recipe you want me to do next.

PAYDAY 2 is a pretty good game, though I feel that you will enjoy the game much more if you have the DLC. Most of the good content is locked behind DLC, though fortunately you can buy the Legacy Edition for remotely cheap, and it has a majority of the good DLC. Sadly, you can no longer get the Scarface DLC due to licensing issues. To the actual game though, the gunplay is some of the best I've ever seen. Though it can get very repetitive when not doing stealth (which is also very odd, like stealth just functions really weirdly and for me at least is not as enjoyable), as most of the loud heists are just "Go to _____" "Use drill" "Wait for ____" and though it does get repetitive after a while, it can still be extremely fun, especially with a group of friends, though playing with randoms online is also pretty fun assuming they aren't a hypersweat. The soundtrack is also extremely good, like by all accounts the soundtrack on a game where you rob stuff should not be as good as it is. Jacket is also the best heister, I'm not accepting criticism at this time. We all know its true.

Payday is a game where you steal shit and shoot guns. Sometimes, you steal some very cursed shit while shooting VERY cursed guns, during which the thought never escapes that the only reason you're in Vegas after said cursed stuff is because you shot a Russian druglord for Gus from Breaking Bad.

Still with me? No? Good. Time for some genuine shit.

Payday 2, generally, is great fun IF you play loud. The flow of jobs and especially the combat are amazing, and the customization beyond your weapons lends well to individuality while (mostly) still being viable for most difficulities. You wanna OUTRUN FUCKING BULLETS carrying a heavy ass RPK? You can do that. You wanna be a bitch and AFK Alesso Holdout with turrets and AI? You can do that. Just...Do not stealth. Stealth in this game is a piece of shit and I hate it. The only good stealth-only heist is Yacht Heist. Also staying quiet means you missing out on Simon Viklund's LEGENDARY soundtrack.

The main other issue comes from the piece of shit engine this game was developed on. Diesel is a crime against humanity and should've been thrown in the trash long ago. This game has some of the weirdest bugs, and also sometimes shield units clipping through walls just to shoot you. Though, in fairness, it's not like the rest of the game isn't utter chaos and most bugs don't really get in the way. At some point, you WILL develop Stockholm Syndrome for Diesel's shenanigans. After all, at this point it's part of the charm.

As for getting your hands on this buggy, chaotic masterpiece, here's the thing. The beginning and endgame heists are available through the base purchase of $10. Don't get me wrong, it's a steal at $10 even with just those 20-30 jobs. But you want Legacy Collection. That'll get you everything released from launch through 2018. Well worth the higher price tag, especially considering you'll get access to all but 3 perk decks (RIP Scarface Character Pack)

also donacdum and buy the h3h3 character pack. it's ass, the two's vo performances make me wanna rewatch SAO over listening to them, the perk deck sucks, and it's not even in Legacy Collection.

By far one of the best games I have ever played on Steam. There is a ton of awesome people to meet online to play with, there is endless heists, weapons, and a ton of different ways that the game can be approached and played. You can use rocket launchers to rob neighborhood banks, or you could stealth up and enjoy the game in that sense. This game is definitely fun and addictive though, and I do recommend it for the price. If you enjoy first-person shooter games with a ton of customization, this is another game that you would end up enjoying.

Payday 2 is a co-op objective based shooter with almost TF2 like customization in both the appearance of your character and what they excel at in game. The paid DLC's, if numerous, are by no means necessary, the strongest perk decks are available for free and there are still free accessable weapons numbering in the hundreds to pick from if you don't wish to spend more money on the game than is necessary.

i dont get why people think this game is hard, definetly on the last 2 difficulties but its a realy fun casual bank robber criminal game you get to level and build your criminal up with neat gadgets, perks, and weapons. fun stealth game and fun horde game. great thing is you feel like theyre isnt restrictions like in other games like GTA you just stea stuff and  always have room for bonus, and pulling off a hiest stealth that gets realy tough if it goes loud feels like you actualy got away with something. customizeation is great too enev though its alittle limited with random unlocks at the end of a mission, but there is variety unlocked at the start for me to be unique. 

only negitive this game has is its comunity, be careful of online unless you host the game yourself as people can just Kick you at the very end and you get nothing for what can sometimes take an hour to achieve even 20 min feels bad though, and a slight negitive is the bots in the offline mode arent the best to say the least they serve to revive you and trade hostages for you but offline is a 1 player one man heist, they even wont mask up and help if you are stealth so offline can be tougher then it has too be and tiedious when you have to move 20 bags of gold by yourself

Amazing game with a bit of a learning curve.

Payday 2 feels like as much of a puzzle game as it does an FPS; the stealth is incredibly addicting, as it forces you to avoid line of sight with the guards and gives you a sense of mischief as you defy the laws of physics to jump-crouch 20 feet past a guard without getting seen.

Loud mode is just as fun, giving a new feeling to the term "hoard shooter". You can try to beat heists as fast as possible to avoid heavy confrontation, or you can set up shop on a heist like "Meth Lab" and cook meth for 2 hours to get stupid amounts of money. There are countless guns/attachments to make sure you never get bored, a plethora of worthwhile DLC, and a metric buttload of achievements.

Overall amazing game, would recommend to anyone looking for a refreshing FPS with fun, yet challenging mechanics 10/10
this game is pretty fun, community can be suprisingly be friendly most of the time.

To explain why this game is both good and bad. This game has a few "easy" stealth mechanic missions which let you play the game stealthy if you wish, but it also has a higher difficulty curve when not using stealth, though the reward is the same. In stealth, you could play the entire game from start to finish and never play a single mission which requires using a non-silenced weapon. There's tons of missions you could easily play when you get bored of one, and not all of them are exactly the same, though they follow similar patterns. A random element is added to the game in order to increase interest in players who don't want to play the same missions over and over. The top two highest difficulty settings scale in a manner that rewards stealth players more. What this game is lacking as of right now a custom mission or maybe even a custom map maker. Custom maps might be asking too much, but custom missions would be easy to put in and make the game less boring for the players that have mastered the mechanics to the point where everything is trivial, and there is a point in personal game mastery where the game becomes very trivial.

I was really into the first Payday. Judging from these hours you can tell I was ALSO into Payday 2 for a spell. I think sometime around when they introduced paid cosmetics that alter your stats my friend group dropped off this title. I can't endorse those middling and almost "pay to win" models. Sure, you can grind out competitively meta items and weapons, you can make a build that compares to the skill ceiling without spending a dime. It's the grind that makes that all the worse, as I can't help but indict anyone that would throw money at the problem instead of alleviating the long slog of a trip to the top.

But that's just my take. Don't act dumb, make your own decisions for this one. Maybe an easy sale pick up?

Payday 2 is a variety game. It offers many different things to do in a single package. It offers one of the best stealth experiences ever, as well as solid gunplay for when you don't wanna go stealth. You can customize your character towards many different playstyles, and play however you want. You can play with up to 4 friends, or alone, or with randoms through the matchmaker. You can mod the game to suit your preferences, including extensive gameplay and UI mods.

Stealth:
- Solid detection system
- "Pager" system that forces you to play actual stealth, instead of killing all guards
- Multi-layered looting system that forces you to be smart with moving the bags of valuables
"Loud":
- Many different build styles
- Many ability interactions
- Solid gunplay
- Many guns to choose from
- Guns can be modified to suit your preferences
- Enemy AI is reasonably smart
- Enemy types are simple, but have different variations of each type to keep things varied

Game balance:
Most guns have a place in the game in one way or another. Pistols are used for stealth, while you can use the rocket launchers to clear rooms in loud heists. Some guns are better than the others, but you can expect to do reasonably well with any gun at moderate difficulties.

DLC:
The DLC of this game falls into one of three categories:
- Cosmetic DLC:
Buy at your own discretion. They add no gameplay benefits or detriments.
- Weapon DLC:
Some weapons in the DLC can provide gameplay benefits that the "Free 2 Play" weapons may not have. That said, Some of the best guns for both stealth and loud gameplay are available for free, so not owning any weapon DLCs is not a huge detriment. Some of these DLC also include perk decks, which can provide some significant benefits.
- Mission DLC:
Unlocks extra missions for you to play. However, even if you do not own these missions, you can still join a lobby that plays that mission. This means that among a friend group, only one person needs to own a certain mission DLC for everyone to be able to play it.

Conclusion:
Game looks expensive with the amount of DLC. However, you do not need those DLC to enjoy the game. Grab the base game or the legacy bundle (which contains the base game and 5 years of cosmetic, weapon and mission DLC for only double the price of the base game, which you don't have to buy if you get the bundle) and play through the game. You can get hundreds of hours of playtime with just the base game alone. Then, if you feel like you want to try something new, consider grabbing a weapon or mission DLC.

2 tablespoons prepared mustard
â…“ cup ketchup

Directions:
Step 1
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Step 2
In a large bowl, combine the beef, egg, onion, milk and bread OR cracker crumbs. Season with salt and pepper to taste and place in a lightly greased 9x5-inch loaf pan, or form into a loaf and place in a lightly greased 9x13-inch baking dish.

Step 3
In a separate small bowl, combine the brown sugar, mustard and ketchup. Mix well and pour over the meatloaf.

Step 4
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 1 hour.

Payday 2 can be easily summed up as a lot of fun with the right online players, futile with the wrong ones, and a complete headache on single player.

The game has a lot of fun aspects to it, and doesn't limit players (in most cases) on how they should or could approach each mission. The majority of the time, the outcome is based on how professional or sloppy you and your team are. Getting through a heist in 100% stealth mode is challenging, but possible if everyone knows their part and acts accordingly.

Much like most online games, this game suffers from people who don't have, or don't want to use their mics. If this were a standard shooter where it was every man for himself, this wouldn't be an issue. However, Payday 2 is very much so team driven, and communication is key to success.

1. The career progression going from normal difficulty to very hard in a very short time-span.
2. The amount of content locked behind a dlc paywall.

Im torn on this one. I'll reccomend it, kind of. The dlc practices and practices of the company are terrible at this point. But the game is damn fun if you get a usual group going, ive even had solid fun with randoms over the years. That is except the time a hacker boosted my progress to infinity and i had nothing left to do. Only once at least.

If you can bear a bit of greedy devs and i bet you have for at least one or two products there is a great game here. But I do caution you.

More specifically if you like wave based objectives mixed with some timers and a bit of risk reward game is good. There is usually plenty of movement in most missions, you dont just camp which is a big plus.

There are also a pleathora of weapons, weapon attachments skills etc to unlock. But again that bussiness mofel. So a very slight reccommend from me.

This has been one of my go to mindless fun games for a long time, Starting out on Xbox 360 and then buying the Crimewave Edition when it came out.

Around 2016 I started playing on PC and I have been playing on and off again since, the game has a nice mix of Perks, Skills and Weapons which allows you to really enjoy the game whatever way you want, Whether it's a meta akimbo Grimms build or an off-meta melee build on anything below Mayhem you can really play however you want.

However on the higher difficulties (DW, DS, DSOD) a lot of the worse perk decks become far more apparent and instead you are forced to use one of the stronger perk decks (Usually being a newer one due to power creep). Apart from some balancing issues and the instability of the game when it comes to crashing and the likes I'd heavily recommend the game to anyone who enjoys casual FPS games but make sure to install some Quality of Life mods though.

Recipe for brownies

Ingredients

Â½ cup butter

1 cup white sugar

2 eggs

1 teaspoon vanilla extract

â…“ cup unsweetened cocoa powder

Â½ cup all-purpose flour

Â¼ teaspoon salt

Â¼ teaspoon baking powder

Frosting:

3 tablespoons butter, softened

3 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder

1 tablespoon honey

1 teaspoon vanilla extract

1 cup confectioners' sugar

Instructions
Step 1
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour an 8-inch square pan.

Step 2
In a large saucepan, melt 1/2 cup butter. Remove from heat, and stir in sugar, eggs, and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Beat in 1/3 cup cocoa, 1/2 cup flour, salt, and baking powder. Spread batter into prepared pan.

Step 3
Bake in preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes. Do not overcook.

Step 4
To Make Frosting: Combine 3 tablespoons softened butter, 3 tablespoons cocoa, honey, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, and 1 cup confectioners' sugar. Stir until smooth. Frost brownies while they are still warm.

Chocolate Chip Cookies:
1 cup butter, softened
1 cup white sugar
1 cup packed brown sugar
2 eggs
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 teaspoon baking soda
2 teaspoons hot water
Â½ teaspoon salt
3 cups all-purpose flour
2 cups semisweet chocolate chips
1 cup chopped walnuts

Step 1
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Step 2
Cream together the butter, white sugar, and brown sugar until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla. Dissolve baking soda in hot water. Add to batter along with salt. Stir in flour, chocolate chips, and nuts. Drop by large spoonfuls onto ungreased pans.

Step 3
Bake for about 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until edges are nicely browned.

Enjoy

First off, know that this game doesn't cost what you think it does. You're going to want to spend another $10, $20 on DLCs to get some of the best heists, weapon attachments, and weapons. You don't need to buy all of them, but you're definitely going to want to pour a couple bucks into DLCs for quality of life.

With that said, this game runs on a very old engine, leaving it buggy and sometimes unoptimized, and the gameplay loop really doesn't click for some people, but the memes are plentiful, the guns are blazing, and the lore is really, really weird. Give it a try, or just wait until Payday 3 in 2023. I will say that Lab Rats is a religious experience, though.

hello guys this is a review by a poor person that plays this game (can't really afford too much because of rental and house bills) I bought the payday 2 legacy collection for $29.98 and I got it on 19 Jan 2019, and I think the game is fun.

You don't really need all DLC packs to enjoy the payday 2 experiences, and also I still have the same DLC packs as I have when I first bought the payday 2 legacy collection.

I feel like for those people that doesn't have DLC packs should know that if you are poor like me you should not have to buy DLC to have fun in the game I recommend people to wait until it goes on special so that you could buy those DLC packs.

I'm not saying to waste your money on DLC packs like those mens living on the streets but what I'm trying to say is that you should save up your pocket money for the DLC packs so that it's easier for you to buy them.

Just if you ever seen a review or heard it from your friends or family saying that you need all DLC packs to enjoy more playtime just don't get suck into it it's just a waste of money if you do, and also it just means that you are a sucker and care about the money more then life.

I hope you guys understand what I'm getting here and I hope I'm not being a bit too hard on you people but I just feel like some of those reviews there saying that "DLC packs are too expensive" or "It's more fun with DLC packs" just doesn't get about savings and debit cards plus some of these people at rich so you do need to be careful about those reviews and make sure to buy the things that are the best and the funniest things that you know you would enjoy.

people that care about savings and pocket money: 10/10

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably deadâ€“ murdered by my brother-in-law, Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now, and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, he asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded. I... I always thought Hank was a very moral man, and I was particularly vulnerable at the time â€“ something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me in on a ride-along and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin, so I agreed. Hank had a partner, a businessman named Gustavo Fring. Hank sold me into servitude to this man. And when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling-out. Things escalated. Fring was able to arrange â€“ uh, I guess... I guess you call it a "hit" â€“ on Hank, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured. And I wound up paying his medical bills, which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge. Working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring. The bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA. To keep me in line, he took my children. For three months, he kept them. My wife had no idea of my criminal activities, and was horrified to learn what I had done. I was in hell. I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family.

Payday is the perfect example of a fantastic concept done terribly wrong.
Granted, I've not played in a few years but simple things like really bad lag for your detection meter and corpses being in differing locations for host/client, sometimes causing answering an alarm to be triggered, are just a few of the problems that have been in this game from the start and (since I last stopped playing) have never been resolved.
The idea of transition from stealth to loud is completely lost, you are never going to run a mission in stealth and then resort to loud if it goes wrong, your stealth build is never going to cut it.
The difficulty for stealth missions plateaus fairly quickly, whereas Death Wish loud requires incredibly specific skill builds and it saps the fun out of even trying.
This, in addition, to the steady stream of DLC that is churned out just kinda killed the game for me. I'll pick it up every now and again and play some stealth missions with friends but it's definitely not worth the price tag and probably not worth your time.
(Also having the music for the Alesso heist not controlled by the music volume is horrendous because it is hot garbage and my god is it painful having to stealth that mission with that crap playing non stop.)

The game overall is fun it's just the content that came after the "H3H3" DLC is what I find lacking. You could in a sense go quite far without any DLC, but if you are interested in completing achievements it will cost quite a bit and time to complete. The difficulty in the game comes down to more health for enemies and more damage to you, so most of the time using builds that are "meta" are almost always necessary. There are a few maps that are easily done on the highest difficulty with one down active but if there is a map with little to no cover and a roaming objective your life can become a living hell. Stealth missions are probably my favorite for highest difficulty one down, it boils down to a mix of luck and skill, with invulnerable cameras, changing guard patterns during/new runs, and random loot spawns sometimes it can be overwhelming or drive you further to want to complete that heist since you've gotten further than you did on your last run. While I do like the guards mixing up their paths sometimes this can be a complete run ender, when you think a guard has left an area and they do a double back to you. 

Holdout is a wave survival with increased difficulty as waves go by with a right build and (AI) Team it can be easy, I like this gamemode it's simple and to the point, I do feel there is something missing to it 90% of my runs end at wave 7-8 with almost every other enemy becoming a dozer, even with the "meta" builds it becomes odd the way to deal with AI going down, Hostage being released, health management, and the dozers. This isn't comparable to most other wave survival based gamemodes that I can think of in games that I have played so that is a factor in this segment to take into account.

More into the DLC area of the game: H3H3 pack was interesting at the time yet it is completely out of place. I think universally the community can say it was the worst character DLC they made besides the tag team mechanic, all other characters that were introduced had some heists added with them included to somewhat loosely tie them to the payday gang, this character pack just planted them center stage (almost quite literally when you read the description for their studio in the safe house and location) without even a small bit of context. Voice acting jobs were bad not just for H3H3, but Rust, and John Wick it was terrible. they had some that were perfect and creative like Jacket, Jimmy, and Scarface somehow though when something was working with other of the DLCs the odd ones out had the poor quality treatment when coming to voice acting. Colors/tailor DLCs should have been a free addition looking at how bad they are and still expecting you to pay for it, it's best to save your money on this front. 

Conclusion: game is amazing with some improvements before they attempt to release Payday 3, they can make a spectacular 3rd entry, DLCs need more time and effort put into them even it requires more time with voice actors as well trying to tie in some way guest characters to the payday gang, also just cut the color and tailor packs it's a complete waste to release something that most players will look over or assume your trying to wring them of their wallet.

Absolutely thrilling. Every aspect of this game plays into one of the fastest most intense and thrilling games I've ever played. First off, gun customization, though not great, especially cosmetically; being able to change the gadgets that your gun uses, the color and decals and a few more things made the customization at least decent, and was certainly enough to make guns unique. Then the maps, absolutely gorgeous. There are so many different environments, whether a mountain top in the dead of winter, or a smoking hot desert to a beautiful hill by the sea; there is bound to be at least some place on the map that you enjoying. Another important aspect of the game is well of course gameplay. It is essentially a PVE where you fight around with the cops, you come across missions like robbing banks or pursuits around the map however far less optional then these secret packages. As you're not the only person in the heist, cops are a very present force and frequently hunt you down. This is the most adrenaline filled aspect of the game. They police are ruthless and difficult to simply outrun, now you can switch sides and know what it's like to be the hunter if you ever so choose to, however most of the customization options are taken away.

This game saved my life.  


I am 69.  


My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.  


When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiralling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.  


After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.  


Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.  


After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.  


Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.  


I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.  


Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.  


Thank you.

This is by far my most played game on steam, and honestly, it's awesome. 

The fact that all of the Payday 1 heists still hold up so incredibly well, alongside the fact that many incredible moments and heists were added over the years and are still being added to this day, leads me to believe that this game is one of the most continually supported games out there, and is definitely one of my favorites in recent years.

My main complaint is that the story, while incredible when pieced together through lore videos and external sources, is very hard to discern when playing normally. The so-called "Career mode" isn't 100% accurate to the true story, as it hasn't accounted for the million additional DLC heists added over the years, and some events are out of order (No Mercy being a flashback in this game, for instance, still confuses me), but it still provides a loose timeline of the story's events.

There are also way too many unnecessary difficulties, with the main game truly starting at overkill, and increasing from there. Also, the scaling on difficulties is definitely weird (hard and very hard feel pretty much identical, while mayhem, and death wish feel like 2 completely different games. And don't get me started on Death Sentence One Down)

This game, despite its frequent bugs and crashes (the ladder mainly occurring if you mod the shit out of it like I do), has an incredibly enjoyable game flow, due to the mechanics and controls feeling extremely arcade-y and responsive. It's not aiming for realism - the stealth AI make that very apparent. It puts cold hard mechanics and lore above everything else, and is incredibly enjoyable for that alone.

All this makes the game fun, fast-paced, and a blast to play alone and with friends / randos alike. But it's the secret of Payday 2 that really elevates the game into something truly special.

I'm going to spoil the true ending for Payday 2 right here. If you have no intention on completing the admittedly drawn-out steps to obtain the secret, then by all means keep reading. Just know that the story surrounding the game gets absolutely crazy from here. After you complete the seemingly final mission [spoiler] and steal the pardons from the White House [/spoiler], doing the secret will unlock the true ending to the game, and cracks the story wide open. You have been warned!

[spoiler] TL:DR of the secret: basically, it's a laundry list of obtaining certain materials from a wide variety of different heists, deciphering codes and an entire hidden language, completing 20 specific and randomized achievements, going under the white house into the secret tunnels, decoding the text on the ruins 3 times while getting kicked by shadow cloakers, killing the Dentist, and rushing Bain to the inverted pyramid and transferring his consciousness into the president through the use of Mayan gold. It's as bonkers as it sounds, and if you never experienced it before, either look it up on YouTube or attempt it yourself. Beware! [/spoiler]

Overall, Payday 2 is a testament to what long-term dedication and work can add to a product, aiding it in the long run. Not every DLC is a win - H3H3 pack and the Border Crossing heist, for instance - but besides a few hiccups, the game overall is a labor of love that will continue to be cherished for years to come.

Payday 2 is a very positively-received co-op wave FPS with decent graphics, and a compelling story-line. The game is extremely fun and has many instances of its core aspect - the heists, having great game-play that is best done with teamwork and friends. But, if you have none at the time, you can also play the offline mode, the same experience, but with an AI team (but the game is best experienced with friends). You also have many ways of playing with perk decks, skill trees, many weapon options, etc.

Payday 2 is not without its flaws however, and the biggest flaw is the amount of money needed to get a decent-sized experience. MANY career heists are locked behind paywalls if you want to host an online lobby of said heist, which makes it harder to play many missions. Another flaw is how buggy the NPCs are, especially civilians / civvies. Civvies when they turn into hostages, are hard to make move around due to the fact that they are glitchy. MANY times civvies will go through walls, move for many seconds after telling them to go back down, etc. The game is heavily reliant on releasing DLCs to make money and stay alive, which I cannot blame them for however.

Overall, the amount of fun, experience, and arguing about pagers will be worth your money, same with the DLCs. However, I recommend getting DLCs during a decently-sized sale, such as the time of writing this review. Thank you for reading this review, and I hope to see you at the safehouse, heister.
I dont have any words for this game. Its just awesome.

If you want a fun, quick, and easy game to learn how to play with friends then you're in luck because this is the one. Cash and XP is fast to gain and you can zoom through heists at the blink of an eye with a good team on your side. The gameplay is very fast but not in an annoying way although heads up if you suffer from motion sickness like I do because the weird bobbing motion while running can be VERY disorienting at first (You can turn it off in the settings luckily but it's still kinda screwy). In case you're worried about crashing I cannot recall a time this game has ever failed on me, it runs pretty smoothly on my MSI laptop. To end the review off, if you're someone who loves first-person shooter games or even if you've played Hotline Miami you're going to love this, so come get your payday!

the original publisher thought it was a good idea to shove as many micro-transaction as they could, in an attempt to milk as much money as they could before the game died out and they make another game and repeat the process
luckily, the developers outright bought the game from the parent company and remove MOST of those issue

in regards to the game itself, it is a decent shooter, albeit at an expanse of a bait and switch, the tutorial mission puts heavy emphasis on stealth, silently taking down enemies, hiding the bodies, avoiding cameras, sneaking past guard, the whole works
but almost all other mission throw all those mechanics down the drain in favor of a wave shooter with the occasionally "pick object A and use it on location B while enemies still attacking" 
if you go to the game expecting action, it's a good fit for you, if you want a strategy and stealth, you'll be disappointed
you will, nearly always, have 3 AI partners that will shoot enemies and follow / cover you, they will not do the "bring A to B" objective, but the will try to cover you while yo do it, if you play on multiplayer both of you can either 1 partner each for the normal 4 members crew, or you can have everyone with other 3 AIs to have 8 or even 16 heisters, but I was unable to figure out how to set that for every mission

and a HUGE plus for me personally, it has a VR DLC completely free, I am a VR enthusiast, I bought my first VR headset over a year ago, and I had this game sitting on my library for over 3, when I notice the VR DLC was there and for free not less, I indeed found more reason to play it, it is reasonably well implemented, while multiplayer friends can't see my motion controls, it does translate will to both, in-game actions, and IRL motion controls, albeit with the same trappings of a game that was not designed with VR out of the box, but it doesn't feel like an afterthought either

TL;DR better game without publisher greed, set your expectations and enjoy the real game, VR is rather good and free

When it comes to first person horde shooters this is the best. Unlike lesser games such as Left 4 Dead 2 (which is not a bad game by any stretch of the imagination) it has more mechanics than "go over there and kill enemies along the way". It has a main objective (usually revolving around steal this *object* and escape) and the waves of police and swat officers only serve as barriers to that objective (while being incredibly fun to fight). From getting the thermal drill, to finding key cards, to getting the loot and escaping. All of the objectives add much needed depth to make the game much more lasting than others in its segment (after all this game will give you about 70-80 hours of satisfying gameplay with no dlc or mods). Along with many of the more challenging difficulties the game itself is ripe with challenges to make the player feel as if they have accomplished something every time they finish a heist. With the difficulty ramping up by doing more than simply increasing base enemy hp and damage, no it add new enemies with specific abilities. The taser can hold you in one place while his friends attack, the cloaker and pin you in place, and the dozer has enough health to tank a rocket launcher to the face and keep on going to stop you. The different enemies make the difficulty feel very fair and distinguish the difficulties from one another. There is more than just basic heists, in fact there are many holiday themed heists, a wave defense mode, and even a mode that ramps up difficulty (and reward) with heist after heist. All of the modes are worth playing due to the great base combat and mechanics (which is the mark of a truly great first person shooter). Over all the base game alone is more than worth the $10.84 (usd) that it sells for normally, and when it goes on sale adding this to your library is a no-brainer!

This game is something I'd compare to a very nice restaurant. 

You try it the first time and you're pleasantly surprised, the meal may not be fancy but it's a good hefty pile of food, with a good taste and texture, so enjoyable in-fact that you find yourself returning to have that meal again.

Eventually you start to try different things on the menu, different styles and experiences keep you coming back to this new ol'faithful, Knowing you're getting some good filling food for the price you're paying.

I've gotten quite lost in this metaphor. Uh... It's something you're happy to return to, trying out new builds and guns, mismatching all the different little bits until you've got seven builds of equally interesting combinations, Facing down gradually more havoc inducing forces of law enforcing armies, Cashing in the hard earned Cash, drugs, gold and jewelry until the escape van hangs heavy.

Payday 2 is a cooperative first-person shooter video game developed by Overkill Software and published by 505 Games. The game is a sequel to 2011's Payday: The Heist. It was released in August 2013 for Windows, PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360. An improved version of the game, subtitled Crimewave Edition, was released for PlayStation 4 and Xbox One in June 2015. A version for the Nintendo Switch was released in February 2018.

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using his connections in the drug world. Connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn.
Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Fring flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Fring was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my criminal activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.

Amazing game, timeless classic, also very underrated. Through my playthrough of about 450 hours iv encountered no more than 2 major bugs. The lore is very twisted and there is "post lore" lore which you have to unlock by unlocking secrets and that's superb in my opinion. The weapon customization is quite easy to wrap your head around, unlike other games. And the missions really never get boring, there is always something harder to do, some secret to find or some treat left for the players by the devs like the toast on white Xmas.
