Very fun game with loads of contents, all though after playing a long time it can be repetitive. If that happens get yourself 3 nice friends and have loads of fun running the heists co-op.

There has been loads of controversy around this game after the 4th Crimefest (Overkill makes an event of every year PAYDAY 2 has it's birthday) With microtransactions being added to the game as locked safes for weapons skins. These safes needs a key (drill) to open. That wouldn't be a problem for most people, but there is also stats boosts to these skins. Now how ever you feel about that this is a PVE game the stats boosts does not in anyway destroy your game. The stats boosts does not make you a god in anyway.

Overkill has since also backed down a bit on the microtransaction skins, and you now can also get the drill as a reward after a heist the same way you get the safe.

Now then would i recommend this game, i have played 1000 hours hell yes i would. In a group of friends it is one really fun co-op game.

An amazing and fast paced co-op shooter marred by bad dlc practices. Payday 2 is a great horde based shooter that can be enjoyed alone, with friends, or online with or without VR. The varying levels of difficulty make it quick to figure out just what you can and can't handle and as you progress, choosing higher difficulties for heists rewards you greatly. The infamy system, now reworked as 3.0, gives good enough reason to reset your progression the first time but any resets afterwards give little to no reward worth going back to level 0 for.

It is like left for dead but cops instead of zombies, and a loadout structure rather than picking up guns as you go. Do some heists, get cash. Game is very replayable. however I'd suggest buying when it is on sale as it goes on sale frequently.

The journey of the developers and players of Payday 2 is long and storied. It's a good game, and in my opinion it always was. I hope one day we see the sequel.

American City Life simulator gives a beautiful, shocking portrayal of the struggles one faces coming home after a long day's work. Mistrustful civilians constantly start fights and call the police at every opportunity, inciting thousand-strong waves of suicidal, abusive bullet sponges to destroy your much loved house and valuables. The economy is so unstable that nearly all your earnings are kept safe out of state, leaving you little to actually spend in your day-to-day life. No driver knows the road, leading to constant crashes and road rage shoot-outs that sometimes collapse entire bridges. The struggles are immense, but so are the rewards of the American Dream.

After spending 300+ hours in this game, i can talk about props and cons... Let's start with cons:
1. If you want full game experience, you need to buy DLC for weapons, modules for weapons, characters (with the exception of Jacket), perk desks (i still cant unlock kingpin perk desk because The Scarface character pack was removed) and heists (Black Cat, Big Bank, ect.). Without these DLCs this game is "PAYDAY2 Demo".
2. Some gameplay aspects can be buggy. For example, you can join any steath heist (Shadow Raid,Murkey Station, Carshop) and kill someone with your mlee weapon and everyone will hear it, like you took a shot with a pistol without a silencer (it's not a regular bug, but sometimes it can be irritating). Also on train heist i had a problem with ammo for turret... so i restarted this heist and it went back to normal (Also Mountain Master with it boss).
3. Adding "Ban" button. This is co-op shooter. Who decided to make this button? Very bad option.. After DLC.
4. Lack of balance in the game. Let's take Death wish and Death sentence and you will see differences. It's harder than it has to be... but still playable, even on one down.
Cons are over, now props:
1. It's fun co-op shooter, you can team up with your friends and play your favourite heists!
2. Also you can make new friends and play any time you want.
3. Soundtrack in this game is amazing.
4.And that's just funny game.
Would i recomend this game? Well, i think yes and no at the same time. So think about buying this game ;)

[h1] PAYDAY TWO: THE REVIEW. [/h1]

(please not that i have played this first on an Xbox Series S and then moved onto the PC release.)

payday 2 is a co-operative FPS heist simulator, where you can work alone or with friends to take on countless heists and try to make it out with cash, valuables, and whatever isn't glued down. in short, it's fun.

I think the charm of payday 2 is customization. you get to pick what goes on your heister; from their base model, to their suit, mask, and gloves. (which are all customizable as well). then once you've personalized yourself, then you move onto your weapons. from miniguns to comically large spoons (real), this game has pretty much any weapon you could ask for. 

now, the heists. you'll be robbing banks, trains, casinos, goats, and secret Russian documents. whatever people contract you to steal, you steal. oh, and don't worry about taking a few spoils of war for yourself. overall the variety of heists is large, and it'll be a while before you get bored. i mean, i have nearly 400 hours on this game as of the time of writing this,, so it must be good, right?

as usual, no game is perfect. and now i shall address the concerns.

[b] WHY IS THIS GAME EIGHTY GIGABYTES. [/b]

for real, this game debuted on Xbox 360 (2013), so how have the devs let the game get THIS big? 80GB is almost A TENTH of my PC's hard drive. i don't know about you, but having 1/10th of your ENTIRE pc dedicated to ONE game. yeah, nah. i mean, if i wanna play this, i find myself installing and uninstalling it, over and over again. 

then, there's the difficulty spike. easy, normal, hard and even overkill seem like a walk in the park. almost the same. just that there's one or two extra random guard spawns. then the moment you go to mayhem or higher, then all of a sudden, the flood gates of hard have been opened, and all the difficulty climb that SHOULD have been slowly ramping up, is now steeper than Everest. hope you enjoy reseting. a lot.

overall, is this game worth it? i mean, with PAYDAY 3's announcement, if you wanna follow the story, yeah, i'd recommend it. also if you just want a fun co-op game for your friends. but please, don't sink 400 hours into it, for your own sake.

Been thinking of reviewing this game for a while, but hadn't decided if I hate this game or approve of it yet.
I think I've finally decided what kind of review it deserves:

Update " 219.3 " apparently added "Gamesight" (formerly known as "Red Shell" ) to the game. 

https://steamcommunity.com/app/218620/eventcomments/3187991824497314636

Gamesight is a third party spyware program that collects data on you and sells it to god knows who. Probably Google, Facebook, the CCP, the CIA, whoever's willing to buy at any given moment. 

You can email the company who runs the spyware (LOL) and tell them* to not spy on you (double LOL) or, alternatively, you can opt out of their tracking in-game at any time. (Other users who have tested it say opting out of Gamesight works as intended.) Call me cynical or a schizophrenic, but do you really trust the game devs who added the spyware, or the spyware company themselves to honor "their end" of the bargain? I don't.

Best to not buy this game at all, not even on sale for 2 dollars or discounted DLC, lol.

OH! right, I forgot to actually review the game; The overall balance of weapons and mechanics is terrible, I bought this game wanting to do the Street Shootout from Heat, instead I got a basic horde shooter with perks, really REALLY bad stealth, and meh guns. Playing this game without any DLC at all puts you at a disadvantage, there are DLC weapons and attachments that are nice to have / more useful on the higher, more insane difficulties. Like the Cavity SUB-2000 for stealth builds or the m60 for not being a cringe stealth player. 

All of the guns have arbitrary stats that don't follow any logical pattern. Some guns do more damage but have no ammo, other guns do no damage and have lots of ammo. A sniper rifle in .308 caliber will penetrate armor, but a Galil assault rifle also chambered for .308 will not. All in the name of GAME BALANCE for a PVE shooter...?

As for the Difficulty settings, once you get ranked up a little bit, anything below "Overkill" (4th difficulty) is boringly easy to do solo. Let alone with players or bots, and anything above "mayhem" (5th difficulty) is an annoying slog where you're forced to play whatever meta the community has come up with at the moment. No freedom to bring what you want, you either run this kit / perk deck, or you die. 

There's no middle ground difficulty where you can experiment with non-meta gear while still facing competent resistance from the AI. It's either a trip to the petting zoo with your 4th grade class or fighting with a butter knife at the Battle of Khe Sanh.

If this game Didn't have terrible stealth, weird weapon statistics, spyware. Or that god-awful, talentless, evil scumbag Ethan Klein as a playable DLC character. I could maybe give it a thumbs up. 

At least the music's good I guess.

The team AI randomly changes from being completely OP to completely useless. Sometimes you can pick every single safety deposit box in a bank without a single officer getting into the vault, sometimes it'll feel like your team does nothing but shoot walls and get in your way while trying to defend yourself from super soldiers who are able to hit a dime from across the map. There's also this strange thing where the AI acts really weird outside of your vision. This can lead to police just walking up behind you even when your AI teammates are looking directly at the officers.

The damage from all officers ramps up with the difficulty to the point where adding more special units starts to feel unfair if you play single player. The officers also seem to prioritize shooting at players rather than AI.

There's also a really annoying delay between looking at an object you can interact with and being able to use the interact key. It's also really annoying that just holding down F doesn't start the interaction automatically when the prompt comes up. I've wasted way too much time to this inconvenience.

Overall it's a really fun game, but there are a number of small things that really make it frustrating to play single player.

â€œGold is golden.â€
â€œItâ€™s payday fellasâ€
â€œAhh I need a medic bagâ€
â€œWULULULULUâ€

From Dallas requesting a medic bag to a cloaker dropkicking you in the face while letting out the iconic sound effect, the game is full of memes and is an iconic game. Gameplay wise it can get repetitive if you are constantly going for the shortest time or the most efficient heist possible, but thereâ€™s a large emphasis placed on â€œifâ€ The amount of stupidity which can take place in payday is incredible, why not make a super short suppressed M1 Garand and not even use it properly, constantly reloading to hear the ping. Alternatively you can do clay pigeon shooting with live grenades, throw a javelin into a guy wearing a bomb disposal suit carrying a Vulcan or even just throw cards at helpless civilians. 

Gameplay:
Can be summed up with: 1. Get to X. 2. Take Y from point X to point Z. 3. Wait at point Z for some time. 4. Take the stuff and get away. 5. Try to stealth, if it doesnâ€™t work then try not to die
As you can see this can get repetitive, however playing with random lobbies always adds an extra layer of challenge as people have different playstyles.

You do get a fair amount of content without DLCs but to really experience Payday you need some DLCs, especially ones such as gage mod courier pack which allows extra weapon mods. The ammo system is also quite weird at first as the number on the right is actually the total ammo, including ammo in the weapon. So thatâ€™s slightly confusing.

Would I buy it? Yes, definitely, but maybe wait for a sale, they are fairly common but payday is already not very expensive for what youâ€™re getting. If you are going to get DLCs, get the legacy bundle, it works out way better than buying individual DLCs. So in conclusion, itâ€™s very fun if you donâ€™t take it mega seriously and you mess around a bit.

PAYDAY 2 is an action-packed, four-player co-op shooter that once again lets gamers don the masks of the original PAYDAY crew - Dallas, Hoxton, Wolf and Chains - as they descend on Washington DC for an epic crime spree.

The CRIMENET network offers a huge range of dynamic contracts, and players are free to choose anything from small-time convenience store hits or kidnappings, to big league cyber-crime or emptying out major bank vaults for that epic PAYDAY. While in DC, why not participate in the local community, and run a few political errands?

Up to four friends co-operate on the hits, and as the crew progresses the jobs become bigger, better and more rewarding. Along with earning more money and becoming a legendary criminal comes a character customization and crafting system that lets crews build and customize their own guns and gear.
Key Features
Rob Banks, Get Paid â€“ Players must choose their crew carefully, because when the job goes down they will need the right mix of skills on their side.
CRIMENET â€“ The dynamic contract database lets gamers pick and choose from available jobs by connecting with local contacts such as Vlad the Ukrainian, shady politician "The Elephant", and South American drug trafficker Hector, all with their own agenda and best interests in mind.
PAYDAY Gunplay and Mechanics on a New Level â€“ Firing weapons and zip tying civilians never felt so good.
Dynamic Scenarios â€“ No heist ever plays out the same way twice. Every single scenario has random geometry or even rare events.
Choose Your Skills â€“ As players progress they can invest in any of five special Skill Trees: Mastermind, Enforcer, Ghost, Technician and Fugitive. Each features a deep customization tree of associated skills and equipment to master, and they can be mixed and matched to create the ultimate heister.
More Masks than Ever â€“ PAYDAY 2 features a completely new mask system, giving players the ability to craft their own unique mask with a pattern and color of their choice, resulting in millions of different combinations.
Weapons and Modifications â€“ A brand new arsenal for the serious heister, covering everything from sniper and assault rifles to compact PDWs and SMGs. Once you've settled for a favorite, you can modify it with optics, suppressors, fore grips, reticles, barrels, frames, stocks and more, all of which will affect the performance of your weapon. There are also purely aesthetic enhancements - why not go for the drug lord look with polished walnut grips for your nine?
Play It Your Way â€“ Each job allows for multiple approaches, such as slow and stealthy ambushes or running in guns blazing. Hit the target any way you want, each approach will provide a different experience.
A Long History of Additional Content â€“ More than 70 updates since release, including new heists, characters, weapons and other gameplay features like driving cars and forklifts.

Fittingly, PayDay 2 is a lot like a bank heist. If you pick your crew well, everything comes together like a well-oiled machine, and everybody gets rich. If, on the other hand, you leave the guy with the IQ of a toaster in charge of grabbing the money while you guard the hostages, youâ€™ve booked yourself a one-way ticket to San Quentin. Like most co-op games, PayDay 2 is only as good as the people you're playing with, but when everyone involved plays it the way it's meant to be played, the rewards include challenging, high-tension action, and intense running gunbattles.


The core four-player co-op gameplay is really strong, as are the many systems and mechanics that feed into it. Crime.Net is your principal gameplay mode, where you'll choose missions from an interactive city map and get matched up with some partners in crime. Things like safe, guard, and camera placement are randomized every time you play a mission, keeping you and your buddies on your toes at all times, but in a creative and thematically appropriate idea, you get dropped in to case the joint as civilians first so you can get an idea of what to expect. Though it might sound boorish, it's actually one of the best parts of the experience. I never felt more like an uncatchable thief than when I started calling out guard positions to my teammates while waltzing through a jewelry store undetected.

Walking around the maps can be a jarring experience, though, due to some graphical inconsistencies. Out in the streets, environments feel believable thanks to impressive daytime lighting and some truly authentic-looking architecture. But that believability crumbles the moment you step inside, where the geometry is so basic, and the textures so flat, that you'd think you were playing a different game. Both could definitely use an extra round of bug fixes, though â€“ I wanted to immerse myself in the fantasy of being a big-money bank robber, but an endless stream of snafus kept shattering it. Invisible walls? Check. Endlessly repeating civilian character models? Everywhere. By the time I noticed I could stand inside of innocent bystanders, I wasn't even surprised anymore.

Thankfully, the excellent sound design does a lot of heavy lifting, rescuing some of the atmosphere. Rifle fire rings out across the streets as beautifully as a church choir, and the muffled sound of a guard getting plugged with a silenced 9mm feels ripped right out of a good caper movie. Paired with a wide variety of well-animated hit reactions, the sound effects give PayDay 2's gunplay a punchiness that invited me to pull the trigger again and again. The dynamic soundtrack isnâ€™t quite as memorable, but musical flourishes accompany each shift in pace, cuing you in that you need to either buckle down for a big firefight, or haul ass towards that escape van when the cops are hot on your tail.

But unlike its predecessor, that wonâ€™t happen every time you play â€“ at least, if you play well â€“ because PayDay 2 actually recognizes and rewards a smart, stealthy approach to bank robbery. Though some of the multi-day missions have unavoidable armed conflicts, most heists allow for a skilled crew to ace them without the cops ever getting involved. Disabling alarms, silently taking out guards, and effectively controlling civilian crowds all have a huge impact on how fast and how severe police intervention will be. A flawless heist is incredibly tough to orchestrate, but it IS possible, and that possibility kept me chasing perfection match after match.
Part of why it's so challenging, and alluring, is all the different details and elements that play meaningful roles. Downing security guards means you'll have to answer their radios to avoid alerting others. You'll need to balance your load-outs between mobility, utility, and concealability. Four robust skill trees affect everything from the kinds of gear you're proficient with to your skill at hand-to-hand combat or lock-picking. The amount of depth is impressive when you add it all up, and the result is a surprisingly strategic affair disguised as a fast-paced shooter. But the best part of all is that even once things invariably go wrong and the focus shifts from executing a plan to thinking on your feet, PayDay 2 remains a blast. The ensuing firefights are long and intense, and the varied types of foes that get thrown your way require good resource management and quick thinking to best.

Which leads us to PayDay 2's biggest, most glaring issue: the offline single-player mode. It should be clear that this is a co-op game thatâ€™s meant to be enjoyed with four human players, but if you had any aspirations of making bank as a lone wolf, you might as well shelve them. These AI helpers aren't even capable of interacting with objectives or carrying money bags, making even the simplest, most straightforward missions nearly unplayable. Theyâ€™re fine as mobile meat shields, but otherwise, they make PayDay 2 look like a much worse game than it is. Itâ€™s honestly baffling that theyâ€™ve even been included in their current state.
Verdict
Played as intended with a group of friends, PayDay 2 is much like one of its heists: things can get a little sloppy, but the potential payoff is big. Parts of its presentation are lacking, and the state of its single-player is criminal, but overall, it's a deep, addictive co-op shooter that tickled my inner burglar.

This is a great game with friends! BUT, it's great for the price. I have put in a lot of hours over the years, but at the end of the day, it's the friends that make it fun to do. After you have played each mission a handful of times, there isn't much to bring you back. Missions boil down into, what gives the most money or xp. None of the missions are really fun. Not fun enough to warrant doing 1000 plus times. The game loop works as follows: you get xp, level, then prestige (lose your levels, and start over with minor buffs and a cool mask). Then you do it again. After you have prestiged a few times, you have done most of the missions in the game. Then you would have to buy dlc. This extends the process by a little bit, but after a while you just come back to the fact that you are doing missions to see a number go up. That number being your prestige level. If you are playing with friends, this is fun enough. But you can only play a mission so many times before everyone is just doing it on auto pilot. I think it's worth the price of the game, but do yourself a favor and play with friends. It's not much fun alone. Hope this helps!

I had been considering writing a review for PAYDAY 2 for a while, and while for the majority of my playtime I've really enjoyed the game, I cannot recommend it due to the questionable changes the developers have been making to the game, especially in regards to its balance. However, that's nothing compared to their decision to introduce the data harvesting spyware Gamesight, formerly known as Red Shell, into the game. This isn't disclosed on the Steam store page either, so you'll only know that Gamesight is on your PC once you've already installed and run the game for the first time.

In my opinion, it's disgusting that this kind of 3rd party tracking is in the game at all, and I really can't trust the developers not to monetise its playerbase more aggressively in the future.

Edit: I'd like to clarify that this review was not written soley due to the Gamesight integration. There are many reasons I can't recommend this game in its current state. They continue to sell DLCs that are nothing more than badly optimised, rehashed versions of heists released years prior, and they continue doing this while leaving the game in a downright broken state. There are many gamebreaking bugs that have gone unpatched for years, such as the black screen bug, cops walking through walls, Cloakers kicking you from another country, etc. The game suffers from excessive power creep, which has somewhat recently culminated in the release of Leech, the most powerfully broken perk deck in the game so far. Ethan Klein is also in this game for some reason.

Half of the game's heists have very poor optimisation, resulting in inconsistent and/or low framerates. People like to blame the engine for this, but that's not the case - community-made mods have proven that even some of the worst-performing heists such as The White House can run at very good framerates without any sacrifices to graphical quality, so this is a developer issue, not an engine one.

Also, the game's Linux port is a joke that features a broken framerate cap, constant stuttering and an average framerate of around 35 FPS. Similar to the console versions of the game, it was released and has since been essentially abandoned. I've heard that some people can get decent performance out of the Linux port, but I've not seen it for myself. If you're on Linux and having performance issues, try running the Windows version via Proton. Just note that, for some reason, the asset files are not shared between the Windows and Linux builds, so you'll have to re-download the entire game if wish to use the Windows build on Linux.

In regards to Gamesight, it's important to understand that the information they collect [i]looks[/i] innocent at first glance. However, they use this information to fingerprint your device and track you across the web. Even if Starbreeze isn't using this data in any insidious way, Gamesight are the ones who ultimately collect the data and can also use it. If you're okay with this, then by all means, opt-in. But personally, I don't trust Gamesight and I certainly don't trust Starbreeze who have a history of lying to their customers.

That said, this game can still be very fun and at its core its a great game. It has great gunplay, an amazing soundtrack and most of the heists are fun and well-designed. It's just a shame that its ruined by the game's overall instability and Starbreeze's greed.

I love this game, and it pains me to criticise it so harshly, but I cannot defend Starbreeze's business practices and laziness when it comes to new content and the game-breaking issues that the game still has despite being supported for 9+ years.

If you're a new player looking to get into this game, I'd say avoid. If you do decide to get it, get it on sale and get the Legacy Collection. Most of the new DLC are simply rehashed versions of what's been released before, so as long as you own the Legacy Collection, you basically own all of it.

2 teaspoons chili powder
1 teaspoon ground cumin
1 teaspoon smoked paprika
1 teaspoon dried oregano
1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
1 1/2 pounds boneless, skinless chicken thighs
1 tablespoon canola oil
12 mini flour tortillas, warmed
1 cup pico de gallo, homemade or store-bought
1 avocado, halved, peeled, seeded and diced
1/2 cup chopped fresh cilantro leaves
1 lime, cut into wedges
DIRECTIONS:
In a small bowl, combine chili powder, cumin, paprika, oregano, garlic powder, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Season chicken with chili powder mixture.
Heat canola oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Working in batches, add chicken to the skillet in a single layer and cook until golden brown and cooked through, reaching an internal temperature of 165 degrees F, about 4-5 minutes per side. Let cool before dicing into bite-size pieces.
Serve chicken in tortillas, topped with pico de gallo, avocado, cilantro and lime.

Why is this game so frustrating yet so addictive

When the game had just come out, Overkill promised players that there would never, ever be microtransactions in PAYDAY 2 on multiple occassions. They lied.

When players were completing challenges for Crimefest 2015, Overkill promised that all content unlocked from the completion of challenges would be free. They lied.

Screw Overkill.

I mean, I really, really wish I could say that despite all that there is still a part of me that enjoyed the game, even after all this. And I tried and I tried - because I never played any other game as much as PAYDAY 2 up until that point. But the weapon balance they brought witht he pay-to-gain-the-advantage microtransactions made all the gunplay feel completely off, compared to what it used to be. Assault rifles are inaccurate and ineffective, and the pistols have all been turned into hand cannons. Concealment in stealth is now more reliant on how much your weapon skin buffs concealment than your skills and mods.

I really still wish I could say "despite all the â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥, what's was always still great about this game was..." but it's gone now. That era has been and gone, and it really, really saddens me.

Rest in peace, PAYDAY 2 pre-Crimefest 2015. A brilliant game with so much potential. You will be missed.

Pros: Play this with friends and it is a lot of fun for a long time. 

Cons: super grind-heavy. Also hold on tight to your wallet. This developer will stop at nothing to drain your bank account with DLC. They will probably cure cancer before Overkill stops producing weapon packs and new heists. I can't even remember how often they said they'd move on to Payday 3 and then came back to this for the easy money it generates.

High difficulty is achieved by making enemies bullet sponges and their damage enormous. The only way to counter this is to read into whatever the current meta is and following it by the book. If you want to complete heists on high difficulties, you do not have a choice HOW to accomplish it. There is only the meta.

This game has more weapons than the amount of socks all the Kardashians (and their film team) combined must own. New players will probably be overwhelmed. Give the game a fair shot and if you like it, buy the DLC in a bundle. Do not(!) buy DLC separately, it will mess you up.

Story wise this game has strayed so far from it's roots that it ofter derails into Saints-Row-like silliness. Payday 1 was a completely different experience, almost incomparable. I highly recommend Payday 1 by the way - very simple, very straight-forward. Payday 2 often feels overloaded with too many details and add-ons that make it unfathomably confusing. It almost feels like features were added into this game over time without applying any filter to prevent superfluous crap from getting in.

About the community: There are nice players, there are jerks. As in every game. But since this game is so heavy on experience and knowing what works and what doesn't, you'll find yourself antagonized in public lobbies if you play inefficiently or appear to have a low level. It is not predominantly skill that determines a successful player but knowledge of the games mechanics, skill tree, perk system and most importantly the heists themselves.

My conclusion: this game is the most fun if you get super invested in it, learn everything there is and let yourself be absorbed by it (and - sadly - if you buy all the DLC). So dip your toes into the water and see if you like it before you commit. Casual on- and off players won't enjoy this nearly as much.

Payday 2 is a very fun and customizable game that can be played with friends for hours on end. However, I cannot recommend this game because of the sheer amount of DLC. Not only is there A LOT of DLC, but the game itself is balanced around the DLC, not items that players can get for free. I would not have a problem with it if the DLC was not so prominent in the game, but you have to spend a lot of money to do well in the game, which may end up making it cost more than most full games today. 

If you do decide to get the game, there are a wide variety of heists that you can play, but a lot of them are locked behind DLC. although most DLC is completely inaccessible by a FTP player, all DLC maps can be played regardless of whether you own it or not, so you can find a contract in the online menu on these maps or have a friend who owns the DLC start a lobby.

You can get by without owning too much DLC if you only buy DLC specific to a class you want to play, but it may get boring to play one way every single time.

Cheesecake recipe
Ingredients:
- 1 3/4 cups Honey maid graham cracker crumbs.
- 1/3 cup butter, melted.
- 1 1/4 cups sugar, divided.
- 3 (8 ounce) packages Philadephia Cream Cheese, softened.
- 1 cup Breakstone's or Knudsen Sour Cream.
- 2 teaspoons vanilla.
- 3 eggs.
- 1 (21 ounce) can cherry pie filling.
Directions: Mix graham crumbs, butter, and 1/4 cup sugar: press onto bottom of 9-inch springform pan
Beat cream cheese and remaining sugar in large boul with mixer until blended. Add sour cream and vanilla; mix well. Add eggs, one at a time, beating on low speed after each addition until blended. Pour over crust. Bake 1 hour to 1 hour 10 minutes or until center is almost set. Run knife around rim of pan to loosen cake. Cool before removing rim. Refrigerate cheesecake 4 hours. Top with pie filling before serving.
You pay 10$ for the base and your savings for the heists.

problems:
1. gameplay is repetitive and gets old after 5 minutes.
2. Feels like a GTA knockoff with only the crime and without an open world
3. VR controls are awful, uncomfortable, and make it extremely hard to play
4. Gets boring after only a few minutes of play time.
5. Hard-to-navigate settings, and almost impossible to change keybinds in vr.
6. gun physics are extremely annoying to use, and you can't drop your gun or change the hand you're holding it with.
Not a bad game, but needs a lot of improvement. If you're a VR player wanting a fun gun game, I would play Pavlov instead.

PAYDAY 2 is a thriller, horde FPS. Commence sophisticated heists ranging from a simple bank heist that takes one day to finish, to taking two days too hunt down a Russian Mafia boss. All while being under attack by the (clone army) FBI forces.

With a total of 22 unique Heisters (ranging from a mute ex-military, to an ex-software developer) and 22 matching Perk Decks (you can use whatever Perk Deck you want with your preferred Heister) that allow you to alter how you play the game, well over a hundred, highly customizable weapons (ranging from your standard assault rifle, to something as outlandish as an old English longbow).

There is a lot to do in PAYDAY 2 aside from just robbing professional money launders, a full campaign, a game mode centered around speed running specific heists, to a survival mode. With around 60+ heists (some similar, most incredibly different), ranging from a good old fashioned bank robbery, to a two day heist collecting goats carrying drugs and getting away in a car on the second day.

PAYDAY 2 is one of those games that (even if you finish the campaign) doesn't really end until you declare you're finished.

Buying PAYDAY 2 and it's DLC supports Starbreeze and Overkill, giving them more money that they can put into PAYDAY 3 development. I'm going to miss Jacket.

PAYDAY 2 is worth your money if your into playing Clown-masked Heisters slaughtering half a thousand cops in a single heist while trying to rob a bank.

Great game, really awesome modding is very accessible and pretty easy to do, but I have some things I want to address!

1st off over the years the textures have been downgraded by sneaking them in updates without any notice for "better performance", but downgrading the textures doesn't give that much more better performance and why not let us decide what texture quality we want instead of giving all the players the same low quality textures even if they have a high-end gaming pc, what they really should have done is optimize their game more and that would have given significantly more performance.

2nd there are SO MANY DLC's and they aren't cheap either and some DLC's aren't even worth getting.

3rd there a many glitchy things that can easily be patched, like wrong dialogues being activated, wrong things being displayed, etc. (Luckily for us there are alot of mods that fix these problems and glitches at modworkshop).

Played as intended with a group of friends, PayDay 2 is much like one of its heists: things can get a little sloppy, but the potential payoff is big. Parts of its presentation are lacking, and the state of its single-player is criminal, but overall, it's a deep, addictive co-op shooter that tickled my inner burglar.

This is one of those games that absolutely nobody says is a good game, but everything about this game will make you want to come back. It's insanely addictive. When I say it isn't a good game, I'm not saying it isn't fun. It's my most played Steam game atm. But the game definitely has a significant amount of problems.

Pros:
-Quite possibly the most fun I've ever had in a shooter, and this is coming from someone who just finished Ultrakill an hour ago.
-A LOT of ways to experiment with builds to fit your playstyles, it's one of the reasons I've been playing it so much for months.
-The story is very interesting, at least in my opinion.
-Very active modding community. This is another reason I've been playing a lot.
-Amazing sound design. There is only a few OST's i would listen to daily, and this and the first games OST's are two of them.

Neutral:
-The DLC's. Everyone who has played Payday 2 knows how much DLC it has, but the reason why is because Overkill and Starbreeze almost went under after the... "incident." This would be in cons if that weren't the case for the DLC.
-The console versions are terrible. They stopped updating this game on console a couple years ago because of the "incident", and because of that the console versions are very outdated in content. PC is the best way to play this game by far. The reason I put this in neutral is because of the neutral before this one.
-The outfits. Yeah there's some cool stuff here and there, but most of it is behind a paywall (which i understand) and don't really look like they're worth four dollars.
-Stealth.

Cons:
-There is little to no balance in this game. if you are new you will have a hard time figuring out which perk decks to start out with unless you follow guides on them. I've been there before, I know how it feels.
-It goes without saying at this point, but the engine this game runs on is horrible. It's a heavily modified version of the Diesel Engine, which was made specifically for racing games. Dunno about you, but that doesn't seem fit for a horde shooter.
-This game is very unoptimized. It isn't Cyberpunk 2077 launch date kinds of bad, but it definitely isn't good. Heists like Hell's Island and San Martin Bank definitely need work with its optimization. 
-There are a lot of cheaters in death sentence lobbies (which is what I play on), and I mean a lot. 1/3 death sentence lobbies will definitely have someone using cheats in one way or another.
-The game is pretty buggy. Enough said.
-Micro transactions. Years ago Overkill promised there would never be micro transactions, but they added them anyways. It's a massive "fuck you" to the people who play it.
-Public stealth lobbies.

Does this game have problems? Many of them. Is this game atleast worth playing? Absolutely.

I give this game a solid 8.7/10, loads of fun but definitely needs to work on the problems I mentioned

also stop calling this game a fucking bank robbing game

"AAAHHHHHH!! I NEED A MEDIC BAG!" Is the only thing I hear when I think of payday 2. I am still surprised that such an old game like this hasn't died or been renewed with payday 3 yet, it still gets constant updates! This game has so much controlled chaos that you control in your fingertips. There is a story yes, but just like many of the other players in this game, I only do it for the fun mechanics that makes everything a living nightmare. There are two ways of doing a normal mission. The sneaky way with lockpicking and silenced weapons takes time and cooperation with your teamates to get more experience and cash for each mission. The other way is guns blazing, running into a bank with 30 civilians and blowing everyone there with a rocket launcher as the police send endless waves of armed guards, the area just becomes a slaughterhouse. The upgrades in this game are also insane, each one giving you basically god like powers that makes you immune to enemy gunfire and allows you to take missiles over and over again. I can go on and on about the crazy mechanics that make this game fun but that would take forever. I strongly recommend this cheap game  that includes hundreds of amazing stuff that makes each playthrough crazy.

Firstly, as I started playing this game, I wanted to redeem my money after 2.7 hours.
But as time progressed I began loving this game. 
As of now I have accumulated 1000 hours in this masterpiece of PAYDAY 2.
Similiar to tf2 with its spagetti code, this game runs on a race engine and plays like a potato. (I love playing potato games)
I met a ton of friends in this game, still play it regulary with new players and will continue to infamy up until I reach infamy 100 for the last infamy achievement or infamy 420 for the fun of having a funny number.

The ride since 2013 was very bumpy. They removed the case drops, so nowadays everyone gets a drop daily (economy was fucked by this tho). Although promised not add further DLCs they are still adding new DLCs, like new heists, cosmetics, weapons etc. I have nothing against this because this way they can get the financial support they need for the upcoming PAYDAY 3, after their last game RAID WW2 flopped and they were almost bankrupt. 

Contrary to other games you can't finish PAYDAY 2, there are always new ways to play it, be it playing with mods, speedrunning, getting better in (new) heists, leveling infamy (Infamy 500, level 50000 is max.), finding new glitches & bugs you can exploit, learning game mechanics or teaching new players (or even friends who are new to the game). The possibilties are endless. 

Of course just like in every other multiplayer game you will encounter cheaters, you can either avoid them by looking and the name before joining a lobby or autokick them / manually ban them if you are the host. In my experience you will encounter cheaters in about every 15-20th lobby you join or about every 30-50 player who joins you. Just like in CSGO you will encounter the sterotypical cheating russian who is infamy 200 and has all achievements done in the same minute. 

With time passing you will encounter the playersubtype I would call "special", there are wide variations of this subtype. This could be either a new player with no silencer who does not understand the concept of stealth after restarting the heist 3 times in a row because he keeps rushing everything or someone who has no brain and does not learn from his mistakes and keeps doing the same mistake repeatedly like bumping into guards or going trought lasers. This subtype of players are mostly found in infamy 0-5. My friends and me are calling those kind of players the "classic payday 2 player". 
Of course you will find very competent players in this range as well and very special people outside of this range.
A cheated infamy 100 more retarded then a player with brain being infamy 0. 

All in all, I would recommend bying a Steam Key for this game outside of Steam, because they removed the Scarface DLC due to licensing issues, which is a great DLC in my opinion.
Amazing game, love everything about it, especially the VR version. The heists are well done, the music is great, and the gameplay is amazing. Can't wait till Payday 3 comes out

Payday 2 is a great game about committing organized crime, and doing criminal work for different people. I love the variety of missions and I'm impressed in how different they can make the same map feel. I like that there are missions where you steal data, destroy money, and take a singular important item, it really makes the game feel less like you just do the same thing in a different map. I prefer stealth in games rather than a loud approach but the weapon upgrades and uses makes loud really fun, but stealth is still my primary approach to missions that allow stealth.

This game is pretty good honestly, It's more hands on/Interactive in missions whether it be having to memorize names, codes, locations, or Pre-Planning the mission before going in, I have a few problems with having to get DLC at times but I got the Legacy Edition at 75% off, so basically I have a series of DLC that would have been more to buy alone, But still I enjoy the game, Whoever is looking for a challenge in stealth, or going Gun's Blazing can change difficulty, I find the entry of Cloakers and Bulldozers at the 'Very Hard' Difficulty more challenging, I'd have to suggest getting a good Loud Skill-set, Otherwise you might just get wiped out on the first few minutes, It's way better to have friends who have the same game as you do, But going online and joining Public Lobby's is also an option, I prefer going solo in Stealth as I usually don't need help, But Going in Gun's blazing I usually need a squad and a plan otherwise I get wiped out, What I really like about the game is that you have to actually take time to memorize the mission names, maps, also you have to make plans, execute properly, and even then Screwing up is going to happen, I am not good for writing reviews or anything but I just felt like expressing this, Most of this was basically the same thing repeated, I once again am just really Shit at writing reviews, Thank you for your time and reading this, I genuinely hope this helped somebody, peace out.

You don't need anyone's opinion on how good this game is. Nevertheless, this is a great recipe for an amazing caramel custard pudding -

Ingredients -
1. 1/2 cups sugar
2. 6 large eggs
3. 3 cups whole milk
4. 2 teaspoons vanilla extract

1. In a large heavy saucepan, cook and stir 3/4 cup sugar over low heat until sugar is melted and golden. Pour into eight 6-oz. custard cups, tilting to coat the bottom of each cup; let stand for 10 minutes.
2. In a large bowl, beat the eggs, milk, vanilla, and remaining sugar until blended but not foamy. Pour over caramelized sugar.
3. Place the cups in two 8-in. square baking pans. Pour very hot water in pans to a depth of 1 in. Bake at 350Â° until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, 40-45 minutes. Remove from pans to cool on wire racks.
4. To unmold, run a knife around the rim of the cup and invert onto the dessert plate. Serve warm or chilled.
5. Enjoy!

This is quite fun when it comes to robbing heists on loud and getting to know the basics and the machanics. You'll get to feel something new if you play stealth. Stealth is easy, I think they should bring back the old stealth system but I guess we gotta keep it how it is right now since it would be practically impossible to actually complete a heist only on stealth.

I love how there is mods in this game! They are quite entertaining and I NEVER knew it could get so big and so far that would keep me modding forever. But still, I don't like mods, but I love mods. You can't deny that mods can be more fun and useful than the built-in features and scripts in the Payday 2 game. However, there is one down side to modding... CHEATERS.

Cheaters are pain in the ass and I can't deal with them easily if they can crash me. It's so disappointing for Overkill making the game so exploitable and explorable in API learning. I still gotta say, this game is damn good and I will never dislike the Payday games and the PAYDAY community. Y'all are the best for being a great helper to new players, and I appreciate it alot.

btw i dislike we have to buy DLCs to be cool

First off, I'd like to thank my friend for gifting me this game.

PAYDAY 2 can be a fun & thrilling robbery game. There is no Workshop on community on Steam for the game, but there is on external websites, so be careful where you download from. Although, I personally feel some of the DLC's are unnecessary, as some of them should be in the base game. It is also very easy to bug the game without realizing it. Such as getting unobtainable characters from public lobbies and forever glitching the character you can choose. Public servers are a unsafe place to go to be honest. Lobby owners will kick anyone they see fit; as they did to my friend more than once.

Over time, the game gets VERY, VERY boring and irrelevant. I spent a whole summer break playing with a few friends and pretty much accomplished what we wanted to do, now the game is boring. When I do play it, it is either to kill time, or play with friends. I am ONLY recommending this game because of how fun it was for me and my friends.

Overall, the game is fun for the first few hundred hours, but then gets boring as time goes on. The game is paywalled a bit, and the game is somewhat easy to bug. I will be updating this review as time goes forward perhaps.

The game guys, go get it.

This game follows that same "Left 4 dead" formula, you can play either alone or with up to 3 friends, you either go from point A to point B, or defend point B to get access to point C in order to get look and escape, while fighting all the time against an endless horde of cops, some of them with special abilities.

What makes Payday 2 special is the high amount of customization that you can get for yourself and your weapons, with multiple abilities and gadgets that you can equip, you could potentially play thousands of games and never ever bring the same primary and secondary weapon twice, always changing something on the equipment that spices up the gameplay.

It has a good amount of heists, so having the DLCs gives you a few more hours of playtime, the good thing is that only the host needs to own the heist DLC in order to host it and allow others to join in without owning the DLC.

[h1]Short version review:[/h1] 
After spending thousant hours in this game, i guess it is good time to write a review.

While ago i got this for free, at first i didnt liked it very much, but played with friends and kept playing even after they left. So it is probably not very suprising that i am more than happy to reccomend. You can play with friends or solo, whatever suits you. Its price is fair and often on sale anyway, also you are not forced to pay anything more you can join any heist even if you dont own them. Achievements are working and robbing banks it is simply a lot of fun.

[h1]Longer version (For those who have time and like reading tons of useless stuff)[/h1]

[b]Players[/b]
There basically four types of players:
Good and experienced - Great to play with theese folks, they know what they are doing and if mistake happens they understand, can adapt and are not harsh to new players.
Bad and unexperinced - Usually they got no idea what they are doing, they are new, but willing to learn and are here to enjoy the game. Fun to play with, it is harder, but not steoretipical and after all we all started somehow.
Cheaters - Not much to say, when you see them, leave server, just idiots with no desire to play.
Bad players thinking they are good - Worse case scenario and main reason i am playing alone. Usually kinds that swallowed all knowing of the world. They are making stupid mistakes and always blaming others. Sad thing that there is a lot of theese rage kids, they are just ruining game experience for everyone.

[b]Mods[/b]
Game got great modding community love to mess with the code. And basically everything can be changed from bot equipement and behavior, to cosmetics and overall map visuals. So now the real question is, am i stupid cheater? Well, i dont think so, im using mods for years and i still dont have most of hardest achievements, because they are not giving me some insane boost, also many mods i basically just balanced and made weaker, because they felt way too overpowered.

Ok, if you read up to this, now it is time to add some hate  to wrap this up.

Here is the reason why im not playing to much anymore: For me game ended when company got financial problems and everything was wraped, and PD2 secret finished. Dont take it badly, im happy that company is back on feet, but after returning, it was not the same. Many dlcs were made just to get cash, new heists are expensive and not ever on sale. We have new useless cosmetics like weapon colors, charms or lobby joining sounds and you cant combine suit skins with armors. New weapons were added but inventory space is the same and overall lot of useless stuf that im not willing to pay for, because i have absolute no use for it.

Not to end it it negatively, game got its flaws, but it also have its beauty and for low price you have fun for many hours. So go ahead and try it :).

Just a little disclaimer before we start: Please be understanding as English is not my first language so do excuse me for any grammatical errors, thank you!

If you've seen my other review on another game, you might know my cousin.

Once again, he was the one who recommended this game to me. Being the gamer that he is, he would constantly be leading all the heists and missions while I meekly followed behind trying to help.

The sheer variety and creativity in each individual heist is incredible. From your normal bank heists, to breaking and entering the White House; You will never be bored of this game.

Not only that, but pushing yourself and your friends to the limit is possible with so many difficulties.

There were moments where we were over an hour into the mission already, getting so difficult and tough to move forward, but we persevered (also because we put in so much time already), and always ending with a huge feeling of accomplishment.

And if you know me, you'd know I love the customisation functionality. I love the masks. I love them so much!

â€œThe Hog Rider card is unlocked from the Spell Valley (Arena 5). He is a very fast building-targeting, melee troop with moderately high hitpoints and damage. He appears just like his Clash of Clans counterpart; a man with brown eyebrows, a beard, a mohawk, and a golden body piercing in his left ear who is riding a hog. A Hog Rider card costs 4 Elixir to deploy.

Strategy

His fast move speed can boost forward mini tanks like an Ice Golem in a push. At the same time, he can also function as a tank for lower hitpoint troops such as Goblins as he still has a fair amount of health. Most cheap swarms complement the Hog Rider well, as they are nearly as fast as him and usually force more than one card out of the opponent's hand.

The Hog Rider struggles with swarms, as they can damage him down and defeat him quickly while obstructing his path. Barbarians in particular can fully counter him without very strict timing on the defender's part, though be wary of spells.

A Hunter can kill the Hog Rider in 2 hits if placed right on top of it. However, if you place something in front of the Hog Rider, the Hunter's splash will damage the Hog Rider and hit the card in front of it more.

The Hog Rider in conjunction with the Freeze can surprise the opponent and allow the Hog Rider to deal much more damage than anticipated, especially if the opponent's go-to counter is a swarm, or swarms are their only effective counter to him. Skeletons and Bats will immediately be defeated by the spell, while Spear Goblins, Goblins, and Minions will be at low enough health to be defeated by a follow up Zap or Giant Snowball.

However, this strategy isn't very effective against buildings as the Hog Rider will take a while to destroy the building, giving the opponent ample time to articulate another counter.

Against non-swarm troops, it can deal a lot of damage during the freeze time, but this can allow the opponent to set up a massive counterpush. For this reason, players should either only go for a Hog Rider + Freeze when they have other units backing it up from a counterattack, or if the match is about to end and they need to deal as much damage as possible.

It is not a good idea to send in a Hog Rider simply to destroy a building, especially if it is the only building targeting unit available, as defeating Crown Towers becomes substantially more difficult. Spells or simply waiting out the lifetime of the building are more effective. The exception to this is an Elixir Collector placed in front of the King's Tower. If a Hog Rider placed at the bridge, he can destroy the Collector for a positive Elixir trade, though the damage from both Princess Towers will usually mean he does not survive to deal any damage to them. However, if the opponent sends in defending troops, it can be an opportunity to gain spell damage value.

In a deck with several low-cost cards, it might be worth it to simply send the Hog Rider against one building. These decks shuffle their card rotation quick enough, that they will arrive to their next Hog Rider before the next building arrives in the opponent's card rotation.

Long-ranged troops like Musketeer and Flying Machine can snipe those buildings, preserving some of the Hog Rider's health, possibly allowing it to get some Tower damage.

When there are buildings placed in the middle to counter the Hog Rider, understanding the placement of the Hog Rider and the type of building placed can help the Hog Rider to bypass certain buildings.

Passive buildings such as spawners and Elixir Collector have a larger hitbox than defensive buildings; which means that if a passive building was placed 3 tiles away from the river in the middle of the opponent's side, then it is impossible for the Hog Rider to bypass that placement as the Hog Rider will get pulled to that building.

Defensive buildings have a smaller hitbox than a passive building, which means if that if a defensive building was placed three tiles away from the river in the middle of the opponent's side, a Hog Rider placed at the very left or right side of the Arena may be able to bypass it due to its smaller hitbox.

If the player has a building already placed down in the center of the arena, and the opponent tries to bypass it with a Hog Rider at the edge of the arena, they can use certain air troops to push the Hog Rider towards the building as it jumps over the river, effectively denying the bypass attempt. They must be already hovering over the correct placement, as very quick reflexes are required to correctly perform this technique.

For Bats, Skeleton Dragons, and Minion Horde, they should be placed right in front of the Hog Rider as soon as it is deployed.

For Minions, Skeleton Barrel, Mega Minion, Flying Machine, Electro Dragon, Baby Dragon, Inferno Dragon, Balloon, and Lava Hound, stagger the above placement one tile to the right if the Hog Rider is placed on the left side of the arena, and vice versa.

They can also use ground troops to achieve the same result. Something like an Ice Golem deployed at the Hog Riderâ€™s landing spot will obstruct his path and force him to go around the unit, which causes him to be closer to the building instead of the Crown Tower.

The Hog Rider can kite Very Fast non-building targeting troops due to his own Very Fast speed and building only targeting if he is placed on the fourth tile from the bridge, slightly into the opposite lane. He can also stall grounded units when placed right at the bridge. He will pull them towards him while deploying, and then be untargetable by them when he jumps over the bridge. After landing, he will pull them back. This can be useful when the player needs to deal damage in the same lane they are defending. It will also help separate troops behind a tank in a large push.

A Tornado placed on the second tile front of the player's King's Tower and staggered two tiles towards the Princess Tower will activate it without any damage dealt to the Princess Tower, helping them in defending future pushes. This can also be a method of mitigating all damage dealt to a Princess Tower, but doing this more than three times may result in the King's Tower's health being low enough to be targeted directly, opening up the possible threat of a back door three crown. A better alternative is to pull the Hog away from the Princess Tower into the attacking range of all three Crown Towers, which will negate all damage as long as none of them are already distracted

A very powerful combo is the Hog Rider, the Musketeer, and the Valkyrie, typically referred to as the Trifecta. The Musketeer will defend against most troops, while the Valkyrie can protect her and the Hog Rider from swarms or high damage units. The Hog Rider is used to deal damage to the tower.

This can be effectively countered by Lightning, one-shotting the Musketeer and severely damaging both the Valkyrie and Hog Rider. The Minion Horde is also effective, but the enemy can Zap them and the Musketeer will one-shot them all. Even if the Musketeer is defeated, the Hog Rider and Valkyrie will have enough time to severely damage the Tower.

The Hog Rider should be placed behind the Valkyrie to give it a boost so that it stays in front of the Hog Rider, protecting it.

A Hog Rider combined with a Goblin Barrel can be awkward for the opponent to defend against. Timing it so that the Hog Rider is tanking the tower shots for the Goblins is the most effective way to deal damage. However, a Barbarian Barrel can shut this down with minimal Tower damage for a positive Elixir trade, as long as the Goblin Barrel was placed directly on the Tower.â€

Hello, hello? Uh, I wanted to record a message for you to help you get settled in on your first night. Um, I actually worked in that office before you. I'm finishing up my last week now, as a matter of fact. So, I know it can be a bit overwhelming, but I'm here to tell you there's nothing to worry about. Uh, you'll do fine. So, let's just focus on getting you through your first week. Okay?Uh, let's see, first there's an introductory greeting from the company that I'm supposed to read. Uh, it's kind of a legal thing, you know. Um, "Welcome to Freddy Fazbear's Pizza. A magical place for kids and grown-ups alike, where fantasy and fun come to life. Fazbear Entertainment is not responsible for damage to property or person. Upon discovering that damage or death has occurred, a missing person report will be filed within 90 days, or as soon property and premises have been thoroughly cleaned and bleached, and the carpets have been replaced."

Blah blah blah, now that might sound bad, I know, but there's really nothing to worry about. Uh, the animatronic characters here do get a bit quirky at night, but do I blame them? No. If I were forced to sing those same stupid songs for twenty years and I never got a bath? I'd probably be a bit irritable at night too. So, remember, these characters hold a special place in the hearts of children and we need to show them a little respect, right? Okay.

So, just be aware, the characters do tend to wander a bit. Uh, they're left in some kind of free roaming mode at night.Uh...Something about their servos locking up if they get turned off for too long. Uh, they used to be allowed to walk around during the day too. But then there was The Bite of '87. Yeah. I-It's amazing that the human body can live without the frontal lobe, you know?

Uh, now concerning your safety, the only real risk to you as a night watchman here, if any, is the fact that these characters, uh, if they happen to see you after hours probably won't recognize you as a person. They'll p-most likely see you as a metal endoskeletonwithout its costume on. Now since that's against the rules here at Freddy Fazbear's Pizza, they'll probably try to...forcefully stuff you inside a Freddy Fazbear suit. Um, now, that wouldn't be so bad if the suits themselves weren't filled with crossbeams, wires, and animatronic devices, especially around the facial area. So, you could imagine how having your head forcefully pressed inside one of those could cause a bit of discomfort...and death. Uh, the only parts of you that would likely see the light of day again would be your eyeballs and teeth when they pop out the front of the mask, heh.

Y-Yeah, they don't tell you these things when you sign up. But hey, first day should be a breeze. I'll chat with you tomorrow. Uh, check those cameras, and remember to close the doors only if absolutely necessary. Gotta conserve power. Alright, good night.

Props to OVERKILL. 
While they could expand or work on the game's glitches more, a majority of the glitches give it heart and a fun laugh with friends.
Who expects a guard's arm to go through the wall? Or expect a body to go flying?

Or to crash straight into a wall because your crew sucks at driving.
Or prop the same car atop another car.

Who knows, but either way, it's a very fun game to play with friends but friends are not required.
I haven't reached a level of infamy yet, but that's because of my own playthrough.

Your skill tree is good to be open, but it's never forced to be, everything is flexible. Which makes it great.
You can be built for murder within loud heists, but then commit silent crimes the time right after-wards, or vice-versa.
It's always a good boredom cure, especially when something stupid happens.

Of course, it has it's aggravating moments, any game does.
But it's centered around teamwork, and if you have a good crew, it's amazingly fun.
10/10 in my book.

[h1] PAYDAY 2 [/h1]

[b] TOP TIER CO OP GAME [/b]
Payday 2 is easily on on the best Co-Op game standing along Left 4 Dead !
the game is more than 9 years old , but it still got many updates and fixes (some of them are DLC)
[b] I PERSONALLY RECOMMEND THIS GAME TO EVERY ONE ![/b]

[h1] Game Play [/h1]
The Game Play separated to 2 parts :

[b] LOUD !!!!! [/b]
The BEST way to play the game in my opinion is to play it loud !
in loud payday 2 shines as a star , the shooting , the music , and the team work with your friends 
is the best elements of this PvE game .
The maps disinde well , to be fun for killing hordes of swat that run on you like zombies , in each map you have different task for example : find manager key-card - open his office - hack the computer - disable the alarm - get the keys - and steal the cars !
every level different story and different loud play style .


[b] Stealth: [/b]
Ooh , I see it's hard to impress you with some shooting , so allow me to present you a world of shadows and sneaky tactics 
from all multiplayer game I have met Payday 2 has the best stealth mechanic off all .
Many of the loud level can be passed in stealth , that add a lot of replay ability to the game 
You can customize you'r stealth in many various way : skills , weapons , equipment and more.
Payday 2 open a big door of opportunity for the player to sneak to guarded In they way the player wants.


[b] Skills [/b]
In payday there 5 skill tree each of the have game changeing skilsl that will help you survive longer, make more damage , and finish job quiver ,
to fully understand what each of the skills do may take up to 100h , but when you start understanding the game logic you will start to have fun !
The only minus is that in the highest difficulty only some specific Builds will survive , and the other won't survive a minute.

[b] Weapons [/b]
all the types of weapons you may think , exist in the game (and what don't you can add with mods)
AR rifles , LMGs, sniper , revolver , mini gun , grande launcher , bow and many more .
All the weapons are customization  you can add scopes , silncer, grips and more.
The main down side is DLC .

[b] DLC HELL [/b] 
The main way the developer earning money is through DLC , around 90% percent of the content looked under DLC 
guns , maps , attachments, characters, skins.
No , you can't full enjoy the game without DLC so if you want to buy the game , you should consider buying the Full edition.

[b] MUSIC [/b]
The music in the game is amazing , Huge respect for Simon Viklund the composer of the payday 2 series !
He got the right scene for music , and he added to the game , he not only created music from authentic for the Payday 2 DLC like Hotline Miami , Hardcore Henry , Scar face , Reservoir Dogs
The music on stealth is pretty good , but in loud you will just want to stand up and start dancing !

[b] MODS [/b]
MODS is one of the main factor why the game is still alive .
the mods add a lot to the replay ability of the game , m there are thousand of modification you can add (character skins , new weapons and custom heist )

[b] CO OP [/b]
CO OP is a bomb it's amazing , awesome , but don't listen to me try by yourself 
playing the game with friends highly recommended !
nothing can be compared to completing  a hard stealth heist with your team on the highest difficulty !

I personaly recommend you to PLAY THIS GAME >< 
ps. YOU WILL NEED A MEDIC BAG

VR Enthusiast here,

At the time of writing (2022), the VR experience in this game is much better than you'd expect, and with access to the entire library of weapons and maps, it can dwarf the enjoyment you'd get out of a lot of coop FPS's you'd find today. Add in the ability to seemlessly play with your NON-VR Friends, makes this game one of, if not the best VR 4-player Coop Action Shooters / Stealth games since the VR DLC's inception. Yes, even better than After The Fall (2022), which lacks content.

The experience is made even better, if you use the VR Improvements mod to allow for smooth locomotion. Follow these steps, and thank me later.

Payday 2 - VR Essentials
1) Download and Install PAYDAY 2
2) Download the "PAYDAY 2 VR" Free DLC https://store.steampowered.com/app/826090/PAYDAY_2_VR/
3) Make sure the PAYDAY 2 VR DLC is activated. Right-click Payday 2 in Steam Library > Properties > DLC > Check PAYDAY 2:VR
4) Download SuperBLT: https://superblt.znix.xyz/ See INSTALLATION. This is the core mod need to make everything else work. 
5) Remember to Launch the game at least once before doing step 3
6) Download the PayDay2 VR Improvements Mod (VRPlus) : https://znix.xyz/paydaymods/download/get.php?id=vrplus&src=mainthread2 This is to allow Free movement (like you'd have in Pavlov, HL: Alyx, VRChat, etc) Natively PD2 only has teleporting.
7) Put the "VRPlus" folder in the PAYDAY2/mods folder. If you don't have a "mods" folder. see Step 2

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using his connections in the drug world. Connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn.
Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Fring flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Fring was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my criminal activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.

Payday 2 is a game that revolves around heists. Heists that are provided by some contractor called Bain. Bain sends you all around the local area committing various acts of robbery on local store owners, banks and breaking some guys out of jail. The payment for doing these things successfully is obviously money, fame and a chance of weapon attachments, masks, mask materials and mask patterns.

You can use the money to buy new weapons or attach weapon attachments to your guns, create new masks with a fresh look. There are loads of guns to choose from and most of them support some form of attachment that adds or changes the looks of the gun. Itâ€™s fun just being able to customize guns like this but they donâ€™t make a major difference in terms of usability in most cases. Itâ€™s pretty good fun but it does require the grind as most attachments are locked behind rng.

The missions has two different types of modes. Thereâ€™s loud which you go in guns blazing trying to complete the objective whilst fighting off hordes of cops. Stealth which is well you sneak around the place trying to not get spotted by the guards, civilians and cameras. Both are fun in their own ways. Every time you successfully complete a mission youâ€™ll get sent to a screen where you are to choose a card

Each card represents loot and choosing one will show you which type of loot you got and then after a couple seconds shows you which pool you got it from. To simplify this you select a card, get shown an image representing money, fame, weapon attachments, masks, mask materials, mask patterns and then after a couple seconds itâ€™ll show you what you got based on that first image.

Now is payday 2 a fun and enjoyable game? I would say it is. It does have its bugs that can ruin some runs. Especially if you're doing stealth online where you could see the body but if you're not the host then it could be in a completely different spot. This is obviously bad as guards, npcs and cameras may be able to spot the body where you think it's safe. This was a run killer for a couple of games and was also really annoying for the more difficult stealth ones. There is also the grind. 

You also have to complete a mission to gain a chance of unlocking weapon attachments, masks and the such. This means either finding a really easy mission to quickly run through multiple times or playing through the mission that provides the currency to straight up buy attachments. You only have to do that mission once to afford any attachment once for a single gun.

If you donâ€™t mind those then I highly suggest it and if you're on the fence then give it a shot when it's on sale since it does go for cheap. There is a lot of dlc but they expand on the gameplay and aren't required to complete the base maps that are in the game. The only bad part is that youâ€™ll see the DLC REQUIRED quite a bit when looking through the weapons, masks and maps. You can test run maps by joining somebody else that has to see if you personally would enjoy it.

After my whole experience with this game, I'd say that I can't really recommend the game in the current state. Especially  if you are trying to find a game with a good public games.

Issues as follows;
- Horrible public game hosts kicking you for no damn reason.
- Unfair DS:OD difficulty. Trying to force your whole player base to play in a certain way with that kind of (spongey enemies that kills you from far-far away is not fun - It is just cheap).
- Crime spree is a damn joke.
- Enemy AI's pathfinding is just horrid. Climbing through objects, dozers floating, etc, etc.
- Desync between players is still not fixed, very nice.
- The vehicle collision is still not fixed until now, cars, forklift, et cetera feels like slipping on a solid ice.
- Edit, despite claims in multiple reddit posts.. apparently civvies getting alerted and sounding the alarm on GO Bank, murkies instantly detecting you on White house was not fixed since 3 years ago either. Impressive.

Yes, you could still have some degree of fun with friends, but you can't just keep releasing more and more paid DLC, Overkill- that's just not how it works in my book.

It does feel like this game is on it's last legs. I'll start with the positives. 

Positives:
Probably a really good game to just jump into and switch your brain off with friends. (I'd probably recommend that honestly)

The humour in the game is subtle at times and charming.

There's tonnes of customisation options from your weapons to your outfits and masks. The DLC practices don't really bother me but I guess you could describe it as pay to win. There isn't really a pvp aspect though and you can get by with the basic stuff and even buy DLC items with the what I assume is premium currency you can earn in career mode. 

Negatives:
The game looks not great, which is fair because it's getting up there in age now but idk if looking like it was made in gmod was good for the time honestly.

The gameplay loop can be really tiring. I haven't been able to really sneak through any levels because everything seems to be randomised every playthrough which includes guard walk patterns and positioning. That just leaves half hour long firefights against a whole nations worth of police and if you're not playing on the higher difficulties this means absolutely nothing to you. Most of the time I just scrolled twitter while waiting for the drill to break.

The servers are dead. I've had a few people join my games playing through the career mode but it's only ever one person who tends to leave halfway through, shooting as many civilians as they can before they go. It's really not that great playing single player as I'll get into.

A couple of missions will see you carrying heavier objects long distances, in one instance using a forklift. These two missions made me want to immediately uninstall the game. The long waits for the objectives to unlock coupled with how many enemies spawn is just frustrating in it's monotony. Adding an encumbered movement objective which you have to pack mule with while going through your own bullet hell just seems like developer sadism to me but who can say.

AI is pretty barebones, and you'll be running with a crew of them unless you have three friends. They will shoot, they will revive but don't expect them to help you with objectives. You're carrying those brickloads and driving the terrible vehicles by yourself my friend. 

Overall I'd give it a 2/5.

TL;DR: Servers are dead, can be a really boring experience solo and not really worth your time. 

EDIT: Just learned that Payday 3 is being partly funded by Koch media, not really keen on playing right wing libertarian oil baron sim so I'm probably going to give that a miss.
