Rating:

9/10

Summary:

Payday 2 is an extremely underrated FPS game that shines in its unique mechanics, varying arsenal, and character customization, while incorporating co-op elements to make teamwork rewarding and the game is based around a theme of crime with an epic story and the game looks beautiful but has sometimes repetitive gameplay and lackluster stealth mechanics.

Gameplay:

The game is structured in different heists and missions that each take money from your offshore bank account to do but provide more spending and offshore money when complete. Heists involve many objectives and maps â€“ usually stealing riches from banks or jewelry stores, but there are some other unique and absolutely insane (in the fun way) heists like stealing nukes, burning money, cooking meth, and attacking the White House. However, the gameplay does get repetitive sometime to just spam â€œFâ€ on items or hold off cops while you wait for drilling or hacking, but some heists stand out, for instance, Cook Off (and its sister heist, Rats), the meth cooking heist, has you put meth ingredients in the correct order not to blow up the lab or Big Oil, a heist where you need to get the correct prototype of an oil alternative machine to the chopper. I personally hate Big Oil because I am no physics nut, but props where its due for gameplay. Still, be prepared for the grind, as Payday 2 is very much intense on grinding for XP (money takes a backseat). For customization of gameplay, Payday 2 is an absolute wet dream. There is so much customization, which I personally love, but if you aim more for simplicity and get overwhelmed but still like the Payday-esque gameplay, Iâ€™d recommend the predecessor, Payday: The Heist. Even without DLC, Payday 2 has a massive arsenal with many weapons to choose from and then you can customize your weapons with many skins, ornaments, attachments, and stat boosters. In addition, you can also customize armor type, armor skins, throwables, melees. Itâ€™s always a joyous occasion to beat DEA officers to death with a giant golden spoon that sets people on fire. Then you can also customize your character guy (which just changes the voice lines), the tons of skills, and perk decks. There are no two Payday 2 characters that are alike, Iâ€™ll put it that way. Thereâ€™s always something for someone to suit their gameplay style, but some balancing issues in perk decks and skill trees exist. When it comes to glitches, they are very minor graphical bugs. Stealth-wise, the game is a rush to play, but the stealth system is clearly outdated and not up to par when compared to games like Hitman.

Graphics:

Payday 2 has exceptional graphics for its time and small production studio and they still hold up by todayâ€™s standards and look good, apart from some lo-res textures for blood splatters or iconography/text when up close.

Comparison to predecessor:

I haven't played Payday: The Heist, only researching features, so forgive me if I get some things wrong. Payday: The Heist has considerably less content and customization than Payday 2, which some may like due to simplicity, but personally, I believe the lack of content and lesser price of Payday 2 makes it more worth it than Payday: The Heist. Payday: The Heist also has only 9 heists, whereas the base game of Payday 2 has around 50 and if you liked the Payday: The Heist missions, they are in Payday 2 as well, remastered, albeit some classic heists are behind DLC. Payday 2 also has a way more fleshed-out stealth system than Payday: The Heist, most Payday: The Heist missions donâ€™t even allow stealth. Payday: The Heist also has extremely minimal story compared to Payday 2.

Story:

Itâ€™s sad most players skimp out on the story, considering it is, in my opinion, an integral part of the game. The story is very good, starting with a gang of masked bank robbers, but ends with them stopping a global conspiracy. To fully, experience the story, complete the heists in chronological order and watch the Payday Web Series to supplement parts of the story, but not all of Paydayâ€™s story is in the web series.

THIS IS THE END OF THE REVIEW, BUT BELOW IS A SYNOPSIS OF THE STORY, SKIP IF YOU CHOOSE NOT TO SEE SPOILERS.

The game begins with the Payday gang, which start in 2011, making money by robbing banks and museums, but as they get in touch with more contractors, they move onto more high stakes jobs. Later, the gang meet a character called The Dentist (played by the legendary Giancarlo Esposito, the actor of Gustavo Fring), a mysterious contractor that usually takes interest in historical artifacts. Working with the Payday gang member Duke, the rest of the gang slowly uncover the Kataru, a conspiracy to control the world with mythical artifacts, which started as a secret society to protect the artifacts but went rogue. The Kataru are working with private security agencies and mercenaries like GenSec or Murkywater to fund their illegal operations and assist the Kataru. The Kataru use multiple contractors to use the Payday gang and Murkywater to do their bidding of bringing them powerful artifacts and allowing Kataru-associates to progress into the political system, while fabricating the illusion they are not working with the Kataru is not working with GenSec or Murkywater by pitting the Payday gang against GenSec and Murkywater. When they finally get what they want, the Kataru then start working with the police to double-cross the Payday gang by offering them new information and capture the leader of the Payday gang, Bain, leading other contractors, mainly Locke, to aid the gang as other contractors like The Dentist, The Elephant, and Hector to be dismissed after being outed as informants or agents of the Kataru. The Payday gang then win the fight against the Kataru in 2018, after killing The Dentist and sieging the White House, giving themselves pardons to all their crimes and retiring from crime.

If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

The game is old but is by no means dead, there is a decent modding community, and while there is a ton of DLC most of it isn't really necessary to enjoy the game or be successful in it.

Even when PD3 eventually comes out, I'll still probably play this game sometimes.

Imagine for a moment you are a person taking out a loan from your bank, when all of a sudden some dip-shit wearing a rage-face mask starts firing wildly with a 40.mm grenade launcher. The only saving grace of this encounter is your miraculous survival. Now a hostage,you watch as an ungodly amount of cops get fucking vaporised by these bank-note bandits wielding all sorts of weapons like the aforementioned grenade launcher, along with a mini-gun, dual-deagles, and a fucking spoon. 
You pray unaware that there is no god left to save you.

After all these years and updates. This game still have crash issues and bugs that makes the game unplayable. What a bloody disapointment this game is.

The game would occasionally shutdown by itself, with no prompt and no error messages. Just closes. (like wtf? especially when during a long campaign. Wasting my time)

And don't get me started on a abysmal bug that makes the game unplayable. I have multiple times where my character would just randomly shoots my full-auto weapon and waste all the ammo. And for single firing weapons, they just for some reason doesnt allow me to shoot at all. The game assumes I was holding my mouse left click down so i can't shoot. 

FYI, my mouse isn't broken. It ONLY happens for PAYDAY2. 

Conclusion: Game Sucks, Still a disapointment, with updates which interest you to buy more DLC rather than fixing the issues. 0/10 would refund again.

This game has no polish at all and rather fixing bugs or improving the overall game they decide its better to just shove more DLC's for you to buy. The story is nonsensical and its not really fun to fallow with, too many references of other licenses and overall its mainly aiming for the gameplay. However the gameplay is also is not its core fun aspect, with a possibility of having stealth and direct approach in missions both aren't fun to deal with. With stealth revolving you playing a simple "don't get spotted" mechanic with not much else with it, which leaves having more players in a stealth mission more redundant. While the action aspects are really basic with gunplay not being viscerally fun or interesting to watch the weapons being used (along guns having no equilibrium, so only the best ones get the most attention), most of the enemies are braindead and spawn human wave offences to flush you out leaving you with no tactics in the game, just like going threw mud when doing objectives. Besides that they also add some bullet sponges to devalue the gunplay even more, leaving you the direct approach with no tactics and no fun actually just shooting the weapons, too. You'l always encounter bugs during the game, the gamebreaking ones a rarer but don't even try to get some atmosphere in the game, it has none or at least its weighted down with bugged out smoke grenades that last whole round or police corpses that clip threw each other and just eventually start to look like its a floor texture. This game doesn't offer anything great in the Story, Gameplay, Atmosphere categories and just feels like shovelware. You can try the base game for few euros when on discount but its stripped of its "content", if you call it that. You better off just buying something else with these few bucks, really.

Finally, we're going after the rat - the fink who screwed Hox, wants to screw us all. Time to put him down. We know he's currently bunkering down in an FBI safe house outside the city. These safe houses are usually built along the same lines. Nice big houses, grounds, 24 hour security, and most likely a panic room somewhere inside. See where your tax dollars go? The plan is simple - get in there, find our informer, and finish him. Now, I'm betting there'll be evidence against us in there too, so it'd be good to clean that up too.

It's payday, you and up to three other people don masks to either run and gun your way to riches, or stealthily sneak around to become the world's greatest cat burglars. Of note, the in-game HUD can be lacking, so once you're used to the game, I recommend installing a modded HUD

Something similar to L4D but with GTAV's heist. Pick a job and run through the objectives while killing endless waves of cops and mercs. AI and revive system feels like L4D. If you ever wanted to be the Bad Guy.

If you ever wanted to mow down police officers with a minigun.

If you ever wanted to perform cracked out heists.

Then, this game is for you.

Admittedly, I'm a Johnny Come Lately to the game, but I am thoroughly a die-hard fanboy.  Learning from past mistakes, the devs have upped their game over the past 8 years-adding more guns, heists, and tweaks to the game than you can shake a stick at.  

There's always players on, so either jumping into a heist or getting players to join is not a problem.  The heists are enjoyable, some more than others (I'm looking at you, SAFE HOUSE NIGHTMARE), and the mass variety of guns and modifications for each will have you tinkering for hours.

I cannot recommend this game enough if you enjoy co-op shooters.  Get the game, heister!


P.S.  HOXTON IS MY SPIRIT ANIMAL!

I have bought most DLC for this game, I have access to every weapon and perk deck (excluding the H3H3 deck) and this game is amazing.

You play as a career criminal in the Payday Gang, and don a mask and rob banks. Well, that's very loose. You moreso take on all types of crime to get your quick PayDay. And yes, the funny breaking bad man is in this game.

First thing to talk about is the cops. It's common knowledge that the AI in Payday 2 isnt the smartest, but that doesnt make it less fun.
Average Police are aggressive, putting pressure on the player, it's fun and extremely erratic. Heavy Police have much more armor, encouraging headshots and to make those helmets fly.
Shields are your first big issue, and remain an issue. Anything explosive will take them down, Sniper Rifles (and some select guns, such as the Five-Seven) pierce shields and also make quick work of them. Otherwise, you're forced to move and flank them.
Tasers first appear on Hard. They do what it sounds like. They tase you, forcing you to stop in your tracks and making you erratically fire your gun. Find them and make them let you shoot them and free yourself, or face a quick down.
Bulldozers, the poster child of PayDay 2. Shoot their visor to make them vulnerable, then shoot them in the head. They do massive burst damage with their shotguns, and can control the heist if you can't take them down.
Cloakers. A PayDay players nightmare. Instant downs, flying kickflips, that damn sound. Aim for the head. I beg you.


There are many heists, all of which feel different.

Rats is a very often played heist for it's XP output. It is a 3 Day Heist, and here's an overview.

Break Bad by cooking meth, combining Muriatic Acid, Caustic Soda, and Hydrogen Chloride to make definitely meth and not at all table salt. Bain will tell you how to cook it.
Trade with the gangsters for valuable intel. After that, you can steal back your meth. Wouldn't be payday without a little bought of armed robbery, would it? 
Finally, take out the Drug Cartel the contractor wants gone, and take their money.

Rats is a good introduction to the idea PayDay isnt a Bank Heist game, it's a Crime Game. No crime too grand or too petty for the gang. Bank Heists are the draw, and the grand heists are what keep you coming back. Breaking your old friend out of jail, raiding the DEPARTMENT OF MOTHER FUCKING JUSTICE, and raiding the FUCKING WHITE HOUSE TO STEAL ANCIENT PRESIDENTIAL PARDONS TO SIT BACK OUT OF A LIFE OF CRIME MY GOD

Yeah it's great. Not even talking about literally dodging bullets left and right, the 23 round M1, a Semi-Auto RPG, and yelling so loudly at your friends they get up and stop bleeding out. Dont ever let those helmets stop flying when they start flying.

And never let yourself look normal, always look either really cool or really stupid.

This game has aged like milk. I don't understand the popularity. It has some cheese value, sure. But:
- This game has some of the worst voice acting I've ever heard. Sean Connery's awful Russian Accent puts "Vlad" to shame.
- The gunplay is atrocious. The hitboxes are clearly not built for gunplay and most player/npc models are more of 'polite suggestions' of where a person might be rather than an accurate representation of 'where to shoot to deal damage', direct gunplay isn't satisfying at all and the npc patrols make silenced killing equally unsatisfying. Assuming your headshot doesn't miss because of a wonky hitbox.
- The missions are neither realistic enough to be immersive, nor silly enough to be funny. Many of them are just copy pasted. The game doesn't really allow for much exploration in maps especially on higher difficulties. 
- There are entire weapon attachment categories locked behind DLC. DLC attachments are better than base, which I suppose isn't too bad for PvE.

Its 10 bucks though. Get what you pay for.

Old Fashioned Pumpkin Pie

2 large eggs
1 large egg yolk
1/2 cup packed dark brown sugar
1/3 cup white sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 teaspoons cinnamon
1 teaspoon ground ginger
1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
1/4 teaspoon ground cloves
1/8 teaspoon cardamom
1/2 teaspoon finely grated lemon zest
2 cups pumpkin purÃ©e from a sugar pumpkin (see Recipe Note) OR 1 (15-ounce can) pumpkin purÃ©e (can also use purÃ©ed cooked butternut squash)
1 1/2 cups heavy cream or 1 (12-ounce) can evaporated milk
1 homemade pie crust, chilled or frozen (see pÃ¢te brisÃ©e recipe or our no-fail flaky pie crust recipe), or 2 pre-made pie shells

Preheat the oven:
Preheat your oven to 425Â°F.
Make the filling:
Beat the eggs in a large bowl. Mix in the brown sugar, white sugar, salt, spices â€” cinnamon, ground ginger, nutmeg, ground cloves, cardamom, and lemon zest.
Mix in the pumpkin purÃ©e. Stir in the cream. Beat together until everything is well mixed.
mixing pumpkin pie ingredients
pumpkin pie ingredients mixed well
adding cream to pumpkin pie puree
pumpkin pie filling ready to add to pie
Fill the pie shell and bake:
Pour the filling into an uncooked chilled or frozen pie shell. Bake at a high temperature of 425Â°F for 15 minutes.
Then after 15 minutes, lower the temperature to 350Â°F. Bake for 45 to 55 minutes more. The pie is done when a knife tip inserted in the center comes out wet but relatively clean. The center should be just barely jiggly.
(About half-way through the baking, you may want to put foil around the edges or use a pie protector to keep the crust from getting too browned.)
Note that the pumpkin pie will come out of the oven all puffed up (from the leavening of the eggs), and will deflate as it cools.
pumpkin pie in dish ready for baking
Baked Pumpkin Pie From Scratch
Cool the pie on a rack, then serve:
Cool the pumpkin pie on a wire rack for 2 hours.
Serve with whipped cream.

Payday 2 is an anomaly, and I mean that in the best way possible. The development crew and community is still active since launch and is still pretty noob friendly. By buying this game (and probably a boatload of the DLC) you are entering one of the most unique communities in gaming. I'm writing this after hitting infamy 1 and I still have a ways to go before I am both satisfied with the game and as good as I can get at it. I snagged this game on sale and it is more than worth full price.

P.S. For people reading this for the decision to buy or not, here are two things that you MUST know going to checkout.

1. This game has quite a few bugs that make themselves quite noticeable as you continue playing, these don't break the game and in fact, are a major part of the experience. These bugs are the good ones, like goat simulator.

2. BUY THE LEGACY BUNDLE, this game has A TON of DLC and a lot of the content is actually locked behind these walls, wait for a sale, buy the bundle for $10, and have fun.

So I am 100 hours into this game and... WHOA! If you know GTA V ONLINE heists, well this game is all about that. Its just epic, 4 player coop heist action with RPG elements. What i mean by RPG elements is not that the game is open world. there are multiple missions to chose from, each of them putting you in the body of an armed robber. the game trows you in a map, where you have the choice to either use the games AWESOME stealth sistem and rob them whihout them knowing OR go in guns-blazing and face off against hordes of SWAT officers. What i mean by RPG elements is that, with a heist done, you get money and XP. With money you buy guns and attachments XP is used to level up, so you unlock new abilities in the skill tree. The graphics are not Red  Dead Redemption or Cyberpunk 2077, but they are decent, especially if you consider the age of this game. This game also has a ton of DLC content, so i recomand buying the legacy pacage, that contains "almost" all of them. This game is a absolute BLAST, buy at the next sale if you like FPS games!

step 2: Somehow get spotted by a security officer on the other side of the building.

step 3: Steal as much stuff as you can.

step 4: Massacre every police officer and swat team member in your way.

step 5: Profit.

I wish it was more like Payday: The Heist. Less corporate soulless characters and more realistic, simplistic robbing simulator. Lots of lost potential. The main reason you would play this over payday 1 is the amount of content and mods it has.

Payday 2 is a very fun experience. I would genuinely recommend this game to anyone (and I mean anyone). But four things that if you're sensitive to or not a fan of, they are: Blood, there is some blood in this game, if you're looking in the right place, but it says gore in the ratings, but there really is no major gore. Swearing, there is a lot of swearing in this game, if you don't like swearing too much, then maybe don't wear headphones. Drugs, there is a contract to steal a bag of cocaine from a club, and there is a few other contracts including taking and cooking meth like you're in Breaking Bad. If you don't like drugs, maybe don't play the meth contracts. And finally, "Citizen POV.". If you don't like thinking of being in the situation of being in a robbery, maybe just don't play this game. Anyway, there's that. Payday 2 is a very fun game, like, really fun, except the lag that happens sometimes if you don't lower your effects quality. Despite all the negatives PD2 has, it's certainly an enjoyable game with or without online play. Hate the game or love the game, at least you can say it was a fun experience.

The game definitely has a lot to entail. You may play it for the first time and not know what to do, but Overkill tries to help you with that. Which is thoughtful. There is also a lot of achievements.

There are countless different weapon customization options, and Overkill has done what they can to provide non-DLC weapons for players.

Many heists and weapon customizations, however, do require DLC to play or use. If you do not care about the game too much, I would not stress about buying the DLC, though it's become a huge help over the years for me. You can play heists locked by DLC online with other players if you do not have it.

Payday 2 is a great game even if they lied to the comunity about no dlc it still is amazing

I Gameplay.

In payday, you can really see what great gameplay is, amazing gunplay and good stealth mechanics. 

Stealth
In payday stealth is usually the go to method for making cash and exp. Stealth has some basic mechanics: detection(what it sounds like, a big bar in the center of the screen, if it fills up, the guard saw you and will move in for arrest/shoot), the ecm (it is a must for stealth, blocking cameras and pagers for a set amount of time, they can be used to open doors with the right skill), pagers ( PAGERS SUCK but they are needed to "balance" stealth, you have a maximum of 4 pagers you must interact with the pager in a set amount of time or the alarm will go off, once you start the interaction you can't get off it because it will sound the alarm) and the most confusing mechanic noise ( "noise" gets triggered once you use the saw, drill, break galss, and shoot an unserpressed gun. The drill noise won't really afect you, glass should generally not be broken because it's shatter noise is loud and can allert nearby guards and the stock saw has a huge noise range)

LOUD
Que up razormind get your minigun and let's go. Loud is the "fun" version of payday2 with swarms of enemys trying to shut off your drill and kill you. Loud works like a horde shooter, with diffrent sections of the attack sgnaled by the music. Also loud has the signature payday music and you don't really need to use meta guns and perks.

II The story.

Payday 2 really took the story off the rails. If in the first game you wanted to get rich now you have way bigger plans. Now there are two endings the one you will get and the one you dream about. The cool ending can only be triggered by your team being infamy 100 (rebirth 100) and completing a complex easter egg that requires the complition of several achievements and playing the piano with a gun. 

III The comunity

Payday is just amazing and the comunity is even better, with Overkill adding a comically large spoon and the golden variant of it wich sets enemys on fire and does an insane amount of damage. Overkill proved themselves to be amazing with handeling the comunity with their twitter posting memes. The devs supported this game for good years adding a lot of content, and if you don't own a heist dlc you can still play it in the campaign mode and by finding the desired heist on crime net.

Conclusion: Payday2 offers amazing price to quality ratio and you should play it if you like to steal shit and decypher the language of gods. You should give this game a try to be honest.
This game is a blast whether you're playing alone or with friends.

The gameplay is arcardy.
The balance is wacky.
The difficulty scale is double-wacky.
The quotes and atmosphere is fantastic.
The (loose) story starts with casual (casual?) bank robbing and ,naturally, cop killing. It then does a 180Â° and becomes a semi-serious one with behind-the-scenes magic and alien lore. Weird.

Aside the base game, there are dlcs, and, more importantly, other players.

Some good, some silent, some bad.
From experience, the best way to get a quick (and relatively peaceful murder-hobo) lobby is to have a votekick-only-lobby. If you have a host-kick-lobby, its a dictatorship, so pray your host is cool and not evil.

Dlcs are wacky. I mean, WACKY. 
Weapons (And other equipment and perks) are generally not in line with the balance of other weapons. 
Some maps are made very well, others are absolute bonkers or under-average.
Base game provides you with a decent enough selection of all, in which 'balance' already is somewhat negligated.

Have fun in casual murder!

Payday 2 is a great crime game, no questions asked. The game is soft on progression, and is made very well. You can play very casually (every once and a while) or frequently, and the fun doesn't change. You can play solo, with friends, or with randoms; the fun doesn't stop. Although being rage-inducing (like every good game is), Payday 2 has a great story, great mechanics, and is regulated by developers frequently. The game has a ton of customise capability, and that's not including the modding of the game. In short, it's a ton of fun. Ramblers, get rambling! (Game reference.)

I received this game as a gift for 10$, and for what I [didn't] pay for it, the game is well worth 10$. Oftentimes the game is only on sale for 1$, and for that you get even better value. The game can be quite laggy at times, seemingly for no reason, but it doesn't have very many bugs, so it evens out I suppose. The graphics are good, but not amazing, especially if you have issues with performance. The game-play is phenomenal, particularly if you are playing with friends. This game can be run single-player, but I would not recommend it because the missions get quite difficult at times. Overall, this game is a worthy investment, and if you and a couple of friends have the money, I would say 'why not'?

It's been so long since I remember playing Payday 2, back when Hoxton Breakout was the new update and an entire skill tree was the craziest thing when I was younger. Now, in 2022, it's still so fun and nostalgic, and the fact you can still join in on heists and play with friends brings me joy. I never got to reach the highest Infamy, but even then, there's still so much to explore in achievements, weapons and skill builds.

Payday 2 is an exciting game with one big problem: there is nothing to do here without three friends. The point is not only the need to coordinate their actions, but also the technical implementation - the game does not have dedicated servers, the match takes place on the computer of one of the players. And if the host decides to leave the game or kick one of the other participants in the robbery, you will lose all the money and experience acquired in the current session. Is it worth explaining how critical this is for a project designed for a network game?

The ability to play alone with fellow bots does not save the situation, since computer-controlled comrades are extremely stupid and can only run and shoot. Opponents, however, are also stupid, but they crush with mass. You canâ€™t count on a perfect robbery in solo mode: you can only go through the simplest missions alone on a normal difficulty level. More advanced tasks require clear coordination of all team members, and only with the proper level of interaction can robbers be able to give pleasure from the game.

Payday 2, a game where we rob da bank (spoiler: there's still more), fight the police, and get out with the loot. Overall, the gameplay is just as basic as I mention before, so no more explanation. There's a lot of dlc weapons ngl, but the base game weapon is enough to cover it. There's 7 difficulty in this game (cmiiw), normal, hard, very hard, overkill, mayhem, death wish, and death sentence. I'm peaked at mayhem, probably going to death wish if already on late-game. There's a skill tree, which, as you would already know, will upgrade your characters. There's 3 skill tree every category. And, it's pretty grindy, so prepare for it. The Deck perk is less grindy, but for a little. Just watch youtube about deck perk, I can't explain it. The Crime Spree mode is if not, the best thing in Payday 2. You'll do heist in a row (you can suspend it) so that your rewards will stacked. And is it just me or the rewards is much more than doing single heist? Anyways, bring friends if you have one, it would be fun (probably, I play solo or public). If you're like me, then prepare to upgrade your AI teammates. Yes, upgrading your AI teammates to ease up the gameplay. It isn't that grindy, so you're gonna be fine in here. Sitting at around 6 bucks for base game, it's pretty much enjoyable. But come on, couldn't you just spend a little bit more money to buy some dlc? it ain't that expensive. If you're lucky, you can get it for around 1 buck when it's on sale. Yes, 1 buck. not to mention some dlc get discounts too.

When I first sat down to play muck I was expecting a bad free to play meme game. And what I got, was a New, Unique, and frankly Breathtaking take on the survival genre. This game is incredibly nuanced, with an extraordinarily deep, Intelligent, yet still challenging story, that will play with your emotions at every turn.

What this game feels like, is as if you gave an expert team of developers an infinite budget, and no time constraints, and told them to make what they want. Further, the graphics that this game provides are some of the best looking, realistic graphics that I've ever seen come from a video game, and it manages to keep My PC cold while doing so.

This game has one of the most intense, and rich story's out there, good enough to rival the likes of RdR2, the entire persona series, the kingdom hearts games, and much more. And with doing all of this, the game is still able to make downright genius social commentary on many real world issues. but not so much that it hampers the story in any way.

To play this game for free, truly is a blessing, Anyone who is out for money knows they could make millions off of this tremendous piece of art. and while, maybe we cant pay for this modern Picasso we can support the creator in other ways

Payday 2 is a great game. It got some bug but a lot of them are graphic bugs caused by the old engine soo, as you may understand, graphic isnâ€™t a masterpiece. There are tons of achievement, challenge and jobs to do that can keep you interested in hundreds of hours if not thousands. There are more than 60 missions (big, small, indoors, outdoors, some with 2 to 3 heist) and a lot of guns, build system and in some missions you can drive some vehicles. The soundtrack is very good. In the missions you can choose preplanning which are the entrance, escape, things that may help during the heist and many more. Also there are missions for all kind of players. In most of the contracts you can choose between stealth or loud.  A lot of them are setted really good and in a lot of them there are a lot of details in and out of the map that you can see. You can play this game in solo too and I recommend you to do it at least with stealth contracts because it's hard to find people that give you an help and don't ruin all the run in stealth. The storyline is made really well for my opinion. There is a secret ending too. The community compared to other games community from my experience it's not toxic at all. It's also very easy to find friendly and funny people. Just do a random contract, talk a bit and youâ€™ll find a lot of friends around. There are a lot of DLC but I recommend to you to buy the Legacy Collection that has a lot of good DLC. So, the game it's self cost around 0.99â‚¬ when on sale but with the legacy pack, which cost around 12â‚¬ when on sale, totally worth it. So, in other words, itâ€™s a great game, very fun, and itâ€™s worth it.

it may be a bit dated but it never gets old. the community is awesome, the devs are active and keeping this game awesome, and there is nothing like it out in the market. the only thing that could kill this game is a sequel that would be even better.
it is a very good game and mods are fun to play with

A tad too Fragmented when it comes to content, otherwise quite a fun game, it will run on lower spec hardware quite well, and heists are quite enjoyable (when they go right).
Definitely do recommend you play with friends, makes things easier, sillier, and much more fun.
The progression system is quite the grind, but is well worth it (though you can get to high levels quite fast if you do the right heists and get good teams)

This game is very fun, there is a reason this game is reviewed as "Overwhelmingly positive". If you see the gameplay and screenshots and decide its not something for you, then theres really not a lot the reviews can do that'll change your mind. 

But if you like the idea of a game where the entire goal is to do heists and be the most overpowered robbers that ever could exist, then this is for you. Payday 1 was incredibly fun, but lacked a few things. Payday 2 improved all those things and more. If this seems slightly interesting to you, buy it and play it. It's cheap, and it's fun. There is a lot of fun to be had playing this single player style, but if you want to experience everything this game has to offer, go in with friends. This game can be challenging as hell, but there are also easy things if you don't want a challenge. Endless hours of fun to be had, you have a lot of freedom as to how you want to do heists. I won't say much about this game, you should experience it yourself. It's only 9,99, and you can more than likely get it cheaper on key sites, so there's no excuse when the overall reviews of this game is so positive, and just the sheer amount of positive reviews. You probably have already heard of this game, so if you need any confirm that this is worth your money, go watch a few youtube videos. 

Also you can play as John Wick and wack people with boxing gloves if you want to go that route.

Reviews for the Deaf and Hard of Hearing

Overall Game
----------------------------------------
KnightShift is a unique blend of RPG and top-down adventure. It can be played as a strategy game, an RPG, or a hybrid mix.

Seemingly very low-budget, KS still brings an interesting, if not intricate, gameplay to the gamer. For those who can tolerate the lower-end graphics and quirkiness of the game (I find it cute how the prince takes a nap, for example, as odd as it is), KnightShift will bring a good round of exploratory gameplay in an indie package that I'd recommend for a fun few hours of Princedom.

Overall Rating: 8/10

Gameplay
----------------------------------------
Warning: There are a LOT of keys/key combinations to remember for this game.

If you're undaunted, the next hurdle to overcome is a slightly awkward mouse control that seems to be reminiscent of Windows 98 mouse acceleration insanity. Once familiarized with it, the mouse awkwardness stops detracting from the interface.

I'm not sure if there were audio cues for some things, but I learned haphazardly that the giant withcraft looking areas are healing spas. This was useful fighting my first few bears. The lesson here is just to explore the areas, as context tooltips don't really exist to assist in understanding what is around you in the game.

Although rough around the edges, the quirky gameplay and level-matched quests can catch you and lure you in for more from this game. The random encounter fights contribute a little to exp farming and provide a balanced challenge as you build up your equipment set and character.

Overall Accessibility
----------------------------------------
KnightShift has dialogue that is not subtitled, making the plot a little inconvenient to follow. I don't blame the developers, who, as a small indie group, made the game because they wanted to, and did so as best they could.

Because I was unable to properly test multiplayer, the overall rating is based on only the subtitles category.

Rating: 7/10

Subtitles/Text
----------------------------------------
KnightShift is an indie game on a unique platform. That said, it's not subtitled or captioned. Deaf/HoH players can still read the text of what was said after by hitting F2 a few times, which cycles through the 'mission log' and flavor text/mission text.

At first I found it annoying, but I find the workaround tolerable and am happy they included it.

Rating: 7/10

Chatting/Communicating
----------------------------------------
While KS has multiplayer capability, I did not test. Based on the keyboard options, I saw no key for chat.

Rating: N/A

The game is really cool, but sadly, it's a dead game. It's hard to find people who still plays it and really does enjoy this game. Payday 2 made my childhood.

> Graphics:
-Good, they aren't the best but atleast you know what's going on. Low end PCs can play it on low graphics.

> Enjoyment:
-A lot of enjoyment. You can download some mods and play the game with friends to have even more enjoyment while playing.

> Where can you play it:
-PC, VR and controller.

> Controls:
-Kind of hard, but you can learn them in less than 2 hours.

> Story:
-It has a lot of easter eggs from the series.

> Learn how to play:
-Really hard. There's a tutorial, but it's not enough to learn.

> Difficult:
-It's a really hard game. But it all depends on your skill, mission and difficulty you are playing.

> About the price:
-I think it's too expensive, because if you want to enjoy everything in-game you have to buy some DLCs.

> Do i recommend buying it:
-Of course, but only buy it on sale.

I have been playing Payday 2 since it was new, and it remains one of the games I find myself coming back to every year. Easily accessed casual mission lobbies, difficulty choices up the wazoo, gameplay that ranges from ultra fast stealth heists to hours-long siege holdouts, simple and yet satisfying strategy options... it's just good fun!

PAYDAY 2 is a perfect example of how style can really push a game forward despite engine limitations. PAYDAY 2 is not a perfect game-- it is janky, buggy, and does not run well on certain maps and on certain computers. But it is one of the most fun games I have ever played by far, and I always find myself coming back to it for some reason or another. If you want an arcade-y addicting shooter that isn't as extreme as most others nowadays, PAYDAY 2 is perfect for you.

There are a great many things to dislike about Payday 2. The game does look dated, and it's only really made worse by some of the weird post-processing effects and grody sharpening filter. The engine is old and is particularly unsuitable as it was initially made for a racing game, despite the fact that when certain heists ask you to drive, it is horrible. Stealth is mediocre at best and infuriating at worst without mods. And although this is a co-op game, the anti-cheat implementation is laughably lackluster.

Despite all of the above, however, there are few games that bring you the joy of wading through a knee-deep sea of dead cops while you airlift gold bullion out of a bank vault you melted open with your friends.

This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

I rarely have positive things to say about an FPS.  This is an FPS that is also co-op vs AI; so, I thought I wouldn't have a positive opinion.

When I began playing, I didn't like the game.  HOWEVER-- it was because I chose the wrong game mode!

Definitely hang in there and play "career" mode.  It's very very very entertaining.  You can get burned out on it, but it's a fantastic game.

Also, read about what to do in the game because it can be a bit complicated.

One of the first games I bought on PC over 7 years ago. I may not be super old, but this game (along with Warcraft 3 and Minecraft) helped deepen my passion for video games over the course of my life. It's super fun, the gunplay feels pretty solid, the perks are fun to mess around with, and overall it's just a solid game. The stealth is always enjoyable when you finally pull of the heist you've been meticulously planning and attempting for hours... I will always cherish my memories of grinding Hoxton Breakout with my friends until my mom finally told me to go to bed. When the game goes on sale it's literally $1. Just buy it. You have a dollar.

I'm not usually one to play FPSs but I made an exception for Payday 2 and I'm glad I did. I love that it isn't an open world game which I find detracts from these sorts of games. There is enough variation that jobs feel fresh but not so much you feel like you are improving and can find strategies that consistently work making it super satisfying. It is also is fun to play in stealth or go loud with both sets of mechanics feeling fleshed out. Most of the missions work well as a solo player as well. My main issue is that can be so much extra content likes skins and the such that it be overwhelming and detract from the overall experience.

One of the worst games i've ever played.

Wanted a co-op game for me and a mate. Bought it on sale for $1.50 and to my disappointment, it turns out i got exactly what i paid for. 

3 matches + a tutorial in and we both quit, unable to stomach playing another match. Matchmaking UI is terrible, sound design is awful with things constantly re-playing over the top of each other (menu music + Christmas event music + mission logs = pain. We had to mute the in-game music) and the game itself was boring as hell. Shoot waves of crappy AI, go here, hold down button, go there hold down button. On any difficulty below 3 stars, you're basically invincible.


The customisation and content side seems to be extensive, but the game (especially the non-stealth missions) is crap. One match we had a barely functioning crackhead mall Santa having hallucinations whilst we tried to get drugs off him and fought off hordes of mindless zombie-like cops. Sounds like fun? It wasn't. 


Feels like a game that you'd play in an arcade with a friend and one of those plastic coloured pistols. I can only assume the price tag and low standards are what keeps this game's reviews high, because unlike just about every game i've ever played, I didn't find any positives here. But hey, that's about what you can expect if you pay $1.50 for a game.

Great game, the first mission I completed took me and my friends hours to complete. We planned "the optimum" route, and we kept getting spotted and owned by the NPCs. The successful run must have taken us 30 minutes. I played it again much later solo and managed to do it without killing anyone in ~10 minutes. The game is pretty hard, but with quite a bit of thinking and careful maneuvering the missions are doable.

I'd recommend playing with one or more additional players as then you can make up for each other's failures - being spotted.

I have played the game for a while both on PS4 and now on my Laptop and I think i'ts time to leave a review of this masterpiece:

[b] Gameplay - [/b] As you may already know Payday 2 is a Co-op Game and it consist of (up to) 4 players playing together as heisters pulling off a big variety of diferent heists, they can do these heists either loudly (which causes the police force to storm in via assaults and forces the players to engage in combat) or quietly (which is very challenging and heavly requieres team work and organization but when pulled off successfully will give the players a boost for their next heist). When completing a heist the player will recive money which they can be used to buy new weapons, masks and moods for their weapons, and EXP to level up. Fighting agaisn't the cops can be oddly a lot of fun and complete a heist without raising the alarm can feel really sastifying.

[b] Costumization - [/b] In the inventory the player can costumize what character they'll play as and mask they'll wear (both don't affect gameplay), they can change what weapons they bring (primary and secondary fire arms, melee and throwables), they can decide either to bring armor or not, they can chose what equipment they'll bring (Medic Bags, Ammo Bags, etc...) and the last two but not least they can equip an Perk Deck which can upgrade or give the player abilities (Examples: More health, abilty to heal from picking up ammo, heal via licor, and much more!) and can upgraded via Perk Points which is given to the player as they gain EXP, and they can upgrade their Skills from 15 diferent Skill Trees with Skill Points which the player is rewarded with when leveling up. This amount of costumization and variety opens many doors for diferent play styles and is what allows every heist you do feel unique.

[b] Difficulty - [/b] The developers did an amazing job in making sure the game would never get too easy, every heist can be played in 7 diferent RIsks Levels: Normal, Hard, Very Hard, Overkill, Mayhem, Death Wish and Death Sentence. Stating the diference of each would take forever so lest just say that the higher the dificulty the more enemies there are, the more variety of enemies there is, the more damage they'll do and the bigger their accuracy. Completing an heist in higher Risk Levels is way more rewarding then lower Risk Levels, this diference of rewards and dificulty motivates players into trying out bigger Risks Levels as they get better at the game.

[b] Soundtrack - [/b] A Banger. I can't say much more, your bound to find an song that you love in this game, they all just kick in at the right time.

[b] Starting Out - [/b] The only down side I can think of is how it might be hard to understand how things work when you start out, I personaly recomend watching some videos on youtube explaining the basics (I recomend TheRussianBadger's first video on Payday 2) and do the two tutorial heists and then three or four heist offline to understand the basics, once you think you got the hang of the basics you should start playing online to learn from other players. If you have an friend that has experience on Payday 2 you probably should learn from then, if not then you can learn from random players you'll encounter while playing, you might find some that see you as an liability even though your trying your best but you can also find nicer players that are pacient to teach you how more complex stuff in the game works. Either way you'll eventualy understand how the game works and from there on out your able to enjoy the game even more.

[b] Price - [/b] I got the game while on sale but I really think the 10 bucks are worth for this game. There is a lot of payed DLCs which is necessary to unlock a bunch of weapons, masks, Perk Decks and more but even though they can be a bit expensive I think their worth it since you unlock extra content and support the developers in the process.

[b] Conclusion - [/b] Payday 2 is one of my favorite games ever and barely gets old, I think it's worth buying expecely if you enjoy Co-op games like me. Not saying I have low expectations for Payday 3 but I really wanna see Overkill Software try to surpass the game with the next instalment in the series.

Dumpster fire of a game engine is my main complaint, as it poisons EVERY interaction you will have.
-Awful map geometry, from inaccurate collision data to just jank map scale.
-Enemies will often teleport into existence.  Flash bangs just straight up dont have a throwing animation and will spawn on the floor.  You are getting shot at from all directions, all the time.
-Player desync, what even is this games netcode.  Kills rewinding, animations breaking, etc.
-Extra point for desyncs when players share a vehicle.  Literally seizure inducing as it updates player positions.
-"""Stealth""" yeah whatever you say buddy.

Unrelated to engine:
-Are achievements and infamy the only form of progression?  This game feels so fucking pointless.
-The """Stealth""" gameplay devolves into "restart after one mistake", as there is no consequence for restarting and nothing to gain from going from stealth to loud.
-Friends required, you're a masochist if you enjoy the public lobbies here.

while the game is fun for the first 20 hours or so, you start to notice how much stuff is locked behind DLC. the base game is 10 dollars but to really get a full game you need to dish out 80 dollars or so on DLC. 
the gameplay also gets boring after awhile, because most of the time you're waiting for a timer to run down. weapon customization is great, but most of the modifications are behind DLC walls. at first glance, weapon variety is fantastic but when you look at the stats you notice most of the guns are near identical. 

tl;dr buy payday the heist the soundtrack is better and while there isn't as much content as payday 2 its way more replayable and challenging.

Straight up one of the best games ever, there's a lot of weapon variety as well as perk decks and skill trees which allow you to build anyway you want from maximizing stealth and launching security into empty rooms with a shotgun or going completely loud with heavy body armor and an LMG. Plus the difficulties that can go from casual shootouts with tons of swat and police to insanely chaotic wars with entire armies. i totally recommend this at $10 and even more so at $0.99 as well as most of the dlcs if you want more guns and missions.

-Very few stealth levels.

-AI does stupid things like walk into walls and get stuck and just stand in place because they can't remember how to walk.

-Player base is pretty toxic.

-You get punished for playing your favorite maps too often.

-In game voice actors are ungodly annoying, but some missions unless you know exactly what to do you can't finish without enabling the voices.

-Upon anyone joining your match the AI with quick hands(or w/e it's called speeds up interactions) is ALWAYS taken out first.

I bought this game as a spur of the moment purchase just because I knew Jacket was in the game, and I was coming off of a Hotline Miami hyperfixation, but after playing it a bunch with my friends, I've found this game is really cool, and wish I had picked it up way earlier. There's an unfathomable amount of variety in missions and strategies, and the game gives you a ton of flexibility in ways you can approach anything. Theres a massice amount of customisation options, and completing anything feels really satisfying, rewarding you with a ton of weapons and gear, new cosmetics, and a ton of achievements to visualise the progress you're making as you chip away at what the game has to offer.  Even alone, I think theres plenty of fun to be had, but to get the most out of this game you absolutely have to play it with a group of friends. Overall, everything this game has to offer rocks, with the exception of the driving. Cars suck really bad lol. 8/10

I know I'm late to this particular party, but what happened here? The game seems to suffer from extremely poor balancing; at least in the career mode the first ten missions or so are just you standing around for five to ten minutes while an automatic drill opens a safe, all the while hundreds of policemen will throw themselves at you only to be mowed down while unable to deal damage to you.

Maybe this changes in later missions or different game modes, but so far I'm wondering about what the hell this is supposed to be. Cops-commit-suicide-by-gangster simulator?

There's also no real tutorialization for many things, but that wouldn't fix the strange gameplay unless it would tell me how to get to the parts where the game is remotely balanced.

The gun customization is top notch however.

I did not recommend the first Payday due to the small number of single tasks and dead online.
The second Payday lives and smells, online is full of players and finding a lobby is not a problem at all.
For the single player campaign, more tasks have been prepared here, plus no one has canceled the training missions.
Surprisingly, unlike the same Insurgensi, Payday is easy to play and understand all at once. Even for those who do not really understand, mission markers are made here. The tasks here are not boring and interesting, sometimes you even need to break your head (as is the case with the prisoner's cell number).
In general, I recommend this part. It's almost perfect for cooperative playthroughs or playing with friends.
(Moreover, I got it for free).

I have owned this game for over a year for my Xbox now. after the lack of updates i decided to go here and it is already better, I love it. Way more replay ability from the new contracts, weapons etc. but also weapon skins and new suits, it honestly feels like a brand new game compared to the console.

So, the game wants me to believe, that the police strategy in a hostage situation is swarm the god damn building with at least 10 SWAT teams, let the hostages die, and in the meantime let hundreds of police officers die, cause why tf not.

2 guys vs 100 police officers. Who would win?

Other than that:
* Hostages clipping through the ceiling (one hostage was literally flying up and down through the ceiling in my first ever attempt in the game)
* Police dropping down on the rope through the damn ceiling
* Police spawning behind your back or even literally inside of you
* How in the world can the police mobilize tens of officers within 5 MINUTES?! Tell me where I can find police like that PLEASE. Where I live, pizza is delivered faster than the police arrives - and we're talking 2 officers at most.
* And in all of that me just standing in the middle of a crossfire, staying alive.

PAYDAY 2 is an action-packed and four player game. It is a co-op shooter where the players put on their masks of the original PAYDAY crew - Dallas, Hoxton, Wolf and Chains as they descend on Washington DC for epic crime sprees. 

The game consists of a variety of "robberies" that a player can choose to carry out either alone, with AI, or as part of a multiplayer game. There are robberies such as bank robberies, drug trafficking, election fraud or theft of secret nuclear warheads. Some of the robberies place a lot of emphasis on stealth, often leading to bonus experience points and cash upon completion, and some robberies can only be done in secret. Shipments appear periodically as contracts on a map of Washington, DC The player can get an open contract, participate in a contract that has another player start or buy an in-game cash contract in an offshore bank account. There are seven levels of difficulty: Normal, Hard, Very Hard, Overkill, Mayhem, Death Wish and Death Sentence (formerly One Down), with increased money and experience paying for higher levels of difficulty. Currently, there is an option to activate the "One Down" function in any difficulty, which means that players can only go down once before being detained (goes up to two downs with the "Nine Lives" ability aced)Some Payday 2 contracts take place over several days, with each day represented by a separate level with different objectives. After a few days of robbery, do not kill more than four pager guards (the number of paratroopers can be reduced through modifications to the "crime spree" game mode). SWAT and by private security contractors GenSec.

Payday 2 is a collaborative first-person shooter video game developed by Overkill Software and released by 505 Games. The game is the sequel to Payday 2011: The Heist. Released in August 2013 for Windows, PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360. An improved version of the game, subtitled Crimewave Edition, was released for PlayStation 4 and Xbox One in June 2015. A release for the Nintendo Switch was released in February 2018.Two years after the events of the previous game, the Payday gang comes to the metropolitan area of â€‹â€‹Washington to carry out another robbery spree. The player takes control of one of the twenty-two gang members and can commit robberies alone or with up to three teammates. The player can take part in various robberies, including, for example, bank robberies, shops and armored cars, as well as drug production and distribution. The game differs from the previous one by allowing much greater customization of the player (aesthetics and gameplay), somewhat improved graphical interface and experience, greater variety and reproducibility at the levels and has redesigned stealth mechanics.An accompanying online series has been created to promote the game. The game was profitable only from pre-orders and received positive reviews. Payday 2: Crimewave Edition, which offers improved graphics, new content and some DLC, was released for PlayStation 4 and Xbox One in June 2015.A sequel, entitled Payday 3, is currently in progress and is scheduled for release in 2023 and will be published by Koch Media. It was also announced that Payday 3 will be made on Unreal Engine.

The difficulty curve makes this game challenging all the time and while the heists could be in danger of feeling same-y after a while the seemingly random variations keep things interesting so you are never fully on auto-pilot. You still have to think your way through a lot of problems and even seasoned veterans can choose wrong forcing them to adapt or die.  I would say the skill tree for being sneaky is way too short. You run out of good ways to upgrade stealthy methods without getting particularly good but you can improve your loud profiles into juggernauts that still lack balance because you've run out of skill points. Which is too bad because loud combat-driven methods are usually the least interesting in this game.

The best heist game I've every played. There is a ton of heists to choose from with multiple difficulties and approaches for each of them. If you get bored of the heists included in the game you can always buy more DLC ones for very cheap or download community created ones off of https://modworkshop.net/game/payday-2. I would highly recommend this game to anyone who likes an arcade shooter and heist games, I have been playing this game for 152 hours at the time of review not counting the weeks of playtime I had on console. My only complaint is that the game isn't the most friendly to beginners and could seem complicated or cheesy and scare them off.

Now that I have a VR headset, I figured now was a good time to review the game so my beautiful 666 hours would be forever immortalized. Honestly, I love this game but it is so hard to recommend. If you love repetitive games, then you would probably like PAYDAY 2. I play in month long spurts, where it is essentially the only game I play, then I don't touch it for a while because I don't want to do the same thing over and over again. STARBREEZE and OVERKILL used to really care about this game, but once the company went under and we all bid PAYDAY 3 to its early grave, they came back with all the cash grabs they could for PAYDAY 2. Honestly, this game had always been a DLC cashgrabbing hell hole, but I own it all. I just don't feel like I get enough in the new packs to want to buy it though y'know? Its an old game and you know what you're getting into if you buy it so honestly I don't even know why you are reading this. I recommend a metric ton of mods though.

This is a really great game! It is worth its price and is suitable for many different types of players. It allows for sneaky peaky on-the-spot improvisation to get past guards and cameras or mowing down hordes of enemies with you newly bought machine guns. I also love the gun and character customisation, there is a great amount of unlockable perks for you character to enable a large variety of different playstyles and many attachments for your guns to fulfill all of your needs.

The DLC's and add-ons are also great if you feel that you want more from the game, I myself most enjoy the weapon DLC's.

Taking into consideration this was designed on the diesel engine (used for a 2001 racing game) and it was created in 2013, I would say it has been one of the best games I have ever played. Of course due to the diesel engine capabilities, there are plenty of glitches in the game's software. Sometimes the game even crashes throughout a heist for no reason. And don't even try getting anywhere near 30 frames unless you have a dedicated gaming PC, designed to handle COD at a high framerate. But even though I only have 282 hours on the steam version, I've played for much longer on the Xbox 360 and Xbox One S/X versions, and love to see new content is frequently coming out. The only other problem I have with the game is the large amount of packs for the game. At least 1/8 of the heists need to be bought, and some of the best weapons need to be bought through another pack. However, these are all reasonably priced and aren't required to complete the entire storyline so you don't even need them anyway. Overall, great game, and I definitely recommend you buy it, unless your PC is a literal potato

Payday 2 is an outstanding Co-Op game with an UNREASONABLE amount of customization, and every bit of it is absolutely perfect for your merry band of idiots that have nothing better to do than bully each other for being anything less than an absolute god at gaming. You can get spinkicked in the jaw to make money, and you can bludgeon everything in sight with a Comically Large Spoon to inflict maximum hilarity on everyone in your crew. If you have ten buck to spend and nothing to spend it on, that last condition better exist solely because you don't already own Payday 2. because anyone who enjoys fun even a tenth of the amount that they enjoy breathing should absolutely put this gem into their regular rotation of Co-Op games.

My only complaint is that I can't bully an even higher amount of my friends at the same time, let me play with up to seven friends simultaneously you cowards.

Payday 2 is a Co Op game. While it might have benefitted with a cool story arc for a single player mode the game offers a great outing with 3 other friends for an experience that will keep having you come back for more. Payday is simply put the improved, polished and closest experience youâ€™ll find to robbing an actual bank. Itâ€™s just legal.

Imagine Grand Theft Auto V, except it's only the most fun parts - the heists. There's no filler fetch quests or lengthy setups, just heists where you make decisions on the spot. That's what PayDay 2 and what it excels it.

Graphics:
It's definitely not dated, but it won't blow you away. Basically on par in most scenarios with GTA V

Storyline:
I'm actually not aware if there was a storyline. Either way, a concise story is not the focus of this game.

Price:
At full price ($10) this game is a steal. I got around 3 hours of gameplay per dollar spent out of this game, which is quite good!

Difficulty:
Depending on the difficulty you choose (and which map) it'll either be a cakewalk or a day in hell.  Perfectly accomodates for casual players and tryhards.

AI:
They're not stupid, but not the best I've seen. Definitely put up a good challenge though, they know how to group up and attack from all sides.

Cutscenes:
Relatively simple cutscenes, but I'd say that's fitting. The game doesn't try to overwhelm you with them, rather wow'ing you with the actual game.

Fun:
I had a blast in this game... but that's because of two reasons. Firstly, I played with friends. Don't get me wrong, it's a great game, but it's miserable if you don't have at least 1 other person to play with (I'd suggest in call). It just gets lonely and infuriating. Secondly, I cheated. This game is truly meant for players willing to put in hundreds of hours to unlock new weapons... and that's just not me. Luckily, the devs understand this and have no cheat prevention (even having a toggle in the pre-heist screen allowing players with cheats to join!). I ended up using WeMod for unlimited cash and the occasional unlimited health/ammo.  

Sounds/Music:
I'd say they're perfect. It's obviously lots of shooting, but the game has some great hype music and general noises too.

Replayability:
As stated previously, this game thrives when played with friends. If you have people who are willing to play - you can play it over and over again. Once they inevitably quit, though, it just loses its replayability. I would love to pick up this game and grind out some matches again, but all of my friends have abandoned it so I am now too.

Controls:
Amazing gun mechanics (especially for a game this old!). It really shows the love and care the devs put in. 

Performance:
Runs on absolutely anything.

Modding:
There's no content mods that I'm aware of, but there are plenty of cheats.

Selling Out:
Overkill Games has sadly gone the route of selling out. There is currently 72 DLC for the game (as of writing this) that would cost $173 to buy all. That's over 17 times the price of the base game! It's sad to see, but the one benefit is that if one player owns the DLC then everyone they invite can play it too.

Similar Games:
The heists in the GTA series of games.

Bugs:
The only bug I experienced was falling out of bounds a few times. Nothing major as you're immediately teleported back into the playable area.

A very fun horde shooter with tons of support from the community and the devs. The amount of DLC this game has is staggering, but you can tell just how much the devs care about their game and players. I got this game for free at 2017. I'll be honest I pirated the game before. It was really fun, but i have no 4 friends to play. But after this free ones, i finally experience how fun it is for multiplayer. So i decided to buy the ultimate editions at sale, never regret. The only downsides of this game is stealth only map desync making it almost impossible to do, hackers with no punishment, pro that "too pro" kick out low level player, low level player that too confident despite not knowing how these heist works and thinking its another battle royale games, and ofc the wait for drills. Despite for those flaws, i loved this game. They almost gone last year but bounce back, idk if i will get those 2 new dlc because some reviews saying its repetitive and unpolished, also the content isnt that much needed. at least for me. But thumbs up they still care about this game. Now with unlockable missions upgrades that finally get rid the paywall weapons mod, i think its time for me to return..

Definitely have to play with friends. The only issue is that random lobbies is full of cheaters and will get you millions on just one heist. Some missions are near impossible without other friends to talk to which limits the repeatability of some missions. However, the game has been released since 2013. Instead of buying this game now, I would push the devs to make Payday 3. Even though you would still get your $10 worth out of the game - I would not recommend this game in 2021 because of how old the game is.

PAYDAY 2 is a fun, horde-like looter shooter that incredibly satisfying. The amount of weaponry and customization for said weaponry is enormous, if you say that there is no gun in this game you like, you're lying. The game combines horde-like gameplay with the objectives of a looter shooter. You will likely be going to somewhere to steal something that always gets you paid, sometimes the mission will give you the option to be stealthy in a heist (or it'll force you to go quiet). But you can choose missions that allows both quiet or loud. If you go loud, a police raid will commence, depending on your difficulty depends on what type  of officers you will face. You can take hostages to slow the raid and get some needed breathing room to get your objective done. To complete the mission, you must pick up what you're stealing, then walk it back to your truck and leave (this is shortened down to almost nothing, and will not go this smooth in loud missions).

TL:DR Fun horde-like shooter with a looter shooter objective, immense amount of guns and customization, and an addictive gameplay loop.

Go stealth with friends and laugh in a vc while you make mistakes and restart the level over and over

Or go loud and shoot cops in the face with your buddies! It's a great time with lots of different levels with tons of different objectives, enemy types, weapons to bring, builds to make, and lots more :D

So much love, so much heart went into this game, I can't wait for the 3rd installment â™¥

It's my absolute favourite heist game, it offers open-ended heists with both action and stealth elements. It's amazing if you wanna be casual and roleplay or use stupid weapons, and it's amazing if you actually learn what the optimal builds are, to the point where i pick two weapons and make a build for them for fun.

It's an incredible game to play with friends , the dopamine rush of finishing a clean stealth heist or a difficult loud one is almost umatched.

The game offers and insane amount of customization in it's masks and has many many fun characters.

Sure , the DLC can be pricy if you buy it all, but the core dlc's to be compettive are cheap, and you can play heist dlcs anyways if you have a friend that owns it.

oh, plus, this game goes on sale like every other month.

This is one of my top three. For a game that came out in 2013, it still stands to meet the excellence of a modern triple A game. I've played for 24 hours and I have to say I've never been so attracted to a game. It's music is comparable to DOOM, with incredible sounds and the dialog is incredible! Live action cut scenes make you feel more connected to the game, and the amount of weapon customization is incredible, not to mention the fact that you could drool over the massive perck decks all day, and another one was just added in time for Christmas. With a third title coming in 2023 I can't emphasize enough just how much you need to play this game for yourself.

It's not a great game, I understand it's probably intended for children and I'm not target audience but I just don't think it's very good. The hostage system is not accurate at all and for a game as old as it is it's still very unpolished. 
The whole point is that it's supposed to be immersive but then you mow down hundreds of police officers and drive off like nothing happened. I keep expecting a negotiation when I have hostages but the ai have no quarrel shooting over the heads of civilians, which unless  the officer is a sniper a normal police officer would never do.
The stealth is okay, but I'm starved for good stealth mechanics so a normal person will probably hate the stealth in this game.
All and all, very mediocre. 3/10 wouldn't buy again.

This game is a guarantee buy. This game has good customization, good weapons, good heists, good feel to the gameplay, and most importantly the game challenges you well. So, listen to this comedic story. It starts with two individuals, King Bach, and his friend. King Bach gets famished and thinks of means to remedy his hunger. He finds that only ice cream can fix this hunger. King Bach then asked for ice cream, but unfortunately, his friend (in a rather disappointed tone) says that King Bach could get only a spoonful. Hearing this, Mr. Bach responds by changing his body language, bringing out a comically large spoon. This means that if Mr. Bach were to get only a spoonful, it would empty the entire quart of ice cream, leaving his friend with no ice cream and nothing to eat but his words. Why did King Bach have that spoon with him in the first place? Did he know that his friend would retort only a spoonful when prompted for ice cream? Why bother carrying around a large spoon when you could have bought the ice cream for yourself? Why are you still reading this? The price of a spoon that big would have more than covered the price of a tub of ice cream. Why does King Bach have to steal his friend's ice cream through a feat of semantics? It is not fair!

For pure [i]Mayhem Dressed in a Suit[/i], devise a [i]Master Plan[/i], make sure you specify your [i]Time Window[/i] to hit [i]The Mark[/i], and go [i]Full Force Forward[/i]! [i]Tick Tock[/i]! Don't take your time getting to that [i]Fuse Box[/i]! You'll need a [i]Razormind[/i] because the cops will be [i]Calling all Units[/i]. You'll be thinking, "[i]Where's the Van?![/i]" because you may have a [i]Hard Time[/i] achieving a [i]Clean Getaway[/i].

After you're back at the safehouse, you might think, "[i]Let's Go Shopping![/i]" but it's time to get [i]Armed to the Teeth[/i] because you now hear that familiar warning of [i]Sirens in the Distance[/i]. You're [i]Wanted Dead or Alive[/i]. Do you have a [i]Death Wish[/i]? No, you don't need to take the enemy head on. You are also a master of [i]Shadows and Trickery[/i] and make your escape, leaving zero trace. [i]And Now We Wait...[/i] For the police to lose your scent... Again.

Some time later, you ponder, will your [i]Ode to Greed[/i] mean your demise? Will you end up in prison or worse? No, they aren't taking you alive! [i]And Now We Run![/i] Grab the [i]Blueprints[/i] and the rest of the intel for the next big score. Don't [i]Freeze[/i] up now! You'll [i]Supersledge[/i] your way out if you have to! There's an [i]Evil Eye[/i] in the sky and the FBI are in [i]Hot Pursuit[/i]. You don't care. You run [i]The Gauntlet[/i] anyway. If they wanna F with you then [i]Something Wicked This Way Comes[/i] their way.

The law is near. They soon realise that [i]Clowns Are Scary[/i] and they start trembling, [i]Ho Ho Ho[/i]ping that they don't come face to face with one when they finally [i]Breach[/i] where the Payday Crew are holding out. The [i]Searchlights[/i] above shine down on you [i]Kicking Ass and Taking Names[/i]. While painting the street red, you remember the name of a filthy [i]Backstab[/i]ber. [i]Shoutout[/i] to [spoiler]that rat Hector and the Sinaloan Cartel[/spoiler]. After taking that [i]Dead Man's Hand[/i], your path continued to where you are today. You snap back to the present. You leave a trail of [i]Utter Chaos[/i], [i]Gun Metal Grey[/i] is the colour of your choice. Your [i]Crime Wave[/i] is neverending.

It's weeks later and your mask is back on. You remind your fellow heisters, "[i]Donacdum[/i] crew! [i]Locke and Load[/i]!" as you all jump out of a cargo plane. You nail the [i]Drop Zone[/i] where pallets of cash await. You fight off the horde of enemies and eventually make a [i]Pimped Out Getaway[/i].

Onto the next big score...

- Steal stuff
- Cook stuff
- Get rich
- Listen to tunes
- Repeat
