Payday 2, an old classic that still holds up 8-ish years later. It's about a group of robbers who rob stores, banks and the White House along with other locations. Although the game is primarily set in Washington D.C, a very unique choice for a heist game it also takes place in places like Russia and L.A. It's quite simple, slightly frustrating and very fun. A must buy, but be aware to upgrade your guns you need to buy the quite cheap DLCs. 



GAMEPLAY: 8/10 

The heists are very creative and well thought out, and are not just your run of the mill heists. One mission you may rob some stores for a mob boss, and the next mission you steal a election. 


GRAPHICS: 7/10

It's 2013 for gods sakes, still holds up.

GUNPLAY: 10/10

Somehow, Payday 2 has better gunplay than later releases from big name game companies such as Battlefield 2042, and even has more historical accurate guns (if you don't bubba them in customization) than Call of Duty WW2 and the new release COD Vanguard. The gun sounds are quite crispy, and may reminds you of the OG COD 4 reload sounds, and the customization system is the 2nd best IMO.
I really like this game, the point when you learn how to really move and how to do the hardest missions in stealth it the best thing. 300 Hrs in it no regrets at all.

There are a few things i liked about this game.   First of all I love the fact that you have the option of doing a decent amount of missions in stealth.   Secondly, you also have the option of playing alone if you choose.         ( some games like this you usually can't play alone ). Finally, the last thing i'm going to mention is that when you "Prestige" there is a separate skill tree / skill points for that so it gives people a reason to prestige and not just to restart and get a number or emblem to show for it.
I enjoy this game a lot and if you like option of being stealthy or loud, then this is a game for you.

In short: I was convinced this was a different kind of FPS, but there does not seem to be a point to it besides having more money. A few hours in and it appears I have seen everything the game has to offer, just not at its hardest levels of difficulty. I am sure it would be fun if goals were more obvious - I spent much of the time having no idea what to do - and if I had more time and a group of friends to coordinate multiplayer. 

More details of my experience:
I jumped right into normal difficulty missions because I had no idea what else to do and could not find a tutorial. I completed the first mission, though probably because other random players joined and met the required goals.  After many failures of a second (normal difficulty) mission, and a crash or two, I did an Internet search to find a tutorial (I had to learn through the key binding menu what buttons I needed to press to accomplish tasks).  I learned the game has "the basics" hidden away in a menu.  

First stealth tutorial mission made me think I had to rush, while also requiring me to hold a button for 10 seconds, with only about 1 second room for error or immediate failure (and you cannot press the button you know you need to press immediately, you must wait).  Maybe it is a scripting problem but from 10 feet away from a guard the default pistol can be aimed at a head, fired, and have no result.  I slowed down and finally finished Day 1.  I start Day 2, follow the prompts and realize I did not hold a new button long enough - immediate failure.  I try again, press and hold the button this time, now I learn I am not pointing at something I am supposed to point at - immediate failure.  On the third try, I found there are cameras to face while holding a button down. I got one but ran against a timer or something so I did not get the second - immediate failure.  Fourth try, crash.  Load the game up again and find no way to start Day 2 of the tutorial, I have to do Day 1 again.  Begrudgingly load Day 1, crash.  

While I am glad I did not purchase this, I am sorry for the friend who bought it as a gift. About a year later it was free for everyone on Steam too - just a sprinkle of salt in a wound I guess.

[h1]Prologue[/h1]
Payday 2 is a collaborative first-person shooter video game developed by Overkill Software and released by 505 Games. The game is the sequel to Payday 2011: The Heist. Released in August 2013 for Windows, PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360. An improved version of the game, subtitled Crimewave Edition, was released for PlayStation 4 and Xbox One in June 2015. A release for the Nintendo Switch was released in February 2018.Two years after the events of the previous game, the Payday gang comes to the metropolitan area of â€‹â€‹Washington to carry out another robbery spree. The player takes control of one of the twenty-two gang members and can commit robberies alone or with up to three teammates. The player can take part in various robberies, including, for example, bank robberies, shops and armored cars, as well as drug production and distribution. The game differs from the previous one by allowing much greater customization of the player (aesthetics and gameplay), somewhat improved graphical interface and experience, greater variety and reproducibility at the levels and has redesigned stealth mechanics.An accompanying online series has been created to promote the game. The game was profitable only from pre-orders and received positive reviews. Payday 2: Crimewave Edition, which offers improved graphics, new content and some DLC, was released for PlayStation 4 and Xbox One in June 2015.A sequel, entitled Payday 3, is currently in progress and is scheduled for release in 2023 and will be published by Koch Media. It was also announced that Payday 3 will be made on Unreal Engine.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2373875370
[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
The game consists of a variety of "robberies" that a player can choose to carry out either alone, with AI, or as part of a multiplayer game. There are robberies such as bank robberies, drug trafficking, election fraud or theft of secret nuclear warheads. Some of the robberies place a lot of emphasis on stealth, often leading to bonus experience points and cash upon completion, and some robberies can only be done in secret. Shipments appear periodically as contracts on a map of Washington, DC The player can get an open contract, participate in a contract that has another player start or buy an in-game cash contract in an offshore bank account. There are seven levels of difficulty: Normal, Hard, Very Hard, Overkill, Mayhem, Death Wish and Death Sentence (formerly One Down), with increased money and experience paying for higher levels of difficulty. Currently, there is an option to activate the "One Down" function in any difficulty, which means that players can only go down once before being detained (goes up to two downs with the "Nine Lives" ability aced)Some Payday 2 contracts take place over several days, with each day represented by a separate level with different objectives. After a few days of robbery, do not kill more than four pager guards (the number of paratroopers can be reduced through modifications to the "crime spree" game mode). SWAT and by private security contractors GenSec.

This game is a long term investment with your time and money. Your health and social life will suffer cause of it. Can you handle the pain?! and the sorrow that comes after

By the time you have all the achievements done....the world around you will be different. Everyone you once knew are no longer alive. it is only you at the computer...alone. You'll look at your hands....and see how dirty and broken they are. You'll get up from the crusty chair and look into the mirror. The only thing you'll witness is how old and ashy your skin has become. Then you'll walk over to the window and only see desolation. Where has the time gone? What have you become

PAYDAY 2 is an action-packed, four-player co-op shooter that once again lets gamers don the masks of the original PAYDAY crew - Dallas, Hoxton, Wolf and Chains - as they descend on Washington DC for an epic crime spree.

Payday 2 is a action-ego-shooter in which you as a robber have to make various raids to get money and xp with which you can improve your weapons and states. 
You always do these raids with 3 friends who are controlled by other players or by npc.
There is a story mode with an genious story and a multiplayer, in this you can do raids with strangers in the world, which means you can get money and xp for your equipment. I love Payday 2 because it's a lot of fun alone and with friends and it's just a wonderful game. I recommend this game to anyone who likes to play bank robbery games and I recommend you to play the story with friends rather than alone because it's just a lot more fun.
9/10

Best described as Left 4 Dead but instead of Survivors you get Heisters and cops/mercs instead of zombies. The game has a MASSIVE selection of weapons and weapon modifications (and most gun models are GOOD), considering the game favors stealthy approach for most missions. Then again, the music does not. Plenty of difficulty levels, tons of features confusing for a first time player, frustrating achievements, and great voice acting with funny accents (most of the time). The game has modding support and the developers still create updates and patches, whether the ungrateful player base likes it or not.

The base game is rather cheap, and while you will be locked out of a ton of DLC content, it should be enough to find out whether you like the game or not.

This is one of those games you stumble upon and get addicted to almost instantly. It seems like a game that might not well age well. A horde-shooter on DIESEL? From 2013? This game has no business being good at all. Somehow, though, it deserves a try. The core game mechanics are rock-solid, with solid gunplay and decent progression but incredible build customization. 23+ perk decks and around 180 skills (Basic/aced), you can make builds for all of the many weapon categories. There is also a massive amount of heists released all the way since the inception of the game in 2013, with more being added every few months. Even though some heists are garbage, there are still heists with tons of replay-ability. There are probably too many difficulties, but this just adds to the amount of replay-ability, especially with how punishing DS and DSOD can be. All this, the heaps of content, good gunplay and progression, a relative lack of grind (unless you want to get EVERYTHING),  an amazing soundtrack with (occasionally) funny dialogue makes this game well worth purchasing, along with the legacy pack. Especially since the summer sale bring the game to under a dollar. If this isn't a labor of love, then what the Fuck is?

After almost 800 hours on PC and over 1000h on consoles, I can't tell you how much this games rocks. It isn't updated on consoles anymore sadly but it has been an amazing game since 2013 and I cannot wait for Payday 3 to come out. This game has everything a good PvE game should have to offer, whether it's mindless shooting with your friends for hours, build creation and higher difficulty game play, achievement hunting and a non linear story line. Everyone who enjoys shooters and like to kick back can fall in love with this game. There are multiple game play systems in the game already like loud/stealth heists, Armoured or Dodgy builds, over 150 weapons and a variety of melee weapons, perk decks to further specialise how you use your build and all of them combined make the overall experience just more unique. All of this combined with the uncountable amount of mods available from the community that vary from basic skins for your guns to complete remodels of the UI, custom heists and changes to game mechanics, there's a mod for everyone and they are a great addition to the Payday experience. The only downside of the game is that, while they aren't needed, there is over 160$US worth of DLC. They aren't all needed to enjoy the game(as a matter of fact none of them are) but they do give you access to launch DLC heists (you aren't required to own a DLC to join a game that is running its heist), special weapons, masks, heisters and gun mods. Altho getting all of them at once would come up fairly expensive, the vast majority of them are worth it and if you are a new player you should look into which ones would be good to prioritise before just getting a random one. oh also, did I say VR ? yea, VR is available as a free DLC that allows you to launch the game in VR, you get  sick main menu, it's the exact same heists and builds and you get to play with PC people ( It's always funny to see someone wiggling their arms around or blind firing a sniper rifle mid heist)

Sunk about 900 hours into this game at this point, and it's a ton of fun.  It's got a steep learning curve and several levels of difficulty for you to get accustomed to, plus lots of heists, weapons, characters, skills, and perks to play with and over 1200 achievements to gun for, not to mention one of the greatest soundtracks in any game ever made.  It has a dedicated development team that are still updating the game regularly after 8 years since it's release and a fairly accepting community that is fun to play with.

Payday is THE shooter game for me. It's not competitive so there's no stress about skill or bad teammates. It's just pure fun.

The game has constant sales, and even the DLC pack comes fairly cheaply around holidays. You'll actualyl be lucky if you see the game NOT on sale.

Gameplay is satisfying, feedback is godly, customization alright, and balance not terribly bad. You'll want to have the DLC pack for the best and most fair experience, as most harder difficulties are made to be a challenge even for those with the best weapons from DLCs.

All around a really enjoyable game and one I hope I get more motivation to play more of  it at some point.

[b]Shut up and take my money![/b]
This is one of the "old but gold" games.
It is amazing to me how the game is still going strong despite it was released almost a decade ago.
If you don't want to bother reading the entire review, take a "that's a must-buy-game" from me right away!
For everyone else, this is what the game has to offer:

[b][PROS][/b]
- satisfying overall gameplay
- headbanging soundtracks (including DLC'S)
- a ton of weapons and modifications (including DLC's)
- best fictional contractors on earth (e.g. Bain, Locke)
- team based
- near to infinite possible loadouts (including DLC'S)
- diversity in missions and tasks (including DLC'S)
- optimizable (mods and community/workshop)
- platform friendly (tested on Win7 and Win10)
- regular updates (even in 2021)
- a lot of creative achievements (+1000)
- amazing characters and voice lines (including DLC'S)
- breathtaking atmosphere (e.g. Big Oil Day 2, Green Bridge, Birth of Sky, etc.)
- creative events (e.g. X-Mas, Halloween, etc.)

[b][Neutral][/b]
- storyline (meh)
- secret storyline (creative meh)
- visuals (it's justified due to the very old engine)
- weapon balancing
- funny bugs (like cops casually walking through walls at times, nothing gamebreaking though)
- infamy leveling (or grinding I should say)
- mask customization (there are a lot of options, yes, yet only three categories of customization itself)

[b][CONS][/b]
- overpowered bots (most of the times, bots are a better solution for harder heists than real players, making it hard for newbies to enjoy online crime.net)
- some perk decks are really useless (esp. on higher difficulty) and received no balancing in the last years (have fun playing with gambler, maniac or biker on DSOD)
- some glitchy physics (including bags, shields, body ragdolls)

[b]OVERALL EXPRERIENCE[/b]
This game has brought so many smiles and laughter to my friends and me.
It is very enjoyable, satisfying and just amazing to play - every single time.
No matter the contractor or heist, there is always something new and unique in each and every gameplay.
The more time you spend with the game, the more you will find yourself loving it!
I can just recommend this game with all my heart and wish you all the experiences I had the opportunity to experience.

Thank you for reading this review, it really means a lot!
Tip; dont do this in real life

Welcome to Update 100 PAYDAY Era, where the MTs are dead from here forward, and the safes can be open for free!
No more 505 Games, no more Stockholders giving full influence, it's back to where we started, this is the new PAYDAY



But seriously, thanks Overkill for listening to the community and making Update 100 the best thing to happen to the game since the Dentist heists
After all these years still fun to play solo or with friends online.

Pretty interesting game. Stealth heists can be great fun and exciting to play. Though there's only a very low number of missions where stealth is actually fun and viable.

Going loud makes for rather boring gameplay as the game just keeps sending more and more enemies that keep getting stronger - it sets way too much emphasis on a mass of enemies which makes it more of a (tower) defense game and grind and less of an actual heist. Police doesn't care about you having taken hostages, to them every cent you steal is more valuable than hundreds of lives. This makes for a rather bad atmosphere and gameplay once the alarm goes off.

In the end it's still fun to play occasionally with some things done well, but there's definitely a limit of that.

Based on the information provided, can you guess what game this review is for? What's it about? What kind of game is it?

Point is, these reviews are completely interchangeable. I bet if you took this exact review, and copy and pasted it to every game in your library, you'd get the top review for half of the games you put it on, even if you didn't change the check marks to fit each individual game.

In my opinion, the Steam community should stop encouraging this format and instead downvote them all into oblivion. Maybe it's just me, and I guess it's not THAT big a deal, but for someone that puts at least some effort into the reviews they write, it is a little disheartening that the steam community prefers lazy checklists that ultimately don't say anything specific about the games in question. Plus I don't see how they could ever actually influence someone's decision to purchase a game or not when so little information is given.

Anyone agree or am I the only one that wants to read legitimately helpful reviews for games I might be interested in?

Fittingly, PayDay 2 is a lot like a bank heist. If you pick your crew well, everything comes together like a well-oiled machine, and everybody gets rich. If, on the other hand, you leave the guy with the IQ of a toaster in charge of grabbing the money while you guard the hostages, youâ€™ve booked yourself a one-way ticket to San Quentin. Like most co-op games, PayDay 2 is only as good as the people you're playing with, but when everyone involved plays it the way it's meant to be played, the rewards include challenging, high-tension action, and intense running gunbattles.


The core four-player co-op gameplay is really strong, as are the many systems and mechanics that feed into it. Crime.Net is your principal gameplay mode, where you'll choose missions from an interactive city map and get matched up with some partners in crime. Things like safe, guard, and camera placement are randomized every time you play a mission, keeping you and your buddies on your toes at all times, but in a creative and thematically appropriate idea, you get dropped in to case the joint as civilians first so you can get an idea of what to expect. Though it might sound boorish, it's actually one of the best parts of the experience. I never felt more like an uncatchable thief than when I started calling out guard positions to my teammates while waltzing through a jewelry store undetected.

Walking around the maps can be a jarring experience, though, due to some graphical inconsistencies. Out in the streets, environments feel believable thanks to impressive daytime lighting and some truly authentic-looking architecture. But that believability crumbles the moment you step inside, where the geometry is so basic, and the textures so flat, that you'd think you were playing a different game. Both could definitely use an extra round of bug fixes, though â€“ I wanted to immerse myself in the fantasy of being a big-money bank robber, but an endless stream of snafus kept shattering it. Invisible walls? Check. Endlessly repeating civilian character models? Everywhere. By the time I noticed I could stand inside of innocent bystanders, I wasn't even surprised anymore.

Thankfully, the excellent sound design does a lot of heavy lifting, rescuing some of the atmosphere. Rifle fire rings out across the streets as beautifully as a church choir, and the muffled sound of a guard getting plugged with a silenced 9mm feels ripped right out of a good caper movie. Paired with a wide variety of well-animated hit reactions, the sound effects give PayDay 2's gunplay a punchiness that invited me to pull the trigger again and again. The dynamic soundtrack isnâ€™t quite as memorable, but musical flourishes accompany each shift in pace, cuing you in that you need to either buckle down for a big firefight, or haul ass towards that escape van when the cops are hot on your tail.

But unlike its predecessor, that wonâ€™t happen every time you play â€“ at least, if you play well â€“ because PayDay 2 actually recognizes and rewards a smart, stealthy approach to bank robbery. Though some of the multi-day missions have unavoidable armed conflicts, most heists allow for a skilled crew to ace them without the cops ever getting involved. Disabling alarms, silently taking out guards, and effectively controlling civilian crowds all have a huge impact on how fast and how severe police intervention will be. A flawless heist is incredibly tough to orchestrate, but it IS possible, and that possibility kept me chasing perfection match after match.
Part of why it's so challenging, and alluring, is all the different details and elements that play meaningful roles. Downing security guards means you'll have to answer their radios to avoid alerting others. You'll need to balance your load-outs between mobility, utility, and concealability. Four robust skill trees affect everything from the kinds of gear you're proficient with to your skill at hand-to-hand combat or lock-picking. The amount of depth is impressive when you add it all up, and the result is a surprisingly strategic affair disguised as a fast-paced shooter. But the best part of all is that even once things invariably go wrong and the focus shifts from executing a plan to thinking on your feet, PayDay 2 remains a blast. The ensuing firefights are long and intense, and the varied types of foes that get thrown your way require good resource management and quick thinking to best.

Which leads us to PayDay 2's biggest, most glaring issue: the offline single-player mode. It should be clear that this is a co-op game thatâ€™s meant to be enjoyed with four human players, but if you had any aspirations of making bank as a lone wolf, you might as well shelve them. These AI helpers aren't even capable of interacting with objectives or carrying money bags, making even the simplest, most straightforward missions nearly unplayable. Theyâ€™re fine as mobile meat shields, but otherwise, they make PayDay 2 look like a much worse game than it is. Itâ€™s honestly baffling that theyâ€™ve even been included in their current state.
Verdict
Played as intended with a group of friends, PayDay 2 is much like one of its heists: things can get a little sloppy, but the potential payoff is big. Parts of its presentation are lacking, and the state of its single-player is criminal, but overall, it's a deep, addictive co-op shooter that tickled my inner burglar.

The devs have made numerous missteps throughout the games long history, including briefly adding microtransactions, a bait-and-switch ARG that turned out to be an advert for another game, and other things that offended the player base at large at the time, however at its core it is and has generally always been a good game. An occasionally janky game, but a good game.

The number of DLC is meme-levels of intimidating, but heist DLC you only need to host and not to play, so there is no fee to play with friends with different DLC than you, and the rest of it is weapons and characters, that while nice to have, doesn't change all that much. Except maybe the sniper pack. Being able to penetrate shields is pretty big. There is nothing in it that separates the player base though; you can even have a miss-matched team with some people playing in VR, which is a rarity in itself.

The graphics are lacking in some of the more modern effects, but hold up well enough, the gameplay is solid a co-op FPS mission based affair with good gunplay, the story has historically taken a back seat to gameplay, but has developed over the years to a state of 'existing', the voice acting is a mixed bag and is generally fine but has some exceptional performances as well as some characters that can't even maintain an accent over a paragraph, and the music I subjectively find a bit of a mixed bag; mostly ranging from electronica to industrial and even drifting near yacht rock at times, but I like the majority of it and it's grown on me over the years.

Overall it's an enjoyable experience that I repeatedly come back to. Or maybe that's the Stockholm syndrome speaking.

Story: 8/10 If you don't care about the story, that's fine since they don't force you to learn it or punish you for not getting into it. If you want to learn about the lore......Well, you're in for a ride. With it's story mode (as well as the videos/trailers outside of the game), you can enjoy piecing everything together like one of those conspiracy theorists. Only problem it isn't 10/10 is because I personally haven't gotten to checking it out.

Visuals: 8/10 Even without mods, the vanilla version of the game has some pretty beautiful visuals. It's not the main focus of the game but it still manages to stick in my head. If you feel like adding to/changing the visuals, they have their own settings with different filters you can mess around with (you can even change the colour scheme to only black white and red). I wouldn't say it's the most beautiful game I've seen however.

Gameplay: 9/10 Lots of fun playing through all the different heists. They also have a TON of different weapons and other things you can combine in your loadout to make your game unique! As for the difficulty of the game, it's of course also customizable too! Only problem is that it is possible to get bored of the heists if you play this game all the time.

Characters: 10/10 OH. MY. GOSH. Where do I even begin? Well for starters, the heisters (of course). All of them (excluding Ethan and Hila (sorry))  have their own unique personality and voicelines that - combined with their own outfits and loadouts - make them special and so interesting. And it doesn't stop with the other non-heisters too. The contractors, the villains, the side characters that we only hear once or twice, they're all so unique that they stick in your head anyway! I don't really know how to say this, but the characters are just.....EVERYTHING!!!
 
Other: 
- The price is originally around Â£9, so even if you (somehow) don't like it, it's only Â£9 wasted.
- If you're scared of losing interest in the game, don't! The devs bring out new heists more often than you think...
- The addons (in my opinion) are a little overpriced, but don't forget all the sales they put on this game! They aren't small discounts either (20-80% off sometimes)!

Pretty interesting game. Stealth heists can be great fun and exciting to play. Though there's only a very low number of missions where stealth is actually fun and viable.

Going loud makes for rather boring gameplay as the game just keeps sending more and more enemies that keep getting stronger - it sets way too much emphasis on a mass of enemies which makes it more of a (tower) defense game and grind and less of an actual heist. Police doesn't care about you having taken hostages, to them every cent you steal is more valuable than hundreds of lives. This makes for a rather bad atmosphere and gameplay once the alarm goes off.

In the end it's still fun to play occasionally with some things done well, but there's definitely a limit of that.

After all these years PayDay 2 is still as fun now as it was when I first began playing this game over 2 years ago.

Lots of content, while most of it is behind DLC, you could easily play the base game by itself and have a lot of fun, you can still play DLC locked heists, if you join an online lobby where the host owns one, then you can play even if you don't yourself.

 Heavy grinding, which is extremely fun (or get carried to max by your high level friends, but don't do that please, you will miss out on the great feeling of accomplishment and reward)

 Great variety of weapons, equipment, skills, and other unlockables, like masks for your character and outfits, skins for your weapons. Weapons and skills go on to affect your play-style in missions, making you go either stealth, loud, in-between, or even just a gimmick.

 And then you have the enemies which are a huge variety as well, with "specials" and encounters unique to heists and all.

 Easily one of the most fun co-op horde shooters around to this day, with only the heavy monetization being arguably the only thing keeping it from being as accessible as let's say Left 4 Dead, still a decent game.


(I'll edit this review by saying, that there's quite literally no other game like Payday 2, this game is one of the most unique games I've seen in a while, it gets VERY complex and you have to be really into it to sink as many hours as most of it's players do, monetization is still fucking trash, engine is one of the absolute worst (mods are fun), balancing is all over the place as Overkill doesn't even know their highest difficulty (you don't have to be a meta slave to play ds stop inhaling that copium) but still good game, would recommend.)
Kinda buggy, but still super fun with friends
pew pew cop die rob money cool
This game was released in 2013, and they are still releasing quality content. It has aged, but like fine wine and it is cheap. The DLC is what is keeping this game alive.

After one thousand hours I feel ready to make a review on payday 2, I absolutely love this game to the moon and back, I did every heist on every single difficulty more than once, I tried pretty much every custom heist and possible mod just to try different thigs, helped everyone that I came across that needed and brought so many friends into the game, I can't  describe how much I love this game in a million words it just has everything I look for in a game and it got me hooked for longer than pretty much any game ever had, I'm putting all my hopes on the next title and I'm sure they will deliver.

My original review was negative after watching 50 precious infamies go down the drain due to a save corruption. Now I've got my progress back and can finally talk positively about the game.

Just buy it. Seriously, this game has quite a lot of issues, but you can look past them due to the addicting gameplay this game boasts in both loud and stealth. 

There are so many heists to play and learn to keep you busy for ages. It's good fun solo, with friends, and even in pubs (most of the time...). Along with this, there is so much replayability and experimenting available to you with the profiles. There are loads of guns you can use with loads of different attachment combinations. Along with the guns, there are loads of skills and different perk decks you can combine to either make the most effective builds possible, or just to piss about.

There is a lot of DLC in the game, sure, but you can play the DLC heists online through a different host who owns the DLC. As for weapon and weapon mod DLC, there are plenty of free weapons and also perk decks that are quite viable on the toughest of difficulties. The only DLC I would say should be considered to be bought is the Spec Ops DLC due to the sheer effectiveness of the Speed Mag.

The game is also extremely moddable. Mods come in many different forms such as music, heists, HUDs and even things like new weapons or custom perk decks. Just don't be a douche and get cheat mods like P3DHack or super OP perk decks and guns. Also, if you do mod your game, please make backups of your save... I learnt this the hard way...
I like the fact the it is still supported by the developers with the release of new playable content.

A classic looter shooter game, super fun to play with friends. Very interesting story to catch glimpses of during missions. 

While a "meta" certainly exists, you can totally get away with playing how you would like to play on lower difficulties, and once you're used to the game you can fairly reliably get away with Overkill difficulty for solos with bots. 

A surprisingly vibrant modding scene keeps this gem shining.
Keep coming back for this game, even in a new account.
Almost 100 hours of getting kicked from public lobby's has been the majority of my time in this game, and I've never had so much fun.

Heres what i've gathered from playing the game for 9.5 hours:
- Depending on the heist. You sneak around the bank, spot cameras and guards.
Then put on your mask and do what it tells you to do in the top left. If your doing it stealth, do so sneakly.
- If your doing a loud mission/Heist then you will die instantly. Nah just kidding... kinda. As of me only doing harder heists im not sure how an easier loud heist would be.
- Equip and use your med kits, because you will be needing them a lot.
- Doing just a easy heist will not give you that much money. So try and do a harder heist that will get you around 1 mill. Try and join a hard heist that have other people in it, for the best chance of escaping with the goods.

If you buy base game Payday then prepare to be kind of disappointed, but when you start to get some of the DLCs in there it becomes a great drill repair simulator. The DLCs are fairly inexpensive especially because a majority of them come in a bundle that you can get for something like $10 on sale. This game is even better with friends, and whether they suck or are great you have a great time either way.

Pros:

- Great graphics for the time it was first released
- Great mechanics
- Lots of character costumization
- VR Support
- Lots of weapons and items
- A pretty neat level up system
- Many characters available
- Weapon skin system
- Lots of different builds one can make, the game will always be different due to these (Making it less tiring)
- Lots of different levels and maps
- Various difficulties with the design of the characters changing (+ new enemies as the difficulties increase)
- The game is still being updated to this day
- Mod support
- Various game modes to choose
- Great voice lines and voice acting
- Amazing story
- Has live-action episodes

Mixed:
- The bot's AI is reasonable, but sometimes pretty messy.

Cons:

- Most characters are from DLCs
- Most weapons are from DLCs
- Most skins are from DLCs
- Some maps have various glitches
- Some actions are often slow or not accurate such as changing weapons or certain ragdolls going crazy
- Driving in this game is terrible (ironic considering the story of the engine it was made on)
- Sometimes the character movement can be frustrating, often jumping too high or low and getting stuck

I've played since 2013 and it's kept me playing until now. Play it with friends, go for an achievement milestone.
This game can be played on a surface level or as intricately as the games engine will allow. Most missions can be done "loud" with police/swat assaults (which I find to be the most fun, the gun play is fairly varied with the many skills, weapon types, and perk decks), or, stealth, which demands you avoid getting spotted by guards, cameras, and civilians. Stealth has some minor issues, but for the most part you can learn to circumvent alerting guards and such. 

Notably, though, playing with a competent team can determine the outcome of a run. Idiots will facilitate the crew being chain-downed (everyone getting downed in order, trying to get one person up), and a great crew can play confidently on death sentence difficulty. Again, I urge you play with friends so communication isn't hindering progress.

Most of the DLCs add a lot to the game if you can get a bunch of them on sale, otherwise play in public lobbies with the base game. Some DLCs really don't add much other than cosmetics, but if you get invested enough you may find it worth your while for custom masks, gun skins. On that note, back when they had the Safes with Drills (loot crates with keys) that was a terrible move. Terrible enough that its functionality has been removed from the game for years now. Now, you get skin drops randomly.

Overall, get some friends, hop on discord, and pop some helmets.

rob banks, cook meth, commit many more crime and scream for a medic bag

If you have a fantasy to become a goat-masked bank robber that wants to constantly rob the same lowly secured bank (that poor bank manager) to make profit....this game is definitely worth your time !

Got friends with the same urge for mayhem ? Great ! Go grab 'em and your Comically Large Golden Spoon and go thwack some 'good' guys' to steal some gold. If gold isn't your style, there's a wide range of missions, events and story line to complete and get your teeth stuck into. 

Skill, Perk Decks and a selection of Equipment and weapons allow you to play how you want. Whether, you want to be a tank or run a stealth build, you have the freedom to do that. And with character customisation, you and your friends will stand out from the crowd...not that the poor AI know that...yet. 

For a game that was released in 2013 the gameplay is sturdy and reliable from my experience. Graphics are decent, weapon and map models voice lines and visual AI are of good quality. 

Weapon play is decent. It can get a bit messy and all over the place at times but you'll find what works for you without a doubt. I've found that once you've unlocked some sights and attachments for weapons you'll stop having such sloppiness. But you'll have to rely on RNG or in game currency to unlock these, so there is a bit of a grind for them. But when it come to bullets hitting things,  the hit reactions are spot on. 

Difficulty levels. They actually hurt the higher you go, so there is always a challenge waiting. However, I don't really advise playing a higher difficultly on your lonesome, or playing this game by yourself, as the AI doesn't help all that much and you'll find yourself doing all the work. 

Overall, for what this game lacks in makes up for the laughs and gripping mayhem you can get out of it. You find yourself looking past the sloppiness and barely there bugs to just enjoy casually walking into a bank, a minigun in hand, with your mates. 

10/10 would definitely recommend.                                                :)

[h1]I really enjoy playing this game,[/h1] especially with friends. It tests your [b]fast thinking/cooperation/shooting[/b] skills all at once.

[b]+[/b] Ability to customize game entirely to your needs

[b]-[/b] For now it has around [u]80 GB of files[/u] which hurts my disk a bit
[b]-[/b] Sometimes audio gets [i]weird and glitchy[/i] (at least for me)

[b]+/-[/b] [u]Very complex[/u] system of perks and skills

If you like to think about various strategies, [b]sneak in silently[/b] to test your [b]stealth skills[/b], or maybe [b]wreak havoc like a psychopath[/b], you should [u]definitely try this game out[/u].

New players may find the different "profiles" and "skill sets," two different menus to mix-and-match, to be a tad confusing. Otherwise, it is simply a fun game that can get addictive. Game-play aspects can be simple enough to understand, aim and shoot cops while stealing money, while creating builds, and understanding the less-intuitive mechanics like "dodge," help to also make the game complex. With the continued support by the developers, and funny vr heisters waving their arms everywhere, this game is worth getting. 

It is a shame, though, about new players missing out on the removed dlc's. Perhaps the next game can better prepare for future-proofing that (like kingpin + other things). In the mean-time, though, I guess people can go crazy with a giant spoon. Maybe after some hours in the game, a new player could even watch a few videos on the game, figure out some neat tricks, try a few mods, and look into the "secret ending" for the game.

[h1] Payday 2 Review[/h1]

Before starting my review, I suggest you buy "PAYDAY 2: Legacy Collection" while on discount so that you can experience the game with a lot of DLC's. Moreover, by buying it you will not need to purchase them one by one and can save large amounts of money.

[i] Payday 2 has a lot of sides to play by enjoying it. Firstly, there are a lot of maps you can play, and the mission in them varies. Also, you do not need to own all map DLC's to play. You can join the players who own them. Secondly, if you get used to the game, you can play it for hours. In other words, if you have any friends who own the game, do not hesitate to play with them because you wouldn't even realize how many hours you have played. Thirdly, there are many weapons you can use and they vary from type to type also, some of them are funny to use. This situation, of course, is to some extent, because you will eventually get bored of them after a while, Therefore, you should consider buying weapon DLC's. They contain a lot of weapons, but as I mentioned at the start of my review, you can buy "Legacy Collection" so as not to purchase them one by one. Finally, in the game, there are many skills and perks you can experience. Also, they change the way you play in addition to some new play types you can develop. Nearly most of them are found in the Character DLC's and they come with them when you order. To me, these are the things that make the game most playable. In conclusion, these things make the game enjoyable and playable, especially with your friends! [/i]

[b] Thanks for reading! [/b]

PAYDAY 2 is one of those games you can all ways come back to and still enjoy the game play after 10 years of the series and the community being one of the better gaming communities out there

To be honest 

The game is not "buggy as hell" as people has stated it is, where as there may be a couple of bugs, the game is still extremely playable, and those bugs do not show their head much at all, I've experienced a bug, probably once or twice.

I've seen people say that the guns are terrible, feel awful, and that Call of Duty has a "natural feel" where this can not be further from the truth, Payday 2 incorporates recoil control, and attachment selection in order to fit the gun to the playstyle you are going for, Aiming down sights feels as natural as it can, considering the games age, Bare in mind, the game was released in 2013....

The AI, can be stupid at times, but again, this is due to the games age, which you can not deduct points for, as they work a lot of the time. People complain that they are sluggish or don't follow commands, However, if you are calling them to you, and they are shooting, they are not going to just run through everyone, because that is not realistic at all, they will seek cover, and shoot their way back safely, this is how the game is designed.

As for the person who stated "The game is rubbish solo" This is completely incorrect, I have personally completed every heist on solo, loud and stealth, you need to learn to understand the game and its mechanics and character build system before making a judgement that is factually incorrect.

As for being cheaply made, the game was made in 2013, Overkill was still a small studio, and what they did, with the budget they had, was phenomenal, you can not compare this game to games like Call of Duty, or GTA, because its just wrong, the studio was small, and are still supporting the game to this day, they are a fantastic studio, that has created an amazing game, and for that.

When I first got Payday 2, I expect to get, maybe a dozen hours from it, clearly, I got more then i expected. Due to solid base gameplay, interesting situations, and great customization, I find Payday 2 to be a worthwhile, if sometimes janky experience. Of course, it has an annoying amount of DLC, much of which feels too much like it's needed for the game experience, but even with out the DLC, the game in it's current state is great, and with Overkill continuing to update the game, even after no longer needing to, it still offers a great time.

Even though this game is really old and is made on an even older engine, it is still one of the most fun I've had in a game in a good while. Gameplay is fun and simple to get into while still having some complex mechanics to it, there is a lot of grinding however for me it never really got boring or old as the game encourages you to play multiple different heists rather then grinding the same heist over and over again. Music is amazing, it always fits the mood and setting for every heist even though there are multiple genres of music in the game. I would highly recommend this game for most people, even if you have no friends to play with you can still play offline mode and have just as much fun.

forever a super fun game that feels good and occasionally hilarious to play. a ton of heists, the VAST majority of which are great or better. its still fun alone, especially for the cheap price, but the best way is with friends. try it for cheap on sale, tell your friends to try it for cheap on sale, then one or both of you buy the legacy edition, on sale, and then play 200+ hours and fall in love with the game. 100% recommend, at least try it.

This game is incredibly fun to play with a group of friends. More could have been done to make pre-planning and scoping locations out a bigger part of the game. Overall, it is a great game to waste hundreds of hours on.

This game was good, I never had any dlc and I don't plan on buying them, but for 66 hours I've played, I'd say about 50~ hours was truly worth it. I played 40 hours vanilla and the rest with mods, playing mods was funner and gave me a more enjoyable time however by the time I got to like 55 hours I didn't have anything to do, I beat most, if not all vanilla heists on overkill+. The game got more and more boring, doing the same heists over and over and over, and then I realised it was just a grind for exp and the heists weren't exciting anymore, as much as I enjoyed the start, which was probably the best part for me and my friends that played this together since we were much more squishy and died easier which led us to try doing it stealthy, which would work 0.5/10 times. I wouldn't recommend playing for more than 60 hours but hey, if you want a game you can just play and shut your brain off, this is the game for you, though this only applies to later stages in the game.

Let's be honest. This game is very good in one and very bad in another.
Good at a variety of contracts, RNG, planning execution of heist, a variety of music and its dynamics, builds opportunities, a large number of achievements, a large number of weapons, perks, skills, masks, customization, live online and mods are also important (jokes about dead game are more ironic than reality).

But you don't have to go far to find cons in this game either: a large number of DLS, the first experience can seem very difficult and possibly boring (mostly the drill is to blame for this), terrible optimization of some contracts (White House, Black Cat, Henry's Rock), on the highest difficulty (Death Sentence) on loud, revealing the rubbishness of most of the perks, skills, and weapons.

This game will be loved by those who are willing to spend a lot of time learning the mechanics and like to experiment.
This game will be hated by those who get tired of constantly failing.

Of course, I mentioned only the most important points, there are also many more pluses and minuses in the game itself.

Played it only a little bit, seems good so far.

Jokes aside, PAYDAY 2 has had a rough history but it always overcame the bad bits and continued flourishing. It's an antique with its age but the developers still actively work on it and interact with the community to a small degree. OVERKILL have earned my respect for coming clean with their bad calls and admitting that they've returned supporting this game after its supposed end mainly due to financial pains. 

The gameplay itself? Simple but not always simply executed. You are a robber. You got a gun, several even if you count your sidearm and potentially up to 6 sentry guns if you spec for them. You shoot gun at police who try to stop you stealing or doing whatever it is you do though usually it involves illegally acquiring goods. Depending on the difficulty set, the cops may be utter pushovers or demigods of crime containment. While you, the players, can have absurd abilities thanks to the skill system, the cops got their own special units to make your life of crime all the more enjoyable. Shields, tasers, cloakers, medics and bulldozers who will also appear more and more frequently the higher your difficulty.

Not a fan of mayhem and epic music blasting at loud intervals? Stealth is also an option for quite a few heists. It's not perfect but it works, especially once you figure out how to cheese certain aspects of movement. Unlike in open assault, kills have to be kept to a minimum on almost all heists since you need to answer the pagers of recently permanently retired guards and after 4 the guy on the other end won't buy your excuses anymore.

The endgoal of the game? There is a storymode available although it's more of a checklist with narrative. A good way for players to orient themselves on what they should do. Otherwise it's all about getting dosh without end, leveling up, unlocking skills and perks, enhancing your arsenal with a gigantic availability of firearms, launchers and other exotic weaponry and then once you hit level 100? Go infamous, start it all over again with more and more extras unlocking. And with more than 1200 achievos waiting for the taking, completionists will be kept busy indeed.

All in all, I recommend a healthy dose of PAYDAY 2 for everyone who likes illegally acquiring currency through the use of highly looked down upon methods. Did I mention you can bring up to 3 friends for even more craziness?

Despite the bugs, the silly A.I. and the fact that the game is more dlcs than base game (which is understandable due to the financial situation Overkill was recovering from), it is indeed a very fun and challenging game specially with friends and most of the dlcs are totaly worth it, with an interesting story, fun moments and easter eggs and a company that cares about the game and community and still fixes bugs and launches new content updates with some regularity.

It's a superbly entertaining game if you have the necessary friends to play it as a team. I personally like the sneak missions much more than the loud missions. A turotial that goes more into the skill system would be desirable, as you are quite lost at the beginning and have to work your way through various third party turtorials. Nevertheless, a clear buy recommendation, especially in the sale.

Used to be great fun a few years ago. In 2021 i would sadly say its not worth it anymore. With years of development locked behind paywalls in the form of DLCs it is very difficult or expensive to enjoy the game.. for me anyway. Now there are mods that let you access all of the DLCs, which tags you as a cheater and doesnt let you join most public lobbies (you can still host or join lobbies that allow the Â¨cheater tagÂ¨), but thats another story. The graphics, especially on some maps just arent good anymore, the whole game is made on a shitty engine and doesnt run well. The veteran community died out and now it just seems like a fairly populated, toxic wasteland of free to play players mostly. The old, polite community was decimated by actual cheaters, ruining heists and lobbies within seconds and taking the fun out of the game. However, if you have 2-3 friends to play with, this game IS still very much fun, the stealth is enjoyable, the gunplay is still decent and if you dont like something about the game, there is probably a mod for it, all of which are multiplayer compatible obviously.

My Personal Payday Review
======================================================================
ðŸ—¹Multiplayer
ðŸ—¹Puzzle solving
ðŸ—¹Horde shooter
ðŸ—¹Hours of replayability
ðŸ—¹CO-OP/Teamwork centered game
â˜Good single player
â˜Good tutorial
======================================================================
Like most co-op games, PayDay 2 is only as good as the people you're playing with, but when everyone involved plays it the way it's meant to be played, the rewards include challenging, high-tension action, and intense running gunbattles. The core four-player co-op gameplay is really strong, as are the many systems and mechanics that feed into it. The placement of guards and objectives are randomized every time so no two heists are alike. Payday realy shines though in its stealth heists, Heists which can be done silently, never having to get into gunfights with the cops. Stealth heists are fun, filled with tension, and are a great fun with friends. Speaking of, Payday 2 is a heavily Multiplayer game, meaning that lots of objectives or heists are easiest when playing in a full lobby of 4 people, While all heists can be done solo It isnt as fun or as easy as playing with friends or some people online. But overall I say that payday Is a fun game worth the pricetag and is definately worth your time to get.

Of course, after playing this game for 90 hours, I need to review. This game in infinitely re-playable, I have played this game for 80 hours without friends, and still had a blast robbing banks and museums. The story I don't even understand its so complex, the difficulty modes are perfect for everyone of every skill. There are over one hundred weapons, and over one hundred attachments. The perks are an entirely different thing, being able to tune it what you what, either be a big chunky guy with tons of health, or a fast guy with high dodge, there are plenty of play styles for everyone to try out. There are plenty of heists, it would probably take a few hundred hours to beat all of them on death sentence. It would take hundreds upon hundreds of hours to 100% the game, including the secret ending which is beautiful. Just buy it already, and get it with friends, it is 2x better with someone to crack jokes with, one time ended up with me and some friends just singing songs. Buy it. Do it. And get it with friends.

Look, you wouldn't believe the lore of this game if I tried to tell you. Just know that PAYDAY 2 is the keystone that connects all fictional media. Hotline Miami can reasonably exist in the same universe as High School Musical because of this. I'm not joking.

Heist: The Diamond

Bain: Guys, the diamond. Go get it.

Heist: Framing Frame

Bain: Guys, the painting. Go get it.

Heist: Murky Station

Bain: Guys, the EMP. Go get it.

Heist: No Mercy

Bain: Guys, the blood sample. Go get it.

Heist: Hell's Island

Bain: Guys, the Bain. Go get it.

I'll keep it short and sweet, and though my hours say just 48, that's not wholly true.
Payday 2 keeps some of the same mechanics you know and love from other modern shooters, you've got your iron sights and crouching and left clicking shoots, that's all fine, but Payday 2 beyond that is far from generic, allowing you to do so many more things you could barely dream of in other shooters or wave shooters, such as converting the people who were JUST TRYING TO KILL YOU to YOUR side so they can shoot the SAME SQUAD MEMBERS THAT WERE ALSO JUST SENT TO KILL YOU. I can't really think of many games that allow something like that.

The variety bag of weapons, explosives, equipments, and throwables make sure there is always an option and a favorite for anyone who wants to play. Would you like to slowly and methodically sneak through an art gallery with a silenced Glock 17 (Chimano 88) or 1911 (Crosskill)? Or would you like to tear through that gallery with a minigun like your ass is on fire? How about throwing cards as a lethal weapon, or even a large, plastic spoon as a melee? Both very real options to choose from. Getting into perk decks is a different beast as investments into making you a full blown min-maxing terror from the depths that the SWAT will soon wish they never got out of bed for.

All in all, there are thousands of combinations and with your imagination I'm sure you'll find something you'll love, and the police will regret taking the call for, enjoy.

I was recommended to do a review of this game even though I just posted a review about this game. Having played at release, this game does not have the thrill that it once had. Prestige system is lackluster and only exists for those who like to start over. It can be fun, but there is not enough incentive. The incredible amount of DLC makes it a fairly boring game to see on the shop. I will admit, I owned all the DLC before the Legacy bundle became a thing. However, as it is now an 8 year old game and trying to come back and seeing another $100+ worth the minor DLCs, I am again discouraged to jump back in. I choose to make the dive every couple years to see if I can get back into the scene, but am always driven back to uninstalling. The community is unforgiving to new/returning players. My attempt to join games is met with outrage that someone who is "Infamy VI" has no clue on what weapons are considered good. I want to like it, but this game is not for new players. This game is for those who want a first person shooter that demands a meta and to know the content before you enter. These types of games are not fun.

Addition #1: Game has two modes. Stealth and Loud. In Stealth, you spend a bunch of time sneaking around (who would have thought) and if you mess up, you're doing it Loud, whether you're equipped for it or not. If you do Loud, the gameplay is exactly the same. Shoot anything and everything that moves and hope your teammates are good enough that you don't have to constantly revive them until they are placed in custody and you are forced to play with one or more players down until the assault wave ends and you have to hope you can get enough hostages to bring your teammates back. Gameplay does not have much variance beyond that. There are different maps with different objectives, but the gameplay remains the same.

I am a 55 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 12 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories

All around amazing game. My only complaint is that the mandatory stealth missions are super unbalanced. There are 2 guards and a camera in every major location and we only get 4 pagers to answer. The guards also have no set patrolling path so you can't memorize their paths in order to avoid them. Their pathing is entirely random. On top of that, the guards are apparently psychic, they have the ability to spot you when you are above and/or behind them. Even with the lowest detection score you can possibly have, you are detected way too easily.

Payday 2 is a fun game with friends. It is rewarding if you can sneak through a mission without setting off an alarm. If that sounds boring, you can go guns blazing in the loud missions. There is something for everyone. Even though it is a great game, it has cons such as AFK hosts, instant kicks, and bad ai (stuck guards, team bots can't save you in certain areas, and weird movement overall). Guards walk backwards, walk over doors, and desks. Sometimes you can even experience the black screen of death. Still it is very addicting and worth checking out.

Payday 2 is a very fun horde shooter. It has many different things about it and that's the fact you rob places for money and its nice to have an objective and the objectives you have to protect and make sure they are not disturbed from your enemies. The enemies are very unique as well we have the standard cops they show up to get the main event started, next is the swat member there are two versions a normal and a "tougher version" of a swat member, then we have the cloaker they are basically a ninja that will beat you to the ground, call you names, put dirt in your eyes, and put lemons in your wounds, The next is a shield its basically a wall that can fall with explosive rounds but you can just shield surf over them, The medic is exactly what it sounds like, The Dozer is a wall that can and will chew you up, they are basically menace and good at taking the payday gang out unless you hit his face, The last one is the taser he shoots you with a stun gun and makes you shoot like a bat out of hell and you have to hit him before you run out. But overall I'd give payday 2 a 10/10 fun gameplay, good music, good dlc, and great dlc and the missions are fun are amazing

I would give this game a 7.5/10. I love payday 2 a lot however I can't say it's perfect. The graphics haven't aged the best. They weren't the best looking even in 2013. There is a lot of dlc which is a bad thing to some people. Personally I'm fine with the dlc because they're fairly priced and you actually get content from the dlc packs. The amount of dlc can be overwhelming to a new player. Also after awhile the game becomes very repetitive. The one thing that you can do to make the game fun is just play with friends. Playing with friends can make any experience fun. Even if you don't have friends I suggest you to get this game. It becomes extremely low priced for almost every sale.

Even without any dlc this game is amazing. It's alone in its theme and style in that few if any other games revolve around this kind of heist setting.
If you like stealth games the stealth missions in this are good for you. They're like puzzles, with many different variables and features unique to payday, and working through those missions will scratch the itch of a player who wants likes strategy, puzzles, or stealth in games.
The "loud" violent heists are a classic shoot-em-up with many different enemies to fight and a great many weapons with which to fight them. It is a lot of silly and exciting fun to play through the chaos of a high-difficulty loud mission.
This game has coop for up to 4 people, and if you can't get your friends together for a heist the single-player ai companions are quite nice. You can have serious, well planned-out, heists with up to 4 friends simulating your heist and going through the stealth and strategy together. It tests communcation and can be a lot of fun for anyone looking for that experience. If you want a silly and exciting mess to jump into with friends you can do that too, and have a heck of a lot of fun with friends.
The npc teammates don't annoy or get in the way like so many other game's ai companions, and they won't ruin your stealth playthrough because they'll purposefully stay outside and simply blend in. The game does a good job of informing you of this subtly and in context with the setting and the characters kindly stay out of your way but will cover you if you get caught.
In summary: the game is amazing, can be played single-player without losing its value or can be played with up to 3 other friends, and it provides wonderfully for anyone looking for stealth, puzzles, strategy, or just a test of mechanical skill and a chance at chaotic fun.
It would be way funner if you could actually play payday 2 with friends on any console.

Ohh man. There is loads of reasons this is one of my best favorite games . Hats off to starbreeze.
First of all one of the things what made this game one of my favorites is the language. 
The rude rough funny as heck and though meanings comments and speech made by the characters and the big variety of them that still suprises me when i hear something new said from a character i played alot alongside is wery cool, same goes for the cops i think i heard it all then comes a new comment lol, some of the funniest stuff i have ever heard and encountered in a pc game in that aspect i have never experianced anything like it and that factor alone goes along way adding to gameplay . Its worth adding more of it 200% and there is room for it and it does alot.
The gameplay is wery smooth even for weaker computers graphics is simple and nice. Appriciated when you run in a replica of scarface house and a copy of the desk in the movie and the jacuzzi with the bed hes wife was laying on. Lol stuff like this gives this a edge and well known enviroments can still be added from movies and its wery nice to see.  I Do miss some more objects that can be destroyed with weopons so when i see bottles i shoot them theres no shortage of windows that break though.
This gameplay is so basic that this game can be addapted and expanded in a million ways. I Joked to my friend the other day and said hey man imagine gta payday lol. The missions that have a more military campain with more open areas and other enviroments than only square building heists like smaller banks if it isnt the big banks with some space to run in is a nice diversity and such scenarios can easily be made to diversify gameplay even more by adding things like manual turrets trenches covers etc abit like a battlefield incoperated. It gives you the notion that its just not a ordinary heist.  The Ai is not bad ofcourse ai is allways one of thoose subjects that allways can be worked on, but i think you guys did a pretty good job. Animations are good and fluid and the ragdoll effect is well made. Bugs in this manner like if a enemy is blown up and get stuck to a chandaler hanging down from the roof or enemy that dies in a sitting position with the chin resting on a low walls edge just makes it even better and funnier. Some more effects can be added even if it exists for bloodspread and bulletholes and all the necessary interactions its allways nice with more of them they dont need to be placed all at ones to eat the gpu or cpu but placed in order . The wepons are well made. The skins are nice some sights cover to much screen like a sight in the tailorpack bundle with the crossing border missopn the wepons mods are wery nice indeed and there is alot of them and the wepons can be modded to become wery accurate and higly effective.The shotguns are abit weak and to slow loading a automatic highly destructive one would allways be fun. The deployable devices are really nice you could add a drone to the game for funs sake automatic or manual with protective functions or offensive or for scouting
googles for nightime and xray so you can see enemies behind walls that you also can shoot with a strong enough wepon ad there is some of them thats also pretty nice high tech and modern, the 50 cal sniper is a beast but its damadge level isnt really reflected on everything becouse one shoot should be enough taking into account that a high caliber rifle like that can penetrate a manhole lid with right ammo .
Prices are pretty low on most Dlc and that is wery good. Becouse a game is just as good as the brand is well known and its better to be cheap and gain many players and get a strong well known brand than be greedy , In long term that is a winning concept. I dont play this game much for graphics egen if there is some pretty nice scenarios but i play it for gameplay. And in that regard starbreeze has done a pretty good job.
Iam totally satisfied and if you dont like the game becouse its to simple looking you must either be deaf or have a wery bad sence of humor becouse the speech in this game i hilarious and it is therefore more close to real life due to its not politically correct than most things ive seen. That was a brave and innovative move by the developers abit groundbreaking and a good decision. Even if i heard some funny stuff in Gta nothing comes close. 
If you havent playes this game and you arent a snowflake i suggest you try it atleast.
Another thing i appriciate alot is that there is no rivalry amongst players .
Becouse you will be playing against bots trough teamwork with teamates that is a wery wery nice feuture so there is no intresst of conflicts between players, thats something ive seen to often in other games. 
The modulators that can be added to change gameplay like abduction enemies split into 2 or explode when they die is also a wery good and clever idea to prolong gameplay longlastibility diversity, a couple of more or this ones just in the right manner can change the gameplay totally and could be combined with bonuses for enemies killed in numbers or in certain ways becouse some people want to play just for the shooting fun aswell. A New enemy character ? I think the game has a pretty good number of different enemy types but ofcourse there is allways room for something different like Granadier Rpg or wallbreakers that use c4 to breach a wall to suprise you. Miss the element of smoke granades but they are not that important becouse its mainly used to storm snipers and blind them at the same time with a flash and the snipers in the game can be taken out anyway. So that was a good thing becouse i hate games with to hard snipers that you cannot storm or take down and you miss the tools for it. A motorcycle police is still missing in the game. Taking down a armoured turrent truck and even better 2 or 3 of them with a rocket launcher would be nice. The cars level of destruction could be worked on it does alot to a scen after a battle if you see uther destruction afterwards becouse the level of shootings in this game beats the hell of anything i played its obvious when you change the avanced graphics body count settings to ultra lol ohhh man you guys are the best but it would be nice if there would be some more impact destruction on the enviroment after a battle, cars expecially its allways one of thoose things you allways expect to be able to destroy alot for added realism , i know it can be hard to keep a game balanced and its obvious that the developers want everyone to enjoy this game even poorer people with weaker computers its reflected in the prices aswell as the game and i have respect for the developers for thinking about this. But also remember that destruction can be added in parts it does not all need to happen at once. I Said to my friend put yourself into the mind of the developers. This guys are groundbreaking keep it up with the straight forward no bs attitude i love it. I Allways try to play a games that has a element of uniqueness in it and this one has it not only the things i mentioned above but how many games do you find that is a pure heist game?
And when did you last time see a ninja cop that jumps you with a baton and shouts stop resisting while beating the crap out of you. 
Also there is a sence of realism in this game that stands out abit missionwise. Rigging elections political misssions corruption and rigging drugs at politicians homes are wery down to earth and realistic things that most games never have even mentioned but yours do and definatly a thumbs up for that. Beeing intense drives a action game and with different levels you can customize resulting in different amount of enemies and kinds of them definatly makes it intense love the chaos. Sometimes you dont want the missions to end and that is a good sign. 
This game has all the elements to be keept alive for a wery long time and becouse it has lots of room for expansion and adding so many things that can make the gameplay last.

Payday 2 is... Kind of weird when you look at it from a genre standpoint; it's a 4-player co-op horde shooter with RPG-like skills in the form of the skill trees, and classes in the form of perk decks. That said, it [i]really[/i] works well; most skills feel very impactful to the gameplay, and the perk decks can [i]radically[/i] alter your playstyle. Combine this with a dizzying roster of weapons to choose from, [i]and[/i] the extensive modifications you can make to those weapons, and you have an almost limitless potential for all sorts of crazy builds. It's a real tinkerer's paradise, and it's glorious--sometimes I'll even spend hours on end just building, labbing out, and tweaking different builds.

Of course, the gunplay is also excellent; almost every gun in the game feels visceral and satisfying to use--wouldn't be much point to any of this if that wasn't the case. General gameplay is... Well, it used to not be so much about sheer volume of enemies, but now you will probably scratch your head at how the DC Metropolitan Police Department has managed to apparently enlist the entire population of Maryland to throw at you. That said, it's still a fun time, and turning the heat up with Death Wish difficulty can give you a real challenge. Death Sentence on the other hand is... Decidedly less fun.

Payday 2 has definitely suffered in accessibility from having 8 years' worth of DLC, but thankfully, there is the Legacy Collection which will singlehandedly get you up to speed on all the DLC that was released, up until 2017. Anything after that you still have to buy separately, but [url=https://youtu.be/lyPNFvtcWRA]given the absolute wild ride that Overkill and Starbreeze went on circa 2015-2017[/url], they really do need the money, and I think it's worth supporting them, given their sheer perseverance through it all.

But yeah, overall, Payday 2 is another one of those "essential multiplayer games" that everyone should have on Steam. Get it, and get it for your friends too, and [i]definitely[/i] buy the Legacy Collection whenever it goes on sale. It's all worth every penny.

 [*] IÂ´ve been surprised how simple is run through all enemies. Normal and Hard option is really like that, possible to do rambo style etc.. But then you realize later with higher difficulty -  Loud way isnÂ´t the best or even fastest option.
 [*] Great to play atleast in 2 friends, and fun is scalling with another one!
 [*] Do the tutorials and career missions so You understand basic mechanics and options of approaching. 
 [*] YouÂ´ll get another skill tree list at lvl 50. So till that time you have to change all skills outside of heist prep. Have that on mind! Same with perks... I dont se option to restart a get your points back, so i put all in to the hitman. But some heist demands rambo style, and me with akimbo pistols, reaveal chance 3 and light vest is not the best option now! 
 [*] PC req are really acceptable, no problems to play on classic office NTBs so all your friends can play with you!
 [*] As some people said, its a really DLC simulator, but just wait, i got some Legacy pack around 11 Euros, which is nice i believe, thinking I will finish collection, because only Party leader have to own the DLCs, while others just connect and can play with him! Thats good!  
 [*]Hope this helps to decide zou to buy or not.  Newbies like I am, if you want to play with me, feel free to add me  ;)

This game is fun with friends. Very fun with friends. Lots of random stuff can happen. however, i really can't recommend this game. There's WAY too much waiting around for doors to get drilled or computers to get hacked, and because of this the game gets repetitive way too fast. There's also the problem of the truckloads of DLC in this game. And it's not just a costume or a mask, it's a heap of content locked behind even more paywalls. It's a very solid game, but too much waiting and way too much DLC for a game that already costs money.

Much like any other complete rando on the internet, my bias when reviewing games shows big time. For the first one to three days when I originally got this game, I was hooked. I was hella hyped to just play with a good online friend of mine and share some memories. But then in came a game franchise I've known since the early 2010's and boom, down goes the ship of motivation. I still did have one-off experiences here and there but when looking at my limited history behind playing this game, the downshift is obvious.
Outside of that, I really don't know enough about the game's lore or culture, so it's hard to say anything outside of it being a great experience for when you want to attempt friend group cooperation and end up screaming down one another's throats for not sticking to the objective and repeatedly dying to a clutch chokepoint that has half of the entire mission's wave waiting for your squad's lowest rank to get their ass capped.
11/10 because we got to see Gus Fring at his part-time job as a dentist.

This game is soooo underrated

Pros:
- Very great heists like Bank Heist and First World Bank.
- Cool customizing weapons, armor and characters like my favorite colors.
- Obviously awesome soundtracks.
- Surprisingly overpowered like deck perks and special enemies.
- Teammates must be great in their job.
- It's fun.

However, sometimes I really don't feel like I get it but I'm not sure, cons:
- A problem is disconnecting from unfortunate lobbies in a coop, I see 200+ times.
- This is really the toxic community I think.
- Cheaters unintentionally.
- Unfortunately got kicked or banned for no reason.
- How about dlcs, shame about one of them. How about Scarface DLC?
- Unintentionally crashed after restarting any heists 3-4 times.
- Useless AI bots.

Anyway I wanted to rate it 4.5/5 stars though!

If you like firing your gun nonstop into endless gigantic hordes of ultra-weak mindless ai opponents - like CoD zombies numbers of opponents, but without even CoD zombies levels of strategy - then this is the game for you.  The "heist" theme seems to suggest that there is some kind of Oceans-11 style nuance to the game, but there isn't in any way.  Blast baddies, run to the next highlighted objective while blasting baddies, push the controller button that it tells you to push, blast more baddies, run to the next objective, rinse, repeat ad infinitum.  Probably a good game for someone who likes the tap-tap-tap mobile games.  I don't.
