Amazing game with a great community of passionate players. It has an amazing Modding community too, with unique and cool mods being made each day 
The game does still have a lot of bugs / issues that haven't been addressed by overkill in years, however, the awesome community has made mods to fix most of these issues. 
There is zero anti-cheat present, and while it is a PvE game, you will find some people sad enough to cheat in this. Luckily, it's pretty rare, and since you can check what mods people are using in the Player List menu option, you can easily kick or ban these players from joining your session. 
Regardless of the bugs, it's still a great game and has been my favourite game for multiple years.  10/10.

PAYDAY 2 is a game about 4 men (or women) wearing funny masks, wielding a 1300th era longbow and a pistol-looking shotgun with a comicaly large suppressor, quietly robbing a variety of different places, guarded by people with eyes on their backs, such as:
A bank
A bank, but big
A bank, but with gold
A bank, but with cash
A warehouse, [spoiler] containing nuclear warheads [/spoiler] 

But... what if you don't like being a ninja(with a longbow)?
What if you want to blow up hordes of [strike] zombies [/strike] cops?
What if you like being kicked in the balls by a man with NVGs wearing black clothes?

Well then, the [b] Loud [/b] and [b] Fun [/b] approach is for you!
Get your RPG and minigun ready
Put on your heavy armour
And start blasting those Dozers
(just don't get kicked in the balls)
And, most importantly...
Don't forget your comicaly large spoon to beat up the cops with.

All in all, 10 out of 10 game, please make less paid DLCs and more free updates next time around.

The pros of this game are:
[list]
[*] Customization - You can customize your perks and weapons freely, depending on situation of the gameplay.
[*] PvE focused - This game has Paid DLC which unlocks the weapons and characters, or perks, however this game only includes PvE and not PvP. So even if you don't own DLC, you can still play without any difficulty issues. (That means Pay 2 Win does not affect the gameplay even if you have all teammates with no DLCs)
[*] Mod friendly - Overkill officially allows people to use mods freely, unlike other online games.
[*] Beautiful Graphics - Even this game is released on 2013, it has awesome graphics.
[/list]

The cons of this game are:
[list]
[*] DLC - I understand that developers needs money. But Paid DLC is somewhat excessive. It would be better if developers keep Paid DLC to minimal.
[*] Not really Mod friendly (Interface thingy) - Supporting mods are great decision, but there is no specific interface about mods (For example L4D2 has it's own interface named 'Add-ons' to allow downloading mods easily), even there is no official guide about installing mods, which makes hard for people who wish to install mods.
[*] Lack of Multi-platform support - This game only supports Windows and Linux, but not macOS. Even this game works better on Windows, and it has less optimization on Linux, which makes game stuttering on some places.
[/list]

Even there is some problems, this game is really awesome Co-op game. It is recommended to play with more players.

Broken promise. 


Payday 2 for me has given me many hours of entertainment. Enjoyed solo or with friends, I could play this game for hours on end. Sure, it can be rage inducing every now and again but it does not mean it is a bad game. However, there is one thing that really ticks me off. That thing is a broken promise. Let me paint for you the canvas for this problem. Imagine you are young again, maybe 10 years of age. Your friend who you really trust has promised that he would let you go on his bike for as long as you wanted the next time you see him. However, after that day you did not see your friend for a while. You eventually managed to meet them on the street, but before you could catch up to him he just speeds past on his bike. 

The same thing applies for Payday2. When they first released the ultimate edition of the game, they promised that any upcoming DLCs would be given to players who bought ultimate edition for free. However, after pretty much abandoning the game to go work on their "walking dead" game, they faced bankruptcy. All because of  legal problems within the company. Now, they announced the end of Payday 2 and even created a whole ending easter egg for the game. But then they came back and just began making dlc's again. We don't want dlcs, we wanted the company to create payday 3 for a long time and only just now are they beginning to open their ears to the community. I just don't think that its right for you to make a promise only for you to not be able to keep it. Let alone abandon the game that made you guys famous to go do something else, and then come back to it when you failed. That is just disgraceful and truly breaks my heart to see that this is your attitude towards the game that you so called put your heart and soul in. While I recommend the game, my feelings towards it and the overkill will never truly be the same.

Methamphetamine[note 1] (contracted from N-methylamphetamine) is a potent central nervous system (CNS) stimulant that is mainly used as a recreational drug and less commonly as a second-line treatment for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder and obesity.[17] Methamphetamine was discovered in 1893 and exists as two enantiomers: levo-methamphetamine and dextro-methamphetamine.[note 2] Methamphetamine properly refers to a specific chemical substance, the racemic free base, which is an equal mixture of levomethamphetamine and dextromethamphetamine in their pure amine forms. It is rarely prescribed over concerns involving human neurotoxicity and potential for recreational use as an aphrodisiac and euphoriant, among other concerns, as well as the availability of safer substitute drugs with comparable treatment efficacy such as Adderall and Vyvanse. Dextromethamphetamine is a stronger CNS stimulant than levomethamphetamine.

Both racemic methamphetamine and dextromethamphetamine are illicitly trafficked and sold owing to their potential for recreational use. The highest prevalence of illegal methamphetamine use occurs in parts of Asia and Oceania, and in the United States, where racemic methamphetamine and dextromethamphetamine are classified as schedule II controlled substances. Levomethamphetamine is available as an over-the-counter (OTC) drug for use as an inhaled nasal decongestant in the United States.[note 3] Internationally, the production, distribution, sale, and possession of methamphetamine is restricted or banned in many countries, due to its placement in schedule II of the United Nations Convention on Psychotropic Substances treaty. While dextromethamphetamine is a more potent drug, racemic methamphetamine is illicitly produced more often due to the relative ease of synthesis and regulatory limits of chemical precursor availability.

In low to moderate doses, methamphetamine can elevate mood, increase alertness, concentration and energy in fatigued individuals, reduce appetite, and promote weight loss. At very high doses, it can induce psychosis, breakdown of skeletal muscle, seizures and bleeding in the brain. Chronic high-dose use can precipitate unpredictable and rapid mood swings, stimulant psychosis (e.g., paranoia, hallucinations, delirium, and delusions) and violent behavior. Recreationally, methamphetamine's ability to increase energy has been reported to lift mood and increase sexual desire to such an extent that users are able to engage in sexual activity continuously for several days while binging the drug.[21] Methamphetamine is known to possess a high addiction liability (i.e., a high likelihood that long-term or high dose use will lead to compulsive drug use) and high dependence liability (i.e. a high likelihood that withdrawal symptoms will occur when methamphetamine use ceases). Withdrawal from methamphetamine after heavy use may lead to a post-acute-withdrawal syndrome, which can persist for months beyond the typical withdrawal period. Methamphetamine is neurotoxic to human midbrain dopaminergic neurons at high doses. Methamphetamine has been shown to have a higher affinity and, as a result, higher toxicity toward serotonergic neurons than amphetamine.[22][23] Methamphetamine neurotoxicity causes adverse changes in brain structure and function, such as reductions in grey matter volume in several brain regions, as well as adverse changes in markers of metabolic integrity.[23]

Methamphetamine belongs to the substituted phenethylamine and substituted amphetamine chemical classes. It is related to the other dimethylphenethylamines as a positional isomer of these compounds, which share the common chemical formula C10H15N.

Medical

Desoxyn (Methamphetamine Hydrochloride) 100 tablets.
In the United States, methamphetamine hydrochloride, under the trade name Desoxyn, has been approved by the FDA for treating ADHD and obesity in both adults and children;[24][25] however, the FDA also indicates that the limited therapeutic usefulness of methamphetamine should be weighed against the inherent risks associated with its use.[24] Methamphetamine is sometimes prescribed off label for narcolepsy and idiopathic hypersomnia.[26][27] In the United States, methamphetamine's levorotary form is available in some over-the-counter (OTC) nasal decongestant products.[note 3]

As methamphetamine is associated with a high potential for misuse, the drug is regulated under the Controlled Substances Act and is listed under Schedule II in the United States.[24] Methamphetamine hydrochloride dispensed in the United States is required to include a boxed warning regarding its potential for recreational misuse and addiction liability.[24]

Recreational
See also: Party and play and the Recreational routes of methamphetamine administration
Methamphetamine is often used recreationally for its effects as a potent euphoriant and stimulant as well as aphrodisiac qualities.[28]

According to a National Geographic TV documentary on methamphetamine, an entire subculture known as party and play is based around sexual activity and methamphetamine use.[28] Participants in this subculture, which consists almost entirely of homosexual male methamphetamine users, will typically meet up through internet dating sites and have sex.[28] Due to its strong stimulant and aphrodisiac effects and inhibitory effect on ejaculation, with repeated use, these sexual encounters will sometimes occur continuously for several days on end.[28] The crash following the use of methamphetamine in this manner is very often severe, with marked hypersomnia (excessive daytime sleepiness).[28] The party and play subculture is prevalent in major US cities such as San Francisco and New York City.[28][29]

Contraindications
Methamphetamine is contraindicated in individuals with a history of substance use disorder, heart disease, or severe agitation or anxiety, or in individuals currently experiencing arteriosclerosis, glaucoma, hyperthyroidism, or severe hypertension.[24] The FDA states that individuals who have experienced hypersensitivity reactions to other stimulants in the past or are currently taking monoamine oxidase inhibitors should not take methamphetamine.[24] The FDA also advises individuals with bipolar disorder, depression, elevated blood pressure, liver or kidney problems, mania, psychosis, Raynaud's phenomenon, seizures, thyroid problems, tics, or Tourette syndrome to monitor their symptoms while taking methamphetamine.[24] Due to the potential for stunted growth, the FDA advises monitoring the height and weight of growing children and adolescents during treatment.[24]

Adverse effects

A 2010 study ranking various illegal and legal drugs based on statements by drug-harm experts. Methamphetamine was found to be the fourth most damaging to society.[30]
Physical
The physical effects of methamphetamine can include loss of appetite, hyperactivity, dilated pupils, flushed skin, excessive sweating, increased movement, dry mouth and teeth grinding (leading to "meth mouth"), headache, irregular heartbeat (usually as accelerated heartbeat or slowed heartbeat), rapid breathing, high blood pressure, low blood pressure, high body temperature, diarrhea, constipation, blurred vision, dizziness, twitching, numbness, tremors, dry skin, acne, and pale appearance.[24][31] Long-term meth users may have sores on their skin;[32][33][34] these may be caused by scratching due to itchiness[33] or the belief that insects are crawling under their skin,[32] and the damage is compounded by poor diet and hygiene.[34] Numerous deaths related to methamphetamine overdoses have been reported.[35][36]

I havent played that much but i can see myself playing this game for a while due to how much content there is to do. If you are looking for a linear path to follow than that is really present here you kinda get to do what you want and just level up and get more money.

I find the game insanely fun the guns are all incredibly fun to use and there are LOADS of guns to choose from. The contrast between stealth and loud gameplay is really small in terms of enjoymant. I love playing stealth just as much as I love going loud AND if you fail stealth you can easily transition into loud allowing for a super fun and creative way to do different heists. 

The game also has such a great range of difficulty its great, you can have a super easy time where you are practically god and you can kill everything and everyone or you can make it seem like a simple scratch would kill you. Stealth also isnt the most easy thing to do so is super rewarding when you fully succeed and pull off the perfect heist without anyone knowing you were there.

If you are an achievement hunter well you are going to have a field day with payday 2 there are so many achievements its actually scary. 

I fully recommend the game even at full price for the hours of fun you will get out of it, its by no means flawless but its just so insanely fun the flaws wont bother you as much.

It's PAYDAY 2 Fellas!

PAYDAY 2 is a 4 player co-op heisting game and a sequel to the original PAYDAY: The Heist. Letting players commit an incredible crime spree as they rob everything from Money to Gold to Nuclear Bombs. Since it's release in 2013, PAYDAY 2 has been continuously updated after all these years with new content to keep things fresh thanks to the game's infamous use of tons of DLC packs. It's certainly one of the most uniquely structured first person shooters ever in terms of style, personality, and gameplay.

Gameplay of PAYDAY 2 takes a lot from Modern Shooters, With sprinting, iron sights, and a slight focus on cover. However, what makes PAYDAY 2 different from all those generic shooters is practically everything else. Heists either range from simple bank jobs to absolutely ludicrous heists and it doesn't shy away from having some incredible and memorable heists. They often more or less feel like real places that you're robbing either loud with guns-ablazin or stealthy by lurking in the shadows. Gunplay of PAYDAY 2 is pretty much what you'd expect from a modern shooter but the sheer amount of weaponry as well how much fun it is to shred down squadrons of SWAT and it's not boring for how much the enemies and rip you to pieces if you're not careful which helps reduce the game of just mindless shooting. Furthermore you're allowed to choose what kind of armor you have, a multitude of equipment to help you out, Skill and Perk decks to give you game changing special abilities, and insane amounts of melee weapons if bullets just aren't enough. Lastly for gameplay there are a multitude of different difficulties to adjust to how skilled you are and as a reward get more cash in the process.

One HUGE aspect that I adore about PAYDAY 2 is how much of the game is customizable. Starting with weapons, not only can you out fit EVERY single weapon with gadgets, sights, stocks, etc to your liking but thanks to Weapons Colors and Skins from free drops you can customize the appearance to suit your needs. But that pales in comparison to one of the most iconic parts of this game, Your Mask. Not only are there 100+ masks to choose from but nearly infinite ways to customize with materials, patterns and 2 colors to personally craft the perfect mask for you, plus some masks are nods to other games or internet culture. Lastly you also have the ability to customize the skin on your armor similar to Weapons Skins but also have entire full outfits that while not as customizable fit well with PAYDAY 2's theme of customization.

Another thing PAYDAY 2 does extremely well is having a ton of character. While the setting and weapons are undoubtedly kinda generic at times. The characters, from the heisters themselves to even the Police Force have that extra characterization that prevents them from being generic cops and robbers. For Example, a majority of the Heisters come from different countries making each heister unique in both personality and how they sound, like Dallas' signature "Medic Bag" lines or Sydney's Australian chaotic-ness. Each one brings something new and doesn't feel like a carbon copy of each other. Like before even the Police have this sense of character, mainly with the special units, such as the Cloaker or Bulldozer with their constant taunts and chatter. This even seeps into their variations in different countries or other factions. Even your mission guides have a ton of character from the iconic Bain, to the Russian Vlad, the mysterious Dentist and many more.

Of course I couldn't make a PAYDAY 2 review without talking about the absolute fantastic OST. Simon Vikland not only voices Bain and the Cloaker but also composed the majority of this game's stellar soundtrack and with his spiritual successors carrying that touch of having some outstanding tunes. I feel the reason why PAYDAY 2's soundtrack is so well regarded is that while it often does the electronic, loud music it's never too shy to try other genres and make them work so well. Some tracks include Jazzy instruments, others completely with classic guitars and drums, some with inspiration from outside culture such as Mexico, others go for a grand musical style with Opera singers, one straight up makes it's own 80s-like song complete with lyrics and there is even Badass Clown Music! PAYDAY 2 wouldn't be the same without it's incredible soundtrack.

Overall, PAYDAY 2 is a great time, either going alone or going with a squad, it excels to continuously being fun while repeating gameplay which boosts it's replay ability. Furthermore as of this review, PAYDAY 2 is still being updated so it's never shy of having new content to be played. Really the only truly bad thing I can think off is how poor the driving controls are which is ironic since this game runs on the Diesel Engine, a Engine made for driving games. With PAYDAY 3 hitting stores in a few years I can't wait to see what our favorite band of heisters will get up too soon!

When describing this game to friends who have never seen or heard about it, the first thing I say to them is that it is the best parts of any Grand Theft Auto heist compiled into one game. This game has fun combat, intuitive stealth, engaging heists, and above all, its fun. I've owned this game for a relatively short time compared to other games in my library but that has not stopped my from getting completely addicted to it. If you ever want a game that you can just load up to kill time then payday is that game. If you ever want a game that you can get lost in for hours then payday is that game. I can see it appealing to many different groups of people and I'm sure those people would all enjoy this game. Definitely recommend.

I've never robbed a bank in my (real) life [strike]yet[/strike]. But it was an experience that I thoroughly enjoyed.

I installed Payday 2 because it sounded fun to play once in a while and since i got the base game for free ages ago, when they gave away a huge number of copies for it, why not at least try.
I was not ready for it. I started my first heist, and after a few minutes, I couldn't put the game down. The gameplay loop consisting of shooting cops, repairing drills, and stealing all kinds of loot, from toothbrushes to cocaine disguised as christmas presents and just regular gold bars, while trying not to get kicked, tazed, punched or shot. The game offers multiple build options, which are balanced terribly, but can work if youâ€™re good enough. Iâ€™ve found myself thinking â€œthis is the last oneâ€ or â€œone more score and Iâ€™ll stopâ€ and then I proceed to spend hours upon hours running with bags in different ridiculous masks and gun combinations, like an anime girl wielding an assault rifle equipped with an underbarrel grenade launcher and a rocket launcher secondary, that gains a few seconds of infinite ammunition when using an ammo bag.

The stealth mechanic in this game is amazing and absolutely ridiculous at the same time. You can have a guard 10 meters away staring right at 4 masked heisters with big shotguns who are pointing and yelling different variations of â€œlook out guardâ€, but because theyâ€™re all outside the range nothing is done. This and you can hide behind the thinnest pole, but since the spotting hitbox is in the head if you canâ€™t see their head, they canâ€™t see you.
I know this sound very ridiculous, but in practice it makes stealth amazing.

This is barely scratching the surface of all the content and ridiculous stuff you can do and i didnâ€™t even mention the huge number of mods there are for this game. I highly recommend you at least give this game a try. Most of the games price comes from the huge amount of DLC, which i do recommend getting if you find yourself enjoying the game. It is playable without em, but youâ€™ll be lacking a lot of quality content.
Also Payday 3 is currently in the works, so while waiting for that, why not give this a shot?

A quick review as one of many ADHD players.

This game is pretty cool overall, i never have seen anything like this throughout the years of Gaming on both consoles and PCs.

The game does have alot of issues with textures, bugs and such. But the feel of the game, the story and everything else just overshadows the whole experience which makes this game legendary.

Personally, i have alot of issues of staying in any game for a while because of my ADHD. But this game, even if i do take frequent breaks always brings me back. The progression keeps me pumping and all the options of customisations, skills, perks, different ways of going throughout the heists always makes me stay for a while and keep me going, and always makes me come back to it.

10/10 for the game as a reviewing view
9/10 for people with ADHD who want to try it out. For the only reason that it makes you come back, without having a hyper fixation to the game.

Payday 2 is a great heist game and a great first person shooter, you have different roles in the game, you either choose being a support, an infiltrator or a hitman. You can build up your character has you like, with a skill system, a perk system, and a lot of guns, guns in this game are fun and easy to use, some of them have a bit of recoil but nothing too crazy. The problem i see with this game is that you need some of the dlc to experience a "Complete" experience, i feel like the majority of the guns should be non-dlc but they arent, wich makes you buy them even if you purchased the game full priced, i think is not fair, and i now they are cheap, but for a game that is multiplayer and paid, this should not exist. At the end of the day is very fun and requires a nice curb of learning to master, great game!

Before I played Payday 2, I had virtually no knowledge of the series.I had played Goat Simulator: Payday, but that was basically it. One day my friend gifted me this game. I played it more and more and eventually got addicted to payday 2 because IT IS MORE ADDICTIVE THAN SUGAR. I have had the game for less than 2 months and at the time of writing this I have 235 hours on the game. Payday 2 is an amazing game with lots of heists to do and literally HUNDREDS of weapons. The gunplay is super fun, even with heavy armour I can still dart across the level and shoot hundreds of police officers with ease, and the skills and perk decks add a lot of variety to the game. I have no complaints except for the escape mechanic, where you have a chance to not successfully escape from whatever heist you were doing and be forced to do a boring mini-level where you have to haul all your loot to a different van, AFTER waiting 3 minutes for it. Not to mention the risk of cops stealing your loot in the escapes when you get more than 4 bags.

An epic FPS heist game with so much fun its impossible to not like. Every heist has its own unique flavor of action packed combat or satisfyingly sneaky and tense stealth. There is so many guns, skills, charachters, customizations, and gameplay styles to choose from. They aren't all perfectly balanced, but the wide range of difficulties allows for all loadouts to be fun. I would highly recommend this game, as well as the legacy bundle for another world of content. With its frequent sales going to $1-5, buying the game is practically a robbery.

If we are playing solely with such buddies or friends,
whom we love and play in duo, Trio or Squad,

The game works with VR devices if someone has a VR devices.

This is not a game like CSGO or any FPS game,
to kill, steal and ready for the mission,
Here is a very important teamwork,
It is very important to build your character,
How do you disguise yourself not to be striking.

Perk's use and setting also depends on many things,
To what you need for you most, how do you play.

Oh yes, and if you seriously like the game,
almost certain that many DLCs should be purchased,
Because without DLC, the game will only be able to play weak difficulties,
very difficult levels without DLC almost impossible,
Very difficult difficulties at levels without DLC, very forget it.

Now: stealing money & stuff involving secret societies, aliens and immortal dentists.

PAYDAY 2 is an action-packed, four-player co-op shooter that once again lets gamers don the masks of the original PAYDAY crew - Dallas, Hoxton, Wolf and Chains - as they descend on Washington DC for an epic crime spree.The CRIMENET network offers a huge range of dynamic contracts, and players are free to choose anything from small-time convenience store hits or kidnappings, to big league cyber-crime or emptying out major bank vaults for that epic PAYDAY. While in DC, why not participate in the local community, and run a few political errands? Up to four friends co-operate on the hits, and as the crew progresses the jobs become bigger, better and more rewarding. Along with earning more money and becoming a legendary criminal comes a character customization and crafting system that lets crews build and customize their own guns and gear.

This game is a lot of fun, Solo and with Friends. It's one of those games where you can take it absolutely seriously or not at all seriously. You can be a serious stealth master sneak thief with impeccable timing and perfectly optimized guns, or you can be a derp with a minigun mowing cops down like you're cutting grass on your lawn. There is no limit to what you can do with Hundreds of Masks, Hundreds of Guns, Hundreds of ways a Heist can go right or wrong, Ragdolls galore, a GODLY soundtrack and a powerful sense of Dynasty Warriors style smiting down hundreds to get to your goal! It does have a few setbacks though. The Paid DLC can be...well in a word, costly. So be sure to have a hole in your wallet if you wanna get everything the game offers. Plus the space this game takes up is horrendous. Not like COD Warzone levels of huge but still it will chew up a hefty amount of storage space on your PC with a, at the time of writing this review, almost 80GB of space. And Death Sentence Difficulty, even when you're Max Level and with the most decked out builds ever, is not for the faint of heart. Stealth Missions can go as smooth as butter or as horrific as doing the mission over 30 times because you either screw up yourself, a camera spots you or that one random guard is like "Duuur hey what's goin on in here?" to the point you just go "FRAG IT!" and go loud anyway because you're fed up and impatient. Overall, an amazingly fun game and I do recommend it. But just be mindful it isn't a flawless game. It takes hours of playing to even complete it 100%. So you either have to be a God or just an Uber-Masochist to the point Dark Souls is getting jealous. But if you're in it for fun and not completing it, then you bought the right game.

After 11 hours of play, I got stuck. I constantly got kicked from friend only lobbies due to Host Connection Timeouts or Host Connection Lost errors. Either I made the lobby or my friends did, nothing worked. We tried public lobbies, but I just kept getting kicked. I've tried everything I could find online: Flush DNS, reinstall, turned off all background running programs, adjusted the in-game network settings, and nothing worked. 

I played this game on the same network with the same group for those 11 hours of fun, but I hate losing everything because of network issues that I don't have on any other game. Until this is fixed, I will not be returning.

If you enjoy thrashing your hard drive, this game is fantastic.

the bad
-this game's mechanics really didn't hold up over the years, newer games have much more crisp and satisfying gunplay and movement, the movement is really "slidey", i have motion sickness and this triggers it a little bit.
-headbob is pretty insane, i have motion sickness and got sick after a couple minutes of playing, thankfully there are mods that remove that completely. 
-this is a swarm game, i personally find this genre boring(especially when i play solo), especially with so many weak enemies, i prefer a less swarmy game with more tanky enemies.
-the objectives are boring and consists of waiting, and waiting, and waiting plus more waiting.
-really grindy, especially the "reset your progress to gain a little bit more" type of progression, so there's not really a "late game" content expect playing the hardest difficulty and yet meeting the same types of enemies over and over again.

neutral
-high learning curve, i usually like this in a PvP game, but i usually play coop PvE game to unwind and turn off my brain.
-somewhat elitist community and the modding community is pretty toxic too, but there are just as many opposing them, so try to avoid engaging with any of them.

the good
-so many customization. the skills, perks, classes, weapons are all awesome and impactful.
-pretty much the best game with this theme.
-really cheap on sale.

this game is a 5/10 for me, i'll probably play it if i have friends that play this game, the gunplay and movement is just too much for me to tolerate it and play solo, but if you like the theme and tolerate the gameplay mechanics in this game, it's definitely worth it on sale.
Fast action plenty of gaming, endless hours of fun!

I obtained Payday2 about half a year ago in behalf of my dear friend. Later on I bought the legacy edition myself on the summer sale.
I put more 600 hours in this game so far. At my first day after some of my friends has teached me the neccesary knowledge about how things works in the game it became much easier, although the game have complicated mechanisms behind the scene...

Payday 2 is always better with friends. Random lobbies most of the time come with hardships. However among the medic/ammo bag eaters new heisting partners also can be found. 

The game offers you 3 types of gameplay; 
- The most common one, LOUD - there are heist that can only be completed in loud.
- Stealth - same as loud, few missions only can be completed while stealthing.
- Death Sentence difficulty with one down activated - a.k.a. cover hugging simulator - a place for psychopats or poor souls trying to get the "Hardest Difficulty" achievements :D

Payday 2 offers a variety of playstyles, and a lot of combinations of skills and perks, but most of the players usually sticks to the meta, althought it's entertaining to test your own ideas.
When you hit lvl 100 you are able to reset yourself, which gives you rewards and pernament prestige next to your name - this is where the grining part comes in, but it is not neccesary for enjoyment.

The game is still relevant, it does have an active playerbase. 
It is getting updates frequently, such as, new heists, accesories & cosmetics and of course new wepaons.

(TL:DR)
In general, if you're looking forward to rob some banks with your friends or some random players and have a lot of fun with different variety of weapons and you wanna play with mods and spend quite some money on Downloadable Content, this is for you

(Review)
Now don't get me wrong, PAYDAY2 is amazing.
I've played this game so much and I can say with honesty that this game is a blast if you play with random people, or your friends, sure there's a storyline but, some people would rather just play random heists and have an amazing time. The guns in this game is a pure arsenal with over 100+ and more weapons to choose from (most being DLC weapons), a lot of customization attachments, a lot of masks to choose from and in general 50+ heists to pick from. This game also features mod support which makes this game more enjoyable if you get tired playing the Vanilla PAYDAY 2, trust me there's a lot of mods to choose from once you're done playing PAYDAY 2 by default.

The community from my view is..mixed. I have met tons of great people, but also a lot of negative ones, I really do not understand the reason why people kick you out from the match when you play the game as it should be played, or just because you're a low level in the game. Sure it can be justified to kick low levels but some people are looking forward to this game and to have fun, sure this may not happen all the time but, atleast let the new players enjoy PAYDAY 2.
The worst part about this entire game is the overwhelming DLC's that kept getting released. as of this review date edit (05.11.2021), the entire DLC pack costs over *170,02â‚¬*. If you have the money to buy this pack, go ahead no one is stopping you, but if you only want to buy that specific DLC, no ones stopping you there as well. I mostly buy weapon DLC's since I love guns, a lot in this game. But the amount of DLC's getting released in this game makes it feel almost pointless to complete your weapon collection from my side when they keep on releasing more and more content. Some of the DLC's are the same thing, actually. Just that its a different model, with different statistics, and a different price to pay.

Now before saying why am I complaining about DLC's and not shutting up about it, is cause how annoying it gets to actually complete the bundle of DLC's that PD2 has, only to release another DLC. Ultimate Edition/Legacy Collection SHOULD'VE BEEN the last bundle of this entire game. I mean I can understand that the company is currently *kind of* bankrupt and struggling financial support, but it doesn't mean people wont agree the same here.

That's all I can write on this review, if you read this review, thanks a lot for reading, I hope you have a great day and enjoy some PD2!

Date of Monetary Acquisition 2: Electric Boogaloo is a video game almost as poorly put together as the US government. In your ventures as John Payday and Dallas Cmeddikbehg (the C is silent) you will find yourself slaughtering endless hordes of police and swat officers so eager to die you'd think they ran a cult and the environmental challenges and advantages each heist brings. 

Taking Shillings 2 is rather known for its rocky development to bring it to where it is in today in 2022, but is in a very acceptable state at the least. From the surface the game seems like a mindless PVE horde first person shooter where you and three others construct a bridge out of the flesh and bones of anything in front of you, and to an extent it is, but much more lies just below to entice and engage you. Such things lay waiting in the expansive customization. 

There are 4 different ways to customize and curate your personal experience and affect the experience of those around you. The first facet is the selection of your gear. Your arsenal of anti-governmental tools of justice are the centerpiece of your terror. Pick whichever primary, secondary, throwing weapon, armour, melee and deployable fit your needs and synergize with the aspects of your build. Every individual weapon can also be customized further to fine tune your exact experience. Guns frequently feel good and shooting them feels fun, and there's a gun for every person out there to enjoy. 
The second decision comes in which Perk Deck you would like to own. Perk Decks are permanent, linearly unlocking stat and equipment bonuses that you pick one of and swap out whenever you please. You may have equipped one Perk Deck that allows you to have the highest possible health and passive regeneration, but then swap to another that allows you to hijack nearby enemy's radios and stun them with noise. You preferred Perk Deck generally shapes your gear and skills.
Speaking of skills, the Skill Tree is a wonderful way to upgrade yourself and spec into whatever you desire. You unlock skill points upon leveling up and use them to purchase malleable and interchangeable skills to benefit you and/or your team. Every skill in the tree feels impactful and worth the price. There are no miserable minor stat increases, only things you can feel in gameplay with and without them on. You find yourself weighing out the pros and cons of taking a particular skill over another often, and how that will affect your next match. But do not put any stress on it! At any point in time you may remove your skill and refund your points to spend elsewhere.
The final and arguably most practical customizable and personalized array of options is your thriving fashion. You have masks that you may edit the pattern and colours on to match perfectly with your outfit, and outfits with numerous colour options to suit your mask. You can even add charms and skins to your guns for a more fun and visually interesting homicide. You also have the option to pick from a roster of heisters all with unique dialogue, personality and interactions. Even some crossovers too! (Coke Jimmy my beloved) A man with no style receives no respect in the criminal underworld. Down here, its drip or drown.

The pinnacle of the gameplay being the heists, more well defined as simply missions, are your setting and your reason for bringing an illegal firearm into a peaceful upper-class neighbourhood. With some outliers, many are outfitted well and designed nicely for both loud and stealth (for the chromosome deficient) ways to approach each situation. You are given a set of goals and it is up to you to complete them for yourself. Much of these missions see to you robbing a group or individual and carrying their bags of stolen goods back to your escape vehicle but others have more nuance. Scan superhumans in a russian bunker and return the data to your employers or scavenge cocaine in festive christmas presents falling out of trees. Not often is there a boring objective in Unauthorized Withdrawal 2 Fast 2 Furious. Not many of these missions get boring, either since the objective is never too time consuming or takes your focus from the action, instead usually building upon it. Not to mention layouts of buildings and spawns change every time you do a mission again, and the online multiplayer aspect provides a pretty vast modicum of replayability. 

There's even the added benefit of this game running well on potato PCs. 

Grab your guns, a drink, a friend or two, a medic bag, the Legacy Collection on one of it's frequent sales and get ready to roll.
Because tonight boys, its payday.

But that's just a theory... a game theory.

Payday2 is a fun game to play. There are lots of way to keep it fresh with customization options like the skill tree, perk decks, modifiers and DLC. The game can be as challenging as you would like with six difficulty settings to choose from. The graphics are sharp and the game runs smoothly. Plenty of guns to play with from normal handguns to grenade launchers. I enjoy the using the throwables as well. Rarely does a heist stay the same with a wide variety of mask, costume and weapon selection. Biggest downfall of the game is the lack of committed players. It's tough to find a good group of players willing to take on contracts at the Death Wish and above setting while trying to tackle achievements. Sometimes the movement from the cops is predictable and repetitive. Overall I truly enjoy the four player co-op style game in a first person shooter with heisting!

A beautiful game, but technically and graphically outdated. Payday 2 is a simulation of bank robberies, safes and vaults. Play alone with bots or 4 in co-op. Gameplay is to prepare for robbery: the choice of customer, quiet or noisy, the choice of modules and weapons. Then there is the process itself: a lot of shooting and hauling bags. Missions are quite replayable. In different ways change either the maps, or the key, or the person. The game has a kind of storyline, linking a lot of missions, leading to certain consequences. Extensive selection of perks and weapons. Suitable game for anyone, for as much as 6 levels of difficulty. Different unique opponents to counter players. Good music, there is a lot of it and you can always choose for any task.

Amazing horde shooter, I'm a sucker for rpgs so this game is one of my favorites, if you haven't tried it you need to.
fun game for a party of friends,cloakers do be horrifying tho

Honestly one of my favs also since i moved from ps4 to here and the game got 1000 fold better!! Controller aim in console port is dog shit... ALAS!!! This game is an under rated coop heist gem,, i mean not to many games like this that i know of at least its not been overkilled, dug up and grinded down further. Its countless days of missions and levels, in stealth or loud, there's driving in some missions, if your a gun nut your gunna spend a lot of time buying and building guns, masks, characters, up grading skill tress and not just having one you can have multiple skill  trees for different types of "social work". Its fresh and and still gets new content and seasonal events and etc. Like fore the money its worth the full collections pack, BUT it does take a lot of time to grind and learn but its made fun. 

Really tho I can go on in short the games super fun with friends or online with the right randos. especially if you gotta crew of 4.

this game is very fun. i have  been playing this game since 2014 and when i started playing this game, i was a console player. i switched to pc gaming quite a long time ago and all i can say is that this game is very well made and i totally advise anyone who enjoys fps games. This game can also pose quite a chalenge in some aspects since on some missions, you can try to stealth them which is something to keep in mind if you're trying to get better at the game.

update at 4.5k hours: still good. death sentence makes me feel like a little b*tch still sometimes though.
Hugely addictive multiplayer and solo experience. Particularly enjoy the stealth focused missions but the gun-play going loud can also be fun. Very creative level design.

This game is really nice with friends and in solo it has so many heists and you can choose how you want to do them such as Loud and Stealth and I think something else I don't remember. There's different type of mods to make the game however you want it such as silent assassin which when you apply the mod If you kill a guard without them spotting you don't have a pager. There's hundreds of exciting robberies you can do in this game. And even better there's levels you can choose your heist as such as normal, Hard, Very hard, Overkill, Mayhem, Death wish, And last but not least Death sentence the hardest one of them all. There's also one down which takes away 2 of 3 of your downs so you can only die once it doesn't really matter if you have it on or off in stealth but in loud it does. You can also get achievements from playing on one down there's one achievement that Im trying to get which is rob Golden grin casino with one down enabled and only use pistol. I think you get a trophy too. also there's different characters and different customization for your characters. Such as suits, Masks, Armor. Also there's skills in this game. Alot of them, And it's just a fun game in general. You can also play with randoms by pressing online and clicking a heist which has a players name below them, or above them I don't remember. Overall If I had to rate this game out of 10 I would rate it a 10/10 and I would recommend it for other players. Especially if you like robbing games, I can assure you that this will be the best robbing game you will ever play in your whole life.

Payday 2 has all the right ideas but with poor execution. This game may be considered old but it had constant updates with 70 DLCs since so not much of an excuse. Very good mod support and community. The gameplay is a mess not much of a fan myself great game structure great customization and some pretty good ideas but most of the time with bad execution. Everything usually sounds satisfying but disappoints. I still recommend this game especially with a friend although a guide or an already experienced friend would be amazing. I have faith and respect for the developers can't wait for Payday 3. Buy Payday 2 it's cheap buy dlcs even just buy it.
a blast even if i only have like 10 weapons unlocked

This game is really fun, basically you are bank robbers and you pull heists with the help of 3 other players/AI bots. You can finish the heists loud or silently and equip yourself with all different kinds of gear and modify it out as the situation calls for. You have a wide selection of characters to choose from, many of which are from movie franchises like John Wick and Point Break, as well as cool cosmetic masks. This game was released years ago and as of writing this (the end of 2021) it is still popping.

This game is downright one of my favorites, as it has mass amounts of detail and story. You get to engage in compelling heists like robberies, stealth missions, and other objective-based heists. You get to unlock new items and shit and it lets you customize your mask, outfit, firearms, and modifications to the point where you can express yourself. You can choose to upgrade your safehouse for continental coins, and you can choose from a wide variety of characters, heists, firearms, firearm modifications, soundtracks, and more. The game has many soundtracks to choose from, and you can play singleplayer or multiplayer with friends, or find a game on the lobby network. I 100% recommend this game as it is worth the money, and you can even watch it's own live-action webseries on steam. 

The game has almost 1300 achievements to collect, and trading cards as well. You can purchase other shit from the community market. Unlike valve's games Payday 3 is happening.

This game is a hoard shooter like CoD zombies. It is nothing like GTA five. The game play is linear and straight forward; almost every mission's objective is the same. The game can get repetitive if you do not own the DLC's; by the way there are too many DLC's. There are such few base game heists. Certain weapons are also DLC locked; which is acceptable. But when they make attachments DLC locked, that's just annoying. If you own a gun you should be able to use it in it's full potential without having to pay for it. My second complaint are the hostage AI's. It is so bad. Sometime when you're trying to move a hostage it goes to the other direction which is a threat as other civilians may see the hostage. Good game over all just too many DLC's and hostage AI is crap.

Played this since 2013 and have been playing it on PC recently and have had tons of fun, I mean who doesn't want to cause chaos while making millions and listening to awesome music, Right? Yeah the game has issues (Disconnects and sometimes bugs preventing you from completing the heist) but when the game is functioning which is 99% of the time in my experience this game is a blast, Especially if ya got some buddies to bring along with you on the way on you're heisting escapades, There's plenty of content and the customization is something to behold from customizing you're masks to you're weapons and yes there's alotta DLC but that's completely optional and does not need to be required for this game to be fun, In my opinion if you like first person shooters and stealing stuff and listening to awesome music, You'll like Payday 2

But seriously, Payday 2 is a LOT of fun even for the base game, I picked this up during the summer sale and I was not disappointed, this is quite worth your time and money, as it's fun to unlocking new things, play with other heisters around the WORLD, and with the expansive DLC (which I have yet bought but I have plans to), it is a HELL LOT OF FUN as I mentioned
Oh? Did I mention that this game can also support VR mode? Playing in VR is a lot of fun, but I'm not a fan of the teleport mechanic, luckily I installed the VR+ mod and it made the experience much more enjoyable (for me at least), but if you have a VR headset, I recommend giving Payday 2 VR a shot! It's fun to move around like you're robbing a real bank or something, plus it's fun to see the reactions of everyone else watching you flail your arms!
This game is worth your time and money if you can buy it, and get some of the DLC too if you can!

I'm probably gonna be at around 1-200 hours by the end of the year, but I wanted to review the game now since I feel like I got pretty much everything I need to review it. 

Payday 2 is hard to define. It's an FPS heist-organizing game based off two different dichotomies: Loud and stealth. 

The loud sections center around waves of enemies that are akin to Left 4 Dead where there's certain special enemies that are defined relatively similar to L4D. You have bulldozers that are basically tanks, Cloakers which are a lot like the Witch (but more aggressive), Tazers that are like the Smokers, and Shields/medics that are just kind of their own thing, and self-explanitory. Sometimes there is a "Captain" mechanic where you have to kill the captian to end the wave. I'm not sure if he is surrounded by a bunch of upgraded shield enemies or he is one of the shield enemies himself, but it can be annoying. There's also swat turret trucks that will spawn on higher difficulties, and they're the worst things in existence. When one of them comes in, you're in for a hell of a fight. Pretty much all of the loud missions deal with lots of hacking or drilling, and often they will keep turning things off or disabling your stuff and it can be a tad annoying sometimes.

The stealth sections center around avoiding guards and tying down civilians to look for ways to get inside. These are really engaging for me, but sometimes just feel unrealistic. It is to be expected of course. There are ways for your hostages to be impossible for the enemies to detect, even if they're literally sitting right out in the open. I've had instances where guards were too close to windows and I accidentally shot the window out while killing them and it ended my entire run. A lot of the stealth missions depend on RNG too; to get the easy objective placement, which hurts some of the difficulty of these things. A lot of the stealth seems like you got BS luck and that's why you failed; rather than it feeling like you made a mistake. Some of the missions that you do stealthy are sometimes almost impossible, or become extremely difficult if you fail at stealth; so some missions you might end up resetting like 50 times to finish. Not the best game design, but at least you can restart instead of having to pay to do a heist again or something ridiculous like that. 

There's a lot of heists and a ton of variety, and a lot of the heists are fun to play themselves. They created a lot of creative heists for this game, and many of them have their own quirks. They've recycled a few heists over the years, but I feel like there's so many different heists, that I don't care about that too much. It kind of sucks some of the heists are way easier to do, and give out way more XP than more difficult ones or ones that are longer, but a lot of other games operate that way, so it's a small complaint. 

Preparing for heists is relatively extensive, as there's a lot of guns and skills to decide on, as well as perk wheels, infamies, and many other things that give this game a lot of depth. Naturally with most build-centric games; there's lots of imbalances. Builds centered around pure stealth and dodging seem objectively better than other builds, and it kind of sucks. Seeing how the devs have fixed guns, I hope they make some builds more viable sometime. Would be nice if tank builds had the same survivability as dodge ones. 

The weapons also suffer from similar imbalance, as dual-wield SMG's and Shotguns tend to dominate, where assault rifles are kind of left behind despite some exceptions like the FAMAS.

Unfortunately, most of the depth is lost due to the fact most of the weapons and whatnot are DLC, as well as a few heists, but only few of them are important. Some builds want guns that are DLC, and it's quite frustrating, but the devs filed for bankruptcy a while back, so I guess I understand why they had to charge for expansions, but they shouldn't have went against their promises. At least the DLC is cheap, but quantitatively it's very expensive, at $160 for all of it. Hopefully sales dial that number back a lot. 

The level system sucks, and I hate the gacha mechanic for getting attachments and stuff. It gives you coins to unlock attachments, but you don't get a lot of them. I've only been able to unlock 10 or so attachments in 50 hours of playing, which kinda sucks, but I guess it's not a huge deal. There's also a CS;Go system for weapon skins, but at least you get them all free.

All in all though this is a fantastic game. I feel like there's plenty of charm and replay value to this. Very enjoyable game that is full of content. It's a great example of a game getting constant updates over a long period of time done right. They've screwed up a few times, but even with some of the bugs or weirdness with the AI; I still have a blast playing this game. I regret not ever touching this back in the day when I got it for free. I missed out on one of the most entertaining games I've played in a long time. For $10; I feel like this game is a steal. Absolute must to pick up.

I just ate some fried chicken. The breasts were juicy, and the buns were soft and warm. Afterwards, the division manager of Popeyes came up to my table and asked me how the meal was.I said I was satisfied, but the meal lacked a certain je ne sais quoi. He apologized profusely, and said he had something to show me that would make up for it. He lead me to the back of the popeyes, to a room soaked from floor to ceiling in blood. In the center of it was a live horse, chained by all four legs to the structural supports of the warehouse like room. As I watched, employees of the popeyes cut large sections from the horse, which was whinneying and screaming in horror, the remaining sections of its body covered with festering sores and a froth of sweat. The popeyes employees took the chunks of horseflesh and sliced them into pieces, then they rooted around through the bags of trash strewn around the room to find discarded chicken bones. They quickly tenderized the meat with sledgehammers and fed it into a machine which formed the horsemeat around the bones, then they breaded and deepfried it. I asked the division manager why he had led me back to this place, and he pointed at the steed's rump, the diseased aâ€Žsâ€Žsâ€Žhâ€Žâ€Žoâ€Žlâ€Že puckering rythmically with terror, squirting pus with each convulsion. "We're just about to use that section, would you like a crack at it first?" I quickly unzipped my pants and wasted no time jamming my erâ€Žeâ€Žct pâ€Žeâ€Žnâ€Žiâ€Žs into the stallion's defenseless aâ€Žsâ€Žsâ€Žhâ€Žoâ€Žle. With each thrust, I donkey punched the horse in the back of the head, making it clench its aâ€Žsâ€Žs even tighter. I came just as the horse died. I was delighted. Popeyes definitely went the extra mile to make me a satisfied customer.

Payday 2 is a very unique and interesting game, with deep lore and a gameplay loop that is satisfying and enjoyable. Payday 2, while having released 9 years ago, still has a bustling community of heisters, and a genuine team of people who care about the game, as you can see visibly through the many DLC released to the game, while the DLC's might sometimes get on the more expensive side, they all bring a good amount of diversity and variation to change up your playstyle.

Overall I would give Payday 2 a 8/10

Payday has aged like wine. Even in 2021, this game is highly accessible for PC's of all specs, has contemporary graphics, and a bottomless rewarding gameplay loop. The VR experience is also surprisingly fleshed out and enjoyable. This game is best with at least one friend to play with- the online community can be a bit toxic and solo play only realizes about 70% of the games potential. Definitely buy, on sale or at regular price.

The game can be very addicting to play, mowing down wave after wave of swat as you fix a damn drill, raid the White House, or steal a whole room. On Mayhem and below, you can pretty much use any perks, perk deck, or weapons you want, but Death Wish, Death Sentance and the hell that is One Down is where you either play Stoic, Kingpin, Dodge, or Anarchist/Grinder (preference really) or you just go down in 2 hits playing basically any other deck. Weather you like to play the game casually on Overkill and below, or go balls to the walls on One Down, you'll hopefully have fun either way. I give PAYDAY 2 a 8 outta 10. Its not a perfect game by any means, but being a cop horde shooter made on a racing game engine? They sure did a damn good job

This is definitely one of the top games for any game system.  This game has been around for years, and it has just gotten better and better.  Why mess with a good thing.  It is better than the typical run and gun because there is some strategy involved as well as a goal.  It has a uniqueness that has not been seen any any other first person shooter.  This game started out way back in the day of the playstation 3, from there is moved up to the ps4 and finally on computers it has turned into a bird that has opened its wings and flew into the sky. Once you play the game in VR there is no going back.  There is still a simplicity to the graphics but there is an overwhelming immersion that brings and absolute realism.

[h1] Good Game, but: [/h1]
[b] too many DLC Content! [/b]

[hr][/hr]

[b] Pluses: [/b]
- Simple game mechanics;
- Funny gameplay;
- A lot of contant (Guns, outfits, missions and heists and more);
- Intresting perks and skills tree.

[b] Minuses: [/b]
- Too much paid content. Yes, a new gun is cool, but pay a lot of real money for all of them is not cool. PAYDAY 2 community, i hope, will understand me :D;

[hr][/hr]

[h1] Afterword [/h1]
If you want to get cool feeling from the game - play with your friends and communicate with them with discord, teamspeak or others.
[u] I recommend that! [/u]
Very good game, (mostly) good community, very fun with friends or solo, I extremely recommend.

I hope Ovk will overhaul infamy system , so it wouldn't be just a grinding simulator ( each infamy would give you some bonuses for example +2% damage  +1 movement speed and so on). The damage range multipliers shouldn't be even implemented. 

And here is a list of other things which are really  annoying or poorly implemented in this game.
1) Lobby system.
2) Lack of anticheat.
3) Weapons and perkdecks balance.
4) Optimization
5) Player progression
6) Developer attitude towards players ( just stop trying to sell us weapon reskins and ugly skins and new heist which we gonna complete once and forget about them)
7) Countless amount of bugs and crashes.

The only positives about this game you probably already heard about like soundtrack random level generation ability to complete heist in different ways. I strongly suggest you not to buy this game or new dlcs to it just save your money and buy a different game. Deep rock galactic is a great alternative.

Do you like breaking the rules, gunning down civilians for no apparent reason, and above all else, fixing the god damn drill? Well me neither, that's why I play Payday, the only game where you can abuse the justice system to turn you into a free man by raiding the god damn WHITE HOUSE in a drunken rage that heals you, along side your friend with an ECM jammer that gives feedback to cops, simulating the sound of a Justin Beiber concert. Did we also mention the guy who can decide bullets don't work, 60% of the time? What about the guy who can spam a tape recorder at someone, while blasting them with a double barrel shotgun the size of a flintlock, and immediately pulling out a greatsword from the dark ages and going Hamlet on someone. Needless to say, if you love chaotic violence of any sample size, this is the game for you.

Pro Tips:
1. Avoid taking hostages on stealth missions, the pathfinding is FUCKING HORRIBLE. You'd have a better chance of finding your father again after all those years than these hostages finding the most direct way to you.

2. Careful of not being spotted through walls, as that can be very inconvenient for most.
(Yes this is a thing that happens on VERY RARE occasions.)

3. Play this game with friends, not randoms. People in most cases are obnoxious and selfish. Avoid them at all costs.

Final words: 8/10 "GET THE FUCK UP!"

I originally started playing this game on Xbox, where it has since been more or less abandoned by the devs, and had a ton of fun with it, so I decided to buy it on PC where I knew it was still getting love, and I was NOT disappointed. It's well worth its relatively low price tag, particularly for a game with no microtransactions (a rarity even in full-price AAA titles, unfortunately) and no "always online" foolishness. It's largely playable solo, especially on lower difficulties, but is of course much better with a team. It's also thoroughly playable without DLC, although you'll want to buy the addons regardless for the fun of it. Our characters feel like more than an arbitrary model we put on for the game, and the lore runs deep, but you can freely ignore those things and play just to rob some banks.

Mechanically speaking, I appreciate that how everything works is very plainly spelled out with numbers right there for you to see, as well as the ability to plan your heists ahead of time, the ability to conveniently swap between your custom preset loadouts and skill-sets, and that the developers have chosen to allow mods even for online play. The shooting feels smoother than most games have for me on keyboard and mouse, and most heists are pretty straightforward- the only one I'd call convoluted is Big Oil, and even that can be figured out if you stop and think.

Lastly, I appreciate the touch of humor the devs have finely sprinkled like good kosher salt over the dialogue, visuals and overall concepts, the way they've managed to use politics in a tasteful manner instead of ramming it down your throat like a Catholic priest with a choir boy, and the fact that everyone, even NPCs, more or less talks like a person instead of a deadpan automaton

Mort meets King Julien and Maurice for the first time when he falls out of a tree in â€œKing Meâ€. Mort is depicted as an important character in All Hail King Julien, and is one of the four members of King Julien's royal circle. It is in All Hail King Julien that his love towards King Julien's feet began. Mort is somewhat creepy at times, but also humorous. He claims to live in his own world, and can turn in to many versions of himself inside his mind.

However, in All Hail King Julien: Exiled, he becomes one of the significant characters who assist King Julien, by getting information and spying on the enemy, Koto, while he acted as his jester. Mort was able to plot plans to assassinate Koto, but was unable to be successful due to his bad luck. Mort was clever enough to generate tactful plans in trying to free the prisoners in various ways. He played a crucial role in collecting an army (the Mort Horde) for the war against Koto. His actions helped King Julien, leading to his victory.

It is indicated in Revenge of the Prom that Mort was abused sexually by Grammy Mort, leading to her consumption. He creates a romantic relationship with Zora in the All Hail King Julien: Exiled and marries her in The Day Before Tomorrow. However, in King Julien is Watching You, Zora leaves Mort and decides to live with Uncle King Julien.

Madagascar

King Julien just before kicking Mort

Mort was partying with King Julien and his people. Out of the blue, the Fossa attacks them and was surrounded by the Foosa. When he was just about to be eaten, Alex comes to talk with the Foosa, allowing him to escape. When King Julien want to see the true character of the Zoosters, he kicks Mort towards Alex. Alex tries to cheer him up but causes him to cry. After he was comforted by Gloria, the lemurs surround them.
Back at the plane, he even gets scold by King Julien since he states that he love the Zoosters more than anyone and King Julien hate them compared to how much he love them. This annoys King Julien. Compared to his witty character in All Hail King Julien, he seems to panic easily since he screamed in fear when King Julien reminds them how they were dreaded by the Fossa.

When Alex performs at the foot of the Central Boabab Tree, he bites Marty. When the whole kingdom sinks in silence, he claps which adds humor. Later, when Alex roars, he says that he is "Going savage", causing all to run. At the end of the film, Alex decides to eat Sushie. King Julien offers Mort to Alex, as a Plan B, so he could eat him. This event adds humor.

Merry Madagascar
He is the only one who comes for the Zoosters' leaving party. This amazes them since King Julien would never miss a party. Later, he is one who is drumming when King Julien, Maurice and the lemurs catch the Zoosters, thinking it is the Red Night Goblin. He was then accused by King Julien and says to stop laughing. Ironically, it was the Red Night Goblin who was laughing.

He appears again when Alex goes to lauch the attack. He was screaming at that time. At the end, King Julien realizes that he must share gifts. Mort is the first lemur to get a gift from King Julien, which is a coconut. At the end, King Julien and Maurice are trying to hit him. He wishes the audience Happy Christmas and Julianuary and then gets hit by a coconut.

"THE PAYDAY 2 STEAM REVIEW, GO WRITE IT."

The game is a clusterfuck of shouting, gunfire, and music. I have loved about 80% of my time playing this game and can't wait to see what they can squeeze in before Payday 3.

Pros++
*Infinite Replay-ability
*Great game for playing with friends *groups of 4 or less*
*Gun Porn
*The Gun Porn
*Hilarious and Heroic moments brought to you by police AI.
*Did I mention the Gun Porn?
*The music slaps so hard my neighbors asked me to turn it up.
*Incredible variety in build and playstyle choices. Want to stab a dude with a grill fork and make his buddies panic? Check. Mow down waves of dudes with an M60 like you're on a hill in Vietnam? Check. John Wick with a kink for pain? Check and check.
*Mods are available online to enhance your experience visually and several for gameplay changes.
*Heist variety. Oh baby, do you have a buffet of options to choose from. Bank heist? Got it. Military compound? Done. Vault under a stadium during a rave? Oh, you betcha. You can spend weeks learning every heist and I've personally spent years trying to master many of them. 


Cons--
*Cloakers. Sam Fisher with a single 3-phase order. "Find them. Beat them. Make them stop resisting."
*Matchmaking can be buggy. Between hosts having mods that cause issues, connection drops, and voodoo magic.. sometimes things just drop. Nothing like spending half an hour on a heist just to disconnect on the way out.
*The DLC chain is horrendous and a genuine eye sore to look at. It's also scary to look at for someone trying to come into the game at this point in its life cycle and see so much DLC. It's mitigated by host-reliant heist DLC so if the host owns it anyone can run with them. The content lost in firepower is a genuine tragedy.
*Cheating is common but the game DOES have a cheater tag for people who are caught. It will alert the other players in the game without alerting the cheater. Kind of a "Play at your own risk" situation after that. Gone are the days of "rage cheaters" that will spawn 100 bags of loot after spending 30 minutes doing it normally and get everyone in trouble with the VAC.
*Cloakers.
*Unbalanced perk system. In-game you have perk decks and skill sets. It allows you to create a unique play style for any situation. In theory; it's a way for someone to play any way they want. In practice; the perk deck system has many "potatoes" with a couple outstanding exceptions. Stoic, Grinder, and Anarchist can effectively carry someone through any difficulty shy of max.
*No grapple system. In a game that has some-what functional melee system; there is a lack of ability to choke someone out in stealth or grab a shield off a cop when things go loud. I don't know the work that would need to go into that though.

Summary&&
This game is a blast from start to finish. It has huge, elaborate, and difficulty heists that you can tackle like a ninja or a warlord. It's not without flaws but what it provides is the FPS experience with an option for stealth. It feels so rewarding to complete a heist totally silent for the first time. The rush of dodging guards and stealing paintings, cutting glass display cases, even moving money without being seen. It can make a 30 minute heist feel like 10. Going "loud" with guns blazing can making a 30 minute heist feel like an hour sometimes with the monotonous dakka and waves. The point is that you have the option the change things up. I may be bias on what my preferred method is. Give it a chance. If you can't afford the DLC paywall don't panic, you can genuinely enjoy this game at it's base with no problems. None of the DLC is a requirement to play. Even the heist packs you don't buy are available to you by joining players in the community that bought them already.

Payday 2 is one of the best "bang for your buck" games. It features endless content, weapons, builds, full coop and a very nice, free VR mode with crossplay capability and perfectly decent controls (looking at you, borderlands 2). The DLCs are a but hit or miss but the missions are generally pretty good and you can join DLC mission lobbies even if you dont own them yourself. The levelling system is a bit slow but much better than in Payday 1. For the extremely low prices that this game is frequently on sale for, its really a no-brainer, especially for VR players looking for new (coop-)games!

I am a 58 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Payday 2 is an excellent, best of breed co-operative FPS heist game with short, exciting rounds, solid PvE gameplay and a wide variety of missions, robberies and drug deals.   No two heists are alike, and there's quite a lot of them. 

Top tier contemporary visuals, 4K support, a pleasing array of visual and performance tweaks hammer down the technical side of things.  The game features an excellent progression and skill tree system, supplemented of course by a comprehensive array of weapons. 

The only caveat is that this is best played with friends, but pick up groups are easy to get into too, and you can play single player with bots.   The $10 USD price tag for this is entirely too generous considering how much gameplay you can get out of this game, so I'd consider this a must-have for co-op fans.

The game consists of a variety of "heists" that a player can opt to either carry out by themselves, with the AI, or as a part of the multiplayer game. There are heists such as bank robberies, drug trafficking runs, rigging an election, or stealing smuggled nuclear warheads. Some of the heists put a large emphasis on stealth, often leading to bonus experience points and money on completion, and certain heists can only be done in stealth.
The level selection menu is styled as a fictional website, Crime.net, where missions pop up periodically as contracts in a map of Washington, D.C. It is not possible to max out every single tree and players are often encouraged to mix and match skills from each tree to maximize usefulness. Players also receive "perk points," in proportion to their experience earned, that can be used to unlock additional bonuses from 17 "perk deck." Players can switch between 15 profiles of skills, perk decks, weapons and equipment at no cost before starting a heist.
When a player reaches level 100, they can opt to raise their "Infamy" level, up to level 500. Becoming Infamous grants a player access to special skill trees and items and gives them special poses in lobby screens. However, raising one's Infamy level causes them to lose all of their spending money and experience, and a sum of $200,000,000 is deducted from their offshore account until they reach Infamy level 5.

Payday 2 is an amazing heist "simulator" that has kept me entertained for a long time and driven me to grind the achievements. The wide selections of weaponry, perk decks, and skill trees give you a lot of choices for what you want to do. I always find myself running Stoic or Anarchist, but I also tend to lean on Sociopath and Burglar. 

The enemies are great, by the way. Bulldozers are good challenges, Medics tactically heal SWAT closest to them, and Cloakers are just walking memes. Fuck the Snipers. They're the only bad ones.

In his cinematic work known as 'Only a spoonful', Mr. Bach subverts the audience's expectations, creating a humorous work. In the beginning, the protagonist, presumed to be Mr. Bach himself, asks his friend if he could eat ice cream. His friend responds with "Only a spoonful!" creating the audience expectation that the protagonist will only eat what is known to be equivalent to a spoonful. However, the protagonist uses a comically large spoon, juxtaposing the audience's expectations whilst technically obeying the rule of "Only a spoonful"; despite the spoon being comically large compared to a regular spoon. The protagonist also creates a face when revealing the comically large spoon, implying that the usage of the comically large spoon creates ingenuity. The cinematic work also uses music around the time of the revealing of the comically large spoon, implying that the protagonist will be celebrating consuming the ice cream due to the music being happy.
