A solo/offline player review

Probably should be mentioned, i bought the legacy bundle which is 8 years of DLC for cheap. The vanilla version is playable but very barebones.

Tried the demo expecting 1 hour of faffing about but this turned out to be alot of fun for me offline with bots.

They cant do stealth or objectives and the only commands you can give are "follow" or "wait here" (theyll follow beyond a certain distance anyway). They help somewhat with transporting loot in that you can throw bags at them to make em carry those. They soak up unreal amounts of damage and give pretty powerful buffs, in the end i was mostly playing on mayhem (which is difficulty 5 of 7), abit of a challenge but absolutely doable. Bots are very good

Regarding the gameplay : you do crimes and if you do it the shooty bang bang way the police turns on the cloning vats and endless hordes of kamikaze cops swarm you. 

Theres multiple scenarios and levels ranging from simple bank robberies to breaking a dude out of prison or stealing nukes and then putting them into a muscle car to drive em around. Theres also randomization, there can be extra or less guards or civilians or more cameras or an extra objective like a vault having an extra door, whole sections of level architecture can be different aswell. This was a big part of keeping me playing.

With the DLC theres a huge amount of guns (albeit especially pistols having alot of samey ones) and you can go tactilol and put scopes on scopes to improve stats and stuff. Theres also some buildcraft with different perk decks and skill sets. You can do stealth builds with only a suit and sneaky skills, Critical hit builds which can do lots of damage but can be relatively glassy or tank builds, theres alot of variety.

Theres a career mode which provides some overarching story in the mission briefings or you can just jump into any mission you want right off the bat

Didnt like :

- constant nagging by handlers. Id sit in a corner being besieged by enemies or doing some stealth stuff and every 3 minutes or so id be reminded to OMG GUYSE WHY HAVENT YOU DONE X YET. GUYSE YOU NEED TO DO X. HEY GUYSE DO X. Extremely annoying

- crit builds favoring or at least being somewhat dependent on silencers. Just not a fan of my guns sounding like farts all the time

- three guns and a color costing the same as an indie game. Remedied by the legacy bundle

Tl;dr : coop game but perfectly playable solo

God. This game is amazing. This game has insanely good and grindy progression. No joke, if you don't like grinding don't even think about getting this game but if you're a grinder then this game is for you. Amazing gameplay with unique and awesome looking graphics, textures and models. The heists are cool and have many ways of being executed. One thing that can be seen as both a con and a pro is the DLC system. There is insanely much DLC. For most people this is gonna be a pain in the ass, but for people who got their mom's credit card on hand the DLC system is very rewarding. Like when you wait for a long time to finally get to play a certain heist or shoot some guns that were locked behind the pay wall. If you wanna get most out of the game it's gonna be expensive and I'd go so far as say that if you aren't planning on getting all the DLC it isn't worth it, but if you're gonna get DLC to experience an experience like no other then buy this game. Overall this game is really good, has some glitches sometimes but nothing game breaking. The DLCs will be a problem for most people but other than that this game is absolutely amazing, masterpiece! Good job overkill software, you're very talented devs who just need some money.

This isn't a heist planning game. It's a game where you just shoot hordes of cops. 

The game purports that stealth is an option in most maps. But it isn't. "Stealth" in Payday 2 is just going in through the back door rather than the front, before you inevitably raise the alarm and do it loud. Because basic stealth elements like distractions or even shutting doors so you can't be seen from the other side of the building are just completely absent. The only stealth gameplay is playing hide and seek with guards going down pre-defined routes. And even then, if you do it slowly and stealthily the game will shout at you to get on with it, flash objectives, the whole nine yards.

What's more this game is stupidly bloated. There are multiple different sets of skill trees because one set got added later and the previous one got reworked. There's a constant grinding mechanism to get random loot from the heist (and the inevitably bloated list of weapons and equipment which goes with it), and plenty of elements which haven't been updated or fixed to reflect that - I couldn't actually finish the tutorial without having to have done another job on the side because the devs screwed up the xp calculation when converting it into one of the new skill trees.

Before going in to this game, I asked about whether the bot AI is good enough to facilitate solo play. I got told that the bot AI is better than most players. However when it came down to it and my task was to escort 6 bags to the escape point, the AI didn't bother going for them. They just followed me around. And the escape point was behind some minor geometry (roof ventillation system) on the map which the AI could not possibly figure out a route for. So I even with being able to throw bags onto the AI's back, I still had to deliver them one by one and go chasing after the bot when it didn't know what was going on.

And from my brief outreach in the community, this is what to get. Stealth gameplay is apparently unpopular (gee, I wonder why something so underdeveloped and poorly made would be unpopular) so the community just go for the loud, horde shooter approach instead. Even the few stealth recommendations I could get were exploiting game mechanics rather than playing the game.

This game is awesome. Unless you are doing any stealth mission in this game. If you want to have the most frustrating and difficult time or you just plain hate yourself play stealth missions. The guards for one have eyes in the back of their head, So you literally can't sneak up on them without them starting to detect you. Two its not even worth it to kill the guards in stealth because in the majority of the missions the guards have pagers that you will have to interact with so they don't sound the alarms. This in itself is not a bad part of the game by any-means, but you can only kill up to 4 guards by this method. Killing a 5th guard will result in the alarm being triggered even if you use the pager. This wouldn't be an issue but the guards respawn thus, making killing guards more difficult for you than not. Plus The A.I. for the guards is just annoying. Oh and it feels like the game punishes you for going loud anyways because all the wait timers just get longer. Everything else in the game is pretty fun though.

Going stealth in a public mission is the worst decision in your life.

Pros: 
+ High replay value
+ Large arsenal of guns, crossbows, etc.
+ Many different playstyles can be used
+ Pretty good VR experience 
+ Stealth gameplay for people who likes them
+ Highly customizable with mods
+ The game will still get updates for a long time
+ Awesome soundtrack
+ Collab with many famous films/games
+ You can probably play this game on a microwave at 30 fps

Cons: 
- Can be very buggy
- Melee is a joke
- You will most likely give in and buy all the DLCs because of the limited amount of base game guns
- 84GBs of disk space
- Sometimes no matter how good your PC is, the game would still get framedrops 
- Pub stealth
- Some heist can feel drawn out, insane cop spawns with very little cover
- The story is... weird
- Can be very addicting

I don't review many games, but I thought this game was well worth the time. If you don't know already, at the time of this review, PAYDAY 3 has been revealed to release in 2023. So, if you truly want to save that experience, go ahead. Now onto the review:

I'm a competitive FPS gamer. Overwatch, COD, valorant, you name it. I've played it and probably loved it.  So when I first launched payday, I didn't know what to expect. Graphics are subpar. Nothing trash, but nothing breathtaking either. However, while the graphics themselves aren't that impressive, THE PLACES ARE GREAT. You could be robbing an everyday bank in a regular neighborhood, or you could be in a Vegas casino robbing an underground vault. Wanna fight off waves of invaders while cooking meth and non-stop action? Or do you prefer slower, more strategic gameplay on shadow raid? And this is, in my opinion, paydays strongest plus. There are so many heists, so much content, and so much variety in that gameplay itself. It's not a point A ----> point B adventure, it's a chaotic mess and I LOVE IT.

So a strong start with atmosphere. Next let's talk about gunplay. The weapon customization and class customization is the most complex, yet straightforward thing I've seen in any game. Literally 100s of weapons to choose from, so again, VARIETY. Sniper rifles, akimbo pistols, shotguns, or even god damn FLAMETHROWERS, if any kind of modern (or unmodern) weapon ever existed, it's probably in payday 2. There is only one thing I have against these amazing systems, and I believe the guns, attachments, and perk decks don't deserve to be partially locked by DLC. I'll take about DLC later, but just know this is the one place where it straight up is unfair. 

Now, the HEISTS. I already showed variety before, but it needs to be mentioned again. Seriously. It's amazing the amount of learning you can put into the game and how quickly you can become a master at these masterpieces. You can do something straightforward like bank heist, or do something more complex like framing frame. It's all up to you. And while, again, DLC locks about 30% of these heists, I think it works fine here because everyone would already get the same payday experience (unlike weapons/perks)

While this is about it, you cannot mention payday 2 and not bring up the MUSIC. If there was a god that existed in today's day and age, it would be the sound producers at overkill and songwriters. Donacdum, backstab, and now we run/wait, break the rules, and I will give you my all are my personal favorites. And there's again, about 100 songs to choose from. They really just had the word (variety) on the drawing board at overkill huh?

Overall, payday 2 gets a 9/10 from me. There are only a few minor issues I ever have. Wonderful game.

Back in the day, Payday 2 was the game to play. Unfortunately, it has seemed to have lost its touch in the modern era.

OVERKILL, this game's developer, has had its fair share of problems in the past, but really seemed to strike a goldmine with Payday 2. It's essentially a heisting game where you try to break into various locations, either "loud" or stealthily, and make it out alive with the valuables. 

There are tons of different strategies and maps and what not more, but it was promised by the developer a few years ago that there would be no more DLC. It didn't take them long for that promise to be broken. Now, if you log onto the game (even someone as myself who had ALL the DLC via the Ultimate Edition), most everything is DLC and requires additional payment. It's frustrating to say the least, especially when the developer promises something and flat out breaks it.

Payday 2 had its prime-time run, but unfortunately its number is up.

PAYDAY 2 is total crap because:
1) To get more achievements, you need to work hard and buy a lot of DLC.
2) They force you to replay missions in the story, even if you have completed such a hundred times in free mode.
3) If you are not a stealth player, then you don't have to think about such missions.
4) The police have no tactics (stupidly rush and rush).
5) Clockers.
6) Skins have depreciated.
7) It gets boring over time.
Although there are pluses in the game, I wonâ€™t say them, because Iâ€™m writing a review in a negative mood after I spent 1.5 hours on an unsuccessful passage of the Oil Business robbery on Very Hard difficulty and an analysis of which engine to take ( depends on the number of valves, what gas, etc.).

I am a 42 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 40 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching Faide montages on YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories

game runs bad because they're pushing the graphics of the engine too hard, the developers suck at optimization and there are like no settings. no turning off post-processing or shadows, no turning off unnecessary props, model LODs don't really seem to be a thing either? really good idea with vast open spaces with a bunch of props sprewn about. mods can partially turn off post processing but the bloom and depth of field is jammed into the same shader responsible for the very much necessary outlines because reasons.

the compression of the assets is complete ass. windows can shave off 20GB of data with its simple ntfs compression from the year 2000.

32-bit and dx9 support are there, which is really cool for backwards compatiblity (and could run well, too) but it doesn't mean much when the entire game is a mess technically.
